reviews.review: The Brooklyn of Amsterdam. This neighborhood is definitely the in-place to live and hang out for the younger crowd off the city. We spent a sunny Sunday morning walking around visiting shops, having brunch on a canal boat, and generally taking it all in. Only watchout is the hordes of bikers who can make things a bit hairy while strolling about.

The Real Amsterdam . We were recommended by the hotel staff to visit this area of Amsterdam.It's less touristy and is full of independent shops, cafes and restaurants.Loved the laid back bohemian vibe and enjoyed exploring the side streets.The buildings are beautiful and full of character if not a bit squint, but all this adds to the charm.You can see why this area is favoured by artists. It oozes creativity.The Jordaan is Amsterdam at its quirky best.Will definitely come back sometime soon.

Romantic part of Amsterdam. My favourite part of Amsterdam was the Jordaan area and I'd recommend travellers to book accommodation here. It was a very romantic place to stroll through and there are plenty of shops, cafes, canals and activities in this area.
Beautiful. This is a lovely neighbohood with art, food and lots of good walking streets. Very beautiful landscaping in tiny places add to the charming area.
Best part of Amsterdam for me. Nothing specific, but a lot of bars/pubs and the unique building style of Amsterdam. Just walk along the canals and enjoy the surroundings

Quaint streets, great shops. This is where you will find beautiful design and clothing shops. The price points go up quite a bit from the H&M in the more touristy areas. I got a gorgeous python clutch. There are small bars and restaurants on each corner, but only a few tables outside, so you maybe need to walk around a bit if it is nice outside to find a table on the sidewalk.
Must visit. Well this area is so beautiful and calm :-) It feels good just by walking or riding a bike around :-)))) All the houses look amazing :-)))

Simply the prettiest part of Amsterdam.. In a city that is known for its prettiness generally, it says a lot to be the prettiest, but in my view this area from the area of the Westerkirk/Anne Frank House is just picture postcard lovely, especially on a sunny day.

Picturesque neighborhood to stroll around near the famous canals. The hip and happening small streets that connect the famous canals in Amsterdam. In most of them you'll find nice boutiques, restaurants and bars. The most famous streets are called "the 9 streets" but try to go a bit more north also; the Herenstraat and Prinsenstraat or the Leliegracht (canal).
nice area to hang around. Very quiet area of Amsterdam - unlike busy and touristic city center. Good to have a slow lunch or simply sit down for a coffee. Markets are great.

Nice for a walk. We walked through this area on a recent trip to the city and enjoyed the scenic surroundings and laid back atmosphere. Lots of nice little side streets and pretty buildings to look at. Not a huge amount to do, more of a nice place to wander.

Excellent shopping district, gorgeous walking about. Jordaan is a beautiful neighborhood to walk around and feel the city bustling about in its day to day life. A far cry from the tourist trap of the red light district and the main tourist trap eateries that are there. We had lovely walks and experienced some good shopping.
great area. We probably enjoyed this neighborhood more than any other in Amsterdam. Lots of restaurants and bars.

Best breakfast in Amsterdam. Winkel 45 is one of the best and quaint places. Go for their apple tart, it is really a pie. Served with homemade whip cream. This place isn't fancy, located in a local neighborhood. The apple tart is one of the best you will have.

Best neighborhood ever!. we encountered the cutest cafes and boutiques, the atmosphere was friendly and welcoming everywhere we went. There was a tiny boutique where I bought some earrings and another one where only dutch craft was sold, I bought a wonderful scarf that I wear all the time. It feel totally off the beaten tracks and less touristy feeling, more authentic dutch experience!

Nice to stroll. Arguably the most scenic area in the old town of Amsterdam. Beautiful building facades, scenic canals, cafes, shops, pubs and museums make it popular with tourists and locals. Anne Franke museum along with a Dutch cheese and tulip museums are located here.

Walking in Jordaan . What a lovely place to spend a weekend - walking between the canals from Herengracht to Prinsengracht and taking in the delights of the 9 Streets is an absolute pleasure. The tree-lined canals, the diversity of independent stores and the variety of eateries from small cafes to outstanding restaurants make The Jordaan an absolute pleasure. Can't wait to return.

Perfect...just perfect. All I really have to say is that this is one of the coolest little areas I've come across on this little blue dot. Too much to say, so just do it! Beautiful, cool, comfortable, full of character, some of the prettiest canals in the city. I wish I was still there. I wished I lived there. I want to go back to there.
Nice neighborhood. Good spot for some local atmosphere. In the old days this place was much more authentic but it's still worth to sit outside and have a local beer.

Famous Romanticized Neighborhood!. This coveted neighborhood was originally a left-wing working class & immigrant getto that was part of the unique urban development project that created the canal ring from 1612-52.In fact, Rembrandt (1606-69) spent the latter part of his lesser life in a rental house on the Rozengracht and was buried in a poor man's grave at the nearby Westerkerk (1631).It has become an expensive upscale area in the center of Amsterdam and home to many (modern) art galleries, boutiques, specialty shops, restaurants & bars. The three popular outdoor markets are the Lindengrachtmarket on Sat. w/ stalls featuring handcrafted items, cheeses, fish & flowers, the Westerstraat on Mon. from 9am-1pm w/ 200 stands of textiles & food carts and the Noordermarkt, the oldest one since 1616, on Sat. organic food and on Mon. textiles.The main church is the Protestant Noorderkerk that was built between 1620-23 and opened in 1636.Finally, do check out the monumental buildings w/ old stone tablets on the facades indicating the profession or family sign as well as the many inner courtyards w/ small restored houses & little gardens.

Very nice. Me and my partner took a boath tour and we saw Jordan too.All I can say it is lovely.The water doesn't smell at all and also the guide will tell you everything you need to know.We were lucky because it was only us in the boat.
Lovely area to stroll. Lovely area to stroll on a Sat with all the markets. Great food and atmosphere. Would come again for sure!
So peaceful and nice. Great place for a stroll and coffee :) Take some time to linger in the area, and don't be in such a hurry. Otherwise, you won't be able to appreciate its charm :)

We Stayed in the Neighborhood. We been to Amsterdam several times in the past ten years. The Jordaan is my favorite. It's within walking distance to most attractions and by using the tram system, you can get most anywhere in no time at all. It's a good area for shopping and just people watching.

Colors and history. A must visit place with wide angle lens and lots of time to walk around. I prefer evening time due to cut light and rich colors but anytime is good. Walk, have a boat or cycle, it's one more activity. Water is clean and you CA in find lots of people around.
Charming, Real Amsterdam. Take the time to walk 10 minutes from Damrak and the Red Light District to find the quiet canals, brown cafes and small restaurants.
Nothing to write home. Situated in the heart of Amsterdam, the area is considered great for shopping, but we found it average.
lovely gallerys and cafés. Lovely part of the city.we enjoyed strolling around the canals and looking at house boats and architecture.
Beautiful . A beautiful area of Amsterdam to stroll around. Just what you imagine it to be, canals, small bridges and elegant tall houses.
Loved this District. This neighborhood in Amsterdam is awesome. It's fully of arty places and plenty of good cafe's to sit and people watch while having a beer.

Picturesque. A pretty part of the city with its canals and bridges. A number of cafes and small art galleries as well. This area includes the Anne Frank house, so worth a look around if you're visiting that.
Quaint. Beautiful neighborhood. I could walk around this area for hours and hours. The old houses, the canals and the shops combined make this such a neat neighborhood.
Take a boat. You have not really visited Amsterdam unless you take a canal cruise. Many tour operators are available just beyond the main entrance to the train station.

A walk around the old district. If you're a fan of culture and architecture then Jordaan is a fantastic place to walk around. The streets have a less "tourist" feel than the rest of Amsterdam. We enjoyed a lovely afternoon there in September. We also hired some pedalo boats, but be warned it's harder than you think! And I consider myself "athletic"
fantastic. this area of Amsterdam is filled with beautiful canals, coffee shops, etc. peaceful strolls through Amsterdam and many opportunities for beautiful photographs.
Saturday Farmer's Market. Stop by the Saturday Farmer's market which is a combo of a flea market, farmer's market and a bio market with yummy organic offerings.
My favourite locatie in Amsterdam. A lovely area of Amsterdam and still the Jewish beurt. Seek out the street markets and the small local restaurants.

The reason you should come to visit Amsterdam. The Jordaan is what makes Amsterdam the city it is, very beautiful and can be experienced for free. It's nice scenery when you are walking around the city.
The Jordaan neighborhood. This is a great neighborhood-- beautiful, quiet at night, and just a short walk from all the highlights and red lights of Amsterdam.
Ah! The Jordaan!. Spend a balmy night at a local bar ... Pet dogs, grannies, kids in strollers, just good old fashioned "gezellig"!
beautiful!. we walked the streets of Jordan....very pretty with the canals! if we go back we would choose to stay in this area. the buses are very handy there.

Beautiful Neighborhood. We stayed at the nearby W hotel and spent the bulk of our trip strolling through this neighborhood and enjoying cafes and coffee shops. I have 200+ photographs of the beautiful colors and architecture. This is the place to really feel Amsterdam!
Lovely Area. Thoroughly enjoyed walking around this busy area with beautiful typical architecture. Lots of cafes and nice eateries.

interesting neighborhood. The Jordaan interesting neighborhood
The Jordaan is interesting neighborhood. Our hotel was in this neighborhood and a joy to walk around.

It's okay, not my favorite area though. This was not really my favorite place in Amsterdam, as it's packed with tourists and the staff in most of the shops are clearly sick of them. Almost everywhere we stopped, we were greeted with suspicion and annoyance (please don't touch anything, eyeing us like we were going to break or steal something, etc). The architecture was beautiful though, and you see a lot of that postcard Amsterdam that you probably were thinking of when you booked your trip. I'd pass through, but I would definitely not want to stay around here.
PhotoStop. We went there searching for one particular shop and dint find it.But ended up with some amazing pictures, It was great walk and definitely not a very buzzing place

Charming and quiet. We stayed four nights and had plenty to do and see. Very scenic district, wonderful hotel (Ambassade) on the canal many nearby great shops and eateries!If you can stay or even visit this district, you will experience more of the true flavor of Amsterdam. Be sure to try some herring!

Loved this area & will visit again. . We plan to return & stay in this area . Great for couples , photo opportunities everywhere. Great little art shops and speciality shops . Great little places to eat & people watch.

Quiet visit. The neighbourhood is just a few minutes walk from Dam Square. We had a guided audio tour (downloaded from internet) for this. The area is peaceful, a sharp contrast to the busy Grand Central and Dam Square area. We had a nice walk of a couple of hours in the area. Anne Frank house is also situated here.
You'd take stunning pictures here. It's very quiet and pretty, yet you can find original small shops and great coffee shops. The nearby market is lovely as well. Bridges are very romantic

So beautiful!. Jordaan is so quiet and lovely. Dam square can become quite busy and hectic and Jordaan was the perfect cobbly street walk you need to chill out. With lovely little bars on the riverside on a sunny day it's so peaceful! Can't wait to come here again.

Lively, lovely neighborhood in Amsterdam. This neighborhood is one of the best in Amsterdam for sips, restaurants, and history. It is beautifully situated along canals (as are most Amsterdam neighborhoods) so it is picturesque, quaint, and full of interesting houses that date back to the 1500s. It also houses several historical sites, including the Anne Frank House, which is well worth a visit. Found one of the best Apple cakes in a small bar/restaurant called Papeneisland. Served up with a mound of whipped cream and one slice is enough for 2 people.

Charming but other areas are also great. We spent a very pleasant morning walking through the Jordaan neighborhood. It's charming, but we found other canal-district neighborhoods just as beautiful and interesting. So if you're near that part of Amsterdam, it's worth walking through, but if it's a long distance, don't worry about missing it.

Real Amsterdam. Walked around here a lot on my last visit in Amsterdam. It is much quieter and you get a real feeling of Amsterdam here than other parts of the city. Visited a bar on a friday evening in the area, it had a lovely atmosphere with local people. Would be a very nice part of the city to live if I were thinking of moving to Amsterdam.

Stunning . The streets of Jordaan are truly beautiful. A lovely area to mooch about in for hours, take pictures, drink coffee, drink wine and just enjoy the beautiful surroundings. If you're visiting Amsterdam, you really must visit this area.
Quartier bobo. Really nice neighborhood to visit, rent a bike and get lost in the small street of this nice area. Many restaurants and bars and canals
want to live here. Beautiful, quiet, stunning, well worth the visit. Antrue taste of what local families do of an evening.could have stayed here all day
Walk the Jordaan. This is a very fun and interesting neighborhood to walk through; there's plenty of cool things to see, shops, and great restaurants - well worth your time!

Simply Amazing. One of the most beautiful part of Amsterdam. Very beautiful place with beautiful and amazing buildings. Very quiet during early morning so that is the best time to visit this whole neighborhood, feel like the place just made for you since its really quiet and not much people.Number of hip restaurants are coming up and looks trendy now.Enjoy visiting this place by boat too. Simply Amazing

Idyllic Amsterdam. The Jordaan is newer than the center of Amsterdam so buildings are a little larger, taller and less crooked. The are still has the canals and bridges that make Amsterdam unique, but it has some more modern houses and smaller businesses. There are many houseboats in the area that provide a view of the unique and diverse living spaces in Amsterdam. The are is rather quiet and there are few food and shops but there are great restaurants and shops that border here (9 streets and westerpark)

Take a boat tour. A wonderful way to see and experience the waterways of Amsterdam. The tour can be jump on, jump off, or one hour around the canals...with translated guide info while you enjoy the beautiful,scenery and sites.

Coolest place to hang!. We just LOVED walking the streets of Joordan (even though the rain was doing it's best to sadden our mood) to savour the feeling of the historical places mixed with and abundance of cool and very, very good restaurants and cafe's, often occupied by a young and hip audience. At same time it's cozy and with very little traffic around, which made me feel safe and instantly like a home away from home.
Nice are filled with history . If talking with a local this is the place where all thing human were born. Besides that, the buildings are nice to see and seems very
must see. The heart of the city is there. Walking in the small streets along the canals you will see many small interesting local businesses and cafes. The best impression you can get of the city.

Wonderful neighborhood to walk around. Nice view of a canal neighborhood. Interesting stores and museums. On mondays they have a market that goes on for blocks with all sorts of stuff from clothes, to household goods, antiques, art. Good to mingle with real Amsterdam folks
Great place to stay. An authentic part of Old Amsterdam and a convenient place to stay, provided you don't want glitz and glamour.
Must go. We walked 21km in just one day in Amsterdam as we are not skilled bikers. This was a surprisingly clean area from what I was expecting. Great architecture. Lots to see and do.
Trendy West end.. High quality boutique shops and places to eat.Very pleasing architecture well looked after by proud owners.Nicer than the some "other" areas of the city.Safe, clean and beautiful.

The real Amsterdam. At a certain age you dont really want all the hectic noise that goes with a lively downtown particularly Amsterdam and particularly if you are visiting as a couple.Jordaan is the exact opposite. Beautiful area that is the real Amsterdam

Non-center district. We were instructed to go there to avoid crowd and expensive restaurants, but we got shady alleys and still expensive restaurants. Although I didn't really like it, I can't rate it less than 4 stars since it's still a really beautiful district.

Visit time and time again. On my yearly pilgrimage to Amsterdam, I always make time to walk around this area - whether it's for breakfast, lunch or a drink this place all every type of bar, restaurant or deli you could ask for. I've not been to one bad place or come across any unfriendly member of staff. Full of quaint and quirky places and surrounded by amazing architecture!
A great place. My family felt safe it is very clean compare to other places in europe lots of bikes just a lovely place to look at

love everything about it..... There are a lot to like in Amsterdam but for me the best part is its canals... Lovely ,cozy , familiar streets and canals with lovely canal houses, which makes you want to walk all over the city and if you like to sit and rest for a while you would be amazed by plenty of restaurants and bars here, many of which are subtle with delicious and reasonable priced food.
Great to relax. The Jordaan is a great place to sit on a bench or outside a cafe/ restaurant to just chill and people watch. The canals here are beautiful and there are many quaint shops and cafes.
This is living. We rented bikes and spend the day biking round Jordaan. It is the cosiest place. laid back - nice stores and historic architecture everywhere. Would not miss it if I where you.

Just like a postcard. There's a lot to like here and perhaps the best attraction in town. Lovely streets, canals and alleyways to stroll the time away. I was surprised at how many restaurants and bars are now here, many of which are subtle and upmarket. Very classy part of the world.

Great Place To Roam. Once you get into the area you feel a sense of calm descend. Lovely canal houses to see and canals to walk by in a peaceful atmosphere. Bars pop up now and again for a drink to refresh yourself. Surprised to see the odd red window dotted about as not in the red light district.

Maybe the best district in Amsterdam. Loved this part of Amsterdam. Full of interesting history, shops and restaurants. Any visit to Amsterdam would be incomplete without devoting a day or more to the Jordaan.

Great Sightseeing in nice Walkable Neighborhood. This was once a working class neighborhood but has now become gentrified and is home to well off residents and many shops and restaurants. There is a house where the famous painter Rembrandt lived and worked for many years and is also the location of the house where Ann Frank hid from the Nazi's in world war 2. A map is really helpful as the area is bordered by, and bisected by water in several locations. If you're in Amsterdam be sure to visit this historic neighborhood.
Lovely View Every Day City Life. Wander around this mostly residential neighborhood. It's a great way to see how Amsterdam families live life in the large city.

Sunny cycling!. The Jordaan is an amazing area, I would suggest to choose a place to stay somewhere around it. As well it is great to cycle through and rental bikes in Amsterdam are great, cheap and in my opinion it's the only way how you can enjoy every inch of this amazing city!
Cool neighborhood . Very walkable and lots to see. The shops and restaurants are aplenty and the people watching is fun. A great place to enjoy the city.

Great for a stroll around the city. The neighbourhood is great for a casual walk or a bike ride in the city. It's just five minutes away from Anne Frank's house so for anyone visiting the house, it is a great opportunity to see the Jordaan as well. The district shows how the people of Amsterdam live, there is also quite a lot of cafes and shops around. Have your camera at the ready!
Great neighborhood. Simply love the area, the shops the arcitexture, the people, the restaurants, the coffeeshops, the girls
Best neighborhood in Amsterdam. We went there few times. Right around the corner from The dylan and also Anne Frank Museum.Some great restaurants will review them separately.
Nice area. Nice area with lots of bars and restaurants. Local markets set up everywhere. Easy access to Anne Frank House, Dam Square, Red Light District, etc.
Great Neighbourhood. This area is extremely lively and there is a huge variety of shops, cafes 'coffee bars' and restaurants. Well worth a wander.

Wonderfully alive yet not crowded.. A great place to stroll and experience Amsterdam's beauty without the crowds. We have stayed in the Jordaan district twice now (Andaz Prinsengracht), and after exploring all Amsterdam has to offer, wouldn't think of staying anywhere else. The beautiful tree lined canals and unique shops are like no other in the city.

Nice to stroll around. I'm not sure what I expected but from the suggestions around I'd have thought it to be more happening. But it's beautiful nonetheless, and nice to stroll around the small alleys and grab some ice creams etc. And Winkel 43 is there so get your Apple pie fix there.

awesome local neighbourhood to explore.. Amsterdam, more than a bike, its even cooler to walk and what more than through Jordaan. Great restaurants, local experience. Lots of stroes to explore, people are friendly.

A peaceful walk in a busy city. A Sunday market, cafes and restaurants lining the canal made for a lovely atmosphere in this part of the city. It was peaceful as there were no cars - just the (quite frequent!) sound of a bicycle bell. The buildings lining the canal are beautiful.

Active. We walked through this district and we enjoyed the variety of little boosts selling art, gadgets or food. Live music and good restaurants around to chose from. It is very active and entertaining neighborhood to enjoy
had to visit. went here for a short trip. really hot weather that day..area open to the elements, so be prepared. brolly or sun cream
Best area. We tended to find better restaurants in this area. Not so touristy. Same beauty in architecture as central Amsterdam but with a much better feel. Loved this area.

Jordaan. Chose to walk around this district on our fourth day trip to Amsterdam via mini cruise. This was an area we hadn't explored before and it was beautiful. Quirky shops and cafes enclosed in a leafy suburb of Amsterdam away from the more touristy areas. This felt like real Amsterdam.
Kind people. Gives you the feeling as if you're in the local quiet area of Amsterdam, smaller boutique shops and cozy local bars and restaurants.

So Unique. This neighborhood is so great to walk through and take in all the history and unique homes. You learn a lot from a boat tour if you have the time as well, and get a view from the canals. Great little shops and coffee spots.

Charming Boho neighborhood w/ less tourists. Really enjoyed walking through this area. Reminded me of NYC Greenwich Village. Cool little shops and cafes to discover. Everyone very friendly and engaging. The loveliest of the canals in my opinion. Great for visiting day or night.
Lovely. Lovely area of Amsterdam. You can stay here. A lot of small shops where you can find some special things. Here is Anne Frank House.

Beautiful part of town. On any trip to Amsterdam it's worth taking the time to wander through the streets and canalsides of the Jordaan. Laid-back, friendly, full of cafes, bars and restaurants. the scenery is beautifula and magical, especially at night.

Pretty area. The Jordaan is a lovely area to stay in whilst visiting Amsterdam. Every time we visit Amsterdam we try to rent an apartment in the Jordaan area. If you are staying more central in Amsterdam it is definitely worth taking a walk or cycle around here to get away from the busy centre
Old world charm & shopping galore!. A part of the older area of Amsterdam, Jordaan is a collection of small streets with tons of local shopping!

Very nice neighbourhood. The Jordaan is a lovely area to walk through. The buildings, canals, and streets are extremely picturesque and it feels much quieter and relaxed than other areas of Amsterdam. It's a bit of an oasis of sorts. We loved the shops and restaurants here as well. We had rijsttafel at Long Pura one evening after exploring the area, if you like Indonesian food I would highly recommend that restuarant. Definitely worth exploring.

Amsterdam visit. Rick Steves guidebook had a walking tour so we took it after visiting Anne Frank Huis and having lunch. It was mainly through residential area and ended at Westerpark. There were some small bars/restaurants where the locals gather. We missed some of the sights but overall it was interesting walk At that point we had trouble trying to figure how to get back to our hotel but we found our way back.

Beautiful quarter full of color and good vibrations. Passing through a quarter of a bike and standing in small cafes at intersections and bridges were the most important part of well spring day in Amsterdam

Very nice area. You should visit this area when visiting Ann Frank House, very close to it, be careful and do not walk on the bike lanes, they can be confusing because they are on red brick, bikers have low respect for tourists. Main transportation in Amsterdam, Cross only in green lights, and many times bickers will not respect the green life. Always be alert!

Browse at your leisure. We came here to explore the area and it was just lovely browsing the shops, grabbing a bite to eat and the odd drink al fresco overlooking the canals. We found one of the hidden gardens that is home to local residents, thanks to a friendly resident who then invited us over to his parents home to show us the rooftop views of Amsterdam. We were very lucky on our trip and it was just lovely strolling through the cobbled streets.

Not that much different than the rest. Lots of people told us to visit Jordaan because its supposedly very pretty. It wasn’t that much nicer than the rest of Amsterdam. Don’t go out of your way to walk there it will probably just happen on its own.
Beautiful . Lovely area to visit. You can spend the day mooching around the shops and stopping for a coffee/beer and snacks !
Beautiful. We loved the feel of this neighbourhood. Lovely shops and restaurants. Lots of walking and biking with very little vehicle traffic which was nice!
Wonderful . It's a really typical part of Amsterdam filled with artists, interesting shops and restaurants. Really beautiful !!
Beaituful. Beaituful view, best canals, excelent restaurants are here. İf you are in Amsterdam, you have to go :))

fun to walk around this very nice are. The Anne Frank House and Museum is at the edge of the Jordaan, which has lovely small streets and attractive architecture. Would recommend a long walk in the area.

Beautiful canals. This neighbourhood is beautiful, with the canals and the huge houses where you get get a sneak peak of how these affluent and stylish families live. There is a lot of nice bars and cafés, we spent the whole afternoon walking around.
Beautiful neighborhood . Lovely neighborhood with local friendly bars. Very enjoyable to walk around and soak up the atmosphere.

Picture perfect postcard of Amsterdam. When you think of Amsterdam and it's tall picturesque houses and canals then the Jordan is the picture perfect postcard that appears in your mind's eye. It has all you need for a fantastic visit. From movie sets (The Pulitzer Hotel was used in the remake of Ocean's Eleven) to tranquil cafe's and bars, where you can sit and watch the boats pass by. It's grown a lot in the past few years with lots of cool boutique shops that are great for mooching around and new cafe's serving delicious food. Of course this does mean it gets busy on a Saturday, especially if the weather's good. But to avoid the crowds you can take an evening stroll through the romantic streets and canals.
Very pretty streets. Just walking around some of the small streets in the central part of the neighbourhood is very pretty.
Like Walking in A Movie Set. This area of Amsterdam is cute, quaint and full of restaurants and bars. It's perfect for wandering along the canals with no destination in mind.

Highlight. In many ways, this is the essence of Amsterdam. Canals, Dutch architecture, Brown cafes (Dutch pubs) and plenty of quirky shops down a multitude of narrow hidden streets and lane ways. It's the best place to stay because it's quiet but very close to the rorcouse nighlife of the Medieval Centre and red light district.

A great place for a relaxing walk . Scenic and peaceful. Little shops, bars and cafes all around. Nice to get away from the crowds in the old town and museum areas. Plenty to spend your holiday money on in the independent shops all around.
Very nice area . Picturesque area which was buzzing in the evening with bars and eateries full. Walked a couple of streets, it has become a more affluent area and has existed since the 17th century.
Great Neighborhood in Amsterdam. My husband and I stay in this area when we visit. We love the neighborhood and the friendliness of the locals.

Stylish and Relaxing. We stayed in an apartment on Marxinstratte and it was very peaceful yet close to local cafes, restaurants and a supermarket. The shops in Jordaan are varied and fashionable as well as their being interesting independant shops. The area is ideally situated for getting into the main centre and the museum quarter by bus, tram or bike or even a long walk.
Stay here!. Jordaan is a nice place to visit. There are lots of shops and places to eat. I would have liked to stay here but accommodations book quickly.
Nice old buildings. An interesting part of Amsterdam. Relatively quite and residential. Nice small eateries and shops to browse through.
Lovely views. . Beautiful buildings, so nice to walk around and see all of the views. Would definitely come back here again.

Quiet Canals. Must quieter and less commercial than the other parts of Amsterdam. It was nice to take a leisure stroll and see all the interesting homes and boats along the way. Not nearly as many bicycles trying to run you down here.

Lovely neighbourhood. The Jordaan is an area in central Amsterdam and its many canals that is mostly residential but has great cafes and restaurants. Not far from the crazy touristy areas but without the crowd looking for coffee shops and red light window shopping

Traditional Amsterdam or a city full of hipsters?. Great neighborhood to spend time for a walk, drinks and dinner. Great local food market on Saturdays at the Noordermarkt. One of Amsterdam's traditional working class areas now turning into a yuppie district, but the old atmosphere is still there. You want a taste of the old Jordaan, do not forget to visit a 'bruine kroeg' such as Cafe Nol.

Why bother going to city center?. This place has everything you need for a relaxing morning-afternoon.Many cafe's and niche small shops fill the long allyways and make walking these streets a good time. If you're into taking romantic photos alongside the canals - this is the perfect place!

A wonderful place for a stroll.. Located west of central is the 'up' neighbourhood. The area as been restored and makes for a wonderful area to walk and enjoy much of the character of Amsterdam. The architecture is beautiful and the building have much charm. The area is very clean and is full of hidden gems. We started or exploring near Elandsgracht and headed towards Westerstraat. The narrow meandering street are full of cafes, art galleries, and court yards. Many phot opportunities as you wind your way towards Noordermarket. Fortunately, it was Monday the Center of Westerstraat was where the market was happening. The street was lined with kiosks filled with clothing items: shoes, dresses, and purses. As well, there was a area selling 'antiques'. There were also a lot of material stalls too. There was also a fresh produce section closer to Noordermarket. A highly entertaining experience walking through Jordaan, well worth the time.

Excellent place to stay and experience, not a party area!!!. If you are looking for partying and night life, this is NOT the spot. There are quiet hotels, intimate cafes, nice shopping and fun walking the canal. There are few party spots and we did not see any "coffee houses". This was perfect for us to spend a few days prior to our cruise.
Great area!. Good shopping, with boutique rather than chain stores. Good restaurants - especially on Herenstraait.

Picturesque. We were told by a friend from Amsterdam that this would be a nice enclave of the city to stay during our visit. Turns out we were so thankful to get that advice. We felt like locals in a city full of visitors. Quiet streets along canals, easily biking/walking distance to all the sights of Amsterdam. Many restaurants, cafes, and shops to fill your day.

Pleasant walk - no hustle & bustle!!. A pleasant walk thru this quiet residential area; not commercial like Old Town, Central Station or Redlight. Not the from 'every which way' bikers too. Get a map to know the boundaries of Jordaan; long & slender it offers a quieter view of Amsterdam. No, not every road goes across the canals so be aware of your location. Use church steeple at Westerkerk at visual landmark. It's at the middle line. Love to sit at a bench, canalside, and people watch. Yes, shops etc but walking around was what we did. Saw galleries, heard children at school. Saw some fine dinner cafes (inside) on Anjeliersstraat (northern part) and on Elandsgracht (southern part).
Annual girls holiday . This is an absolutely beautiful neighborhood to just stroll through and appreciate the beauty around with of course an ice cream in your hand!
A place to visit. Lovely area of the city glitter than the centre with museums and very quaint streets to explore away from the vibrant centre.
Great place for shopping and strawling. One of the greatest areas in Amsterdam especially when you want to go shopping. A lot of little boutique's in between the canals
Great area. Good walking along the canals, not as many tourists as other areas. Great little corner bars to stop for a drink.
Nice Neighborhood with a charm.. The Jordaan is a district for artist, it has the charm and unique spirit of the old world which is what we were looking for.

Very pretty worth a visit. Lovely little streets with boutique shops and cafes. It's really easy to get to, you can either catch the 1,2 or 5 tram and get off and walk or the number 10 goes around the outside. We chose to walk as you get to wander down all the little side streets. Lots of the smaller shops seemed to be closed on the Saturday which was a little disappointing as they looked great. Definitely worth a stroll around if you get chance

Escape the crazy center to see this side of Amsterdam. Go to the Jordaan to see a quieter, calmer side of Amsterdam. Great restaurants, shops, cafes, bakeries, squares with markets, bike rental shops, pubs with locals. You see a lot of locals around, there are some children's parks. Anne Frank's house, Tulip museum and other sights are in the Jordaan.

Beautiful area to see from boat or by foot. Lots of historical building to look up at from the canal view or the street view. Loved looking into the living rooms of the house boats or walk along the the tree lined streets. There are a lot of tourist but there always are in Amsterdam, especially on a nice day in September.

Beautiful Canals and Homes. A great neighborhood to stroll, pause on bridges, look at the houseboats and wonder what it's like to live on one. Stop at one of the many restaurants alongside the canals for a light lunch, cold beer and you'll feel refreshed. We didn't live in the area but took a bus there and back.

My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed the Saturday Market and beautiful views. My wife and I decided to walk through The Jordaan and enjoy the views. We were fortunate enough to be there on a Saturday so we spent some time in the Farmer's Market. This included picking up some very inexpensive and delicious Indonesian food. We took it to a local pub and enjoyed some drinks while eating and interacting with the locals.What a memorable time we had.

Very touristy but plenty to do. We liked the back streets in Jordaan more than the main roads. Quiet but full of character. The main roads, as expected, full of tourists, bikes and party goers. There are plenty to do and defenitely take a boat trip around the canals. The area is not buggy friendly and be aware of cyclists.

Just wander. It is almost better not to write details of where to go and what to see in this area because the beauty is exploring yourself and finding stunning buildings, extremely creative individuals, lovely little restaurants and artisan shops. We wandered for a couple of hours after a visit to the Anne Frank Museum, but could have easily spent the day with a few stop offs for cold beers and canalside lunches.

Good for strolling. We spent a lovely sunny afternoon criss-crossing canals and wandering the streets of this beautiful area and ended up at bar - one of the oldest in Amsterdam - according to the local man we chatted with while downing a few glasses of beer. He also gave us some good tips on places to eat and visit.
Treat for eyes. Beautiful picturesque area! One can spend hours and hours walking on those streets. All houses are lovely across the canals.
Great Afternoon. Perfect place to stroll in the afternoon. Peacefull place minus the crowds. Lovely houses, boats, canals. Also has some nice coffee shops and boutiques.

Very nice area. We came to this area to see the historical buildings and to get away from the busy downtown area. We sat and watched the boats and bikes and had a very relaxing afternoon. The buildings were very nice to see

Comfortable . We stayed in the area and found all the comforts of home in many shops cafes bistros pubs and a nice neighborhood feeling. All the canals are picturesque and also full of life! Any cafe corner or bridge is a place to soak it all up.There are several quiet canals for just strolling.Best time to visit is early evening - beautiful light. The nine shopping streets are great mid day and the local pubs near noordermark are the best for dinners !
Just wander.... We spent many happy hours wandering through the Jordaan: lovely canal-side houses, cafés, restaurants and small boutiques.
Market is great. lots to buy in the Market and great boutique shops to check out, homemade cheese and chocolates filled the suitcase we bought at the market for gifts.
Beautiful!. A much calmer part of Amsterdam compared to the crowded city centre. Very beautiful area. Feels more authentic than the touristy parts.
Bohemian picturesque area. Away from the hustle and bustle but still only a short distance from it , shops are great and scenery stunning , well worth a visit with plenty of great places to eat

Feels like a local. This is a great tour and would recommend to anyone to rent a bike or canal boat and enjoy the area. Nice restaurants and cafes everywhere, nice buildings and you feel as a local what is the best about this tour.

The Posh End. By moving slightly south of the city centre you find the Jordaan area. Full of café and arty things. A wonderful change to the Damrak which is an area that should also be enjoyed. The Jordaan is a great place for a late lunch and a bit of peace and quiet.

Most authentic place in the city!. No doubt it's by far the very first image that comes to mind when you start thinking of going to Amsterdam or remembering your visit there! Great , unique , picturesque, very laid-back & making-you-get-lost-in-thoughts place
Beautiful . This area is truly beautiful. It's such a nice walk and great for pictures. Walking along the canals and admiring the amazing architecture is worth visiting this area.
Stunning. Beautiful old buildings and a peaceful atmosphere make this a must visit place in Amsterdam! Try renting a pedalo to explore The Jordaan by water.

The Jordaan. Worth at least 1/2 day of your time. Make sure to stop into the Anne Frank house (make reservations to avoid the line). Best way for me to see it was on a bike rental, covered a lot of ground at a easy pace.

Fun, interesting quaint neighbourhood. We spent an afternoon doing a self-guided walking tour of the Jordaan. Exploring it's different streets, enjoying some ice cream and checking out fun little shops.

My favourite neighbourhood in Amsterdam . Went here after reading the reviews on trip advisor and I'm so glad that we decided to visit the neighbourhood for some drinks. It's got a really relaxed chilled vibe with bars that have outside seating areas by the canals. The prices for drinks are reasonable considering that our pound to euro is shocking at the moment. All the bar staff are friendly and welcoming. I look forward to coming back and would look for a place to stay in this area as it had such a great vibe.
Lovely to walk around!. Lovely, quaint streets, nice to explore. 2 minutes walk from hustle and bustle but very quiet! Good for food if you want to 'eat like a local'.

Quaint. This is a wonderful city, which is busy but has some quiet areas to sit and contemplate. The architecture is amazing with leaning houses, and small alleyways running alongside the canals. Fantastic places to eat and sit and watch the world go by. A must visit as this is Amsterdam
Very scenic!. Nice area with beautiful architecture! Would suggest renting a bike or taking a canal boat to ensure seeing it all.

Best area to stay in Amsterdam . If you are looking for authentic Amsterdam away for the craziness of downtown, then stay in Jordaan. Picturesque canals, great bars and restaurants, easy to walk around, 15 min stroll into city Centre, close to Anne Frank Haus. If and when I return, I would choose the same area to base myself.
quiet walk. one of the most beautiful places to hang out while in the city.nice cosy coffee shops(not that kind),nice canal views .a must do is the Ann Frank House.
A good walk . A very nice part of Amsterdam , just around the corner from our hotel (The Pulitzer) good shops and bars to sit outside and watch the world go bu
Lovely area. Great for enjoying canals without hoards of tourists. Very enjoyable during the evening as well. One of the most beautiful part of the canals.

Beautiful district. Yes the houses appear to lean they are so old. Most enjoyable using the canals. Just buy a combo hop on hop off pass. Some antique shops. You can find a shopping map online. Safe for walking but be very mindful of the bikes & trams and look both ways. Rest & enjoy a beverage.

Cute neighborhood. Possibly The Jordaan neighborhood's most famous attraction is Anne Frank House. Highly recommend taking a walk around the area before or after visiting as there are so many beautiful houses in addition to the gorgeous canal views.

Quiet area away from hustle.. Visited this area with husband. Quieter part of Amsterdam city. Mainly an upmarket residential area with a few cafes and restaurants and quirky shops.
Lovely to walk around without so many cyclists attacking from every direction.

Lovely little area for a bike around!. Definitely head here if you've rented or plan on renting a bike. Such beautiful little houses in a really traditional and cute old area of Amsterdam, very few tourists compared to other areas as another little bonus.

Saturday morning stroll through an Amsterdam of times past. We went on a Saturday morning and enjoyed the lovely sense of a neighbourhood waking up to the weekend; with flat dwellers sitting sipping coffee on the broad sills of opened windows, people nipping out to the bakers, and the lovely surprises provided by the narrow sidestreets festooned in all kinds of greenery with hollyhocks and roses, in the way Amsterdamers have of creating a garden space around their front door.The Tulip museum was a treasure trove- the bulbs from the shop here are cheaper than at the airport! I was aware of the 'gentrification ' of the Jordaan,, and the relaying of the cobbles is a benefit... but the renovations seem to be sympathetic and nothing can take away the feeling of following the curve of a boat beaded canal ,and looking across at a front window crammed with curios and decorated with all manner of hanging baskets and drift wood. Amsterdam, where a man's home is truly his castle. The Russian Orthodox church was an unexpected discovery, and testament to the all embracing flavour of the City.

Interesting nooks and crannies . This is where you can walk and explore nooks and crannies of design products of the city. As a visitor, this felt closer to say Shoreditch, specifically Red church street of London. Whereas once you move on to main roads-they felt closer to Regent street. So if you are here to shop or browse, this is the place. Although to find all the gems of this place, maybe research or take a local with you cos as a clueless visitor relying on Citymapper, there were lots of walking back and forth.
great neighborhood. rent a canal bike, eat at Winkel, stroll the neighborhood and don't miss Electric Ladyland--the museum of fluorescent art.

A great bar hopping and restaurants neighborhood. An upscale neighborhood near downtown Amsterdam . Has all the benefits of walking streets with nicely built homes and shops, bars and restaurants . It is a combination between scenic and dynamic

Real Amsterdam. The pure Amsterdam,too bad it is yuppified. It used to be a working class neighborhood from real Amsterdamers But walking around is an experience. Not to be missed if you visit Amsterdam.
Fun place to explore. Jordaan is a great place to walk around and enjoy some of the quiet streets that Amsterdam has to offer.

Lovely area. My daughter's boyfriend wanted to show us the Jordaan as he said it was the nicest area in Amsterdam and he wasn't wrong. It has a lovely feel about the place. Super shops and bars.We thoroughly enjoyed mooching about.It is well worth a visit.

Raining. Visiting this Jordaan place under the rain has been a funny experience, pity that most of the shop were already close but we found a nice restaurant with good food and...interesting beers :-)

The real Amsterdam. This neighborhood is where real Amsterdamers live. Stroll through and find great eateries and lots of shopping options. Enjoy some of the quieter areas of the city strolling around the beautiful canals.
excellent area for walking, eating and shopping. This is an area that we did a lot of walking through. We had dinner in this area and it's full of great restaurants and bars.

Must-see neighborhood. Exploring this neighborhood was a great way to spend the day. You can find breakfast, quirky museums, coffee shops and coffeeshops, history, and some of the loveliest canal views in the city all within blocks of each other.

My favorite part of Amsterdam. 20 years ago the Jordaan was quite scruffy compared to today with a number of supermarkets and old pubs and restaurants where you wuld be able to have a Pils without running into other tourist. These days it is way more polished but still remains my favourite part of this great city: There are loads of great shops for those you want to buy something not available on the high street, beautiful little cafes and pubs. My favourite bit about the Jordaan is to stroll through the little streets which are residential behind the Westerkerk and get a feel for how the Dutch live. You will find lots of plants and flowers outside lining the narrow streets with benches in front of most houses. The thing I love about the Dutch is that they do not cover their windows with curtains and blinds, for me a sign of being open and approachable.

super cool and alive area. gorgeous, so much to see, do, eat, shop. easy to get lost and every street is as great as the next! try to find 9 streets, wonderful vibe. really miss it! very "hip" neighborhood. fine for a rainy day if you're ok with using an umbrella. if you can, also great to walk just outside towards westerpark and check out a place called broer - best people, food, ambiance! miss it much already!
Jordaan, nice place in a sunny day. You can go around the neighborhood and meet the original "amsterdammer" life. Nice area with a lot of tiny art shop.

When does it open?. Everyone says that a wander through Jordaan is an essential part of any trip to Amsterdam. We decided to do this on the last day of a 3 day trip. So we wandered up Prinsengracht on Monday morning. Shop after shop after shop was shut.It was a lovely walk and even saw the queue to Anne Frank Museum was growing bigger and bigger but no shopping.Time your trip here wisely. It doesn't get going till 12pm.

Beautiful part of the city. Had a stroll around here on a sunny afternoon. It's not far from the Anne Frank Museum. Lovely market for souvenirs and little cafes to stop for a drink and people watching. Completely different to the busy streets around central Amsterdam. Worth a visit

Great neighborhood away from - but close to city center. I love the Jordaan because it is in a real neighborhood but still within minutes of the city center. Tram and bus stops from the airport and Central Station. Several small hotels are in the area. Eat and shop with the locals who speak English. Buy local cheese from a small cheese shop - not the market!

Nice Area. Rented an apartment in the area. Really nice neighbourhood to take a walk along the canal. Very safe, and a lively place on Sundays. Only downside is the fairly long walk to the city center.(about 40 minutes which I personally didnt mind)
Quieter residential area. Beautiful houses along quiet canals with small cafe's and sitting outside watching the canal traffic was very peaceful

Nice place. The last day of our trip we visited Jordan. We went there by taxi. The weather was very good even though it was at Christmas. The place was very clean, quiet and graphic. We really enjoyed that daily trip because we had the chance to admire another place in Holland and see the daily lives of the people living there.

Nice area. This Joordan was nice with a lot of small restaurant to sit down and relax and enjoy the moment. Looking at other people or river and boats and buidlings. Some different small museum here. I went thru the area on the walk to Anne Franks house who are close to this.

Beautiful walking neighbourhood. If you just keep walking beyond Anne Frank's house, you reach this neighbourhood. It is so picturesque almost like out of a painting sometimes. I saw some beautiful little houses and the sunlight on the trees and canals makes everything look beautiful.
Nice walk. Nice place to walk around and enjoy Amsterdam and the Canals. Some very interesting looking houses and shops.

Interesting. We had luck to have a private guide who told us the story of the Jordaan establisment. So, apparently, the Jordaan area was created at the large expansion of Amsterdam in early XVII century as the district for the working class and immigrants. The population increase during the next centuries was enormous, caused by the stream of refugees, mainly English protestants like Fleming, Spanish and Portuguese Jews and French Huguenots. It was a poor district with small houses and slums, every little room stuffed with families and lots of children. Interesting!

A Lively, Interesting Neighborhood . The Jordaan is a lovely, walkable area with lots of beautiful buildings, canals, shops and restaurants. There is plenty of quiet space away from the main streets which is a welcome respite for weary travelers.

Good neighborhood, more locals than tourists. Great area for walking. Lots of interesting shops, cafes and restaurants. Definitely not aimed at tourists but more local. Very good selection of dining options, and when the weather's nice most of them offer spots to sit outside in front.

Escape from busy Amsterdam City. If you're looking for a nice, calm walk through a beautiful neighborhood, Jordaan is the area to go. Not many people, nice little cafes, shops (lot of butchers and shops that sell specialities) and restaurants. And don't miss the beautiful "hofjes", backyards you can find in some of the streets.

Organic Food Market!. My favorite area to wander around. There are plenty of shops, cafes, restaurants, places to see, boats and bikes to hire if you tire of walking. Everyone seems to be on holidays and happy to have a chat. Would highly recommend a visit.
Loved the area . We had a great time exploring the bars and small restaurants... what a beautiful area. Well worth a day walking and taking in the atmosphere.

Peaceful. Amsterdam these days is packed with cars, pedestrians and what seems like millions of bicycles which come at you from all directions. Eventually you feel you want to get away from it all for some peace. So, take the number 14 tram to Westerkerk and then head towards this haven of peace and tranquility. There are so many pretty little streets with the occasional cafe or restaurant. Perhaps, you could also take in the Pianola Museum which is very quirky and the curator is somewhat eccentric! This is just the place to recover before heading back to the maelstrom that is Amsterdam central!

Great Neighborhood. The best neighborhood of the city. Clean, beautiful houses, good restaurants and shops, a couple of nice souvenirs shops with out of the ordinary things. Is one of the few places I would visit again if getting back to Amsterdam.
Intersting small streets with shops and cafes. Good place to just wander around finding little gems. On Friday through Monday you will run across outdoor markets which are fun but very crowded.

Go early and enjoy the markets. Only in Amsterdam you can walk 10 miles a day and not even notice it! The Jordaan must be on your list - pass the crowds at the Ann Frank House and continue west, you will love the markets with fresh food and antiques as well as the manecured windows.

Quirky. I didn't get to see as much of this area as I'd hoped owing to appalling weather. However what I did see was quirky, Jewellery designers, art, potteries and funky clothers shope along with some lovely cafe's too. Try Rakang.
Walking zone. Like most of Amsterdam this district is well worth a avisit. Always something to see in the many museums and art houses.

Quiet and beautiful neighborhood. Actually, that's a place where residents actually live. It's quiet, beautiful, and once you cross the last prince canal, you will feel like you travelled to another city.

A nice walk, great place for a quick bite. I likea lot when I walk around the Jordan. I usually say to my visiting friends to leave it for last if they do not have much time, because really, is just a cute quiet neigborghood of the city, full of cute houses and small streets.the best part for em is the places for cafe, falafel or sandwiches. On the weekends restaurants can be crowded.

Fun walk. So cool to walk through the Canal streets with cute shops and pubs. If you could not get your tickets to Anne Frank on line (get them the moment the go on sale) the line up is huge at the door. Door sales start at 1:30pm and people are lined up first thing in the morning.

A must to walk. This is an area everyone visiting Amsterdam must walk to experience the true Amsterdam. Walking the canals and looking at the architecture, the boat houses, the cafe and restaurants. An area where you can experience the life of locals. Such a picturesque area.

Quiet, peaceful, genuine neighborhood. We rented an apartment in the Jordaan and felt like we were a part of the neighborhood. Lots of restaurants, shops and things to see. Everything is walkable from here. We never needed to take a tram or bus. Resistance Museum was the furthest sight we ventured to and it took about 30 minutes to walk to with much to see along the way.

OFF THE TOURIST PATH. Walked this Amsterdam neighborhood with a tour guide. Interesting home, some shops and a great feel for Amsterdam as lived by the locals. Not a destination but an experience. Recommend if time allows. Hope this helps.

An interesting historic area. Visit here by bus, tram or boat. Many places to visit such as Anne Frank's house, noorderkerk, westerkerk, the markets around Westerstraat, Lindengracht and Noordermarkt.

Worth walking to. To try to find time to walk here. It's beautiful and very interesting. And of course free! Tranquil in its own way and shows a view of a more 'real' Amsterdam - though i suspect still expensive to live here.
Nice old Amsterdam area, with lovely bars and shopping. This old amsterdam area close to the Centre is great to Walk around, nice terrace, bars, shopping in the 9 Streets.

Favorite Neighborho. We spent 3 days in Amsterdam and returned to Jordaan regularly for the wonderful restaurants, shopping, and pleasant streets. Such a relief after crossing through the more touristy areas near the train station.
great place to walk around. go for a walk to the nice shops and restaurants :) there are plenty so make sure to also walk the 9 streets
Amazing part of Amsterdam. Definitely worth a visit when in Amsterdam. If you can walk around and just capture the spirit of the city it is one of the best parts of visiting Amsterdam.

Great neighbourhood. Full of small independent shops and restaurants, beautiful houses and tranquil canals. (Please note - this is not and 'attraction', it is a mostly residential area of a stunning city)
Cool and quiet. It´s such a relief to walk around this area after visiting the noisy streets around the station. Lots of small shops and restaurants, great architecture and nice canals.
Beautiful Area. A nice neighborhood to walk through enjoying the houses and the canals. It's less touristy than other areas of the city.

Great neighborhood. Quiet but cool neighborhood. The beautiful canals are right there and just walking distance to the major sights in the center. Restaurants here are also nice! Would live here if I could move to Amsterdam :)
Nice walk. Enjoyed the walk around this area. You can found nice quit canals to walk along, not too busy of the tourist crowds.
Nice area in Amsterdam. I've been several times in the Jordaan, it's a beautiful area of Amsterdam. Nice litte bars for a drink and good for a city walk.

Take the Frommer's walking tour to make the most of it. This neighborhood is close to the Anne Frank House, and as almost any guide will tell you, it is one of the nicest areas in Amsterdam for a neighborhood walk. We did so using the Frommer's walking tour as our guide; with it, we were able to enter courtyards we would not otherwise know exist, and we saw some particularly picturesque streets, buildings and canals. It is also a great escape from the most heavily-touristed areas while still being close to the action. We missed the market days, but that would surely make this even more interesting.
Another very average area full of canals. Walk around here if you like canals and the odd cafe and want to get run over by mad cyclists. lol Just the usual nothing amazing.

Charming!. We visited Jordaan on a saturday morning, the neighborhood is really quiet, elegant, and with amazing buildings that you wouldn´t know where to look. We alwso had the chance to visit the farmer´s market there, and it was really worth it!

Over 40? This is the area to stay.. We stayed in the Jordaan for 8 nights and had an apartment on one of the canals. The owner of the apartment summed up the Jordaan this way. He said the area near Dam Square is where most of the tourist and under 40 stay. It is noisy, busy, crowded and has lots of night life. If that is what you want, stay there. He said the Jordaan is where you stay if you are over 40 and like the more mellow laid back feel. Less hustle and bustle. Since we are over 40, we really liked this area. We liked the other areas to visit, but it was nice to come home to the Jordaan..
Beautiful areas of Amaterdam. We were recommended to walk through this area and really enjoyed it! Very quiet compared to the city center and allows you a chance to see real homes of locals.

Enjoyable visit ..... A beautiful area in Amsterdam that happens to be simply a neighborhood! The canals & homes here are typical Dutch & most enjoyable to experience. The views of the Jordaan can be enjoyed on a canal boat tour or simply walking around ! We did both & certainly enjoy our lunch in this area where there are also shops & cafes.

A great part of town for a leisurely walk.. A quietish , pretty neighborhood with a lot of history and not so many bicycles. A few nice little "brown bars" in the area , which are always a lot of fun.
Charming!. Charming area to walk or ride your bike through.there are so many interesting cafés, restaurants and shops to stop in!

I love this place. The jordaan is one of the nicest places in amsterdam.On monday you have the westermarket and on saterday the lindengracht market.Go there for you stroopwaffels and other dutch delight.Walk true the narrow streets and over the canals. Take a sit at a lovely cafe st the noordermatket and eat a applepie.Just enjoy the quite and real side of amsterdam.

Prettiest part of Amsterdam. This is such a beautiful part of Amsterdam you just have to go and have a walk around. There are many bars and cafes here to just sit and watch the canals. Many of them are on the boats themselves

Unique site. We saw this area while in cruise and also walking. It is again one of the interesting areas surrounded by momentary buildings of Amsterdam. Every building has historical significance and the canal side of Jordan appears even more beautiful.
Revitalized District . Great area to explore. Good restaurants, shops, and bakeries. This area has become trendy. A great break from the chaos of the Center. Enjoy!

Watch out for the BIKES!!!! But beautiful!. This is an absolutely beautiful part of Amsterdam - completely as you expect Amsterdam to look like, with colourful houses, all squeezed up together, with it's interesting architecture and all the canals running through them. But watch out for the bikes!! If you let down your guard at any time, you could get run over very easily!
Lovely place to stroll. A very lovely part of Amsterdam with quirky shops, beautiful canels and a very peaceful vibe. Perfect for strolling around on a sunny day.
great part of town. i loved cycling around it so lovely and quiet almost no cars around the place.great cafes and interesting things to see and just RELAX.
Say cheese . Great area to enjoy the views, grab a bite to eat, and shop. A nice relaxing area to stop and just be in the moment.
Beautiful Neighbourhood!. Busy by day -- picturesque canals, shops, pubs, galleries, restaurants -- but then quieter at night. Perfect for our family stay in Amsterdam!
enjoyable . nice for a stroll around. quite a few nice nick nack independent shops. very pleasant afternoon. allow about 4 hours even for the fastest of walkers

Beautiful neighborhood. Such a picturesque part of Amsterdam. Its different from many other parts of the city, because its much more quiet and less tourist - orientated. It has a degree of class about it, and it gives you the opportunity to explore the canals, admire the architecture, grab some food, and take a moment to appreciate this fantastic city in a way that is sometimes missed in the more hectic areas.

Strolling along the canals in the Jordaan. This is our favourite area of Amsterdam. We enjoy walking there in the evening and watching the people at the terraces of the numerous cafes and on the boats sailing by on the canals.When daylight is waning and the street lights and the arches of the many bridges are turned on, the Jordaan becomes very romantic.
Great Neighborhood. Great place to walk around the canals, see the architecture, grab something good to eat and view the city. Great experience for Amsterdam

The most picturesque neighbourhood . Jordaan is cosy, yet classy, not touristy, more quiet and full of wonderful eye candyand great places both strolling for foodies, drinks, culture and other sights.

Loved the outdoor Market. We walked to this neighborhood from city centre to visit the outdoor market. Beautiful fruits, vegetables, cheeses, seafood, sausages and flowers were available. Displayed so artfully. Wonderful smells. Many locals shop here. Love the neighborhood. We also took a canal boat ride through it on our second day. Don't miss this lovely area.

One of the best neighbourhoods in town!. Walking along the streets of this neighbourhood was quite nice, specially during the hot summer days we encountered during our visit. Nice restaurants, stores and beautiful views of the canals. Around the Anne Frank house you can buy some amazing cheese at the Cheese Museum and hop on a boat cruise to enjoy a complete different view of the city. Moeders restaurant, in the area, offers a great menu of traditional dutch cuisine.
Favorite part of the city!. The most beautiful part of Amsterdam is the Jordaan area with its nice streets, canals and a lot of good shops and restaurants! Go here for diner
nice place for a leisurely stroll. nice place for a leisurely stroll. check out some brown cafés. read some of the history of this area. Interesting to read about the past and see the place today.

The 'Other' side of Amsterdam. Away from the crowds, its a good neighbourhood for a walk with make several pitstops for ice cream and coffee. The neighbourhood has plenty of small shops selling everything from clothing to souvenirs.

An adventure . We had an adventure no doubt in this neighborhood. It is alot different than the typical city center being quiet and more so residential and upscale. I'd just explore the neighborhood and sit in the local parks. Also strolling down the canals in the Jordaan are extremely pleasant with plenty of house boats to look at with amazement.

Beautiful part of Amsterdam . We went on Saturday morning as there is a market which sells everything. You can eat there so I suggest you skip breakfast. We also stopped at a bar (plenty about) to watch the world go past.
Nice place to visite. It is a neighborhood in Amsterdam full of café's and small shops lovely area with very friendly and party people.
Calm. Vers Nice walking by the canals. Beautifull restaurants, houses, stores and bridges. Not many tourists.

Best part of Amsterdam . This for me is the best district in Amsterdam. Charming, quieter than some of the other districts but only a short walk from all the Amsterdam night spots. Quirky shops, nice cafes and bars.

Very charming but dominated by shopping mall-like street. If you want to shop at all the big stores, you will find it here. Quite mobbed thought. I recommend stepping into a side street for a meal. This is like many other touristy shopping areas--5th avenue in NYC, Lincoln Road in Miami.

lovely walk. when the weather is nice the best is to walk to Jordaan.
enjoy the canals and people walking.
so many visitor enjoying the canals

My favourite area in the old part. Relatively quiet, upmarket area, good bars & cafes, quieter place to stay if you want to be by the canals.
Don't miss L'Oliva pintxos restaurant nearby - fabulous

Strolling The Narrow Lanes.. We hopped on a tram and ended up here.We learned that the area of cafes,restaurants and little shops was once the toughest area of the City.We found gorgeous street markets,a Tulip Museum where we learned how it came from Turkey,and tasty pancakes and apple pies.We also went native and drank jenever!
Lovely area. A lovely area away from all the tourists.. Much quieter than the Dam area. Some nice places to eat and have a cold drink. Beautiful buildings everywhere. Would recommend it.

Shop till you drop. A commercial area in Amsterdam where you will find many branded shops catering to the hordes of shopaholics from around the world. A great place also for people watching as well as for enjoying a coffee and/or local treats at one of the numerous cafes.
Great walk. Probably the most representative walk of what Amsterdam is all about. Canals, houses, house boats. There are many guide books describing routes and sites though the area.

Beautiful must see. Definitely visit the neighborhood..
Beautiful homes, flowers, lots of character!
Just take a slow walk down any quiet back street
Beautyfull location. Very beautyfull location , very nice restaurant, very quit all zone. A good zone to live and stay for journeys

Great neighbourhood!! a must visit. Great neighbourhood!! One of the nicest visits of Amsterdam...quiet and plenty of history. It is also very nice to visit it during the afternoon/night were all the brown cafés are active and plenty of life!! The canals and beautiful houses are a dream!

Interesting neighbourhood. Ending up in Jordaan after a tram safari (recommended), we walked through Jordaan back to the central station area.
We bumped into a fantastic market along the entire Lindengracht (this was Saturday), and also found the cozy Cafe de Kat in de Wijngaert.
I wish we found this neighbourhood earlier!
Great walking area. Loved walking through Jordaan! Every day you can open something new there! Beautiful views of the canals and buildings! Nice food and cute shops.

Simply charming. We spent a few hours getting lost- if that is possible with WAZ or Google maps- in this quiet an charming section of Amsterdam
No specific recommendations except talk to the locals- they are generally sweet and helpful
They speak English better than many New Yorkers

Worth a visit on market day. Jordan area of Amsterdam looks good from a canal tour but is also worth exploring on foot. Plenty of shops and cafe's here and good street entertainment. We went on a day when there was a street market which made things much more interesting. The market was near the main church and was a good mixture of nic-nacs, clothes, food and flowers. The food stalls were very good. We explored during the day which was still very lively and busy. This was a part of Amsterdam that I had not visited before on previous visits. I guess a lot of people are only visiting for one or two days and will be heading for the more famous attractions but this area iS definitely worth putting on the itinary of things to do and see.

Nice place to stroll. We walked there after visiting the Anne Frank house. Make sure to find Winkel 43. Best apple pie you'll ever have! We walked back towards Centraal station via Haarlemmerstraat and checked out that busy shopping street too.
chill neighborhood. the jordaan is definitely one of the chillest areas in amsterdam. not too many tourists and it has that cozy home feeling.

Great spot to base yourself. Loved staying in this part of Amsterdam as it felt more like where I'd want to live myself. Has a nice, chilled vibe, smaller shops, cafés and picture perfect canals. Would stay here again for sure.
Loved it. Charming neighbourhood. Lots of cute little shops and great places to eat. Found a lovely Spanish restaurant, La Oliva

Great area of Amsterdam with load of thing to see.. Walking thru Amsterdams Jordaan area either on a self guided tour, or some group tour is a very enjoyable half day event. We have had several walks in the area and one 4 hour guided Food tour with a canal ride with more food and drinks. You will find many small and interesting cafes along the streets and canals offering a wide selection of items from Dutch treats to formal items you would expect at 4 star establishments. On weekends you will find Farmer Markets set up with a wide selection of items from fruits, breads and cheeses along with a number of vendors with Dutch cooking that will make you want to eat all day. This is one of the Can Not Miss sections of Town.

Fun area in NW Amsterdam. Our hotel was near this area of restaurants and shops. The area seems to be being reborn as a destination for tourists, but is much more pleasant than the areas near the train station of the red-light district.We had two very good dinners in this area. I would recommend it, especially if you are going to visit the Anne Frank House.
Lots to do and so little time. Here is a place where you can spend a few days. The restaurants are so many to choose from but the sights are breath taking.

Fantastic area. Fantastic area of Amsterdam.
Lots of great cafes, restaurants and shops.
The apartment we rented was in the area, right the cafe that has the best Apple Pie in Amsterdam.

Character, charm and edge, all in one!. The Jordaan is a wonderful neighbourhood, originally an area for workers and artisanal workplaces, the poor of Amsterdsm crowded it's small homes and narrow streets. After the war, its inhabitants moved (mostly willingly) from the overcrowded dilapidated and dirty area to new flats at the expanding edges of the city, and it's end seemed assured. But as the families moved out, the hippies and the counter culture moved in, by the 1970s they had won the war agsinst the 'demolish & rebuild' brigade, and since then steady refurbishment and conservation have made the area a vibrant sought after neighbourhood for residents and visitors alike. For some such 'gentrification' teeters on the brink of eclipsing the character of the area, but change is the nature of cities and for mr the balance between preserving architectural integrity and enabling modern life is working, there remain many artisanal and independent businesses, restaurants and cafes, and even s few good watering holes. Given the tawdry tacky nature of some of the city's neighbourhoods and nightlife, it's not unreasonable to be happy that at least one area remains somewhere to enjoy a little romance of the soul, absorb the history of the canals, browse small shops, or even study in an independent canal house hotel. It has interest for all generations all year round, and for me it is still the Amsterdam that the world wishes for. Enjoy.

the Gem of Amsterdam. This is my favorite area of Amsterdam. Great little shops, cafes, restaurants, etc. and best of all, very few party-going tourists. The place is mellow but hip and beautifully maintained. A true gem of Amterdam.

Has just become painfully crowded with cheesy shops and tourists looking at maps and taking selfied. What was a charming neighborhood has become hellish due to way, way too many tourist. Tiny streets overflowing with lost clueless people. The neighborhood has lost all charm and become hellish. I had to move out a few years ago. A miserable sad place.
Great area to visit. We loved the area. Great streets and canals. Amazing views. A must area to see if you visit Amsterdam.

Awesome neighborhood to visit. After visiting The Anne Frank house, we spent the afternoon in the Jordaan area. It is a beautiful area with some cool speciality shops & restaurants & modern art galleries. It is a quiet area with less crowded streets so it was pleasant to stroll through. Many of the canals were lined with gorgeous trees and flowers so it was nice to take pictures. Recommend this area to anyone wanting to escape the "touristy" scene of Amsterdam.
Really nice part of town. Stayed in a little hotel in the Jordaan, beautiful neighbourhood and well located, you really feel the style of amsterdam there
Every corner you turn, it's a postcard!. My (now) finance proposed in this neighborhood, highly recommend for anyone wanting to explore the most beautiful area in Amsterdam!
Great area. Very cosy and historie place. We could spend days walking and biking just looking at houses, shops and cafes.
Beautiful neighbirhoow. Great people watching, eclectic shops and nice local restaurants. Not too touristy which is a welcome change from all the "must see tourist attractions".

Apartment stay. Lived in this part of Amsterdam for five days during our stay in The Netherlands. Well located, walking distance to the centre of town and probably the best selection of cool inexpensive restaurants and bars in town.
A nice walk. Really nice walk, good restaurants with mostly locals, quieter less crowded streets. All in all, a good break from the city madness to experience the less touristy Amsterdam.

Exelent. Nice area to walk, far from the center crowds. Nice little shops.
Good area for a bicycle ride, low traffic.
Continue south and walk through nine streets.

Rosie's Place. Staying in this area in a fantastic apartment. The canals are so beautiful , the little streets with their cafes and quirky shops are delightful . Close to Anne Frank house and not a hard walk to anywhere really

Where to avoid the other tourists. This area is famous for being a bit off the beaten tracks. There are small shops and cosy restaurants. You'll also find regular markets in this area. Stroll along the streets and Grachten and enjoy how green Amsterdam is.

Great to explore the real amstedam and mingle with the locals. We explored th area on a Saturday morning, and enjoyed the market wher the locals were doing their shopping. A lovely relaxed atmosphere, and was quite busy with Rhine going around their everyday lives. Plenty of great bourptiques and unique shops and cafes to spend a few hours on.
Not heaving with tourists. Lovely area to wander around in. Amazing architecture. Nice little cafes/shops in the side streets. More upmarket than I had expected.

Great place to just walk. Walking through this area you get a feel for Amsterdam, its quiet the architecture of the row houses is beautiful and their are some pretty good coffee shops; Paradox is one of my favorites as the space cakes are worth the trip.
Beautiful Area. This is a lovely area of Amsterdam, away from the touristy hustle and bustle. For now at least! There are lots of lovely looking shops and restaurants and many historic buildings.
Wandering!!!!!. Great area with lovely restaurants and shops. Great just to wander about.W E had a lovely lunch in a Spanish Restaurant,followed by ice cream in a shop further along the street.
