The flowers of the city.. Many of the streets bear the names of flowers and there are plenty of small cafes and interesting shops. A visit at anytime is good but the Sunday Market is an interesting aside.

Quaint and quiet. Great for a quiet stroll and get away from the tourist madness. Quiet streets and courtyards. Nice buildings, shops and restaurants. Be sure to check out the Hordaan courtyards. They're on some maps and frankly a bit hard to find, but picturesque gems when you find them. My map says they're only open from 10-5 daily.

best place to relax. I spent the whole evening here. The atmosphere was really relaxing and comfortable. When I was being there, it was their Jazz Festival. I enjoy the performance there too. A best place to relax!
Beautiful!. Great area with beautiful views of the canals. Many options for eating and drinking indoor and out. Extremely touristy, many shops and busy streets.

Fun walk through the neighborhood. Such a different feel to get out of the main tourist area and experience something closer to everyday Amsterdam life. Interesting to talk to the people living here and see their after work routines. It was very hot when we were visiting, and the average house has no air conditioning, so the people bring chairs and tables to the sidewalks in front of their houses. Great restaurants and bars in the area as well. We especially enjoyed La Oliva for some Spanish wine and tapas.

As a B&B owner..... I send many of my guests that way. Walking around by the canals, lots of small businesses like privately owned shops and bars, especially terraces in summer make all my guests (and me) quite happy!

Nicest place in Amsterdam. After a weeks trip to Amsterdam where I walked around most of the centre I would say The Jordaan is the nicest part. There are nice restaurants and bars as well museums and cafes.

Cool shopping bar area in Amsterdam. Stayed at the nearby Hotel Andaz and found lots of cool bars, restaurants and shops in this area. Restaurant Envy gets a special mention as does the wine bar Vyne nearby

Walk through the Jordaan . This is an iconic area of Amsterdam. Many historic points of interest, restaurants and canals. All within easy walking distance of the central station. Nobody who visits Amsterdam could not want to walk through here. The only negative (and this applies to all of Amsterdam ) is the constant danger of being taken out by a cyclist.
Must do in Amsterdam.. Stroll, observe people, enjoy a cup of coffee, ... just soak up the atmosphere of this part of town.

Don't miss this. This was a highlight of my trip. I would suggest you do not do this without a guide. You certainly can do it, but I had no idea what I was looking at, so finally I went up to a pedicab driver and asked him to give me a tour. It cost me 25 Euros, however he explained the significance of the architecture, he explained why the city is like it is, and really gave me great insights into all of the buildings and houseboats which were significant. This is a very romantic part of the city, so bring a date.

The place for tourists to take a stroll: weed and sex shops. I think this is the most popular area among tourists: you'll see all the typical Amsterdam cliches you are looking for. And yes, it does smell a lot like weed everywhere, since you have one cafe next to another and in between them usually a sex shop.Other than that, you'll see the canal, boats, the houses you see on all the fridge magnets, so go ahead and quench your thirst for cliches. On some of the adjacent streets you might find also some "showcases" ;)
Saturday Market. Go on Saturdays. Fun area to see and walk around. Sort of flea market and local food. Small. Can then walk around the area streets.
Beautiful area to walk around on a nice day. The Joordan is the picture postcard Amsterdam neighborhood, with canals lined with interesting shops and restaurants.

Wonderful. Be sure to go out of your way to see The Jordaan area - it's slightly off the city centre and doesn't have as many crowds. I was surprised to see it is so peaceful in comparison - it's real amsterdam. Definitely worth a walk around, beautiful!

I'd like to live here. Vancouver is great. But The Jordaan in Amsterdam beats it. What a great place. Beautiful, small streets, antique buildings,nNice restaurants and really lovely people. Just go there and hang around for a couple of hours!

Full of quirky shops and many cafe's!. This was a great place to do some slower paced exploring. The shops are quaint with unique stock. There are also cafe's, you can sit along the canal and people watch for awhile.

Nothing worth going out of your way for. We tried to find this area and once we did, we walked around and enjoyed the architecture. It is more like a little neighborhood that wants to be recognized. It did take us to a great cheese store though.

Loved it. Great multicultural area. Good food for vegans. Great shops. Able to walk only a few street and get a great feeling of the area. Something a bit different to do but still interesting. Great time waster to walk around see shops etc

Beautiful part of Amsterdam...highly recommended.. Great area of Amsterdam. Stayed here for three days on a houseboat on Princegraft (sp?) Canal. Close to all the wonderful cafes, pubs, speciality clothing stores and restaurants. So much to do and see. Highly recommended.
Finally, quiet. City centre of Amsterdam is like Disneyland. Only tourists. And finally in The Jordaan you enjoy a quiet natural Amsterdam. Oh, I would like to live here!
Pretty place to wander around . Lovely area. Well worth wandering around. Lots of restaurants and a relaxed feel to the place. Not as touristy as other places.

Where's the beef. I guess I don't get what the fuss is all about with the Jordaan??While my daughter toured the Anne Frank house I wandered around the area Granted it was a Thursday afternoon, Seemed really low key, locals mostly which I prefer but nothing special by any measure A few trendy shops but few and far between. Maybe if the markets had been set up?Didn't see anything here that'd I'd ever feel a need to return for.
Add Jordan to No:1 list "must see places in Amsterdam". we spent half of a day but was not able to finish this part of the city.Each steret has his own speciallity and in short "it is amazing".

Lovely area to wander around. Amsterdam is a city to take in at slow walking pace or to enjoy from a canal boat tour. Most visitors simply wander around looking at the architecture and the unusual houses. The Jordaan Area is beside the Central District and you simply cannot get lost. The best thing is to wander where the fancy takes you stopping for a coffee at one of the many canal side cafes or pop into the many art shops in the area. The area is much quieter and less crowded than the major tourist attractions.

Eat something while seating at the edge of the pavement, its great!. Located at quite the center of crowded area, Jordaan provides quite an interesting experience. You can sit on the edge of the pavement while your feet is dangling above the water if you wish so. Or maybe just strolling around while looking at the interesting architectures and the boats on the rivers.overall its a nice calming experience that you should give a little of your time.

Quiet and Peaceful. We went here since a local suggested to us that this is a great area to experience the true Amsterdam without the tourist. Though not as many canals in this part, we found ourselves riding bikes through the neighborhood and finding great restaurants in the area.

Attractive residential district. Very interesting architecture in this area as there is throughout much of Amsterdam. Much quieter than the frantic tourist spots like Damrak and the Red Light District, but plenty of cafés and restaurants to relax and soak up the atmosphere of a beautiful city.
Cool. A very cool area of Amsterdam with particularly nice buildings and canals. There is a great market on Sunday ... buy some herring, syrup waffles, berries, pancakes etc. Super fun

Beautiful Amsterdam not too crowded. If you are getting crazy of too much tourists in the center of Amsterdam, then visit the Jordaan Area, where almost all steets and canals have names of flowers. It has aso canals, beautiful houss, shops , restaurants and terraces, non touristic pubs and markets on Saturday and Monday ( Lindengracht, Westerstraat, Noordermarkt ) Pubs: Café Chris- Bloemstraat 42, 't Smalle, Egelantiersgracht, Café LowietjeDerde Goudsbloemdwarsstraat 2

Lovely canal quarter. Amsterdam is a beautiful city and the Jordaan wholly represents that beauty. It seems a must to take a walk around, sit down at one of many cafes on the canal, better if at the crossing of two canals, to sip coffee and look at life going on around. If you're not a local it'll likely feel like being in a movie, so picturesque, peaceful and relaxed, people laughing, eating and drinking, people-watching, looking at the boats go by, cyclists everywhere... a tide of impressions that's hard to describe, I actually had to film it as still photos wouldn't do it justice.
Nice.. Lovely part of Amsterdam with fantastic shops and cafés. We had a great time staying in this part of the city.

Picturesque area of Amsterdam. Brad Pitt apparently has a place in the Jordaan district. This is a truly lovely area of Amsterdam -- not touristy, you'll interact mainly with locals here. A great plus is that you avoid the crowds of the more central part of Amsterdam. Beautiful canals, plenty of cafés, restaurant, and galleries to explore.
Great architecture. I loved the architecture of the houses near the canals and the people were really friendly. it was a peaceful place.

Great area. This is a great area for walking, dining, shopping and sightseeing. We spent hours each day we were in Amsterdam in this area and it was very enjoyable. There are a lot of restaurants and shops (all very small) that will catch your interest.

Visit. Lots of things to do here. Shopping is a nice experience as you small independent shops which add character. Loads of cafes and bars you should definitely try the locally brewed beers for that region.
Great on Saturday with street markets. Walking or better biking here is for essence of Amsterdam, what is important - it's more for locals than tourist!

Must See Neighborhood. Trendy, quieter neighborhood that provides a respite from the crowded central district. Often you run into pop-up markets with fresh cheeses and produce). This was one of my favorite areas of Amsterdam.

Charming district to stroll and explore!. Away from the hustle and bustle of Centrum, Jordaan provided a perfect side trip to the real feel of Amsterdam. We happened upon a open-air market where we couldn't resist sampling the local fresh offerings. So glad we found this area.
Jordaan. Beautiful town, buildings and canals were outstanding, most amazing was the people, friendly and helpful.

Great Neighborhood. A great city, but Amsterdam can become overrun with tourists in high season; many of which are noisy, alcohol-induced mouth-breathers (as opposed to the much quieter pot-smokers) who aren't exactly there for the cultural experience. This can be particularly true inside the Canal Ring and De Wallen. The Jordaan is quieter and still walking distance to everything if you're that type. Still with great restaurants, bars and street food, it is certainly more local, less touristy.

Passed through on canal cruise. We only passed through here on a canal cruise but it seemed lovely. The guide was informative and told us about the ideas behind the meaning of the name. Lovely for a stroll or a cruise by!

More residential and an Amsterdammers place to live funky, arty, beautiful. As ever, turn off the tourist streets, and go along the canaals.Jordaan has the markets selling 2nd hand things, and art, and is a rather hedonistic place. aside of Amsterdam city centre, great cafes, little treasured places to have a drink and relax. Quirky and beautiful.

Quieter area of Amsterdam. A nice place to walk to but lacking in many eating options. The streets were quieter and cleaner this end. The tulip museum was worth seeing. I could not get over the lack of nice places to eat. Sorry Amsterdam...but Rome you are not. There seems to mainly be bars rather than actual restaurNts.
Quiet, Pretty and Convenient. We stayed in this district which is very pretty and most convenient. We walked everywhere and enjoyed the quiet streets.
Lovely neighborhood. Good restaurants, pubs and coffeehouses. Walk-able from museum district. A bit trafficky, both auto and bike.

Small, tidy in a quiet yet central location. The apartment was ok but for the price and pictures I expected slightly more. Ok for a couple. Paper thin walls thou so bring ear plugs! Ground floor is always a huge bonus in Amsterdam. Overall it was ok but nothing special.

Worth waiting for good weather. Wandering the canals in this cute neighborhood is perhaps a perfect morning! The long markets offer tons of snack and souvenir options, as well as interaction with real Dutch locals.

Best neighborhood in town!. Amsterdam is full of tourists ,all year round. If you to find some serenity go to Jordaan. Lots of small bars and restaurants ,not so crowdy and an excellent atmosphere.Definetly recommended!

jordaan - casually spectacular. Neighborhood filled with old warehouses converted into great apartments, houseboats with gardens, cafes, restaurants and bar.

Charming Amsterdam. Narrow streets, beautiful houses with lots of flowers, perfect for a morning stroll. Best part of Amsterdam

Staying on this neighborhood gave me the feeling of being a local. This is a quiet and quaint neighborhood that is only 15 to 20 minutes walk to the Amsterdam touristic sites. I stayed one block from Anne Frank's house and I loved the place. Highly recommend it.
nice walk. this neighborhood has nice houses and restaurant, we enjoyed the walk there exploring the beautiful city of Amsterdam.

The place to be!. At my last few visits i rent place in the jordaan. Is has everything...good place to it, nece caffe's, shops and what not.

Relaxed Good vibes. Locals and lovely residents cures tiny cafes chic shops and great place to bike. Good for enjoying Untouristy sunny day. Stop and smell the gorgeous roses.
It is ok. compare with the other neighborhoods there is not special thing in here. Price are slightly higher then

Amazing artist district in Amsterdam. In Jordaan you will find yourself surrounded by lovely tenant houses, numerous art galleries, vibrant cafes and cosy restaurants with cuisine from all round the world. You cannot miss it while visiting Amsterdam !

The most perfect place to stay in Amsterdam!. What can I say? This was the most gorgeous place to stay in Amsterdam. Canals, architecture, and a gentility not really found in the rest of the city. Like a breathe of fresh air after all of the hustle of the other neighborhoods.
Nice area. We spent a bit of time in this area. It's really pretty, lots of canals and wonderful cafes, bars and restaurants.

An Oasis. I love this neighborhood in Amsterdam. It feels like real Amsterdam away from a lot of touristy stuff near the train station and the coffeehouses. This area is walkable, a little slower pace, and very picturesque. Yet is has some interesting sites to visit like the Anne Frank House, and has nice restaurants. perfect for walking. You can walk there or visit the canals by cruise, nice and cozy restaurants, beautiful neighborhood and colorful houses
Six days in Amsterdam.. Nice area for a stroll, but didn't find it anything special. Interesting to get out of the main areas that are busier.
Fun. This neighborhood has something for everyone. Walk along the canals. Visit a church or just have fun eating at some of the cheap joints nearby.

Not quite what I expected. The area is basically a residential area of Amsterdam with a number of cafes next to the canal. The houses are ideally set with many having pretty flowers growing in the balconies. When we visited several shops and cafes were closed (don't know why) and construction was on at some roads. wonderful to wander around here. We stayed in the Jordaan and found it extremely walkable to everywhere we wanted to go. Wasnt what the reviews raved about. We visited this area in Amsterdam 2 days ago after seeing such good reviews of this area and our own research. Quite frankly we found it uninteresting and dull compared to other nearby canal strips. We stayed in the Amstel region and found it a perfect location for lovely canals,restaurants and shopping. In our opinion The Jordaan region seemed dirtier and lacking in as much atmosphere as we were informed. ( If you find this review helpful please tick the box tks )
Beautiful! . We visited here during autummn. Which was beautiful time. I would Like to see this place in summertime. I love houses and atmosphere! Recommend.

The NOORDERMARKT. We went to visit the Noordermarkt on a Monday morning, because than there is the flea market from 9.00 till 2.00PM. It was unfortunately raining, but we still went in our search for curiosa and antiques. Well that was a big disappointment ! half of the vendors did not show up and the rest were used cloths and textile vendors. nothing for us, a pity, coz it was soooohh pushed as THE place to be

Nice neighboorhood! . When in Amsterdam, the first and last thing you want to do is look at the channels! ;)Close to the main spots... If your hotel is here, don't bother buying a GVT Travel card. Walk your way around!

Best neighborhood in Amsterdam!. I liked this neighborhood so much that I even lived there for 2 years! Everything is close by without the hustle and bustle of the city. Oude Leliestraat, Leliegracht and the area is super.

Nice Area. Beautiful neighbor near canals and you can see beautiful buildings and trees over there.
Good for a walk and it takes around 1 hour too see around.

Great way to spend a lazy afternoon. The old workers area of the Jordaan is now dotted with shops of all sorts from craft to specialised art, as well as a multitude of cafes and bars. It is easy to walk and makes a contrast to the other areas of central Amsterdam full of merchant houses.

Best Place to Soak up Amsterdam. Rain or shine this area is just gorgeous.....stunning 17th century townhouses, live aboard barges and house boats along the many waterways, flowers everywhere and pretty tree lined streets all create a charm and ambience hard to do justice in words alone. Cafes, bars and restaurants abound to suit all tastes and budgets great for people watching photography. Tour by cycle of on foot and you'll get as sense of real Amsterdam a little away from the usual tourist traps.
Pretty area. This was my favorite area in Amsterdam. Many pretty streets and canals. The shopping also was quite good and offered many small boutiques.
Beautiful. It was so nice here, all the canals and off streets with plenty of quaint little shops were amazing, I already want to revisit!

Nice residential area full of canals. Used to be an area for those who are not rich and it got transformed into a more fancy residential area with nice views of the canal. nice bridges and lots of flowers. very pretty area to walk around and relax, drink coffee and take pictures. The boat trips will pass through this area as well.

Interesting neighborhood full of history. Take time to walk around this area with a guis who can explain the history of the area. It is a working neighborhood with lots of specialty food shops. Try them!

Wonderful neighborhood . We stayed in a small apartment right in the heart of this wonderful district. We were surrounded by really great restaurants, supermarkets, great shops, & only a 10min stroll to Dam Square & Central Station.

fantastic walking tour. A must for any tour of Amsterdam and a great area in which to wander, get lost, and find a great spot for a bite or tipple. A center for new restaurants and bars, they host the local markets and entertainment. By the end, I was dreaming of looking for real estate. enjoy!
So Beautiful!. We took a canal cruise and was able to experience Amsterdam from the water. It was very informative and absolutely breath taking.

Best place to stay. The area is definitely the nicest.. Not too touristy and great shopping.
Amazing juice bars around, quiet neighborhood compared to the rest of the district.

Where the locals go. Drawn to the area by Los Pilones Mexican Restaurant, but lots of small, often idiosyncratic, bars full of locals and generally a nice feel to the place. Would look to stay in this area next time rather than the main tourist area. Good area to follow your nose and bar hop.

Pretty. Lots of non chain shops, little plant lanes, cafes everywhere and only ten minutes walk from central amsterdam and the train station. However, at night the noise of cars and even people chatting travels all the way up the road so at night when you are trying to sleep you will hear one car sound very loud for what feels like 5 minutes! If you are a light sleeper wear yourself out in this lovely city first!

One of the nicest neighborhoods of the center of Amsterdam.. From origin this is an area where small factories did their business, craftsman, poor people, all together in small streets with too many people, children, activity on a square meter. Nowaday you'll find nice small shops with luxury goods, special design, craftswork, food, cafe's, lunchrooms, small restaurants. And it is surprisingly peaceful special after 17.00 u.
Nice. I just love riding bicycle all around Amsterdam. The Jordan area is really nice, cosy. There are lot to see in the streets.
Great area. The Jordaan is one of the nicest areas of Amsterdam. Bars and cafe's, people 'live' on the street, it is one of the best areas to visit.
Every photo is a post card picture. Great place to walk around but after awhile it looks the same. Best for photographer, every house is unique and different.
Eclectic mix. The Jordaan is a large part of the town. You can walk for hours among shops, restaurants, apartments and canals. Good for a stroll.
Authentic AMsterdam neighbourhood. good place to wander around and visit some small local restaurants and or pubs (cafe's). Especially the old brown cafe's

What a neat neighborhood !. Walkng this neighborhood gives you a feel of the real Amsterdam, bikes and all ! The choices of the restaruants are great and we hit the jackpot by making it to the Westermarkt on Monday from 9 am to 1 pm. Can find some great clothing bargains and especially second hand.We hit a delightful weather day and walked as far as we could .

A must visit!. If you love wandering around, quirky shops, great bars and restaurants and want to be away from the stag and hen parties then the Jordaan is a MUST.Was staying a stones throw away and loved exploring it's streets. Saturday market near the New Churd was excellent for food and trinkets. And the ambience was superb. But dip into a bar and if you love shopping then it has something for everyone.

A walk among the Jordaan channels. The walk started at 20.00 approximately but, as it was late June, sun was still high in the sky. It was a unique experience to get lost in the narrow streets of "Jordaan" and cross the channel bridges, admiring the canals from the handrail. Life in this part of the city is very lively, with many restaurants, cafes and bars. Eventually, we chose to go to a restaurant. Attention! In Amsterdam, the restaurants serve food until 22.00 in the evening. Thus, although there may be some guests, they can only drink. Fortunately we found an open restaurant. After we finished eating, we continued our evening walk, among the streets and canals of Jordaan that continued to be full of people, having fun, drinking beer and talking, in and out of various places. We really wanted to stay there until dawn, but fatigue led our steps to our hotel which fortunately was in the area.
Great way to start your trip. Make to take a canal cruise to start off your trip. It is breath taking. Make sure to have your camera ready to go.

Best neighbourhood in Amsterdam. Even though all neighborhoods in Amsterdam look alike, this one has a different atmosphere. It is quiet and nice to walk along the canals while enjoying the view. Beautiful tipical houses and bikes tighten to EVERYWERE give you the feeling of beign there!
Nice part of the city.. This was a nice part of the city to visit.The canals and bridges were full of history as were the tall thin houses.The canal boats and bicycles were abundant.

Old cozy area left of the canals. Looking for a less touristic area, visit the Jordaan!! Lots of cafes (Chris) and good restaurants! Visit the weekly market on Saturday on the Lindengracht and the biological market on the Noordermarkt!

Staying in Jordaan. Awesome neighbourhood, only 13 minute bike to the centre and on a tram line. This neighbourhood is the perfect place to come home to after a day in the depths of the city. A lot of locals around, and an endless amounts of restaurants, cafes and shops. A quieter part of town, but only during the work hours. Highly recommend over the other neighbourhoods I've been too for living accommodations.

Nice neighbourhood, lots to see & do. Although the bicycle-riding mayor is said to live here among other celebrities and wealthy folks, its still a somewhat artsy and fun neighbourhood. Lots of both kinds of cafes, restaurants, sights, and the canal cruises visit a lot!

a real Dutch Neighboorhood. If you are supper tired of heavy tourist spots, take a walk thru this area for some quiet and beauty. We also found a few nice places to stop for a coffee or beer or soft drink and snack alongside a canal.

Amsterdam is a wonderful city, whatever the weather!. You can use the tram to visit Amsterdam or you can walk through the smalls streets and the large boulevards. There are ancient buildings that show the history of city. I recommand to take the boat and visit the canals. The city is different that way and so typical. You learn many details about the stories linked to the buildings and also the various neighbourhoods of Amsterdam. The canals are peaceful and so romantic at night.

The history of Amsterdam. "Jordaan"comes from the name "jardin", means garden in FRENCH. I would recommend,to book a guide when you are there.They know so much.Amsterdam was protected in the past by the canals. As a defence weapon.The canals were used in the past for transport, but nowadays for tourisme.There are cosy streets with plenty shops. Many restaurants between the canalbeltsTo see the houses is fascinating, the roof can look like a stairs and they can be all different."Keizersgracht" is expensive"to live , but nowadays companies own it.Hardly anybody lives there now. In the J ordaan are many pubs the brown cafes and 'They are very cosy..As a person born in Amsterdam I can really recmmend this.

Lovely area. We prefer to stay in the Jordaan when visiting Amsterdam. Lovely area with local people. Close to the centre depending on your location, weekly markeys, but away from the hustle & bustle of Amsterdam.

Beautiful neighborhood. When you get tired of the noisy Leidsplein just take a stroll in this peaceful neighborhood. You will see beautiful houses, houseboats and wonderful canals. When you get tired just sit at one of the coffee shops and relax.
Nice area!. Great for a walk letting your self get lost in the small streets, with lots of beautiful and interesting shops, restaurants, galleries.
Canal canal canal!!. How could you not fall in love with all the canals in this area. Amazing boats, historic houses and quaint bridges abound this area.
Best neighborhood for charm & history. We traveled throughout the Baltic area to many towns and villages but I believe this area is by far the prettiest.
Perfect for a Sunny day bike ride. Be sure to bring your camera and a large memory card!! It's one of my favorite sites to look at all the picturesque homes and their reflections in the water!

Great walking neighborood. This neigbhorhood is somewhat touristy right around the Anne Frank House, but wander into the little side streets and there are cafes, art galleries, shops, with some traditional businesses and some more gentrified.
A lovely area. We walked through this area and took a canal boat trip which passed by here. Lots of individual shops and restaurants, quite trendy but a lovely atmosphere.
Shopping. The shopping in this area was amazing! Very friendly people. But be prepared! Some of the stores were quite pricey!
Not for a Sunday?. I went there on a Sunday and found nothing open. The area on the city-center side of Prinsengracht offered much more.
Crooked houses. It is suprising how houses of "Jordaan" are crooked! Get lost in this neighborhood and you'll be impressed.
Great Walking Location. we stayed in this area. Convenient to everything that makes Amsterdam a great city. Small shops and restaurants abound in the area

Lovely place to walk around.. This is a really nice area to walk around, especially on a beautiful day. Extremely picturesque and lots of cool shops/cute cafes and eateries to explore. A must visit when coming to Amsterdam.

A quieter part of Amsterdam with lovely canal scenery. Its a quieter part of Amsterdam to take a lovely stroll and take in the canal scene. Everywhere else it seems Amsterdam is flooded with tourists and traffic and retail shops.

Best area to stay.. This area is close to everything, yet quiet and tranquil enough. Restaurants have a more 'local' flavor and it is easier to park. We stayed in a B&B on Marnixkade and it was the best location I've ever stayed in in Amsterdam.
Very beautiful. Perfect to ride bikes! You should definitely check out their cute cafés and restaurants! We rented bikes and explored the more quieter area

Nice quiet area.Great food places. Lovely area. Quiet at night.
Good transport links. Close to city centre.
Good restaurants.
Great architecture.

Tour the old place of amsterdam. The area is very beautiful and very special.
Quiet area in the morning little bit far from the crowded area.
you can walk in a beautiful street .
Nice place to drink coffee.
Nice neighbourhood . Went for a walk through this neighbourhood. There are some great parks and historic looking Dutch streets. Great little cafes and shops. Worth the walk.

Overrated . The time that this was the real Amsterdam. Now it's a gentrified, yuppiefied, overpriced and overcrowded neighbourhood for tourists and airbnb-ers.
Nice fir a walk-through but that's it
Best neighborhood. Jordaan is by far my favourite area of Amsterdam. It has everything you need. Quirky bars, shops, and beautiful scenery. Well worth a walk!
Wonderful relaxing stroll. It was wonderful and easy to stroll through Jordaan. The life in the streets, the small cafes and the shops makes the visit of Jordaan a MUST while visiting Amsterdam
Rent a bike and cruise around. Such a nice neighbourhood, lively streets, boutiques, cafes, restaurants.. I would recommend renting a bike and driving around!

Beautiful and underrated. Jordaan is absolutely stunning; a lovely walk around can be just what the heart needs. We stopped for coffee and cake and enjoyed the stunning views I'd the canals as well as the lively outside seating areas!
Best shopping. We visited some nice markets and lovely boutiques. Everything is reasonable priced and looks unique with good quality. It is a definitiv must go!

Can see why this is a World Heritage sight. Beautiful area with many lovingly restored residential buildings, interesting bars and restaurants spilling out onto the pavement. Peaceful and lively both, a real pleasure to wander around. Aesthetic.

Adorable area. We walked around the Jordaan in the evening before and after dinner. The canals are decorated with flowers and everyone bikes all around. Just the way I thought Amsterdam would look.
Restaurants are Fab!
Fun, Fun, Fun !. What a place. Litle streets with litle stores - botics, canal fool of action and many ships, small caffe houses on the canals. Hey - what more can you ask ?

Picture perfect. We got the chance to see this picture perfect view because of our canal cruise. Wonderful experience. There's more to see.
A must see when in Amsterdam

Serene Atmosphere . A quiet and picturesque neighborhood.
The canals and houses are amazing and you can feel what it is to live as an Amsterdamer while traveling there.

Great neighborhood to venture about. We enjoyed walking around in the Jordaan neighborhood during our trip to Amsterdam. The home, canals, shops, and cafes are charming. It's a great place to wander around, enjoy a bite to eat, and take some pictures.
Delightful walking. I just like to wander around and admire the scenery. There are plenty of shops, restaurants, bars and interesting spots to check out.

cameras on fire!. This is a neighbourhood that with every step you make, there's something interesting to see. Not only the buildings of course. If mean the people living there are just like your next door neighbour. Will say hello and good morning with a smile.

Beautiful area of boutiques and art. It was great to get lost amongst the off shoot streets that lead off from this area. The Jordaan is really beautiful, lots of cafes to sit and watch the boats go by. Very different to the old town, and near the Anne Frank House.
Cute hood, perfect for strolling. Charmig neighborhood with lots of character. Walk along the canals, and grab a coffee at one of the cozy little cafés.
Beautiful. Every turn is a site to see.. Don't need 100 characters for that :p....... ... ..., ., ,,, ,.rthvfft d r h g d g h
Great neighborhood for a walk. Hip, trendy, artsy, full of restaurants and studios and shops, pretty canal streets - very comfortable and interesting area to walk in - great restaurants too.

Relaxed part of town. This is a beautiful quiet neighborhood in the center of the old town. Naturally all the buildings are old. There is a pleasant mix of residential and commercial, restaurants, and boutiques. It is fun to just wander around and look at everything.

Cute neighborhood near Anne Frank House . A very cute neighborhood near Anne Frank House worthy of a stroll. Enjoy a coffee or hot chocolate at one of the cafes along the canal near the Tulip "Museum" shop.

Worth a stroll to see some more attractive residential streets, buildings and canals. Life in these narrow street and canal neighbourhoods, with their local shops and strolling residents seems like a peaceful oasis from the hustle and bustle of the busier tourist areas. Pretty and calm, an ideal area for a rest or refreshment, and surely a magnet for the budding artist or photographer. The architecture alone is worth admiring.

Great district to visit. If you dont want to visit the usual tourist invested areas go to the Jordaan area. Local people and typical Amsterdam bars and restaurant. Don't forget to order bitterballen with you drink. Dont ask just order them.

Best neighborhood to see the authentic life of Amsterdamers away from tourist' crowds. Skip the line for the Anne Frank house and get lost in the small streets of Jordan. Find a nice cafe, enjoy your coffee and apple pie and just observe. It's a very peaceful place, filled with life of locals.
Nice area of amsterdam. Nice quiet area of amsterdam mostly resedential not far from dam swuare worth a nice walk there plenty of churchs and canals

The real Amsterdam. Visited the Jordaan with friends and family. All of us had visited Amsterdam before but never lived in the Jordaan.
Enjoyed life a few days the Jordanese way and will never forgett it.

Loved this neighborhood. This was a great little walk from our hotel in the city. The area is hub and bustle of people with quaint shops and restaurants. We particularly found this area to be peaceful, and it was fun to explore off the beaten path.

Amsterdam areas . Pleasant area, very relaxing , plenty of places to eat and drink, easy access , lots of places within there worth seeing, all the locals friendly and helpful, just be aware of cyclists

A vision of Amsterdam. As a local I really like the diversity of this neighbourhood. Roughly between Amsterdam Central Station and Leidseplein, the canals and small streets each have their beauty. Daily when I bike around, I find new things in the architecture. Go and explore walking (because on a bike is a challenge for tourists and for us locals too)

Lovely area in Amsterdam. What a beautiful and cozy neighborhood this is. On one of the days during our Amsterdam trip, my husband and I decided to take our bikes and check out Jordaan. It's such a clean, peaceful, less crowded area and I love all the tiny streets. We came across a nice cafe on Egelantiersgracht (Cafe Sonneveld) and had beers outside to soak in this nice neighborhood. What a great day that was exploring and getting lost, something that we'll remember forever. Definitely my favorite area in Amsterdam.

Very Pretty. We walked through the Jordaan area whilst on a food tour. This area has a lot of history and beautiful buildings. It is a much quitter area than Amsterdam which made it relaxing walking around.

True Amsterdam. Many people here are reviewing the Jordaan for a day visit, but I would honestly recommend staying here for a few nights. During my 5th visit to Amsterdam, we decided to stay in the Jordaan away from the hustle and bustle of the city, but close enough to easily walk. Plethora of cafes, restaurants, coffeeshops, and retailers, all in a very quaint and picturesque setting. If you are staying in the centre, I would highly recommend a day's visit to the Jordaan - a wonderful place.

fantastic, lively area of Amsterdam. This was one of my favorite parts of Amsterdam. The Jordaan is the area near the Anne Frank House and the Westerkerk and such a fun part of the city. Lots of great cafes for good eats and people watching, beautiful canals (especially Prinsengracht), little boutique shops. Great place to walk around.
Beautiful area. Beautiful to walk around and enjoy the Dutch culture. The buildings are really interesting and everywhere is very clean

Nice Area for Lingering. Very very beautiful area especially on sunny afternoons. We loved lingering in the Jordaan. Quiet, less touristy, peaceful, charming -- but definitely not boring. The Amsterdam canals are really special. We walked into quaint shops at the 9 Straatjes and enjoyed our coffee & pastries at cozy cafes. It's just too bad that there was a long line at Winkel, we just didn't have the patience to line up for apple pie. Well, maybe next time.
Nice to take a boat trip down the canals. I went for a boattrip down the various canals with my wife, i would recommend it for everyone that visits Amsterdam.
Great Area. We stayed in this area in a B and B. Was away from the major tourist area but plenty of restaurants and bars to enjoy. Not too far to walk to anything. Great apple strudel at Winkel's!
Great Neighborhood. Get the real feeling of Amsterdam in this residential friendly neighborhood. Great restaurants line the streets.
Lovely area in Amsterdam. great to discover the bars and restaurants, the 9 straatjes is a must! try the Dutch 'bitterballen' at apéro time at one of the bars.
Interesting area. Shop til you drop in this area but be careful as the bikers rule! If you cross in front of them, they will treat you like crazy New Yorkers in the Bronx!
old Amsterdam. I think it is a must weather permitting to have a walk around this area. The canals and old houses are interesting and show you what it was like to be part of old Amsterdam.

Great place to get lost!. This district is so beautiful! We managed to get lost / wander around while we were waiting to enter Anne Frank House. It offers lots of little shops and cafes to visit. Less "touristy" than other places in Amsterdam. Could have spent hours more here, just soaking it all in!
Must see . If you are going to Amsterdam I would highly recommend that you book a place in Jordaan area. It is the most beautiful area in Amsterdam with a Dutch feeling.
Very beautiful . It's very beautiful, cozy and charming. You walk and see charming houses, nicest restaurants and young and exciting people. Go there and walk, walk...

Beautiful. Lovely place to visit, quiet and I ended up taking some of the nicest photographs taken on a holiday. One of which is being printed big as it is such a beautiful near painting like picture.

Wonderful shopping area and all the shop staff were so helpful and friendly!. We spent quite a bit of time in this lovely trendy area. The shops are very inviting, clerks more than helpful and shops were very clean with attractive displays/windows. The cafes in the area were very welcoming and servers all very friendly, willing to help in any way. All in all, a beautiful area of Amsterdam.
Calm neighbourhood. I really loved walking around those Streets. It is very recommended also to take a boat and take the trip along the channels to see all the beautiful bridges of the city!
Beautiful area. We stayed in this area and loved it. It is residential, peaceful, and lovely . It is fun to just wander the streets, stop for a coffee, and enjoy the parks .

Great escape from the mass of tourists. This is a great area to visit away from the masses of tourists in Amsterdam. There are a number of really great bars and coffeeshops, that have a lot more atmosphere that what you see elsewhere in Amsterdam!

Beautiful, Calm Neighbourhood. Definitely make a point of strolling around the Jordaan in Amsterdam - this was one of our highlights. The neighbourhood is gorgeous, lovely canals and beautiful houses but more importantly not many tourists and not busy at all. We strolled and soaked up the wonderfully calm and relaxed atmosphere, a world away from the frenzied activity just a few streets away. Try the apple pie in Winkel too - it's very good.

Great location to chill. The Jordaan is popular among trendsetters and young hipsters in Amsterdam. It has some great restaurants, a good view and some interesting stores. Worth a visit if you have time.

cosy hostel. stayed for 2 nights and must say the people there are very friendly. they invited us to their baking classes in view of christmas, and some other events. unfortunately we've got our plans lined up! thanks for the invite though

Perfect for a Walking Tour. The Jordaan is a beautiful neighborhood in central Amstedam. We took a several hour walking tour one Saturday morning and it was terrific. We saw historic buildings, beautiful courtyards, and bustling markets full of food, drink, flowers, and other goods.

Visit. This is an interesting area of Amsterdam, Easily reachable,there are some very interesting little shops to browse,and has a slightly different and quieter atmosphere. Canals are still close by.
EXCELLENT PLACE TO TAKE A WALK. Excellent place to take a walk, see its beautiful streets and places full of little cafes and stores. Best place to go in Amsterdam.

Perfect location! . The Jordaan area of Amsterdam is the perfect location. Very close to everything or just s tram, bus or boat trip away. We rented a flat and it was the perfect spot. We could walk to restaurants, bars, shops. Just minutes away from the Anne Frank house and Dam Square.

Most beautiful part of Amsterdam . Amazing place. The canals of Amsterdam are absolutely beautiful. The houses have a particular style, seen only here. Lots of cafes and pubs.
Went in November and the weather was a little bit too cold, however I loved every minute of my holiday.

Wonderful neighborhood. We stayed in the Jordaan and loved walking the streets and canals--you have to experience it for yourself especially the restaurants, the eetcafes, the coffeeshops, the cheese shops, and all the other shopping opportunities nearby---

Jordaan is my district. My dream was leaving in Jordaan and now it is real....the district is not touristic at all and you can smell the real dutch flavor with small pubs with typical cousine , with a variety of small ethnic restaurants , with a new boost of breakfast places

The most beautiful part of Amsterdam. Strolling through Jordan is activity that you can do every day in Amsterdam. Something like pit stop in every day exploring. Quiet ,clean and autentical part of town which represents truth spirit of Netherland. Don't miss markets that happened once a week in different parts of Amsterdam so as in Jordan.

Cosy and romantic neighbourhood. This is the greatest neighbourhood in Amsterdam! On the narrow streets and canals you will find numorous independant little shops, cafes and restaurants. Apart from just walking around, taking in the atmosphere, I would recommend checking out the Noordermarkt on saturday. There is lots of delicious organic food, straight from producers and/or farmers. Oh and have a piece of appeltaart at de Winkel, right on the Noordermarkt. If you're in to vintage clothing, on monday morning, also at the Noordermarkt, there is a big second hand clothing market.

Get a paddle boat!. Best viewed using a paddle boat. It's more fun especially when and if you get lost. You burn calories, get to see a few cranes, admire the the boats and have a little competition with fellow paddle boatsman all without the fuss and hassle of other tourists and fast moving mopeds of the streets. Taking it easy and enjoying the company of your family and friends. Lovely!

Just like the pictures. So pretty just like the pictures, classic European part of the city that people think of. Beautiful row homes on the canals with cute shops and eateries and very bike friendly and pedestrian friendly. Easy to navigate and walk around.

Great food tour!. Great change of being in The Dam Square!Loved the quant streets and hidden food shops. More laid back then Centre station and Dam Square. Eat Amsterdam was a great way to see Jordaan and a fabulous way to get a 3 hour tour and a 1 hour private boat tour with champagne!Love Amsterdam!

Beautiful neighbourhood with less tourists and great restaurants. As per my title, reluctant to write a review about this place as it's peace and quiet (in comparison to the city centre) is part of it's charm. Went to an amazing Italian restaurant here.

Lovely to stroll around. A very attractive part of Amsterdam. It is calm. Most of the other places seemed pretty hectic with bikes zipping everywhere. Here the greenery seems to make it more tranquil. Very quaint houses.

Cuteness central. Amsterdam embodies everything that's cute about Dutch culture. This neighborhood is just too cute to pass up. You will get addicted just staring at all the slightly crooked buildings that scream for attention. In any city, just one row of these houses would be a tourist attraction. This neighborhood has hundreds.

Live like the Locals. A quiet and laid back district where real people live, shop and dine. Many good small restaurants and cafes. Useful shops for groceries, banking, etc. Lovely quiet streets and interesting shops - all just a few minutes walk from the canal district. Our hotel was on the edge of the Jordaan and we were very happy to be there.
Beautiful. You could spend many hours walking these pretty residential streets with something interesting to see and do around every corner.

Relaxing . Such a relaxing neighborhood we spent a whole day walking shopping eating and visiting sites and galleries I loved it very much make sure to visit this neighborhood when in Amsterdam lots of restaurant bars and boutiques watch out for bikers they drive like crazy

We loved this district and felt very comfortable here ... The Jordaan was a perfect area for us. Well placed near the Prinsengracht canal and a 15 minute walk to the Dam. We had a fantastic supermarket round the corner from our apartment and bought some delicious food from here. There are also many very nice cafes and shops - easy access to a tram as well.
Jordaan - the best. Jordaan is by far my favourite area in Amsterdam, it's a great place to just wander. It's a really beautiful neighbourhood

Very nice neighborhood. Had a day with nothing scheduled and decided to spend it touring in The Jordaan district., we ended up walking over 7 miles and thoroughly enjoyed every bit. Beautiful neighborhood, with lots of restaurants, bars and places to stop for a chocolate and coffee. Well worth a visit.
A wonderful area to explore!. Be sure to add a visit to this part of Amsterdam if you enjoy great restaurants, great scenery and wonderful photo opportunities.
Interesting combination of individually owned shops.. Love the character of the neighborhood, walked every street. Stopped into many shops including home furnishings and clothing.
Beautiful area in Amsterdam. It was a lovely day so we took a canal ride to view the Jordan. The architecture is so beautiful. Lovely houseboats line the canal.
quaint. A very picturesque part of the city, lovely to stroll around. Take your camera the views are amazing, opportunities around every corner for a photo.

Gorgeous neighbourhood. This area of Amsterdam is the place to be if you want to see the cool, relaxed and trendy part of Amsterdam. Great for getting away from the crazy touristy parts, you'll discover quirky shops and local bars.
Nice place. Very nice place. Lots of places to eat, drink, stay. Loved the street walking and the atmosphere. Ond of the best zones to be in amsterdam
Very different architect..great view of Canal. Very nice area to stroll along the canal..lots of shops..old building...arranged in different colors like lego blocks..:)

Nice Quiet Place for a Stroll.... After using the Canal Cruise Hop-On, Hop-Off service, we debarked the boat at the Anne Frank house and spent about 2 hours just enjoying the views along the canals in The Jordaan. There are not as many shops or restaurants here as in other Amsterdam districts, but this means that is is much quieter. The canals are not as wide and the bridges offer some very good photo opportunities.So, when you grow tired of the noise and bicycles, here's your chance to slow down and enjoy a peaceful walk through a special part of Amsterdam.

Just walk.... We wandered around in our first afternoon just looking at the architecture, navigating the "killer bikes", stopping for the odd coffee or beer and soaking it all up. We clocked up 13 miles without even realising. This was true Amsterdam. Best to walk it, then a canal trip later to get both perspectives.
Quiet and beautiful. Jordan is a beautiful and very quiet district perfect for walking without the amount of tourist of the center of Amsterdam.

Quiet neighborhood with good food. This is a great little neighborhood area with markets and great food places. We took a canal boat up to the top of the area and walked back towards the center of Amsterdam. it is a quiet area. the two markets that are there are nice but closed on Sunday so keep that in mind. There are lots of food places in that area and they are mostly all good.

what a wonderful place to set up "operations". We rented an apartment in the Jordaan and it worked out great. It is so central to everything and had such a local feel to it. Not touristy at all, and easy to get to the station or pick up any kind of public transportation. Great restaurants too! This is the spot to be in!

Wonderful Jordaan. We stayed in the Jordaan neighborhood during our visit to Amsterdam and it was a great location. We were near many of the locations we wanted to visit, there were many restaurants and bars nearby, right on a canal off Prinsengracht. People were friendly and the vibe was amazing. The view from our apartment was beautiful and it was super convenient to get around. The only miner drawback, being on the canal, it was a little noisy a couple of the nights, but we came in late and it didn't really bother us. It may be something that others would want to consider? I would highly recommend the Jordaan area for your next stay in Amsterdam, it was awesome for us!

A really beautiful part of the city. This was probably my favourite part of the city. We were really lucky with the weather in late May and it showed up this part of Amsterdam with its wide canals and leafy foliage to its best. Well worth the walk.
Worth the walk. We went through this area with our private tour guide and then walked it ourselves the next-day... very neighbourhood and family like. Some shops and places to eat but a great walk.

Beautiful section of the City. This is a lively and lovely section of the city, far from the prostitutes and rough side of society. Very pretty canals with historic homes. Great for photography.Very easy to get around with google maps. I really enjoyed wandering here
Very beautiful . We wandered around the area and found a canal boat bar. Beautiful part of the city highly recommend!!

Easy to explore, better places to go.... If you're in Amsterdam for longer than a few days, then you'll want to spend a day exploring the museums and cafes of the Jordaan, but I spent a weekend and strolled around it. I didn't think it was that impressive, but I didn't go into the museums. I think it's worth spending a lot of time in.
Jordaan. We stayed in this suburb for a week and found it within easy walking distance to most attractions. Buses and trams were within a short distance. We felt safe in this quiet district.

Amsterdam Immersion. Walk the streets and along the canals of this quaint section of old Amsterdam and discover the creative and vibrant core of this great city. There discoveries to be made around every corner with boutique shops, cafes, dining, and lodging.
Dearest. This is a happening place and is situated in the heart of the city. One can enjoy local shopping and food here. Mainly a residential area.

A very charming place. The Jordan is truly a charming and lovely area surrounded by bicycles, canals, riders, cobblestone, narrow streets and sidewalks. You can enjoy a relaxing stroll and appreciate the overview.
It's very beautiful!

Wonderful Neighborhood. Amsterdam by itself is already a beautiful city with its canals, museums, etc. The Jordaan started as a working class neighborhood and has evolved into something which is by many considered as being the 'real' Amsterdam.

Amsterdam at it's best!!. This neighborhood typifies Amsterdam--bicycles and riders, canals, crooked houses, cobblestone sidewalks, narrow sreets, quaint shopping lanes. If you have limited time and cannot see all of the city, take the time to walk this part and know you got the essence of the feel of Amsterdam. But, if you have more T ok me, don't try to cheat and skip everything else--Amsterdam is too great a city to miss!!
Beautiful Area. Go on Kings day, makes the whole experience so much better. The Jordaan is a beautiful area and lots to do

Hofjes!. We spent a half-day (maybe 3-4 hours) taking a self-guided walking tour of the Jordaan, and we were thoroughly charmed by its many details, quiet vibe, and historic character! I didn't realize how many Hofjes (housing around a communal garden that used to be used for single religious women) were hidden behind the doors here, but many of the Hofje courtyards are open to the public, if you just have a tour (or guide book) to tell you what door to walk through! This was one of my favorite days we spent in Amsterdam, since it was such a lovely area and the Hofjes were an extra treat. Highly recommended!
Popular quarter. This quarter, once developped for housing the poor, is now the favorite place for students and artists. There are a lot of popular songs about the place.

Must Be Seen from the Water!. We originally walked through this area on a cold and rainy day. We were wondering what the appeal was, until we did an "open boat tour" (when it was sunny).....This is how this area must be seen! It's beautiful, quiet & serene. And there is no doubt that this is an upscale area. Very enjoyable.
Anniversary Holiday. Lovely area of Amsterdam. Very relaxing bars and Restaurants. People very friendly, chilled, would definitely visit again.

Not the greatest. I only went there because i saw it on trip advisor so i thought of checking it out. It is just a quiet neighborhood with very few shops almost to none with many canals to see. It may be a spot for picture taking but other than that not much going on.

Delightful area to meander. We walked around this area of Amsterdam several times during our stay. There are some nice cafes and restaurants and cute shops. The feel is very local and friendly, less touristy here.
Great Amsterdam Neighborhood. Really great neighborhood with a lot of neat independent shops and cafes. Very picturesque around the canals. Definitely spend some time there while visiting.
Trendy Area. Residential area with lots of restaurants and shops. It is a lot calmer than the old town or red light district. Was recommended to walk by the hotel on the first day.
Nice. Really good to take a boat around. Just keep in mind to bring an extra coat, the river makes it colder

Nice neighborhood. The inner part of the Jordan, around the canals, is pretty and inviting. As you move outward it really becomes less interesting. Boring in fact. The restaurants become blah, the bars generic. Shopping...meh. But the closer in part is lovely and charming.

My favorite area. My favorite area in town. Stroll through the small streets, have a coffee, smile at the local passers by, shop in the original shops. You have not seen Amsterdam if you haven't been there

Great Place to Wonder. Our rented apartment was in Jordaan so we go t to know the neighborhood quite well. We absolutely loved it. Jordaan has residential feel and is quite cool. Lots of small restaurants, bars, and shops. You could easily spend half a day wondering through small alleys.At the edge of the neighborhood you can find the Westergate park which is not as famous but really nice. We were lucky to be there during the rolling food trucks festival.

Lovely stroll along canal. Wandered into this neighborhood and found ourselves thoroughly enjoying the winding alleys and friendly cafes. We were initially going to the Anne Frank house, but found the lines and crowds too much to deal with. Found quaint corner deli that served pickled herring and several cheese shops. Definitely take the time to meander around this district.

My Favourite part of Amsterdam!. You can spend hours in the streets of Jordann getting deliberately lost, finding quaint restaurants and tiny bars, looking at different buildings, finding small parks, it's fantastic! If I could live in Amsterdam this is where I would pick.
No all-you-can-eat steak restaurants, or hordes of tourists after a pair of felt clogs. Go, get lost and enjoy!
Best neighborhood in Amsterdam to relax in a sidewalk cafe.. Be sure to visit on a day that the Noordmarket farmers market is open. Not just a bazaar for junk dealers like some other markets
A wonderful walk to Jordaan. I had a great time walking around the alleys and ending up in the Jordaan area !Enjoyed seeing the difference between the sections of Amsterdam

Place to go to avoid drunk tourists. This is a great part of Centrum, with many cool bars, restaurants, where mainly locals go. So "when in Rome..." The good thing about this part of town is that less crowded and there are way less drunk tourists. Really nice walk along many canals in Jordaan especially on a nice day. Weekends are bit busier as all the residents crawl out for a beer or a glass of wine. Highly recommended...

Amsterdam district not to be missed. We enjoyed the Jordaan area which is around Anne Frank House. Take special care to note how many modes of transport fit into such a narrow space, pedestrian, automobile, bicycle and canal boat. A place for many photos.
Spend an afternoon wandering. Had a great time getting lost in the little alleys and sipping coffee at the beautiful cafes on the canal.
An interesting place. This is a very interesting part of Amsterdam. It gives you sense of what the place was all about, shipyards etc. I'm not sure that I'd recommend it late on a night though!

Wine with a view . Sat on the edge of the canal in a small cafe and enjoyed our first carafe of wine at the first stop of our European adventure. Prompt friendly service. Good views. Tasted bitterballen a local treat and of course Dutch cheese. Plenty if food for the price.

Lovely neighbourhood. This is a nice neighbourhood with lots of restaurants bars and shops. Like in other parts the canals run through this place too. Many historical attractions here and you could visit this place by walk from city center. Buildings and layout look the same as the rest of amsterdam
Plenty shops. it is made from route around the canal. There are plenty of restaurants and shops. Worth to try at once!
Hip area - great for dining, bars and shopping. Great area in Amsterdam for restaurants, bars and shopping - cool vibe. Beautiful row houses and flower boxes in the windows.
The Jordaan. Wonderful area filled with shops and cafes. Nine streets make up the area along the canal. Great place for shopping for unusual pieces.

The place to get away from the hordes of tourists. I visit Amsterdam once a month and this is my home like feeling area. I try to get away from the hordes of tourists and tourist trap restaurants in the centre canals. I come here and have a relax drinks amongst real Amsterdamers and hole in the wall great food restaurants. Also good for a stroll through their unique city meets gardens streets.

Great way to stretch your legs. If you have 2 full days, a walk along the canals or around the Squares will give you a flavor of Amsterdam. I didn't see that much at the Jordaan but then shopping did not interest me

Traditional Streets and Canal Views. Anne Frank, Amsterdam Museum and Red Light District are located in the Jordaan area. The streets and the buildings are traditionally dutch. The narrow and tall buildings with two or three windows are typical of dutch architecture. The cobble streets are relaxing and dated. There are several small shops and bars. The canal with moored boats looks beautiful.

The part of Amsterdam you shouldn't miss. Jordaan is a very important neighbourhood in Amsterdam. In here, there are countless beautiful streets, apartments and canals. It sure is a great idea to sit in a bar, order a good beer and just enjoy the fascinating streets and canals in Jordaan. It is quite a big neighbourhood but it is really hard to get enough of this beautiful place and move on to the centre. So you may end up spending more time than you planned in here.
Old Amsterdam.. This area is my favourite because it is away from the usual tourist areas and it is like stepping back in time.Narrow streets old houses quaint shops and very atmospheric.

Awesome cobblestone streets - good for getting lost in!. We loved wondering through the streets of The Jordaan.. Local shop staff were lovely, everyone spoke English (us Aussies are so ignorant and the streets were just so beautiful to look at!! Amsterdam definitely has taken a piece of our hearts - especially around this area!

Beautiful. The Jordaan became my favourite place to just wander around in while I was in Amsterdam. It is so beautiful, and a very relaxing neighborhood; there were many people in the streets of Jordaan, but the atmosphere is still a lot more calm than it is in the centre of the city. Countless of cute cafés and restaurants are situated on every corner and in every alley!

Touch4healthMassage in De Jordaan. Excellent massage if you want to treat yourself to a top quality therapeutic massage in the centre of Amsterdam.
The masseuse is a fully trained professional massage therapist with more than 20 years experience, 5 years at the Dutch National Ballet and Cirque du Soleil.
True essence of Amsterdam. I ll just put it like this. If you only have an hour to spend in Amsterdam, you should spend it wandering around this spectacular part of town.

360 degree of excitement!!. Because you can just stroll the area and everything to excite you will be just around corners.Bars with rich variety of beers where you'll encounter interesting people who are nice and will tell you interesting stories, coffee shops that allow you to carry dreams forward, expand your horizons and meet all kind of people :p (too bad my loving man didn't let me smoke), restaurants serving classic dutch spectacular foods (I love all their foods! Crazy...), fresh markets can pop up near you too - simply said, you can spend just one fine day browsing only Jordaan.And, being in Jordaan - means you are close to all Amsterdam's highlights. Red Light District? Half hour walk, Centraal Station is 15 minutes walk, Dam Square is half hour walk, and when I tried to walk to Nine Street; I got so lucky to get my self trapped in Leidsestraat and Kalverstraat - so there you go! Spend a day to shop till drop also possible just by walking. And if you walk further - without you even realize, you will make your way to the Oud Zuid.I stayed in Jordaan for 3 days and I didn't even need to use public transportation to browse Amsterdam most exciting places.
Loved it!. Loved the neighborhood! Took a stroll around it and admired the life and calmness (after walking through the red light district) of this area.
Beautiful and relaxing.. You can walk for hours and find many little shops and great sidewalk cafes. Take your time and don't expect to see it all.
Shopping Dream. Wonderful neighborhood with shops, cafes, and restaurants. Sit at a cafe along the canal and people watch to your hearts content. I'd compare it to midlevel shopping in SOHO NYC.

Interesting. Did a two hour one-on-one guided walk with Bart of the Jordaan area. The area was very interesting particularly the private courtyards but thought there would be a lot more historical buildings within the area. Bart the guide did a very good job.
Lots of great shoping!. This is where the locals come to shop! We spent many hours in the Jordaan as it was one of our favorites neighborhoods. Many great cafes as well.

Picture time!. Photographs are a must when seeing this neighborhood. The buildings are exactly what you expect to see along the canal! We rode a canal boat first and then later walked through. Beautiful!

Boat Tour a Must. I had no idea the extent of the canal system in Amsterdam until I took a boat tour. It was well worth it and very informative. We saw so much more than we would have only walking. The kids with us enjoyed it also.
Picturesque area of Amsterdam. I really recommend this area with its array of nice shops, restaurants, and buildings. A lovely part of town for a stroll!

a walk through the jordaan. We just walked through the streets of the neighbourhood the Jordaan and enjoyed both the calm and the atmosphere of it.We were drawn by the music played by a Jazz band at the Maddeliefjesplein and just stood their for a number of songs enjoying thhe little sunshine there was. After that we had to warm up in one of the small pubs in the Jordaan, pitty there was no singing there...

Wandering the Jordaan . Easy couple of hours wander in an interesting mixed residential retail neighbourhood. Get a map with the little neighbourhood gardens noted on it. Lots of cafes and restaurants along with some shops but mostly just interesting from an architectural and societal viewpoint. Out of interest I looked up the price of some the flats for sale. Eye watering!

Amazing and calm neighbourhood.. This area is worth a visit. I strolled the street on foot and on bike. Recommended. Not to crowded with tourists and there are several of good options to eat and drink.

I simply love this area of Amsterdam. Probably the area of Amsterdam least altered and possessing of the most character. Home to fantastic old buildings, many excellent bars, cafes and restaurants, great open air markets and eclectic shops. Visit on Saturday and be sure to visit the Noordermarkt next to the Noorderkerk and on the Lindengracht. Stay for afternoon drinks and dinner. We particularly like Café Proust on the Noordermarkt square for a bottle of wine and dinner at Tapas Cafe Duende (on Lindengracht).
A lot of restaurants, bars and people wandering. It is an old neighbourhood, were you can see old houses and streets with lots of young people passing by, drinking beer, having fun.

One of those iconic places. Worth a stroll. The Jordan is just what you'd expect it to be. Cute homes along houseboat-lined canals. Anne Frank house and statue. Loads of bikes. Cafes, restaurants, and boutiques. The heart of Amsterdam

Beautiful architecture. Lovely to walk along the canals and take in the beautiful architecture which is amazing. Lots of nice little cafe's to enjoy a drink, hopefully take in the sunshine and watch all the boats go by on the canal.

One of Europes - if not world´s - prime locations. A lot has been written about the Jordaan - hard to add something valuable, new, inspiring to all the positive quotations. Walking there or admiring the location while enjoying a boat cruise, with all senses savouring the neighbourhood - a real delight. Already simply being there makes one feel happy, more demanding ones will certainly add either shopping, eating/drinking or musea visiting...

Walking tour through the Jordaan. Took a walking/food tour through this neighborhood. Really enjoyed the guide's explanation of the area. He took us to several laces to try Dutch foods. We never would have found these places or tried these dishes without this tour. Loved it.

Yes Everyone take a canal ride... and for a good reason. Canal tours are one of the best ways to see Amsterdam. You do not have to look out for cars, bikes, mopeds, strollers or just pedestrians. This boats take you up close to all of the sites. We were fortunate to take 2 tours on bright sunny days but the boats are designed for those rainy days as well.

Lovely view. It was wonderful to see people by the river relaxing, eating and drinking together. The bikes moving around the city and the people just looked so relax! The trees around the canals make them look stunning. Totally worth taking a boat tour as the view is stunning.

A True Amsterdam Neighborhood . We went through Jordaan following a walking tour described in Rick Steves' guidebook for Amsterdam. The architecture is authentic Dutch. All of the different gable styles are readily recognize able. I was intrigued by the beam and hook at the peak of the gable for hoisting furniture to the upper floors. Be sure to drop into one of the restaurants.
Fantastic neighborhood. Great for walking around. Lots of great little markets, bakeries, neighborhood restaurants and shops - Also we found a great little wine shop.

Lovely area in Amsterdam. Jordan is a charming locality dotted with chick restaurants, pubs and great shopping and indigenous designer boutiques. Also you can get on a canal ride from this area. One of the areas which is a must visit when in Amsterdam. Most food tours begin their tours from here as well.

Walk about and enjoy. So much fun to walk around, go in and out of shops, restaurants, pubs, etc. Great area to stay in. Ann Frank musuem - we walked there, to Van Gogh to Rembrandt and to Heinkein Experience. Great area!
Beautiful. Easy to walk to from the central area but way more local people. Beautiful place and some good food.

Beautiful Area For a Stroll. The Jordaan is an absolutely beautiful area, however, if you are visiting, either do extensive research, use the Rick Steves app and download the Jordaan walk (an hour or so walk with descriptions of what you're seeing), or hire a guide. We chose to hire a private guide who gave us a wealth of info and showed us things like the hidden courtyards. There is so much you'll miss if you try to do it on your own.
Charming neighbourhood. Beautiful area at the heart of Amsterdam. Stunning views of the canals and picturesque shops. Perfect for a nice walk on a sunny day.
Nice. Great neighbor to stroll around and stop in some cafes or boutique stores. A great location to center your trip around

Great Vibe. Strolling through the Jordaan area is a nice way to introduce yourself to Amsterdam. There are canals, unique boutiques, cafes, museums - the works. We spent half of King's Day walking through here and it was crazy and fun, had a great vibe! I'm sure it would be as impressive on a quieter day.

Best part of Amsterdam. To experience the best of Amsterdam, book your stay in a house or room near the Jordaan. The city is a busy place, but the canals, streets, cafes, and pace of life in this section is near idyllic.

Beautiful . My husband and I stayed in the Jordaan area for 3 days and it was stunning.
When the sun in out the scenery is amazing.
Lots of bars, restaurants and boutique shops. Lovely market on Saturdays selling fruit, veg and flowers.
The best way to see everything is by walking!
Cozy. The best district for aimlessly wandering around falling into quaint shops and cafes. Beautiful scenery and often quieter than the main roads. A must-visit when in Amsterdam

THE HEART OF AMSTERDAM.. Close to the Wester Kerk you will find the Jordaan district. Small canals, little side streets and alley ways make this area a real delight for a relaxed stroll. In the "skinny" old houses you will find an array of trendy boutiques and small cafes.A lovely area to admire before visiting the nearby Anne Frank House and going on to the more crowded city centre areas.

Great for a stroll . Go for a walk or a bike ride around the most beautiful streets of the country. Enjoy a nice canal side coffee or have a lunch (apple pie!) in one of the many small cafés in the ares

Stay here in Amsterdam. The most picturesque region containing the Western canals of Amsterdam, removed from the red-light and "coffee house" atmosphere found in the dead center but close to everything. Full of brown cafes (bars with food menus) that are still visited by locals for coffee in the morning and beers and borrel (snacks) after work.
One of Amsterdam's most charming neighborhoods!. The Jordaan has become one of THE go-to picturesque areas in Mokum — plenty of little exotic boutiques, cafes & quaint streets & canals!

A beautiful person neighbourhood . I stayed in a hotel close by, and I loved walking though this neighbourhood. It's a residential neighbourhood so the tourists aren't really all over the place. You can get a feel for local life. Lots of cafés and restaurants. Great photo ops for street photographers.

Stayed in an airbnb in the Jordaan. It is a lovely neighborhood. We rented an apartment rental for ten days on Bloemgracht. It is easily accessible to anything you might need or want to visit and wonderfully peaceful to come home to. Simply walking the canals in this neighborhood is relaxing and enjoyable. We were lucky with the weather and the trees were full and the sun was shining.
The Jordaan is beautiful...... The Jordaan has any and everything you would want and or need. Great restaurants, shops, cafe's, coffee shops. So beautiful and full of history.
Excellent part of the city. You can just stroll in small streets, enjoy restaurants, cafés. Small shops are all around you can really take your time.
Very quaint . Beautiful, I enjoyed it a lot. Will def go back to this area next visit. Was a lovely walk by the canal.

Walking through the Jordaan. Beautiful buildings, so many shops and interesting things to see. Take time to stroll through the Jordaan, which is considered a high end, upmarket place in Amsterdam. You will be pleasantly surprised at what is affordable and the walk through the 9 streets is enjoyable.
Lovely part of Amsterdam. Enjoyed the restaurants in this neighborhood. The ambience is fun and relaxed. Try Cafe 't Smalle. I visit everytime I am in the city.
Great ambiemcr. A fun area to visit - interesting shops and restaurants with a lively vibe to the narrow streets. Great area to stroll and window shop.

Great Area of Amsterdam . We have been fortunate to travel to Amsterdam several times, and returned from another memorable trip at the end of April after enjoying Kings day. Amsterdam is one of the best cities in the world and the Jordan is definitely one of the best areas of the city. It is a world apart from the regular tourist areas and will not disappoint. The area has a great vibe with many off beat shops and little cafes to pass the time with the locals over a cold beer and bitterballen.. The canal area and all of the tourist attractions are within walking distance which makes the peace and quiet of this area that much more enjoyable after a long day enjoying the tourist sights.. We are already looking forward to our next visit to the area.

Beautiful District. This area is a beautiful district, it is full of beautiful canals, perfect for taking a picture of the canals. It has nice architecture and it is full of lovely independent cafe and restaurants. Get a true feel of what Amsterdam is about.
Beautiful part of the city. A nice place to wander and look at the various gable roofs, small streets, and quaint canals. Lovely.

Soak it all in with a cold ice cream. We wandered through this area on a really hot day. Just eating our ice creams and taking the views in. Bring your camera with you. The classic 'I have been to Amsterdam' photo can be taken here overlooking a canal. And a few bicycles locked against the railings. Beautiful! Just beautiful!
A nice neighbourhood for a stroll. Walking next to the canals, admiring the various tiny art galleries is a great experience here. It is not very crowded either.

Old and new together. The Jordaan is a nice place. It is an old part of Amsterdam, where people used to live in small houses. The working class so to say. Nowadays it is an area with a mix of old and new with many hip and young people which reflects in the eateries and bars
Colourful and fun area. Just wandering around the streets, even took a boat cruise to go by this area. Very colorful, very charming, very relaxing area

Meander, don't rush!!. The Jordaan has been a favourite of mine since I came to Amsterdam in 2012. Its a laidback type of place. There are a lot of tourists around the Westerkerk and Anne Frank's House of course, but as you head a little more west, the tourists are less visible. Try out the restaurants and bars, and relax. There all several good ones. On a Summer's day, there is nothing like it!!

I live there. I work in Amsterdam and live in Jordaan. It's a quiet area in the center of the city. You won't see much action, but it's my favorite district for a walk mear the canals. If you go deep enough, you will ind yourself at the italian street. All kinds of good italian foods can be found there. Most of them are good quality. I recommend to walk around Jordaan at night when it's dark. Very safe and romantic. You can jump into one of the boughts if you want to have a break, but I dont recommend that if you are afraid of falling into the canals and looking like an idiot :p
Lovely area, but rapidly being overrun by tourists. Lovely area, but, as I said, rapidly being overrun by tourists. Much better at night, after the hordes are gone. Find a small cafe and chill out.

Lovely quiet part of Amsterdam.. We came here with 5 friends its a really nice quiet neighbourhood, but does have local shops Albert (supermarket) stocks best bread btw wee tip yummy. & local coffee shops too Abraxis is just on corner they do great selection if you know what I mean & & cups o t & service is great as well.
