Its about a 30-40 min walk fae station but you just stick to walking along beautiful canals you should be ok getting there & its doesn't hurt to print a map from google maps for central station to your destination it makes life a lot easier but its a really nice walk up & down to Jordan esp at night when its all light up can be quite romantic if that's the plan. But you will get a decent taxi driver show him your address or phone your host first let them know your gona get a taxi & they will probably give you a taxi nu.So happy holidays
Perfect for walk!. It's a great area to walk around in a sunny day and enjoy this amazing views! The architektur is beautiful and canals looks like like in a tale.
Magical timepiece place.. Has alot of surrounding bringing on spectacular views from the canal around. So much to see for a place mostly waterway mode transport. Never fail.
A picturesque and peacful part of Amsterdam.. We took a two hour self guided walk around the Jordaan and can recomend this quiet part of town if that's the sort of thing you like.
Enjoy it on a sunny day. You will get to see the variety of houses of diff sizes and windows, perfect for architects! Take snaps of the water houses, amazing how some live in the water..

The best place of Amsterdam . I love this place, it is a small village in a big town. Her are the best restaurants and the nices bars of whole Amsterdam. The streets are beautiful with nice houses and trees. Everybody knows there neigbours and everybody is kind in the neigbourhout. It is really expensive to rent a house but it is the best place to live. I am living her with a small child and a love it here.

Great area to walk around.. The Jordaan is a great area to walk around and browse. It has an arty air about it with very unusual shops and interesting merchandise. Perfect for a sunny day in Amsterdam, stop at a cafe and have a coffee, watch the people walk by, soak up the atmosphere.
Great neighborhood and canals.. Fun to walk around local housing nest to canals, see locals on a chair getting sun, great cafes and wine bars next to canals to chill. Trendy area.
Lovley place to spend a day. A wonderful neighborhood with intersting streets that ar full of curious buildings, shops, restaurants and bars where you can enjoy yourself all day long.

See real Amsterdam. Avoid the hordes of Central Amsterdam and walk through the pleasant surroundings of the Jordaan. The area was originally built in the 17th century, for the "lower classes", and the name derives from the French word "jardin" (garden). I used a 1990 (!) pamphlet from one of many previous visits, describing the area's narrow streets and intimate canals. In the last 50 years the area has become popular with students, artists and musicians, and one can still find good cafes and restaurants which are predominantly not dominated by tourists. I am sure the VVV offices might still provide some sort of brochure. If not, just find the area from any map of the city and amble round enjoying the gables, architecture and refreshment opportunities.

Favourite area in Amsterdam. This was an area we had already decided to visit based upon reviews - and it was worthwhile, even if we completed a very circular route to get there because of a poor map. You really enjoy the canals in this area - which provides the essence of Amsterdam, the beautiful houses, pleasant cafes - and if you are there at the right time, a lovely small market selling wonderful bread, food and other items. Just great to walk, take in the beauty of the area and chill in an outside cafe with a beer.
So nice!. We stayed in this area with an Air B'n'B and it's great! Beautiful buildings, markets and gorgeous shops! Great little bars too! So glad we stayed in this area!
Nice neighborhood. We walked in this neighborhood before our 7:15 appointment to tour the Anne Frank house. The residents and tourists were enjoyed sidewalk cafes and it was a lovely experience.

Less Crowded than central - buzzy for a discerning crowd. 15 minutes west of Daam square, outside of the stag dos and canabis wielders, this neighbourhood is exactly right for what I like to do in Hollands first city - meander, perouse, coffee, tasty dining, charming hosts. You never feel intimidated or out of kilter with this areas pace and pulse. Everywhere remains walkable - the Brits abroad hoards sufficiently far out of sight as to virtually not exist. Makes you want to return.
Beautiful. This area, has an amazing relaxing, cultural feel to it. Beautiful buildings! Bridges. The nine streets have different, quirky, unique and very individual shops.

The Greenwich Village of Amsterdam. The Jordaan is full of small restautants, cafes, bars, shopping boutiques, bakeries and sights. Great area for meandering with the locals without the tourist crowds of Dam Square.

The best district. In my opinion if you have already seen Dam Platz and the other crowded place in Amsterdam Jordaan is the best place where to "inhale" the dutch way of living. Dont miss the market on saturday
Nice for a wander. If it's a pretty day, then it's nice to wander along and see the city. Good to stop and have a coffee along the way.
Best part of the city . Its less touristy, haş great restaurants, bars, cafe, gorgeous canals and architecture. Aldo vertu close to centrum, stay here or by here and walk yo the tourist sites.

Fantastic Neighbourhood . The Jordan is a fantastic neighbourhood rain or shine boasting some of the best contemporary galleries restaurants and bars to some of the newest always a must when visiting Amsterdam

Lovely area with a good Buzz. We loved this area - it was a great place just to wander and window shop. Plenty of good coffee shops and restaurants A great place to people watch over a glass or two of your favorite tipple.
Go!. Lovely walks in all the small streets of the Jordaan. Get a map and walk... So many different houses ,cafés and lots of small restaurants . The canals are part of this area

The best neighborhood in Amsterdam. Really.
Beautiful grachts, nice and friendly people, great food and indie shopping, small enough to walk around.
Felt safe around the clock.
Lovely . Probably the prettiest place we came across in Amsterdam. Lovely to walk around here in the day especially when it's lovely and sunny!! Definitely recommend
Beautiful . The Jordaan is very beautiful. Take a canal cruise to see and learn about the dam and the locks. There are waterways throughout the city.

simply beautiful!. the scenery within Amsterdam is incredible. this area has extremely unique and beautiful architecture and colours. the canals are lovely. this area looks like a real fairytale village come to life! be careful when walking, bikers never stop!
Cool.... In spite of the cold and wet weather, we thoroughly enjoyed wandering around the streets of this lovely area, with its many interesting shops, cafes, bars and restaurants. Excellent.

Feel Amsterdam. One MUST walk through this area to feel Amsterdam! From the beautiful streets to the wonderful shops and the fabulous market on Saturdays, one will not feel Amsterdam without a walk through this area! The area has shops (food, clothing, museums, and anything one wants to find here! One must look and he/she will find excellent places to explore! I never go to Amsterdam without a visit here!

Well worth a visit. Skip the high streetside with the golden oldie chainstores and wander around The Jordaan and its little boutiques and quirky/ trendy stores. It gives a way better view of just how beautiful Amsterdam really is.

Fabulous location . We booked an apartment in Prinsengracht. Fabulous restaurants in the area, and very close to all the sights in central amsterdam . We walked nearly everywhere and had a fabulous time over Konings dag.
Lovely place!. Et flott sted å bo og besøke når du er i Amsterdam. Et must når du er i Amsterdam. Just walk along the canals and take life easy. It is very beautiful. Recommended!

Interesting neighbourhood to visit. Lots of cafés, restaurants and varieties of food to sample in a more residential area of Amsterdam. Within easy walking distance of Central Station and Dam Square - well worth a visit!

My favorite neighborhood in Amsterdam . De Jordaan is a hip neighborhood in Amsterdam located just southwest of centraal station. It houses some of the best restaurants, shopping and walkable streets in all of Amsterdam. If you are looking to do some shopping head to the area that the locals call the Nine Streets.
Interesting area. This is a really cool area, many cafes and shops to enjoy, we spent quite a few hours here just cruising the streets taking it all in.
Charm of Amsterdam. I had the most pleasurable stay in this area. There's always something to explore and be at awe at. I would definitely revisit when I head back to Amsterdam.

Where old and new meet. This is an older neighbourhood of Amsterdam that is filled with smaller streets and old houses. A lot of those however have been converted to hide more modern living quarters behind the traditional appearance. Unfortunately this has taken away a little bit of the authenticity. There are many small cafes and restaurants. This is a nice area to go for a walk, but it is also very much an area where people live, so be respectful towards the locals
Just wander. There are lots of quirky shops in this area and beautiful houses. At intersections just watch out for the bikes especially the wobbly hire bikes.

A lovely friendly neighbourhood with quaint old streets. We enjoyed staying in this neighbourhood. There were cafes and restaurants and shops for food everywhere. Locals in cafes were friendly and talked to us. The local street markets were interesting and cosmopolitan. We could easily get trams and we could walk to central station

A walk in a great city.. A easy walk that you can do in about 2 hours with stops to take photos and shopping.See Amsterdam old city crossing canals, narrowest house in the city and apartments,as well as restaurants and churches.

The village feel in abig city. OK this is my old home, so I'm biassed! The Jordaan - the "Jordanian quarter" was three centuries ago where Arabic merchants traded, hence the name. This is where you see traditional canals (grachten), traditional merchants houses and warehouses - mostly converted to bijoux apartments. There are lots of bridges bikes and activity on the water. What I love is the traditional bars, the small cafes and the quirky shops. The Jordaan is a great place for a stroll, a drink or a cheap meal. The Jordaan is still very much "lived in"; real residents in a real and active community. The Jordaan gives you a real sense of what it is to be Dutch and in particular an Amsterdammer.

Nice Area in Amsterdam. We rented an apartment along the canal which was nicely situated to restaurants & shopping. Can walk to the museums. Lovely neighborhood, mostly quiet. Unfortunately, it rained & was cold, but was sunny for King's Day.

Quintessential Amsterdam neighborhood. We stayed in a great little ground-floor apartment in the Jordaan neighborhood and LOVED it! Great neighborhood of quiet streets to walk, but plenty of activity, good restaurants, and cute shops. We walked everywhere and enjoyed every moment of our time in the Jordaan.

Walk, walk, walk. The most intimate area of old Amsterdam. Take at least an entire morning or afternoon for it and enjoy a real good evening in one of the many bars and/or restaurants. Take it slowly and simply walk around.

Storlling through The Jordaan. One of the nicest areas in Amsterdam is the Jordaan. Lots of small shops and picturesque canals. You can walk the Jordaan without too much concern for kamikaze bicycists! Enjoy the less bustling, but beautiful canals and surrounding buildings that are slightly leaning or twisting. Walk back into the 18th century in architecture, shop the shops (including bakeries), and return rejuvenated to the bustle of the central part of the city and Dam Square.

Food tour and saloon boat canal trip.. Food tour of the Jordaan area was book on line and a high point of 3 days in Amsterdam. So much to taste you can forget about needing lunch or dinner. The boat was 107 years old and held about 12. This was a 3.5 hour eating and history walk and ride. It started at 11am at a tavern Bill Clinton still goes to once a year for Dutch apple pie. Forget politics he knows good food.

One of the coolest parts of town to stay in. We rented an apartment overlooking the Singel canal in the Jordaan district of Amsterdam.The Jordaan is an eclectic combination of residences, cafés, boutiques and antique clothing stores, bookstores, coffee houses, and real life Amsterdam intersected by multiple scenic canals and cobblestone walkways.it is lively and safe at all hours and provides a perfect city location central to virtually everything you want to see.

Beautiful Neighbor. Walk from Amsterdam Central station to this beautiful neighborhood of Amsterdam. The homes and houseboat homes and little gardens on and off the canals are so charming. Take in little shops with a local artisans flare.Have a coffee on a street side cafe.
Awesome neighborhood!. Cute neighborhood with fun shops. Very beautiful too! Definitely worth checking out on a trip. Be sure to go to the Cheese Museum over there--free samples and fun atmosphere.
Great area. Walk around the neighborhood was fun. Lots of shops and restaurants. Near Anne Frank museum. Sara's pancake bakery was great. Belgium waffles the best, no syrup required

Nice lanes but better in dry weather. The area of The Jordaan was made up of lanes and routes around the canal. Don't go on Monday morning unless you aren't expecting to look in the shops, some don't open until 12pm or 1pm.

Beautiful area. What a beautiful area to walk around and soak up the peaceful atmosphere. Finding somewhere to have a drink isn't easy but the ones you do find are absolute gems. Grab a lager and sit outside and etch the world go by xx

Decent neighbourhood in a Tourist City. Amsterdam is famous for lots of things, including Tourists and the red light district. To get a place to live where ther's serenity as well as blooming life, it's tough. But that's what Jordaan is all about. Amazing homes dating to 16th century can be seen in the narrow streets. U can see imitations of cats, puppies, boy ,girl , kind of climbing on the balconies. I still don't understand the exact meaning of this, but I have seen different homes having different things decorated in balconies.The best restaurants can be found at walkable distances in Jordaan.The best thing is the quiet n beauty of the place. Loved every bit of it.Please do walk or cycle the streets. Avoid transports, that's what Amsterdam is all about.
EXTREMELY NICE. I loved that this neighborhood has been recreated. It is filled with little shops run by the owners. Lovely!

overrated. nice place, cool atmosphere, but not much more special than the other neighborhoods. because of the hype, prices are slightly higher. I would recommend visit areas more to the west, where they are still more exited to serve tourists

Quintessential Amsterdam!!. Stayed in the Jordaan and it was an excellent choice. It's close enough to walk to bustling downtown, but far enough to enjoy quiet at night. Walking these streets will take your breathe away. At night it's cool to take a stroll and admire the beautiful architecture. There are some really nice lofts and home rentals available in this area, check it out!

Go there, it's Amsterdam at its best!. This is the old workers quarter of the city, just off the chique canals. It starts right across the canal from the Anne Frank House. Small streets, lots of great bars and restaurants and nice little shops. You can easily spend a day walking this area, especially when the markets are there (farmers market on Saturday) Do not visit Amsterdam without visiting de Jordaan.

It's all here. We love this central location. It is the artsy area with lots of shops and restaurants. It is also a brief walk to Central Station which makes it very convenient. Unless you are traveling for business, stay in one of the AirBNB locations or small hotels here!
Chillax!. Relaxing boat cruise with family. Tickets cost about EUR 9.50 apiece. Highly recommend the night cruise, when it is a bit more quiet and serene.

Overrated. I'm from Bombay and I could not get what the hype about this neighbourhood was. Even on a weekend, it was quiet and hardly any activity around the place, or may be I went to the wrong streets? Saturday Noordermarkt is supposed to be good, but by the time we reached there, they had all packed up. Good to walk around when the weather is good, and to get a sense of an Amsterdam neighbourhood, but avoid if you have very little time in the city.

We rented a houseboat in The Jordaan. We loved staying in The Jordaan. It gave us a feel for what it would be like to live in Amsterdam, that is if we could afford to live in this luxurious and beautiful neighborhood. We loved just sitting on the deck of our houseboat watching the world go by. There was always so much to see any time of day. The market on Saturday was a treat. The small shops were fun and the shopkeepers friendly and welcoming.

A lovely peaceful and beautiful part of the city. Saturday market excellent. Foods and arts heaven. Nice selection of cafes in which to sit and reflect on life. A definate must to walk around. None of the rowdy drinkers and lesser mortals.
oude jordaan. you can do a walking tour by youself. this is a old workingclass neigbourhood. with nice cafes and buildings

Great area to walk!. Walking up and down these streets, along the picturesque canals lined with beautiful housing and vibrant restaurants and shops is exhilarating. Loved this area of Amsterdam. Very accessible from the central city.

A Charming spot .... There are always hoards of tourists at the centre that diminish the further from the centre you go...Jordan is a little corner that has lots of character and interesting nooks and crannies to explore .

Beautiful area for biking. We spent several hours biking around this beautiful area of Amsterdam. There are lots of shops, cafes and restaurants to explore but we just enjoyed biking up and down the charming canals!

Great area to stay in!!!!. We are renting an apartment in the north part of the Jordaan district. I didn't realize how fantastic an area it was.. The district is quiet with many shops and nice residences.. More of a residential area with many great cafe's, shops, bakeries, meat and fish stores.. In particular uw VolEndammer Vishandel can't be missed!!!!!

Charming!. This neighborhood is an absolute must when I'm Amsterdam.
Hundreds of pictures opportunities.
Bring your camera!
Stroll in Amsterdam. Had an afternoon stroll in Jordaan, lots of shops, eating places and clearly an area visited by locals and tourists alike.
Great area to wander round. This is a great area to wander through and take in the architecture with numerous cafe's and bars to visit.

Another side of Amsterdam. Rick Steve's Amsterdam Guidebook has a guided walk around the Jordann neighborhood. It is a good 1-2 hour stroll along gorgeous bridges, canals and Amsterdam houses. A must-visit if you want to experience a side of the city away from the frenetic tourist center.

Great walking neighborhood. Amsterdam is a great walking city, but the best part for walking that we found was The Jordaan neighborhood. Picturesque canals, great canal view cafes for drinking a beer or glass of wine, great food, the best apple cake we ever had at Winkels, and endless walking makes this a great place to just stroll and soak in the atmosphere.If you are American watch out for the bicycles, but otherwise it is as fine a walk as the Highline in NYC, or a stroll up the Champs-Elycees.

Well Worth Exploring. I spent part of two days exploring the Jordaan. First on a pushbike stopping to look at quirky shops or drink coffee and watch the world go by, and then, as part of a photography themed walking tour. the Jordaan is very vibrant and interesting. I got lost on the day I was there on the bike, and the experience of being lost ended up making it all the more enjoyable. I'd been following the suggested route from a guidebook; having to figure out where I was and where I was headed led me down all sorts of interesting streets and canals. Do think about including a potter through the Jordaan as part of any trip to Amsterdam. It ended up being one of the highlights of my visit to beautiful Amsterdam.

Arty, good cafes.. A fairly bohemian area, good cafes , a relaxed atmosphere. Good to stroll around & look at the interesting arty shops. Great for people watching whilst you have a coffee & lovely Dutch Apple cake .

A gorgeous little stroll in the Jordaan . This neighbourhood is an absolute must visit for all people visiting Amsterdam, especially for first timers! The buildings have been maintained over the years and are a beautiful piece of heritage and culture. Loads of quaint, beautiful little shops and foodie places dotted around. Go on a sunny stroll and just enjoy the ambience :)

SPECTACULAR! . Went there for a short layover and once again, we had a blast. I love that part of Amsterdam as there's such a flair and great aura about it. The buildings were so beautiful lining up on the canal. There's so many cool little restaurants and bars all along. Can't wait to be back there.

A taste of the golden age of Amsterdam. Probably the most interesting neighborhood of Amsterdam. The houses, streets and canals are really beautiful and it isn't as packed as the main canals. I like to get on my bike and just ride along the streets without any purpose. The shops, cafes, patios and the street market are really nice also. Definitely a neighborhood to visit if you want to have a taste of Amsterdam.
Typical. Now, this is problably the most typical area in Amsterdam that shows how the city has been built in the water. Sounds touristic but take the boattrip

it is a great place where local lives. I used t live in this city for 5 years and Jordaan is the place we were always going as locals. It is the true flair of Amsterdam. Please take time to walk in the area.

OLD AREA OF AMSTERDAM CENTRE. this pl better.art of AMSTERDAM ,is nice to walk or to bike in.on monday morning thy have a market at the WESTERSTRAAT.on saturday thy have it on the LINDENGRACHT,and arround the NOORDERMARKT.if you like to see how thy builth the houses in that canals and Streets ,than i give you the advice to do it on sunday morning.than there are not that many people and you can see al.tru the week you can visit some old cafe,s,and look at some nice stores .even many good restaurants ,big and small are there.many to see and to do.

A place to walk around when in Amsterdam. This is Amsterdam's most atmospheric neighbourhood's, full of hip cafes and restaurants, as well as lovely independent shops and an amazing atmosphere! Walk around here, zig-zagging the lovely streets and traditional houses and enjoy the company of artists and students as well as other happy visitors. Guaranteed nice time!

The true dutch neighbourhood of Amsterdam. Everybody knows how crowded, noisy and dirty the city centre of Amsterdam can be, with thousands of tourists of all ages wandering around. Sometimes it's not a nice experience and one feels being part of the herd.Jordann is a different place. It's an authentic dutch neighbourhood where the pace is slower, the shops are local and there is no rush with cars and bikes.For me this is the best Amsterdam has to offer with nice Cafés, restaurants, galleries and shops.
Best place to stay. Try and stay in this area of Amsterdam. I stayed 6 nights in an apartment and the location is perfect for shopping, cafes, bars and for wandering along the canals.

Very Quaint Neighborhood. Our AirBNB was located in Jordaan, so any time we left to go anywhere, we were fortunate to be able to walk through this charming neighborhood. This part of Amsterdam was once home to the lower class, but it is now home to what seems to be a younger population and is full of good restaurants, pretty homes and narrow streets. It is a beautiful environment for a home base during your visit to Amsterdam.
Great walking and shopping. We always wonder the streets and canals of the Jordaan each visit. Lots of small shops, hidden eateries, and life happening all around you.

Lovely. . I could walk these streets forever. Quaint, pretty, pubs and cafés everywhere and such interesting shops.
It's the epitome of Amsterdam.
so nice and quiet. you can walk and use bikes around the canals. many lovely houses and the saturdays you have big market

Beautiful Area filled with amazing history. We stayed in this area during our trip to Amsterdam. there are amazing sights, restaurants, bars, etc. to see while in the area. Make sure to look at the different roof types and beautiful buildings and house boats alike.
Beautiful architecture. We had a beautiful walk through the Jordaan neighborhood. The architecture was beautiful and it was a nice quiet respite from the noise of central Amsterdam.
Walk and walk, any direction. Beautiful.. Take your time yo,walk in any street or canal, in any direction. Stop for coffee or a meal. Look any direction, see the buildings up close, beautiful.
Sightseeing. Viewed the area by Canal cruise and lots of history. Didn't get a chance to walk around on foot but worth a visit

Beautiful place but.... Great views on both canals and apartments even people walking by, be extra carefull when walking around Amsterdam, bikers are a little agressive, as the place is full of tourists from all over the world, all year round. The ground is not so clean as both human and animal waste could be in any corner.
The cutest neighborhood ever.. As if taken out of a dutch fairy tale book. The cuteness factor is very high. 17th century lovelyness around the canals. how can it get better than this.

Place to stay next time!. Most beautiful part of Amsterdam, I think. Wish we had known about this section ahead of time. Beautiful canal houses, cafes, shops, views. We will definitely look for a place in this section on our next trip.
Great area. Have a stroll around the streets or along the canal. There are many great little shops and cafes to keep you busy. Its trendy and quaint.

Beautiful side of town. This part of Amsterdam is perhaps the nicest section of canals, canal homes, the occasional cafe and shops. It makes for excellent exploration on foot and with your camera. We even found a little Saturday market near Haarlemstraat that had such a nice variety of Dutch cheeses, produce, meats, seafood, trinkets, shoes, clothing and all manner of everything interesting. Always a great stroll.
Nice Scenary. Scenary in Joordan is nice and worth taking a look. It is around a 15-20 mins walk from the Amsterdam Central Station.

Such a lovely area of Amsterdam. This area of the city features traditional canal houses, tiny cafes and great restaurants where the Dutch eat. Its very quaint and quite a few of the streets and canals are only accessible to view if you walk or cycle. Take a stroll along by the canal as there are plenty of photo opportunities.

Lovely walk and few drinks. Lovely picturesque setting on a canal with few little bars and quiet vibe. would recommend for a chill out or relaxing day. near all attractions and central station if needed.
Quaint. A lovely area with numerous shops. It's lovely to amble along the canals and just revel in the fact that you're in Amsterdam.
Place to be!. The Jordaan is s great area for folks to stay in Amsterdam, it has a great neighborhood vibe. Lots of fun places to eat and easy access to the nightlife.

Love this area. A great place to stay, peaceful, quiet, beautiful. I just loved this area, even just to walk around. A nice place to stay as well if you like the peace and quiet. Not far from the central station, but about a 20-30 minute walk to the square.

Pretty area. Enjoy a stroll through the neighborhood, but be prepared to feel like a voyeur. You feel like you don't belong because you don't. Take pictures in a more tourist-y zone. Respect these people's homes.

What is not to like?. This is a great area of Amsterdam. Close to central station but not the red light district. Lovely bars and cafes. Got to love all those shops. Conceptual and quirky with a healthy smattering of local shops.

Delightful place to walk around . Lovely area to wander around taking in the beautiful homes plus other quaint buildings and canalsWear very comfortable shoes as the beautiful cobble footpaths are uneven. It's great to just walk with no actual destination as you will see such wonderful sights. Stop all the time and look up down and around but WATCH OUT for cyclists and motor scooters they drive very fast on the footpath and don't seem to give way to anyone. Be careful on crossings too even with the crossing telling you to cross, double check as its not always safe.

Beautiful area . This is one of the most beautiful areas in Amsterdam, there are quaint shops, nice
Cafes, if you go down some of the side streets they become very reasonably priced. This area is only a short walk away from the red light district area but in the Jordaan you will not find any coffee shops.
Lovely Jordaan. This is the place to stay! a short walk from the bustle of the City centre, this area is peaceful and characterful with interesting little shops and restaurants.
Lovely to wander. Fun place to meander on a sunny day. Very pretty, lots of nice cafes & small local shops. Could be a bit bleak in the rain though!
magic. Seen from the boat and on foot, a beautiful part of the city that you must see.It must be wonderful in the spring

Beautiful area with galleries, shops, great people watching. One of the great places to be in Amsterdam. Gentrified since the 1970s, the area is now a posh district with art galleries, boutiques, little shops and plenty of garden spaces. The Anne Frank House is in the Jordaan so you have tickets, you can spend a morning doing a bit of exploration & then visit the museum. Beautiful area.

The best area in Amsterdam. A great place to just stroll around and soak up the atmosphere. Nice bars, coffee shops, restaurants and interesting little boutiques. A world away from the nosier and less subtle Red Light district. We spent most of our time in and around the Jordaan.

Scenic Neighbourhood with Food & Flea markets. The Jordaan is a beautiful and extremely scenic neighbourhood in Amsterdam.
The views of the canals, little shops and eateries all around adds to its appeal. One can find food markets and flea bazar too here. Nice place to go for a food tour and some souveniers shopping
I wandered for hours.... What a cheerful, charming part of Amsterdam! SO photo-perfect! That's where I bought my souvenirs for friends back home.
Charming. The Jordaan is not a place you go to do things, it's where you go to look at the charming 1700 pretty houses, pretty bridges and you walk along the canal path. Its a lovely little place.
Food tour!. We took a food tour through the Jordaan and we were very pleased! Saw the sites, learned the history and ate and drank our way though!

Lots of litter. Nearly everywhere in Amsterdam is covered in cigarette ends and chewing gum stuck to the floor. I was quite surprised to see this because it made the place look scruffy and I expected Amsterdam to be very smart and beautiful, which it is not! The place is dark and depressive with very tall buildings most of them apartments and thousands of cycles - they are everywhere and don't stop if you are in their way! I was very disappointed with the place and wouldn't visit again!

The best neighbourhood in Amsterdam!. During our short stay in Amsterdam we choose to stay in a little apartment in The Jordaan and it was by far the best decision we made.With quaint little eateries, busy canals, beautiful architecture and more, we could have spent the whole trip exploring the Jordaan. There are also excellent transport links if you want to venture further afield.I would definitely recommend visiting the food market and flea market on Saturday morning to get a taste of what the Jordaan has to offer.
Pleasure. It was a wonderful sunny day,. We live walking, people were very friendly, if you like walking you will enjoy
Nothing much at Jordaan. We walk through Jordaan on a Sat morning. There's nothing much as most shops are closed. If time is limited, you can give this place a miss.

Jordaan under the lights. I saw this neighbourhood during my night Blue Boat Cruise. I realised only after the cruise got completed as the voice over guide on the cruise was of no help. It is as beautiful under the lights as it is during daylight.

Our favorite neighbourhood. We can easily spend a day wandering the canals and taking photographs. So many architectural details and interesting shops to explore. Best people watching in the city on the many canals. Can't wait to go back!

Peaceful and safe area to wander at night. We stayed as a family at easter. The area was close to our hotel and we went there during the day and evening. The architecture is magnificent and their are lots of cafes, restaurants in the area.It has great mix of the old and contemporary.
Food and canal Tour. Great places Great Tour Guide (ilyne) fantastic canal Tour on Pulitzer tourist boat.....end offcourse the fabulous captain ....

Lovely part of Amsterdam. The area known as Jordaan makes for some really nice pictures. It's quite easily one of the loveliest parts of Amsterdam.The view of beautiful buildings, each done up differently, statues and boats parked in the canals is one of our favourite memories of Amsterdam.

Quaint, more authentic Amsterdam. Has a lot of great shops and restaurants. Cosy streets with nice, more traditional, architecture. Less touristy but typically still fairly busy with the odd number of tour groups intertwined with the locals.
Not to be missed. Jordaan is a great place t visit.we stayed in the area. Plenty to see and do. The Saturday markets should not be missed.

upscale location in Amsterdam. Originally a working-class neighbourhood, the Jordaan has become one of the most expensive, upscale locations in the Netherlands. many shops around to have a coffee. you can walk it or see it by bicycle.
Old buildings. Viewed from our canal cruise was the area known as the Jordaan. Each building different in some way.
A lovely way to spend a couple of hours. Strolled around this lovely community on a bright sunny morning. Several interesting statues hidden in secluded corners and lots of charming buildings.

The cultured part of Amsterdam. Some of the better restaurants and pubs, (generally) away from the tourist traffic but close enough to it if you get lost. It's my favourite part of Amsterdam. If you're a couple looking for a nice weekend in the city, this is your best option..
Great place to wonder. Some great little art galleries, shops ,cafes and bars. really lovely to wonder around day or night . Or sit and watch the world go by !!

Nice for food. Our hotel was about a 15 minute walk from our hotel and we came here a few nights to eat and it was definitely worth our while. Lovely restaurants. Came here one morning to stroll and wander around. Cute shops and a pleasant place to pass a few hours. We had a coffee in a canal side coffee shop which was lovely. While it was nice here it didn't blow my mind away.

Most charming neighbourhood of Amsterdam. Come here if you love small hidden streets, little cafe's and restaurants and wandering around. Very pretty and cute neighbourhood which comes alive in the weekend when all the neighbours sit in front of their houses, the little terraces are full with peopl ejoying the sun and the canals full of boats!
A stroll on the beautiful side . It was a great walk with friends and at night the fun starts, it's like no one is sleeping and everyone wants to see the Red side of the city night lights.

Was not that impressed. Based on the excellent ratings here on TA, my wife and I wandered this neighborhood for a few hours. Perhaps we didn't go to the right areas, but we just weren't all that impressed. It certainly is a nice, residential and commercial neighborhood, but we just didn't see what the fuss was about. But, based on other reviews, clearly we are outliers in our opinion. I would suggest asking ahead of time what specific areas of the Jordaan to visit before going.

Quiet & pretty . The Jordaan area is a lovely place to wander around in. The side canals are very picturesque. It's a place to get lost then find your way again. There are plenty of shops to browse in and bars to sit a while in too. A must see area of Amsterdam.
Interesting. Pretty and interesting, we visited on a canal tour and the audio guide was full of information about the area. Some nice little kitch shops too
Beautiful. A lovely area to walk around, sit with a drink and rest or watch life go by. Pretty shops to. Very near to the Anne Frank House. Easy to find by canal bike or tram.
Beautiful Amsterdam. Beautiful area consisting of houses, restaurant/cafes, canals and stores. This is the picturesque area you a quaint Amsterdam with.
Beautiful. A very beautiful neighborhood, nice to walk around the streets and canals. Not much to do besides that.

A stroll along the canals. Hard to go wrong in the Jordaan district. I wandered around for what seemed lifelike hours, taking in the sights and eating small plates and copious amounts of bier. Seemed like the first day of spring as all the locals were outside, relishing in the warm weather. The vibe was really cool.
Nice and beautiful neighbourhood. its right in the Dam district. Lovely neighbourhood with some funky restaurants. its just fun walking down the lane and experiencing what the city
Not a straight building in sight. This was a very interesting area, easy walking, you just had to watch out for for Cary bicycles. Many of the buildings lean in all directions. Well worth the time
Relaxing. A nice place for a relaxing stroll looking at the houseboats after the busy city centre. Beautiful Dutch architecture.

Interesting streets. The area which is the Jordaan is much larger than a map would indicate and we followed directions for a walk around this area from our AA Amsterdam pocket guidebook. It was quite interesting although we felt the guide was a little inaccurate in places and street names weren't always visible. Additionally, several roads were under maintenance and difficult to negotiate. However, we managed to see some lovely little private courtyards and many of the interesting streets of this area.

Great to explore!. Not only will you find the best apple pie in this area, but its a lot quieter than the centre of town. There are loads of shops and if you are feeling adventurous, there is a lot of food to be eaten. Would recommend you see it!
Great area to wander around. We really enjoyed our time wandering around here, past the canals and sampling the many cafes/bars. Sadly missed the northern market as it was easter sunday

Awesome!. I recommend anyone to start the day walking through streets of the friendly Joordan neighborhood, the old working-class distric that eventually got popular among artists and bohemians and became a posh, happy and trendy district . Just wander with no hurry (you will get lost anyway) and enjoy the neibourhood atmosphere. It is a charming neighborhood , full of cool cafes, bars, shops, thrift stores, beautiful canals, narrow streets and restaurants of all types, perfect for those who want to experience this most charming side of town, away from the red lights windows, stores chain and fast food restaurants. One of the coolest things is that here lies Westerkerk Church that houses the remains of the painter Rembrandt and whose sound of the bell was mentioned in the diary of Anne Frank. The tower can be visited with a guided tour and has the best view of the entire city. There are 85 meters high and many steps.
Nice Neiborhood. Nice Neighborhood to wonder around. Very safe and plenty of shops. This will show another side of Amsterdam compared to the RLD.
Nice shopping, quiet area. Small shops, seldom seen items, outside the tourist streets. Jordaan is nice region fir walking and shopping.

A Delicious Adventure. A really great way to see a very cosy and interesting neigbourhood. A small group meant that it was easy to talk to everyone and get to know people. Our guide, Arlene, was super friendly and knowledgable. I felt very well looked after. There was a great variety of food stops and I learnt so much history as well! What an experience to sit in a 400 year old cafe eating the best apple pie in the world then finding out that Bill Clinton is a regular there!

A stylish and classy end of town. This area was by far our favourite in the city. With plenty of independent restaurants and shops serving up some creative offerings. Only a short walk from the busy and touristy city centre – it's worth straying a little to get a lot back.

Most beatteful place in town. This is the most iconic neighborhoods in Amsterdam with its amazing canals, and cozy cafes. You must take your time to sit down in one of the many bars and cafes and watch people pass by while enjoying a great beer.

Beautiful and Historic neighborhood. We took an evening stroll through the Jordaan (pronounced "your-DAN") guided by the free Rick Steves podcast. It was awesome. If you love to stroll and feel a little bit like a local, this is the place for you.
A Peaceful Neighborhood . It was good to walk around this neighborhood with the family. We visited small boutique shops and ate delicious snacks along the way. It was a unique Dutch experience.

Can't Get Enough. I've stayed at The Toren previously which was located in The Jordan. Now I've stayed at Hotel Andaz which isn't that far. It's nice to walk around the area and could never get enough of it. We will definitely be back soon.

SO happy we stayed in this neighborhood, and it IS a neighborhood!. Loved being a part of local daily life in this charming area. We will definitely return! We found "our" bakery and "our" kibbeling shop and "our" bar. After a week or so, people start to recognize you and say hello. Close to everything, but quiet at night.
Lovely area for a wander. Nice area to stroll around,the houseboat museum is interesting and stop for coffee and apple pie at koffiehuis de Hoek. You wont be disappointed.
Good place for a stroll. Very nice neighbourhood for a walk and a prosecco on a sunny day. Lots of nice places, wonderful architecture, and a really good general feel to the entire neighbourhood.
Lovely part of Amsterdam. We did this as part of a walking tour and it's a truly beautiful part of the City. Do not miss it. Really good

Fun day strolling the Jordaan. We headed here for a late breakfast and stuck around window shopping and doing some of the 'things to do' in the area.
Fabulous architecture and canals!

If one has to spend some time in the city and is not interested in the main attractions can give it a try.

lovely place. We stayed on the edge of the Jordaan, it's lanes and narrow streets are a joy to wander, lovely shops to nose into, great bars, super restaurants and if you like to investigate some interesting history too - highly recommended
Wow. Stunning area, great market place really huge.You got all you need and want there.I had to much now I'm got overweight on my luggage.

Perfect area. very nice place at Amsterdam. I walked at Jordaan area over one around. Plenty cafe an shop which will let you surprised. The building beside the river and also very beautiful. There are a good area for visit at Amsterdam.

I could live there. Beautiful architecture I loved peeking into locals' living rooms. Some of these apartments/houses are stunning: tall ceiling with beams, large spaces tastefully decorated Streets full of charm with pubs, cafes and restaurants A bit too touristic but that's the price to pay

Great Area. A great way to explore this area is to go on a canal cruise which are informative, relaxing and there are many to choose from. Red light district and plenty of "coffee shops" prove popular with those that are looking for this type of stimulus.

Wonderful canals. The place where we stayed is within Jordaan area. There a lot of tourist walking around the place all are in awe to the wonderful neighborhood and beautiful houses. We tried some coffee shops while getting around and you will be surprised.

Beautiful 9 Streets. One of Amsterdam's original neighbourhoods. The 9 streets is a great area for real Amsterdam shopping and dining. Great cafes along the canals, antique shops, specialized local markets.
Idyllic. Very pretty area and nice to have a cycle through. Some of the shops in the area are more antiquey and worth having a look at
Walk around Venice of the Northern Europe. This is the best place to walk around through the different canals and admire the unique architecture of Amsterdam. Wonderful city, an unique place
Nice walk around. We were in the neighborhood and walked around. Nice neighborhood but nothing very special. It's nice walking through the streets.

Van 17e eeuwse hofjes tot markten tot gezellihe terrasjes, er is van alles !. As my son lives there I often visit it, so I like the easy going atmosfere alongside the hectic of the bustling city and the many not too wxpensive restaurants.
Its peaceful and serene. Its amazingly serene and offers more of canal beauty which Amsterdam is famous for. Its has a beautiful surrounding and has plenty good coffee shops

Fun and funky.. This is one of my favourite parts of Amsterdam. Great funky shops and bars and if you're of a particularly curious state of mind you may happen on one of the "hofjes" (like alms houses) that are scattered about the area. Jordaan is a dutchification of the french "jardin" (garden) but this was meant sarcastically as in former times this was an extremely poor area.

Pretty area . Hi came to Amsterdam with my partner. We had a lovely walk around The Jordaan. Lots of little cafes to sit outside and watch the boats or just people watch.One thing is to Watch out for bikes they are everywhere

Nice areas with plenty of lovely old houses and a little away from the main tourist drag.... A series of smaller streets and canals. Lost of small artisan makers.Good coffee shops. A little off the beaten track without being too remote
Nice area to wander round. Some great buildings, markets, small shops and coffee shops - even the ons that just sell coffee ! look out for the bar T small well worth calling in

Great selection of shops. The Jordaan is a very trendy area full of quirky shops and great little restaurants in which to grab a snack in. The area is pretty and great to walk around, though does get very busy at the weekends. Well worth venturing over to.

The Jordaan makes me speechless; you must visit this beautiful part of Amsterdam. A visit to Amsterdam needs to include a walk trough "The Jordaan". A neighborhood where flowers dominate the street view, people still speak original Amsterdams. Bars where you can drink your local beer in a real Amsterdam atmosphere.
Picturesque and interesting place for a half day visit. Lots of different architecture and interesting shops to explore in fairly quiet and relaxed atmosphere.

The oldest residents of this district "De Jordazen"are a nation apart.. DE JORDAAN The name De Jordaan is probably derived from the French "Le Jardin" corrupted in the Dutch to “DE JORDAAN." What we know is that De Jordaan was intended as a vegetable garden for the wealthy inhabitants of Amsterdam. Especially for the new rich residents of the canals: the Koningsgracht (now The Singel) the Herengracht, Keizersgracht and Prinsengracht which 400 years ago are dug and then constructed and inhabited. However, due to the large influx of emigrants lead to the great explanation of the city and in 1612 De Jordaan whas constructed with homes for workers and emigrants. The oldest residents of this district, De Jordanezen, are a nation apart. They speak their own language, carry the heart on the tongue, are fond of wisecracks, fooling around in Dutch “Dollen” love a drink, fond of opera, accordion music, singing and have a heart of gold. The Jordaan is in many songs sung about, songs that are also popular by not Jordaan Amsterdammers. The most famous singers of the Jordanian songs are: Johny Jordaan, Willy Alberti, Tante Leen and Manke Nelis. Their statues stand on the “Johny Jordaan Plein” at “De Elandsgracht”, corner Prinsengracht. Besides that you should not argue with a Jordanees in his neighbourhood, because then you get direct the whole Jordaan at you. One for all, all for oneFunny is that everyone calls each other uncle and aunt. So basically it seems like that all people are related to each other. A pity is that the popularity of De Jordaan and the enormously high prices of the houses there is almost no real Jordanees people more in De Jordaan. Their place is taken by new, wealthier residents.The Jordaan is great for walking, to get to a brown café, to dine, to shop and to go to the market. On the lindengracht is every Saturday from 09:00 to 16:00 hrs market, on the noordermarkt (North market) market, there is the farmers market from 9:00 to 16:00 hrs and the Flea Market from 09:00 to 13:00 hrs also on the noordermarkt. On Monday there is a patches and vegetable market on De Westerstraat from 09:00 until 13:00 hrs.And if you look closely you can still find a few gems. That, as we call them, the courtyards in Dutch: “Hofjes”. I will mention three. The oldest surviving hofje (1614) is the Sint Andries hofje, 105 at the egelantiersgracht. The second is the Huiszittenweduwhof (1650) Karthuizersstraat 21 and hofje “De Zeven Keurvorsten” (1645) Tuinstraat 197. Oh well, just look around and amaze yourself!Tip! visit a real Jordanees Brown Amsterdam Café, Café Chris. It's located on the corner of the 1e Bloemdwarsstraat en de Bloemstraat. Tourists & Expats do you need more helpful Amsterdam tips? Just visit my blog at: http://amsterdamalmanac.blogspot.nl/

Beautiful neighborhood lined by canals. The Jordaan is a beautiful neighborhood that I recommend everyone walk around. It is the best place to take pictures of the canals, bridges and narrow homes of Amsterdam. There are many restaurants and cafes in the area too. Plus, it's a lot calmer than the city center.

Fantastic shopping. I went with my friend and we spent hours going through all the small vintage shops and came away with a few treasures. Found some great furniture places that were a design students heaven.
Nice area. Great area to visit whenever in Amsterdam, feels like seeing the real amsterdam with all the cannels and rivers.

Beautiful residential area to visit. I love this part of Amsterdam - I lived here for 18 months when I first arrived in the city. It is lovely to visit and stroll around the streets or stopby a cafe along one of the canals. It is such a picturesque place to visit and a breath of fresh air for tourists looking for a more sophisticated central location as an alternative to the annoying tourist heavy red light area.
Such a great neighborhood. Full of great shops and little cafes. Want to go back and spend more time there. Many streets to explore and shops to duck in to.

Learn the history!. Learning about the history of the Jordaan makes it that much more impressive. We took a canal tour and I was honestly a little disappointed that they didn't include more historical "fun facts." When the pointed out the ice bar, I knew it was aggressively touristy. But if you have a guidebook, or just want to see the city from a new angle I'd recommend it!

Great to wander - a surprise a minute !. There is such variety in the Jordaan. Interesting architecture and juxtaposition of old, new, homes, businesses - quirky and straight ahead. Interesting canal boat homes and crafts.

Scenic views and little cafés and boutiques . Very special neighborhood where locals and expats actually do love. Little narrow streets with restaurants, cafes and bars that serve locals and tourists.

A Taste of the True Amsterdam. I set off early morning for a walk in the Jordan area, when the locality is free from tourists, traffic, although you still contend with cyclists. It's a ten minute stroll from Centraal Station and has lots of canals, bridges and narrow back streets to explore. At night it also has a magical charm. Definitely the highlight of my trip to Amsterdam.
Beautiful Surroundings, Amazing Shopping. Such a picturesque area to shop, dine and enjoy the city. There are many unique shops worth checking out and plenty of breathtaking canal views to take in.

Lovely Neighborhood. This is another gorgeous slice of Amsterdam. It is perfect for strolling the area and taking in the ambience. And for photography fans, it is definitely a must do. Relaxed, easy, friendly and beautiful.
Lovely area. This is a lovely area to wander round. Plently shops and cafes. Very nice. Could spend hours wandering around here.

Beautiful neighborhood . The Jordaan is a beautiful neighborhood to walk around and enjoy. The cafes, the shops, the homes are a delight to see. My favorite picture I took in Amsterdam was on the canals in the Jordaan.
Beautiful. Beautiful for a walk, bike ride or a boat tour. Highly recommend renting a bike and just riding around the city
Walking around . Really liked this area of Amsterdam fab to eat drink and walk round ..... Lovely area and so different to the main strip ....

Nice. Though The Jordaan was a working class neighborhood in thee past, it is certainly not so any longer.. There is a polished coziness about this area though as with most of Amasterdam there is a friendly relaxed attitude.
Great scenery. Lived close to this area while visiting Amsterdam and walked many times there. Took loads of pictures and truly enjoyed the experience.
Good friendly area. Very welcoming to tourists. Lovely to walk around the canals and pop into coffee shops or cafes. Friendly.

Great architecture. We love this area of Amsterdam, strolling around the lovely townhouses and maze of canals. We quite enjoyed getting a little lost and finding random shops to look in and cafes that serve great beer and nibbles.
Pretty!. Lovely area to wander and get lost in, a good Sunday afternoon stroll, the city is just a beautiful place to walk around in.

Local experience, convenient, quiet, but close to everything. We rented a lovely apartment in the Jordaan and I would do so again. It's a perfect area for exploring in all directions. There are many 'homely' advantages such as parks and grocery stores while also being very convenient to touristy and other attractions and the train station. A great experience.

Canals, Restaurants, Cafes. Here you can have a peaceful walk -if you are lucky enough not be hit by any bicycle even on sides- through the canals. You can also enjoy a coffee or food break as there are plent of options. Frankly this area is not very special than other parts of the Amsterdam. Very decent.
Fun area of Amsterdam. Love the up and coming energy of this artsy, thriving neighborhood of Amsterdam. Cafes to relax in, fun boutiques to shop in, a Farmers Market, and just good energy.

Make sure you visit the Jordaan area. We spent a good few hours walking around the Jordaan area, along the canals and bridges, around the shops and having a beer in a couple of cafes. Pick one along the canal to watch the world go by. It's such a pretty area, don't miss it.
Quiet, but no more authentic. The area looks charming at some places, however, there are many brand new houses which lower the effect of visiting an jld residential area

Perfect place to stay. We rented an apartment and made this neighborhood our home base. The shopping, local coffee, restaurants and location are perfect. The neighborhood was quiet - but there were many pubs near by! Can't wait to go back!

SOMETHING TO DO ALL DAY. This suburb of Amsterdam goes back hundreds of years, is steeped in history and criss crossed with canals and link bridges it is just the place to spend a day strolling around taking in the sights and the people. Endless opportunities to take photographs and eat from a wide variety of cafe's and restaurants. You can walk to it from the main city square or railway station but a number of trams go to within minutes of the area. Don't bother taking your car.
The 'real' Amsterdam. Full of locals, great cafes, restaurants and diverse independent shops without the frenetic tourism and tourists of the city centre.

Worth to visit. We have been in Jordaan on a Saturday, enjoyed the local market in the street and small boutiques. It is very close to Dam square in a rather isolated area whichk makes it more enjoyable.
Great zone to visit. The Jordaan neighborhood is nice to visit. It deserves some hours of your visit in Amsterdam. You won't find a lot of turists walking there.

Very nice place. Next time, I definitely prefer a hotel near here. the streets, small cafes, canals are extremely beautiful. If you like to feel Amsterdam you should at least walk there and take a coffee near the canal.

The (Michael) Jordaan of Amsterdam. Jordaan is the neighbourhood i live in, so it will be hard not to be biased about this place.It is an amazing and my top fav area in Amsterdam because of how beautiful the architecture and landmarks are. It is in the centre of the city, but has a lot of pockets of goodness that is hard to find. The nine street is in the centre of Jordaan, and offers plenty of new boutiques that will keep even the critic busy.My suggestion is to start at the nine streets beginning of lunch, it still quiet and gives you the space to enjoy it... start at the beginning which is closest to Leidseplein, then work your way towards Central Station. The farther you get the quieter it gets and has more cafes this area offers. Check out Frozen Fountain for great Dutch DesignsTenue Denime for your latest fashion apparels

Prefect place to base yourself. Stylish and walkable. I'm not a particularly fashionable person but our base in The Jordaan was great for walking/tramming our way to all the sights, plenty of window shopping, great restaurants and amenities, Thoroughly recommended.
Nice Neighorhood. Amsterdam's Jordaan is probably the most famous neighborhood in the Netherlands. The is worth a stroll.

Peaceful. Took tram 10 from just opposite the Rijkmuseum. Just maybe 5 stops away. Went on a thursday, no tourist in this area except the residents staying here. Beautiful shops & cafes. Really enjoy the peaceful & quiet stroll around this area.

Off the Main Street - fantastic stores. Great for those that aren't interested in the big chain shopping and want more of a local feel and boutique flavour. Some awesome little shops selling all manner of things, great little cafes and coffee shops - no where near as crowded as the main shopping areas in the city. Worth a look!!!

Truly beautiful area. Between canals, the area of Jordaan is wholly Amsterdam! Pretty shops, great places to eat, marvellous apartments to stay and all within easy walking distance of the hustle, bustle centre.
Great part of Amsterdam'. Anne Frank's house is in the Jordaan area of Amsterdam. There are great places to eat and site see. Great churches!

Fantastic neighbourhood. We stayed for 1 night in the Jordan and loved it. The canals and houses are so beautiful. Its quiet and peaceful with some lovely cafes' bars and shops. We found some nice vintage shops too. Will definitely stay here again if we get the chance.
authentic area. The Jordaan is a very authetic area in Amsterdam. Small streets, nice people, little cafees with typical Dutch music and menus. Very friendly neighbourhood.
Lovely markets, shops and cafes. Lovely place to wander especially when the markets are there on Saturdays. Lots of interesting shops, cafes and small restaurants

If you go to Amsterdam this is a must for a walk around. We now stay in the Jordaan after walking around it on a visit. The wonderful buildings, unique canals and interesting history. Ideal for a romantic stroll day or night.

Away of croud. Nice area for take a break of croudy center. Just 5 min walk to Anne FRANK House.
Recomanded for visit at night too. Go to Woonbootmuseum where you can see how the people live on a houseboat.

Typical of a sophisticated city. This district is a delight, but every city of any size and fine culture will have a similar district, filled with interesting restaurants and shops. Amsterdam is a fantastic strolling city because of its canals, which adds to the beauty of the Jordaan, but other than that it is just an average, typical upscale district.

Get to know how Dutch people really live. I think this area gives a much better image how the Amsterdammer really live. It's a lot quiter than the city center and you can find some nice typical bars, not overrun by tourists. You can also find 'Café Lowietje' here, from the police series 'Baantjer'

Quite quiet withou markets. I believe when there are markets it's much more interesting and vibrant. I was there during a work day so the area was very quiet, many shops closed. It was still nice place for a walk but nothing exciting - but I believe on weekends it might be much better.

A leisurely stroll in a picturesque area. Once we were museum end out we took a leisurely stroll round this picturesque and quirky area. We used the walk outlined in the Dorling Kindersley guidebook. We found plenty of interest in addition to what was in the guidebooks. In particular we enjoyed crossing the old bridges into the western isles and warming ourselves in a number of brown cafes - all very atmospheric

Beautiful Neighbourhood. The Jordaan District of Amsterdam is a beautiful and peaceful part of the city filled with lots of little unique shops and a fantastic atmosphere in which to take a gentle stroll.
Brilliant market . We wandered over this area on the Saturday and found a huge market full of character and yummy food! So worth a visit.
Canalboat sightseeing. We went here in a sightseeing boat. Nice canal area. Did not see very much of the area, but we will like to see more next time
vibe neighborhood. walked around here for some hours and absolutely liked it. Nice neighborhood, many restaurants, great vibe.

Amsterdam District Jordan. The Amsterdam District Jordan is a special unique and beautiful district with many shops ,restaurants,cafes and bars.Has a beauty with canals and a nice atmosphere for a walk

A beautiful neighborhood in Amsterdam. This area of Amsterdam is a beautiful to experience Amsterdam and its spirit. Nice walk alongside canal, Shopping local Products, coffee...It is also nice in the eveening
Empty and very quiet. It doesn't look like something is going on at all. The most of restaurants are Italian so not too much to choose. Disappointing

So quirky. Lovely place to walk during the day seeing the details of different homes, buildings and daily life but then at night its like a different place. Lots of people walking around, lively atmosphere, bars, bikes and lights lighting up the canals beautifully. We loved walking around here.

A must visit while in amsterdam. The jordaan is a beautiful neighborhood in Amsterdam, definitely should walk around , there's a market there with great local products, and the amazing Apple pie in winkel cafe
GREAT walks by the canal. loved walking by the canals. I would recommend visiting it twice once in the afternoon and other at night because the area is gorgeous either way.

You haven't been in Amsterdam if you haven't been here. The Jordaan is one of the most representative neighborhoods in Amsterdam. Plenty of bars, restaurants and sights. Be sure to include it in your plans!
Nice to go to. One of the oldest secrions of Amsterdam, now featurin many boutiques, bars, small food places and a relatively hippy scene....

Lovely, characteristic neighborhood and perfect walking area. This is one of the more characteristic neighborhoods in Amsterdam. Lovely facades, plenty of shops, nice people and superb setting. A must see in Amsterdam.

Beautiful area of Amsterdam. Spent a day walking around the Jordan area. The weather was gorgeous considering it was February so we were lucky. Lovely boutiques, cafes, restaurants, lots of outdoor seating. Art shops, antique shops, this area has it all.
Picturesque Cityscapes with style. This area of Amsterdam is perfect for walking, sightseeing and shopping. Endless nooks and crannys with classic views of the canals and architecture.
A wonderful walking neighborhood. I loved walking around the Jordaan. Even on a sometimes-rainy day it was very interesting. So much to see that is different that from where I live. Loved it.

Our favourite part of Amsterdam. This for me is the quietest and prettiest part of Amsterdam, I used to live there many years ago and have often returned to visit. It is a great place to cycle in, have a nice hot chocolate at a nearby café and watch the world go by, or go to one of the local markets. Plenty of great restaurants and original boutiques too. Much better than the crowds of Dam Square or Leidseplein. For me this is the soul of Amsterdam.
Nice trip. Full of daily bar n nice pubs for the night. Had a really good time in Jordaan and actually there was a really good vibe in the air

Nice peaseful Jordaan scenary. I really enjoyed this region seeing Amsterdam's life style... This is closely Anne Frank house and cruise stop, you can walk or use bike to see typical houses and shops/restaurants. I highly recommend the visit!
A ,must to visit when in Amsterdam. Fantastic area very close to Anne Frank's house. Lovely streets/canals to walk round. Definitely worth spending a couple of hours exploring.

Wonderful. If you like to explore narrow streets, then the Jordaan is the place to visit, quirky buildings, places of worship, history & little cafes that you can sit outside rain or shine & enjoy just watching the world go by. Could walk around there all day

Nice boutiques and quirky shops. Well worth mooching these lanes for some good quality items at a great price. It gives visitors a chance to support artisan craftspeople and get away from the 'same old same old' of labels. Some fine coffee shops and eateries too. Recommended.

Amsterdam at its best. Strolling around this area on a crisp sunny February day, we realised just what a wonderful part of Amsterdam this is. You can feel the history, the architecture is simply beautiful and stylish and it is so peaceful, albeit not far at all from the centre.There are wonderful little cafes and bars to sit outside and soak up the whole atmosphere, while listening to the regular chimes of the magnificent Westerkerk church. Don't miss this area if you are visiting - if only for a couple of hours.

Highly recommended!. Took a stroll through Jordaan on Friday afternoon, it had been recommended as real Amsterdam, narrow streets, beautiful houses. Found a lovely cafe for lunch and enjoyed the walk, very different to the central area.. Peaceful.
Nice. Nice place in the city, I expected to find many coffee , bar and small boutique shops, but they don't have so many It's nice place to walk and relax.If you around ...visit!

Attraction. A must see attraction in Amsterdam. A district, nice to visit, there's a flower mart, charming houses, lovely little shops and boutiques. Food is good, entertaining, nice to spend an afternoon.

Beautiful arty area. Worth a walk through and a stop in a quaint cafe or wine bar. Lots of quaint little shops and galleries. A very pretty area with canal side cafes and restaurants. Very pretty indeed.

Very nice for a walk . Nice part of the city. Download a tour guide to get the skinny on the buildings. Many were built in pairs to save money. Look up for the furniture hooks to get furniture in and out the house.
Great Place. Great place to visit. Lots of bars and great restaurants. Put it on your list of things too do in Amsterdam. Great in the daytime too

This is where I'd live.... My husband and I took the Rick's Steves' Jordaan walking tour and it was great! Jordaan is a beautiful neighborhood just a few blocks from the craziness of the city but it feels so much less touristy.

Not what I expected. I was expecting Jordaan to be full of busy, boutique shops, bars and cafés, however it seemed rather closed when we visited, although the Amsterdam architecture was still lovely to look at
It was good.. I enjoyed my time with friends. We go there sometimes to the cafe and sometimes to the shop. It's nice and love the cheese there. Thanks Jordaan.

Great way to spend the day: Cheese, Coffee, Shopping.. The Jordan is a great little area filled with shops and cafes. I would recommend checking out a great little cheese shop, Reypenaer Proeflokaal. Also a famous coffee house is close by - Grey Area Coffee Shop. We stopped in numerous little shops, too many to count. It is a nice place to walk around, ride a bike, shop, and get a coffee, or grab lunch.
Beautiful. The whole are is not only pretty, but is full of lovely restaurants. Spend some time wondering the streets and appreciating the architecture, it's beautiful.
A beautiful canal walk.. This is a beautiful walk along one of the canals of Amsterdam with lots of opportunities for photo shoots of typical Amsterdam architecture.

Nice area. The Jordaan is a typical workers neighbourhoud in the City of Amsterdam. There are a lot of restaurants, bars and cafe's in this area and very nice to walk within this neighbourhood. Also nice canals and typical Amsterdam atmosphere. Feel it, tast it and enjoy it.
Quaint. An attractive part of town with beautiful buildings, quirky shops and interesting cafes and restaurants.
Lovely afternoon wander. Great place to stroll between the picturesque canals. Plenty of good restaurants & cafés to visit, well worth the time.

Good wandering. We spent an hour or so wandering around this area following a recommendation from our B&B host. Very picturesque part of town with some interesting shops, galleries, pubs, canals, coffeeshops, cafés and restaurants but without the crowds of tourists.

Small Amsterdam. If you have time visit the Jordan and especially the nine streets. Go on week day and check out the small shops for the stuff you don't need but want! Take a coffee or have lunch in a small, typical Dutch restaurant. Or go on a Sunday morning stroll and enjoy the peace and the cute bridges and canals. Or have dinner in a nice restaurant. Whatever is your choice you will most certInly enjoy it.

Cool neighborhood, walk anywhere, got everything. We rented an apartment in Jordaan. Found some top ranking restaurants, art galleries, main Amsterdam shopping street, supermarkets, coffee places. Lively and fun place.

A neighborhood with a lot to offer. I love staying in the Jordaan. It is well situated to Central Station, a lot of restaurants, bars, shopping and so much more. This is one of the most beautiful neighborhoods.

Beautiful spot to wander. This was my favorite neighborhood to get lost wandering. It is so beautiful, some quiet spots especially along the canals, and great shopping too! I would love to stray in this area on my next visit to this great city!

I was expecting more. We walked the neighbourhood on a quiet Sunday morning and while it was nice it didn't live up to the reviews. We had a nice coffee at an outdoor patio but didn't stay long in the neighbourhood.

Great Neighborwood. Is beatiful and as great things to visit as a relaxed walker.It is also where Anne Frank's house is, but for that plan ahead since it has tremedous cues all day, even on a rainy day it as more that 200 mt cue. Ended up not visiting it, went for a famous Winkel 43 Pie... a great pie but not worth to travel all city to eat it, there are good pies all over.The Jordaan as cool shops, great vibe and less crowded than other touristic neighborhoods
Good area to walk. . We just spent the morning walking the area. Lovely canals and architecture. There are many restaurants and cafes throughout.

Best area in Amsterdam . So pretty and lovely: canals, small roads, cafes. There was a market with delicious food, perfect for lunch (pea soup, waffles, fried fish). I can't remember where it was but if you see it, don't hesitate if you're hungry!
Great Markets. A more bohemian part of the city, with lots of picturesque canals and architecture. Worth spending a few hours and you should definitely check out the markets
Nice to walk around. This newly popular area is a must see. Buildings and livelyhood are things to see and experience. Make time for strolling around the streets of Jordaan

The heartbeat of Amsterdam. Once a place for cheap housing now the heart of Amsterdam with trendy restaurants Jazz café, lots of fast food.Best to rent a bike or a scooter and visit the hiding place from Anne Frank

Preaty nice:). Calm, enjoyable and quite place... nice to walk around the channels (by Cruise or by feet:)... many restaurante and shops are avaliable there, different from the Rush Red light área. Its also the área where you have the Anne franks house... and take a trip on 9 streets market and buy some fruits or flowers.Beautifull neighborhood!
Perfect to wander around. Lovely area to walk around even on a cold day. Nice little cafes and boutique shops, with interesting architecture and good views across the canals and bridges.

So beautiful. The Jordaan is such a beautiful neighborhood for simply strolling and taking in the sights. If you love photography there are so many opportunities for calutrons just the right shots. Put on your walking shoes and enjoy.

Bed of Roses, bed and breakfast. Excellent hosts, and location in the Jordaan section; seconds from a canal, minutes to the streetcar and a good walk to most areas in Amsterdam. This section of Amsterdam is worth visiting by itself!
wow!. This is my favorite area of Amsterdam! I love to cycle around here especially when the weather is good.

Strolling. There are few 'major attractions' in the area, the nearest is Anne Franke's. But its a great area for strolling and visiting small shops, pop-ups, cafes etc. Its just a few canals away from the centre, but has a completely different and laid back feel.
another Amsterdam beauty. This street is filled with lovely old and tastefully coloured buildings. You are sure to stumble on this street while walking along the beautiful canals

Dirty, a littlebit tiny and I'm not sure .... Well, I'm not sure what's so special about this Jordaan. I understand what's it, and it's historical meaning, but to say that' something special, no, it's not. After you visited Paris, not much can be compared that.
my hangout in Amsterdam. this is the place for design shops, good restaurants and bars. It's a vibrant area with everything from nice tourists to locals.

Why?. The "nine streets" of the Jordaan are filled with tiny shops and boutiques of varying quality, taste and cleanliness. If you have never been to Amsterdam or are a serious shopaholic. The buildings are intersting and the shopping is varied - particularly for mens fashion clothing.It is nice area for a walkabout, but I would not make it a top priority.

Beautiful scenic area.. Wonder around this scenic area. Stop for a bite to eat or something to drink.This area is very touristy, filled with small shops and quaint cafes and art galleries. Quiet areas or noisy areas they are all there within a few minutes walk.

This is Amsterdam. If you wan't to experience true Amsterdam, this is where you need to be,Away from the hustle around Central Station.The beutiful canals, lovely cafees and bars.You can walk around for hours finding new small shops, wonderful restaurants. This is truly Amsterdam
Best part of the twon. In my point of view is the best part of Amsterdam... but so many tourist, plenty of small cozy restaurants, bars and shops

Bohemian bliss. The Jordaan is a world away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre, despite only being a few minutes away on foot. This is the picture perfect Amsterdam you imagined before you arrived. Here you can get lost strolling along the uncrowded banks of the canal, relax with a hot drink in a quirky little cafe or take a wonder round one of the many art galleries or small shops. You can cover the whole area on foot in a couple of hours, just dont forget your camera!

Lovely little quaint area of amaterdam. Away from the hustle and bustle of central Amsterdam, Jordan is more quiet and quaint. My friend and I walked around Jordaan after visiting the Anne frank house. There are cute shops and little cafes you can stop by and have a coffee in.
Good palce to wander close to the city centre. Great place to wander and experience Amsterdam's more bohemian side. Many small shops and a market should you so wish.
Heart of Amsterdam. Idyllic canal sceneries and great area to stroll around. Just remember to take your map with you :-)
Beautiful, unique and quirky. Gorgeous area, intertwined by canals. Beautifully lit bridges by night. Lovely range of unique shops, boutiques and eateries.
Beautiful place. I really liked the Jordaan kwartier very much - not so crowded with tourists as well + beautiful sights and cozy cafés
Picturesque. We walked through this area on the way to Noordermarkt. The houses are very picturesque and the shops and cafes are nice.

Nice area to visit on a sunny day. Jordaan is quite a nice area to visit, especially in a sunny day. If not, there's plenty of cafes where you can go to enjoy apple cake and more. In summer you can also find nice ice-cream places...

Favorite area of the city. We stayed in The Jordann Area by recommendation from a friend. Good recommendation. This was right up our alley for what we like to do when we travel... There are tons of little cafes, bars, boutiques and there is a market on Saturday and Monday that we walked through for both days. It is definitely a hipster / trendsetter neighborhood. Love it! I will stay here again when coming through Amsterdam.
poor. was not what was on the pitcures, nothing like it, also right on top of a pub so very loud! terrible

Cozy neighbourhood!!. We had local guide that showed us this area in Amsterdam. Cozy narrow brick buildings in colours from the rainbow. Interesting story around why some houses are painted black. Well worth a goggle search to find out. Bring map when you walk around in Amsterdam or have loads of data on your mobile phone 😊

Great area. This was such a nice area, full of bo Ho shops, cafes and eating places, this is most certainly a better area than the main drag and Dam square, more lay back and convivial, but saying that, the Dutch are not great at just joining in conversation.We were fortunate to have booked a hotel just adjacent to Jourdaan, which made it even better.Lino Len

Great place to wander. We were here mid winter and really enjoyed just wandering around the streets - great atmosphere, interesting shops, good restaurants and a really good market (the Westermarkt) on the Saturday. The canals and the architecture are so different from home. Just a good place to be.

Love the bohemian Jordaan, some great 'neighbourhood bars' and restaurants. Love the warren of streets and drinking with the locals in bars that are steeped in history. The food served is of better quality and value than many in the tourist centre. Some great specialist shops and galleries also.
The Nine Streets. Lovely genuine area in the canal district of Amsterdam! Spend a half day here and don't miss The Nine Streets!
