A must see. This is probably one of my favourite areas in Amsterdam. There a so many different bars and cafes you are spoilt for choice. The streets are very authentic and many pictures opportunities around the canals.

The heart & soul of Amsterdam.. A fun and vibrant neighbourhood of Amsterdam, picturesque, and filled with hidden gems for eating and drinking.Less touristy than other areas, so you get to feel the vibe of the area and live like a local, even if just for the afternoon.If you're looking to wander around and discover some local treasures of stores, restaurants and cafes, the Jordaan is perfect. If you're searching for the perfect canal shot for your trip photos, you'll be spoiled for choice here.A perfect spot to spend the day discovering all that Amsterdam has to offer.
Picturesque. A nice area to walk around and take photos. Interesting architecture, original shops and boat-houses.

Safe environment. A great place to find a hotel.quiet clean lots of interesting places and some great places to eat.. Recommended.iEven if the weather is not too good. The main attractions are easily. Accessible?
Lovely Area. Lovely area of Amsterdam, Lovely shops and Restaurants. Worth a visit. So Central. Felt you were on Holiday

Lovely area to walk around. This is a great area to walk around, take some photos and relax in the centre of Amsterdam but brush up on your knowledge of Amsterdam's bike rules before you get run down!
Lovely. Do a boat tour all the building are amazing, have a nice stroll round. Its a nice place day or night.
Lovely . The Jordaan is a lovely area to walk around. I recommend going on a Saturday as there's a market. I tried oysters for the first time there. Definitely worth an afternoon of wondering around.

Beautiful . We stayed in the Jordaan area while in Amsterdam and it has unbelievable character. Highly recommend staying in this area if you're visiting. There's tons of beautiful old bars and cafes and lots of exploring to be done.
Beautiful . Really picturesque scenery, the houses are beautiful & the canals are just so lovely. It really is such a nice place to visit.

Probabaly one of the nicest neighborhoods. Trendy, hip and uprising neighborhood that is worth the detour. The environment is quite eclectic and there are lots of places to have good food, drinks or smokes. I would surely recommend prioritizing coffee shops in this area rather than the very center of the city or the red light district as they are packed with tourists, overpriced and a little shady, whereas in Jordaan they are far nicer and not as crowded.
Great. This is what Amsterdam is all about. Small streets and Lots of restaurants, bars and shops. Close to Central station. definatly something worth visiting.

Shopping, vintage & more . I don't think we covered all of the Jordaan but this area is nice to walk around its cute little narrow streets where you'll find cafes and little shops. For those who like vintage clothes/accessories this is the place to shop as prices vary widely.
Beautiful district . The Jordaan is full of amazing places and things to do.. You can find good restaurants, lovely places to visit... It's charming and cosy.. I like the atmosphere!

Jordaan Area of Amsterdam. A very bohemian type of district that is a great afternoon visit from Central Station. Lots of very hip and cool shops as well as brown cafes where you can drink coffee, eat some space cakes and enjoy the brown cafes of this very eclectic district.
Wandered for hours. Amsterdam is a lovely city to spend hours just wandering, the Jordaan district has lots of small shops, cafes and bars so that you can take a break when your feet start to ache.

A great place to wander, eat and shop in the afternoon.. I spent a week in Amsterdam on my honeymoon and we kept finding our way back here almost every afternoon after visiting a art gallery in the morning. It was a great place to just relax and unwind and watch the world go by in that cliched way people imagine they will do when they visit a European city. Also I bought some awesome clothes while I was wondering around its a great place to buy street wear or rockabilly style clothing and there are a few good op shops.

Great area to mooch around. We were staying in the area and had a lovely morning strolling around the streets. Great market on the Saturday morning, and loads of interesting shops. Canals and buildings are beautiful too.
Nice area to visit. very nice area to go and visit. A pretty area with good shopping. Nice way to spend some time in the afternoon
Special place. So welcoming and calm ^^ we only had the opportunity to see one market but it seemed like a good place to live in ^^

My favorite area in Amsterdam. Whenever I go to Amsterdam I spend a day in the Jordan. Streets around the canals have nice houses and it is great for a walk of some hours. Cozy pubs, coffee bars and restaurants as well.
Great location. Jordan is one of the nice place in Amsterdam, lovely and safe neighborhood with option of lots of bars and restaurant
Great location. Lovely part of Amsterdam, wandered around here for hours. Lots of coffee shops and great views of the canals.
Jordaan. This neighborhood in my opinion is the most bohemian area in Amsterdam with a nice and cozy restaurants and cafes away enough from the crowds.

Lived and worked in this fabulous location!. I lived and worked in the Jordaan, on Rozengracht and Stadhouderskade for a year. The area is brilliant, such a mix of people in a really good location for the centre. I loved that I was able to walk 10 minutes in one direction towards Leidseplein (for work) and 10 minutes in the other took me to Dam Square! The Jordaan is quite a widespread area, with lots going on and lovely little bars and restaurants dotted around. I would always pick this area as it's so convenient.
The real face of Amsterdam . I loved this neighborhood. It shows the real beauty of Amsterdam, beside the touristic part stuffed of people searching coffeeshops. So quiet and romantic.
Jordaan is a great area. Stay in this area every time I go to Amsterdam. Just wonderful area. Lots of lovely restaurants, bars and of course the canal views.
Colourful Walk. Its really beautiful in the evening, shining colours, people relaxing on the canalside and taking an easy stroll with snack or french fries in hand.
Pretty area of Amsterdam!. Beautiful area to walk - lovely little shops and quaint houses on the canals. Stop for a coffee and just people watch

Beautiful Suburb of Amsterdam. have a walk around and enjoy the beauty!. Great area of Amsterdam, If you have time I'd suggest to have a walk around the suburb, take in a coffee or a beer and enjoy the beauty! Good shopping too. Great area, with great restaurants too.

Quaint, picturesque. A must for a stroll and a stay!. When we booked our hotel in the Jordaan, we had absolutely no idea what we were doing. I knew two things, I wanted to stay in a boutique hotel and it had to have a view of the canal. Trip Advisor rarely leads me wrong, so I went with the number one hotel, The Toren. I simply can not say enough about the hotel or the neighborhood. I'll write about the details of The Toren under hotels, but after having walked many of the touristic neighborhoods in the city, I can say the Jordaan is the most beautiful. It almost feels like it's own village within a city... I would walk a few steps then stop to snap a foto-it's that picturesque! It's charm is that the area is quiet and quaint, and near the Anne Frank House. You can find wonderful treasures tucked away along tiny streets. A must if you're looking for local food is De Reiger, a rustic, lovely restaurant where the food is hearty, savory and served beautifully. If you're in the mood to relax, Koan Float Spa has a personalized Epsom salt bath where you can meditate and relax, an experience unlike no other! There are many local stores for souvenirs and shopping. If you come to Amsterdam, you will not regret staying in the Jordaan area, and especially at The Toren hotel.

Walking neighborhood with tiny streets and canals. We took an afternoon stroll through the Jordaan while listening to Steve Ricks walking tour. If we hadn't had the tour app, we would have missed many things of interest. The app and its walking tours are free.

Fun walk. Only steps away from the Nine Streets and the Red Light District, this feels like it's a world away from the rest of Amsterdam. A stroll down the Westerstaat to the Lijnbaansgracht and then back east was a leisurely affair with lots of stops for window shopping.
Quaint streets. Really beautiful part of Amsterdam with some great little shops. Ideal if you like independent stores, we found the level of service was brilliant.
Worth a walk. This is a residential area that is worth visiting, possibly on one of the guided walks available through travel guides like Rick Steve's.
Beautiful area. I wouldn't bother with a tour. Get a good guide book and make your own, much more fun and at your own pace. Would recommend the markets on a saturday.

Beautiful and Lively Area in Amsterdam. We wandered around Jordan after we visited the Ann Frank's House and we loved it. It has a nice flare to it. It's lively and it is full of stores, cafes and restaurants. The view of the canals is what I remember the most. If you are visiting Amsterdam, this is a must!
Beautiful area. One of my favourite areas in the city. Stunning architecture, and lots to see and do. Fun and bustling in the warmer months, but a wonderful place to explore at any time of year.

A very nice neighbourhood. We stayed here the last time we visited the city. It is nice, borderline-safe, like most of the city center, and is perfectly accessible by many tram routes.
However, it is a bit father than other central neighborhoods from the nightlife part of the city.
Very authentic environment. This is the real Amsterdam in my opinion. We walked around, had something to eat and went for a drink. I can imagine that in summer, this area is even better.

Lovely area of Amsterdam. Possibly the best area of Amsterdam? So pretty and worth a walk around streets and canals, stopping at some cute cafes and shopping at some amazing independent shops at the 9 streets.
Nice walk. We walked through Jordaan using Rick Steves book as a guide. Nice walk with beautiful canals. Cute shops and many restaurants.
Beautuful. Amsterdam offers a unique experience to travelers. The Joordan is practically The heart of the city, amazing.
Nice neighborhood. I liked this neighborhood, we were recommended to take a walk here by our host. And we definitely enjoyed it.
Saturday street market worth a visit. Good area to walk around. Nice Saturday market with clothes and food. Great stall selling home made soup - Dutch pea soup fab on a cold day

one of nicest area. probably one of the coloest and typical walk to have in the city. great architecture , nice cool atmosphere, nice little shops to stop by, really a place which must be pass by during a stay in the city

The best Amsterdam has to offer!. By far my favourite area in Amsterdam and for me the best thing to do in Amsterdam is to stroll through the Jordan and all it has to offer.
Small canals, lights on the festive season, charming little shops, restaurants and side streets!
Just exquisite...

Picturesque. It was lovely just to wander around this area, full of the quintessential Amsterdam buildings along the canals. There were lots of small shops and also you can be really nosy and peek into people's windows to see how real Amsterdammers live (all their houses look like something out of a catalogue!!) You can get a real feel for the day-to-day life of the people living here, it was quite an immersive experience. (Especially nice to get away from the crowds and noise of the city).

Great Location in Amsterdam. We rented a apartment on Rozenstraat in the Jordaan neighborhood and it was ideal. The Jordaan is clean, quiet and close to everything. Nothing but postives for us in this location.

Gorgeous just to walk around. This is a place to stroll through with your camera. Day-to-day life is fascinating and picturesque. People presenting each other with flowers. Movers using the old hooks at the top of the house to haul furniture in, friends meeting for coffee all with the charming canals and row houses for background.

Perfect!. Perfect place for browsing and shopping if you like something different from the usual run of the mill shops. Full of quirky boutiques, cafes and bars, with beautiful architecture and a great atmosphere. Can't wait to visit to Christmas shop later in the year!

Jordaan is the perfect place for artists.... If you are creative, in any way, then Jordaan is the area for you. This part of Amsterdam is filled with boutique Art galleries, beautiful graffiti and more vintage and antique shops than you can count! You could without a doubt spend 2 days just walking around and visiting the small galleries, many of which are simply a living room or small shop area but are filled with interesting and unexpected work...Worth a mention alongside the big galleries in the area such as Foam and Amsterdam Museum are Antiekcentrum and Kochxbos. Along Single canal you'll find Episodes and nearby Bijon Vintage shops to name a few. in the centre of Jordaan you will be treated to the Monday Market on Westerstraat, not huge but a good 2 hours of mixed stalls new and vintage. I could go on... you won't be bored.We're not in Kansas anymore...
stunning area. It would be lovely to ride a bicycle down here in the morning and take in the scenery. This area is a rich area nowdays and is really stunning.
Classic Amsterdam. This part of the city is wonderful for walking and exploring the shops and haunts of the locals. Close to the centre and some big tourist attractions. Beautiful, classic Amsterdam.

Stunning. Quaint streets with lovely buildings of apartments shops cafes bars and restaurants set by the water side lovely to sit out on a nice day. Some areas are very busy and lots of pushbike like all of Amsterdam. Recommended. Festival of light is also on st the minute
Perfect for photos . I believe this is the best and nicest, most scenic part of the city. Spent hours strolling and photographing. Highly recommend!
Great to View by Boat. Dutch architecture is refreshing and fun, seen by boat makes it even more impressive; also good by wandering around the narrow streets and getting lost.

Interesting and sparkling quarter . Vital, fully of shops, typical restaurants, bars. Easy to visit by bicycle or on walk
Amazing And originale houses just in face to canals
You can feel the lifestyle of this beautiful city
Fun neighborhood to explore. Go for a walk, stop into a bar for a drink and then keep wandering to see what else you can find. Really enjoyed the neighborhood feel (at least for Amsterdam).

Good local neighborhood. Does not represent the true ethnic diversity of the city.. Wandering the streets and canals here you would think there were no or only a small ethnic component to the city. The area is really a bubble. Land prices have driven almost all the ethnic groups out of the city center. If you pass thru the south east side of the city on the bus you will see a much more realistic picture of the ethnic community. No shortage of coffee shops where people grab a lattee and warm up before heading back to whatever it was they were doing.

Charming Neighborhood. Loved walking through this neighborhood and all the small shops, restaurants and bars. Asked a local for recommendations and was greeted warmly with wonderful ideas. Loved getting away from the large chain stores and tourist traps. Saw lots of families getting kids off to school. The area was beautifully decorated for Christmas. And we had some of the best food of our entire trip here.
Beautiful area for a stroll. There's nothing quite like Amsterdam and this is one of the nicer neighbourhoods go for a nice walk and then stop at one of the many outdoor cafes along the canal.

Quintesential Amsterdam. The Jordaan is the essence of Amsterdam: the shops, the overhang of weed, great restaurants, fun people and great canals, ambiance and architecture. A great stroll through on numerous streets and far more residential in mood than far more touristy parts. No way one can not have a big smile enjoying all the senses.

What Amsterdam is really about :). I was fascinated with The Jordaan district.It is only 3-4 bridges away from the centre and the Red Lights district,however, you can feel a completely different energy.Everything is peaceful around here.It is also known as a ,,workers" district,because around here almost everyone was a factory worker back in the 30's and 40's.You have wonderful restaurants with reasonable prices and some important historical place,like the Anne Frank's house.So if you don't want to visit the Red Lights district,or feel bored with it,just go around the block and experience Amsterdam in its true colours. :)
Good walk, eats. This section of Amsterdam is a welcome change from the usual bodegas (Prada, H&M) and worth a look. All ages, international foods, interesting views.

Beautiful Area!. We stayed on a house boat while in Amsterdam right off the Jordaan and it was quite amazing.
We highly recommend you go to this area while in Amsterdam.
There are wonderful cafe's and restaurants as well as many interesting shops.

Historic. Beautiful historic area of Amsterdam. This was an area that inspired Rembrandt and is therefore interesting for those interested in Dutch art. In the 17th century it was already a multicultural area and was important for the cultural and economic development of the city.
One of the best area in Amsterdam. Full of nice cafes and restaurants. I found it as one of the most romantic parts of the city. Give it a try!

Very Christmassy. This is a lovely area for strolling around, absorbing and browsing in shops! The cafes and restaurants are nice. Excellent area for healthy places to eat, lots of organic / juice / health cafes! Some amazing spa's and places to relax. Well worth walking for hours just absorbing a beautiful part of Amsterdam! The lights and decorations made this a very Christmassy place to be!

Love, Love, Love!!. One of my all time favorite places to wander through, this neighborhood is full of little gems to find! Little cafes, art stores, courtyards, a blend of different cultures and music! I highly recommend taking a stroll through this neighborhood if you get the chance.
Great shopping . Loved this area, really great feel to it with a good selection of shopping and eating . Very arty . Max's restaurant worth a visit and lots of antique shops and the likes .
Beautiful. Beautiful place, not very crowded, but still just couple of steps of everything else. Nice for walking, having something to eat, just chill with a beer...

Quiet, but everything is in easy reach. It's a great area to stay in. Beautiful restaurants and shops. 10-15 walk to the station. Wonderful designs in ceramics shop - they make everything by hand on the premises.
Heart of Amsterdam. Many different nationalities come together in the Jordaan area of Amsterdam.There are ethnic restaurants, interesting shops, delightful people, and a world of interest to visit!
Great. Heineken gives away free boat ride if 15 minutes - also I recommend of taking the tour only at day time. You can also do it alone or Asa romantic couple, family's loves it as well.
stark565. This is the way how the people off amsterdam live and eat. It is the real amsterdam with the original houses by the canals
Nice walk. Walk trough this area and was a nice change. It feels more Dutch and les touristic. You simply needs to get lost for a hour.

Great neigborhoood of fun shops and great food. The Jordaan was near our hotel so we had great access by foot to lovely bistro style restaurants and some fun shopping. Rick Steves offers a great map/info thru the area.

Nice area. We only had a day to explore Amsterdam, we spent the afternoon wandering the streets here after looking at some other sights. Quite a nice area with plenty of restaurants, so many lanes to explore. It would be nice to spend a few days to roam the streets of Amsterdam, as there are so many amazing places I'd like to stop and eat at.

Lovely for exploring!. This area of Amsterdam is just on the outer edge of the canal district. It is great for exploring and just plain old wondering. It is filed with lovely cafes and great restaurants like the Bordewijk on Noordmart Straat. Don't leave out the great little bars. Some of the best town are hidden in the Jordaan.
Fun Wanderings. This is an awesome area to wander around for a morning or afternoon, stop for (lots of) coffee, explore all sorts of interesting arty stores and cafes, and just "be" in Amsterdam.

Historical area. That is well worth a visit while in Amsterdam,interesting architecture .The buildings are now being used as shops ,bars and restaurants.Interesting to view from the canal as well as wandering around .

Beautiful streets along canals. Great area for a stroll. Beautiful old houses, canals, streets. Nice coffee places and different shops.Compared to damrak/red light district area it's quiet here with a good vibe. Love it here!

Gorgeous, steeped in history and charm. The Jordaan is ideal for casual wanderer or the architecturally interested. Beautiful views along the canals abound, wonderful appartments can be glimpsed, small shops and bars and restaurants lure you in. Prepare to be beguiled.

I missed what's special about this area. I heard about this as being the cool new hipster area. I must have missed something. There wasn't much here except a small street with a few restaurants. I would not go out of my way to visit. But it was perfectly fine once we got there.

Great area of shops, restaurants and canals. This is a lovely area of Amsterdam, the type of place you will want to go to after seeing the Westmarket and buying something unique there. Very quaint, and lovely to wander through, with cafes and other diversions all around you.

The Ritz of Amsterdam.. The district was once the pits of Amsterdam but now is very pretty and often opulent. The streets are fabulous to walk around or passing by via a canal cruise. This is also the area where you will find the famous Anne Frank House and the Renaissance Westerkerk ( West ) Church.
The most traditional neighborhood of Amsterdam. This neighborhood defines the character of Amsterdam...small streets, houses, beautiful canals...businesses....just the authentic amsterdam

Same but different. The Jordaan is also a neighborhood with many canals, small streets. We enjoyed walking around, sitting in a great coffee shop having the best pancakes we had in Amsterdam, just srolling around watching nice boutiques in a very quiet atmosphere
Walking , walking and more walking.. Loved this area, flowers everywhere, quint shops everywhere. There's a wonderful cheese shop there, you have to try.

Different from most of Amsterdam - dont miss it!. This is a quieter, classy neighborhood.
I had a great time walking around here on a Sunday morning, great closed street with a market - tons of coffee shops (actual shops selling coffee, not weed ha) and other cute stores. Close to the rest of the city, but I bet most people dont know this!

Quiet. Away from the hustle and bustle of Amsterdam central lovely place to walk around peacefully .
You can enjoy a good walk without having to Pass by sex shops, red light , or weed shops.

Traffic on the Canal. Sailing down the canal one gets to see the classic Dutch houses from previous centuries it is like time has stood still. It is charming and a delight to go down all the canals during spring and summer. The cruises are avaiabel to be picked up from different spots in Amsterdam I suggest if you anticiapte feeling hungry or thirsty during your trip you bring a packed lunch and bottled water as you cannot buy anything on the boat unless yo take a special dinner cruise.

some of the prettiest canals. Situated around the North Church, this once working class area is more bohemian now. At its north end one of Amsterdam's prettiest canals is the small Brouwersgracht until it intersects Prinsengracht. Even in damp weather it is worth a stroll around :)

The central Amsterdam. I was here just between flights so i didn't stay for too long, but it was enough to do the damrak, the dam square, the new and old Churchs, the canals and the red light district. It's all together, so everything is close!
one of the best free attractions in the city. this place is worth a cycle of walkabout in the day and another time at night. its full of history and character.
Such an atmosphere. This is a must see in Amsterdam. Walking ir biking, enjoy criss crossing streets with unuque colorful houses by the canals. It is not a big district but us really amazing

Great neighbourhood!!!. It's one of Amsterdam's authentic neighborhoods with great ambience and lots of things to do. Strolling down the narrow streets, shopping at the quaint shops or having a bite to eat at one of the many eateries is one of my favorite past times when I visit Amsterdam.The beautiful architecture of the famous canal houses are a feast to the eyes.
Grest time!. Great time, good atmosphere with some shops, coffees and restaurants! Very nice!We have enjoyed a lot with my sister!Would like to come back!

A Jordaan Walking tour. I downloaded Rick Steves audiotour for the Jordaan and it worked out very well for me. The area is beautiful and a relief after the very busy Dam Square. It's an oasis of calm and I imagine it's even lovelier in the spring and summer.
Lovely neighbourhood . Beautiful neighbourhood on the edge of the centre of Amsterdam. It's has narrow cobbled streets full of hidden gems of restaurants and bars. Worth a wander around.

Good atmosphere. Great atmosphere with small shops and cafe`s. Hidden treasures and cosy streets with a friendly vibe.Markeds are small, and a lot of charming buildings in the streets.Can take lovely walks along the canals, or rent a bicycle.
Do the Boat Trip. Do the cruises in Amsterdam, is baeutiful. It will cost you arount 9 and 15 euros depending the company.
Perfect for an afternoon walk. This area is really nice and artistic with lots of long and narrow alleys. You really get a taste of what was going on here decades and decades ago!

Great afternoon stroll . We had a couple of hours to stroll around Jordaan and we enjoyed every minute of it! The markets are small and nice and you can enjoy the tastes of the cheese and pesto or tomato paste. Don't skip on the apple pie in the corner of the street!

Fun and interesting. Great small shops with friendly shopkeepers who graciously speak English to those of us who don't speak Dutch. Wide variety of items, lots to look at. Homes along canals have interesting and beautiful architecture. Lively neighborhood which is great for people watching.

Narrow streets with hidden courts, interesting shops, café's and restaurants.. Just stroll the canals with flower names and take side streets and their first and second side streets: like x-gracht, x-straat and 1e / 2e x-dwarsstraat. Find weird shops, different café's and nice restaurants here. All times of the year. Can you find and enter a few of the gorgeous hidden courts behind a huge door?

Great part of a great city. Like all over the city, the architecture and general views are incredible. It's so beautiful and iconic.
Some lovely cafes, shops and walks here, so get out on foot and explore

nice and romantic. We were passing from there almost every day as the hotel where we stayed was very close to the Jordaan.
We had very nice and romantic walks

Quirky shops great atmosphere. Lovely selection of quality shops, cafes & restaurants showcasing some of
The best home wares, fashions and jewellery. It's worth the walk, lots to see
And great food to enjoy whilst soaking up the relaxed atmosphere.
You will be spoilt for choice, but that's a great excuse to keep coming back.

Great character, wonderful cafes!. If you're looking for a place away from the hustle and bustle of tourist areas, Jordaan is it. The cafes and quirky shops make it a perfect place for some window shopping, actual shopping, a coffee, a drink, and/or a snack (or all of the above). A wonderful place to spend the day wandering, if time allows.
Nice atmosphere. Nice, small shops and restaurants, good atmosphere, lots of canals. Good place to hop on a canalboat (by Anne Franks house)

Worth the stroll!. Authentic and full of wonderful bars and restaurants. It's a bit off the beaten path from where you'd normally spend your time (if limited) in Amsterdam – but we loved it! Gorgeous views, tonnes of photo ops!
Funky, fun neighborhood. Full of authentic neighborhood bars and restaurants, Jordaan is a bit off the typical tourist path - a must see for those willing to wander a bit.

Jordaan area of Amsterdam. One of the prettiest sections of Amsterdam. Beautiful Pakhuis (Warehouse) building and homes of the very rich. Architecture is beautiful and very clean streets. (Be careful of the bikes here and everywhere in Amsterdam!!)

Cozy and Colorful. Rented an Apartment on the Bloemgracht Canal here. Ate at many local restaurants and shopped in many small, local businesses. Convenient to public transportation. Felt very safe here. A very enjoyable part of Amsterdam.

Romance. This area is my favourite in the whole of amsterdam. Mostly there are locals drinking beer in the sun, outside on benches or cute cafe's. Also, the art galleries are very intimate and have very good contemporary art. In sum, this is a romantic side of amsterdam that one has to see!
Nice place . We have had a nice half day here. Went trought the Jordaan, saw the nice houses. If you like architektur, this is right place. I recommend

Beautiful River Views and Scenery. We took a boat cruise through the Jordaan area and the views all along the canals and river were splendid. We were able to closely view stately old buildings, homes, bridges, and ships converted into house boats tied up along docks and water. It was a very interesting ride and the guide on our ship did a nice job entertaining us with his knowledge of the city and the water ways we were sailing along.

Stay in this area. We rented an amazing house in this area and we were not disappointed. You can walk in walk for miles and explore the canals and shops in architecture. When we come back to Amsterdam, we will definitely stay in this beautiful area to be right in the middle of all there is to do.

Great for a wander. Lovely quiet part of the city with loads of good architecture and views to match. Worth a visit. Unique collection of shops. Close to the centre and easy to get to. Loads of good photo opportunities.

Where Did All this Come From?. Of course this is my misunderstanding as this was my first time back in Amsterdam in over 40 years. The area below Central Station to Dam Square was not the nicest-lots of alcoholics and others sleeping along the streets. Now the area below Central station and West to the Jewish Section towards the Anne Frank House-the Jordaan has been revitalized. It is Amsterdam's prime pedestrian area filled with privately owned boutique shops(Pricey), restaurants, bars, markets, and coffee shops with beautiful exotic fragrances emanating all in remodeled homes. A great area to walk and watch.
This is all what Amsterdam is about!!. Just go there!! Have a boat cruise, try to watch that wonderful view of canals and take some pictures!!

Taste of Dutch. We have just spent six days at the Studio Elf which is situated in Amsterdam's characteristic Jordaan district. We rented the top floor which consists of an attic in and old typical Dutch house complete with steep winding staircase. The house is situated about 600 metres from the famous Anne Frank House and very near to important tourist attractions which can be reached easily on foot like Dam Square, Centraal Station, Damrak, Rijksmuseum etc..The area is full of narrow street mostly interspersed with canals and interesting shops and countless cafes along the way. Most residences are very old with wonderful architecture especially the gables.
Stayed in this neighborhood. Fabulous. Great place to stay as well as wonder around for fabulous small, high quality restaurants away from the crowds near redlight area.

kewl stores!. Special stores! (not chewed up like around the Dam Square)...
quite expensive, I'd suggest window-shopping. (;

Breathing Amsterdam. Ask somebody from Amsterdam which areas they like the most, Jordaan will be most likely in the top. This area stretches out over a part of historical Amsterdam, with its protected sights, houses and views. On a sunny day or on a nice evening a typical Amsterdam feeling is what you can catch here. Walk around through the small streets and it will be Amsterdam on one of its best sides.
Great spot. Loved the market and the walk around the area. Nice restaurants and coffee houses and great architecture and quirky details
Easy way to get overview of the city. In spite of the rain it was fun to take a canal boat ride. The boats are fully enclosed to not wet or too cold. Guide pointed out things go interest.
This is Amsterdam. A great area which was my first introduction to Amsterdam - looking just like Amsterdam always did in my imagination. :)

Peaceful. A wonderful part of Amsterdam.. I have been on a tour with Omy Amsterdam tours and found the hidden gardens and little brown bars. The history of this 400 year old neighborhood is interesting as the architecture.
great quarters. i loved this aerea, i stayed here too.........great restaurants, coffeshop, buildings and shops and easy access to the railwaystation for comings and goings
typical amsterdam feeling. skip the tourist places ..come to the Jordaan, and get the real feeling of Amsterdam, love tje shops and the so called ''brown cafe;s'' so fun

Very nice neighbourhood farfrom the very touristic places and full of charme!. You will love walking along the canals and discovering from the inside what is a dutch neighbourhood. There is a very calm and relxaing atmosphere with the canals and the many bicycles passing by!

Cute neighborhood. This neighborhood is so cute and has lots of cute shops and the architecture of the buildings in the area are beautiful. If you want to experience the city like a local then you should spend sone time just wandering around these streets and exploring the hidden gems. And if you like markets then you should check out the Noorder Markt in this neighborhood.

Very cool area. Walk around Joordan if you have time (especially on saturdays with the market but not on Mondays because lots of things will be close). The houses and shops are beautiful. Very cool to discover.

"Tiny Heart" of Amsterdam. Staying in this neighborhood, gave the perfect opportunity to walk along the tiny paths and by the canal side. The most important attractions are the houses facing the canal. As explained to me by one of the walking tour guide, each house attic has a different elevation, which defines the house owners profession. Try to walk away from the main road, Walk along the unexplored paths. You can find the perfect photo opportunity of the less busy canals.

From working class to chic. The Jordaan is a certrally located area in Amsterdam that was once working class and poor but was rejuvenated in the '70s and is now a rather chic area and a real tourist attraction.It's very pretty - and very Amsterdam; narrow streets, canals and bridges everywhere. There are a lot of small artisanne shops there now and it really is worth your while to visit. I have a nice personal memory in that I was walking there and seen a small record shop (you don't see so many of them anymore), so I went in and they had some really nice music playing. I asked the guy behind the counter who it was and he said Lizz Wright. I bought the CD there and then and every time I play it I'm reminded of my trip.The Jordaan was also famous for its style of music - old traditional Dutch music; accordions and singing. Some rather famous (national) artists came from there. You can still get a taste of that sound and lifestyle in some of the pubs there. It might be a bit kitchy and perhaps it's put on a little for the tourists but it's still a fun way to spend an evening. All in all, worth including in your visit to Amsterdam.
Beautiful part of Amsterdam. Just strolled thru it, was very nice with the old Architecture, will be staying in an apartment there this coming January, will post a review on that

Hofjes. The most impressive in this area are the hofjes :small back gardens. The acces to these inner gardens is the front door of the house. The most beautiful hofjes are: St.Andrieshofje (most beautiful),Anslo'shofje at the Eglantiersgracht, Karthuyzerhofje, Suykerhof (nice flowers),Rapenhofje. Don't miss the flower market and the Brouwersgracht (warehouse).
Great neighbourhood to walk around. One of my favourite neighbourhoods to walk around! Lots of cute cafes and beautiful houses to gawk at.

Good vibe neighbourhood. Stroll around the area and drop in many of the quirky places for a coffee, cake or just a look-see. Antiques, modern design, shoe repair and makers rub shoulders with a myriad of food places.
Quaint. A great area to stroll around taking in the quaint little shops and houses. Visit the Tulip Museum and the Delft shop

Dutch living. Great area to stay while in Amsterdam as in a neighborhood surrounding rather than in touristy areas. A short distance to Dam Square, walking distance to many recommended restaurants, public transportation and attractions.
Cultural walk amongst the locals. A beautiful district with lots of boutiques and cafes - we were able to stroll through the area and enjoy the relaxed local atmosphere.

Out of the fray. We stayed on the edge of the neighborhood and found it the best possible place to be.Just walking in a different direction every day uncovered many charming houses, shops and restaurants. If you can manage a walking tour with guide, I think you would learn a great deal more about the houses. Without a guide, we learned that our B&B was connected by tunnel to the now bar across the canal. During the reformation, Catholic church services were secretly held in the house.

The beautiful joordan. Nice and pleasant strolling around the joordan admiring architecture and how beautiful the houses are adorned. Cafes and bars plentiful to rest tired feet along the way. Peaceful and tranquility away from the rush of everyday life.
Visually stunning. Great place to get lost in. Historic, diverse, trendy and lovely to explore. Trendy and beautiful. A must to go if you visit Amsterdam.
A good place to spend a few hours. It is a good place to walk, like the most of this city. Many shops and some restaurants. We had a lunch there.The best time to go is around noon.

Great area of Amsterdam. We stayed in the area for 3 nights on a canal boat and loved soaking up the atmosphere by living like a local.So many cyclists all over so one had to have eyes everywhere. Loved the area, the little bakery and other shops too.

Love love love this area. We came here as somebody recommended Toscanini Italian restaurant but we got so engrossed with everything else we ended up going to an Indian up this little alleyway. The bars, restaurants, scenery is superb, love love it - going back in a couple of weeks and will definitely try the Toscanini!
More relaxed vibe. The Jordaan is beautiful, full of lovely places to eat, antique shops, trendy shops and much more. It's more replaced than right in the centre, a must see for all visitors.

shop until you drop. The small, historic streets in the Jordaan accommodate numerous shops and a substantial number of restaurants. The range of activities is varied and so is the population. This very popular neighborhood is well worth a visit, at the end of your visit walk over to the Westerkerk, the very beautiful church crowned with an Imperial crown.

Great little shopping/restaurant area. Started at 9 little streets on our shopping excursion. Great little shops and a few restaurants. Went on to the Jordaan district for more shopping and lunch. Lots of little local owned boutiques and restaurants. No chains here. Had a great time. If you like big department stores and chains do not go here. If you are looking for unique things there is no better area in Europe.

Lovely area. Beautiful sights. The photo oportunities are endless here and the restaurants are top-notch.
I especially loved the shopping in this district. I bought my fair share of "baubles" and intesting art pieces.
I would say that it is a must area to vist in Amsterdam!

Hire a bike, nice neighborhood with coffee and lunch bars. I have been heading to Amsterdam twice and the Jordaan is really something to consider when you are in Amsterdam. I always enjoy the cofeebars and the last couple of years it got this 'Hip' movement coming up here. So nice to do when you are in Amsterdam! Tip: Hire a bike, the Jordaan could be a bit better if you have one since their are places where there is nothing, so you can stop whenever you want.
amsterdam like a toy shop. this area is so walkable! we stayed there and thank god we did: everything reminds me of haensel and gretel...
was nice. looked the same to me as the rest of amsterdam, happened to go there o the way to the ann frank huis

Lovely Area. WE stayed in The Jordaan area and loved it. It is full of tiny shops, quirky old bars and great restaurants and cafes.We were happy to explore on foot for our whole stay apart from a trip on the canal which is also not to be missed.It feels more local although there are lots of tourists of course.

Nice zone. It's a very nice place in Amsterdam. We saw stores and restaurants from different countries in this area. The whole street is designed by red lights designed like a rose flower. Totally I suggest you to have a walk in this area
Worth it. Its really pretty, its also more local then other parts. It's kinda in the opposite direction. Of the red light so you get more of the dutch vibe. Its cool worth a stroll
Trendy quarter. Very nice place to potter around with a coffee, look into little galleries and peek into the lives of wealthy amsterdamers.

old warehouse district. we loved this area . little cafes, pubs restaurants. bikes everywhere. one can walk everywhere. local stores instead chain stores. relaxed atmosphere. close to good bus/tram routes. Our Hotel was hotel Linden 100 years old, small rooms but comfortable with good staff.

Beautiful place to see. My husband and I and a couple of friends had hired a private boat trip around the canals, it was amazing to see, beautiful buildings and was amazing to see the sunset on water it would be crazy not do it

Best avoided on a wet Autumn day. Walked through the Jordaan in November as part of a circular walk around the canals in Amsterdam.
Sorry but I thought it was just a boring, quiet ( and damp) residential area. Might be better in summer?

Watch out for Bikes they have the right of way!. The Jordaan is a lovely area in Amsterdam. Great eating places and lovely stores. A nice place to walk around but beware of bikes...their riders have the right of way and they take it. The canals are beautiful and a ride in this area is most enjoyable.
The Jordaan. The Jordaan is a neighborhood and there are many attractions and restaurants on the streets. It is a must see. You can get there by tram or canal bus.
just stroll and be happy. this is the best on a sunny day. just stroll and look at the people, the buildings and try some of the small restaurants where the locals hang out.

Really good area of Amsterdam DamSquare say no more. Loads of bars and restaurants including O'Reillys Irish Pub, and a stones throw from the red light district. Always remember when in Amsterdam, all trams go to Dam Square the heart of Jordaan

To see the real amsterdam you need to wander through the jordan.. Great buildings, atmosphere and characters. Pubs are fantastic (the kroegjes) and just watching people is great. Beware, it's very very busy and bicyclists are not careful.

So cute!. Somebody told me that the Jordan is the district of hipsters and I thought "MammaMia" because I hate the hipsters (don't hate me). But it's very cute, the streets are very particular and the ivy surround the houses.

A Great Place to Stay. We loved being in the Jordaan area and recommend The Canal House. It s fun and funky and the staff accommodatng and delightful. The garden area is a bonus. Small but interesting rooms, great location.
Lovely area. Do yourself a favor and plan on spending at least 3 hours meandering the streets. We downloaded Rick Steve's free audio walking tour, and it helped us appreciate the area even more.
Great area.... We hired a driver and first drove the area to get a feel but this is Amsterdam so what could be wrong....nothing
fun place to explore. There are lots of beautiful buildings, canals, the odd coffee shop and a nice shopping centre. It's easy to navigate and close to key touristic attractions.

A beautiful neighbourhood to wander. A super long line at Anne Frank Huis meant we chose to wander around neighbouring Jordaan. It was the best decision we made! I'm not one to overly advocate the use of the well known travel book series however it does contain a good walk meaning you get a real feel for the area.

Lovely neighborhood. We stayed in the neighbourhood for a week and had a chance to walk around - lots of neighbourhood shopping and restaurants.
It's about 10-15 min walk from the Centraal Station.
Beautiful place to walk around and easy access to most places in Amsterdam.

Great neighborhood!. Amsterdam in general is great. This area is especially nice. very close to most everything,dining,attractions,train. everything close. very safe to walk at night,clean and beautiful.

Stunning!!!. We went here one morning and had a lovely chilled out stroll with beautiful scenes and lots to see this is a definite area to head to.
Lovely shops and cafes to grab a pit stop

Much more subtle amsterdam experience. Amsterdam with its canals and architecture in itself makes for very unique experience. But it also becomes touristy and loud. Somehow this neighborhood has got a fine balance of residential buildings, relatively less tourists, laid back cafes and beautiful architecture. It is not exactly "off the tourist map" or "upscale" neighborhood but something more subtle and real !!

A beautiful area to see architechture, canals, and people watch. The Jordaan is a beautiful neighborhood with well kept homes and many good restaurants and shops. The Anne Frank House is there as well and canals and well kept houseboats to view. A fun area to stay or visit.

Interesting architecture and a fun place to explore.. We I stayed in this area during at the end of May and really enjoyed the entire Jordaan area. Nice shops, boutiques, and markets. Would definitely stay here again.
Great upscale area. Great brown bars/cafes and restaurants. Good for people watching. Nice shopping on 9 streets and great for riding a bike. A safe upscale area full of locals.

The Best Neighborhood in Amsterdam!. I've been to Amsterdam many times, and have stayed in various neighborhoods over the years, and I do think that The Jordan is the best place to stay. You could walk around for days, discovering something new at every turn. Shops, cafe's, fine restaurants, nooks and crannies...there is a feel of authenticity, charm and sometime quirkiness that is unique to the city. Highly recommended!

Perfect place to wander around. We stayed near the Jordaan district during our stay in Amsterdam and it is a really beautiful area - stunning buildings in typical Dutch style (beautiful), nice little shops, cafes and restaurants
I would really recommend visiting this area of Amsterdam - whether for food/drink or just for a wander about it is really worth a visit.

The Jordaan is where Amsterdammers hang out. I am an expat and have lived in the Jordaan for 23 years. There are sorts of little cafes, shops and restaurants to explore right in the middle of the city but a bit off the beaten track.

Lovely area to walk. When you walk around in the streets of the Jordaan you will find lovely shops, little restaurants and bars. Enjoy the atmosphere in the area.
It is near the Anne Frank House !!

Love wandering the Jordaan. The Jordaan is one the most beautiful areas in Amsterdam to walk around, and Amsterdam is a walkers paradise. I find it calm as there are fewer cars and more families riding their bikes. Best area for a nice peaceful outdoor cafe.
Moseley by the canals. Lovely streets to wander through on a very pleasant moonlit autumn evening. Great looking shops, bars and restaurants.
Nice quarter. Beautiful cafes and shop, intgeresting people, a bit off the main tourist streams, this quarter offers a special insight into Amsterdam. You will enjoy your visit.
Colourful!. Immerse yourself in the 'real' Amsterdam and absorb the very special atmosphere of this once fairly impoverished neighbourhood that has produced man colourful characters

The most lovely neighborhood in Amsterdam. Walk and wonder around Jordaan, every corner has something special. Some of the best spots to take pictures are there. Also, the markets and restaurants are very nice (Jordaan Saturday Market, or Winkel serves the best apple pie in town!)

Scenic neighborhood. We really liked walking around this area. There were plenty of scenic streets/canals, but also fun bars and restaurants. We enjoy somewhere a little more laid-back than the red-light district, but were able to find a nice, seemingly local, coffeeshop to enjoy the Amsterdam vibe.

Best area of Amsterdam. This is my favorite neighborhood in Amsterdam. Lots of cute shops, great restaurants and some nice architecture. It seems to be more where the locals live and hang out. It is not a touristy area but very charming and quaint. Stop in a pub and meet locals or just enjoy the walk.

One of the must goes. I am living in Amsterdam and would any visitor to go to this area. Less crowded, not really off the beaten track anymore though.
Go see Bloemengracht, one of the nicest in the city!

intresting. we were staying in Amsterdam at the EDEN HOTEL, which is not far from the Jordaan easy to get to by tram --great system , the day we were there ,there was an open air market ,it was huge with all types of vendors from food ,fruit and veg ,meat ,clothes dvds and many more its worth a visit
a good place to walk. Very nice place. Buildings very representative of the city. Street calm with very much canals. Good place to eat and drink.
Beautiful Area. We walked around the Jordaan on our first full day in Amsterdam. It's so beautiful and I can certainly see why it has the name Jordaan. Much nicer area than the noisy station area.

Lovely Part of Town. An eclectic mix of old , tree lined streets, canals, speciality shopping and lots of restaurants and bars. This area is worth a couple of hours of anyone's time. The speciality shops on Haarlammerdijk are particularly worth seeking out.

Love this eclectic part of the city!. Always finding something new in Jordan despite visiting 6 times. Really lovely interesting shops, bars & restaurant! quite a classy little place to visit whilst maintaining the wonderful chilled Amsterdam vibe!

Nice , very traditional, nice streets and little places to eat or shop.. nice streets and little places to eat or shop. Friendly people, very dutch, not good for rainy day. We had lund at a typical dutch at a little sandwich shop, Do try the egg salad sandwich!!!

Charming and quieter than Red Light District . My friends and I this year and last year either stayed in the Centruum or in De Wallen (red light district). There are a lot of things to do and see in those areas but I'm glad we ventured out in Jordaan this year. We booked a gondola ride and this was were we were set to leave from. There is only one gondola operator in all of Amsterdam. I would highly recommend this to anyone wanting a quiet and romantic tour through the canals of Amsterdam. This was probably one of the best things my husband and I have ever done. It is so peaceful without a motor running. We took our ride at night and could see all of the canal ways lit up. After our boat ride we walked around Jordaan. It has the beauty of the rest of the city and the iconic architecture without the tourist feel. It was so quiet it was hard to imagine the Red Light district only a mile away. Jordaan seems like an area you could actually live in Amsterdam. Do your self a favor if you want to see a part of Amsterdam that is not all coffee and sex shops go to Jordaan!
Not sure what all the fuss is about. ... Just another neighbourhood... besides Anne Frank house and a few shops... not sure what else there is to do.
A must in Adam. Great place to walk around to feel real Amsterdam under you feet. Consider Your visit to Adam not complete without strolling down these streets.
Great walk and sight seeing. Beautiful area in Amsterdam. We saw this on our canal tour and then walked it. Stunning buildings and houses

Jordaan - Amsterdam's best neighbourhood!. I fell in love with Jordaan, it's quaint little streets, unique buildings, beautiful buildings & fine bistros. It's only a stones throw away from the heart of Amsterdam & Dam Square yet it couldn't be any more different if it tried. It really is stunning, so picturesque. Nestled in the heart of the neighbourhood is the world famous Anne Frank House museum, there is also the Tulip Museum opposite. Well worth a visit!

Absolutely Quaint!. Quiet, narrow streets ligned with old buildings in good shape. Many open street markets, tons of small specialty shops. Lovely area to stroll through and have a coffee and a sandwich.
Fascinating and beautiful neighborhood. If you want beautiful houses, alleys, canals, and bridges; great restaurants and shops; and excellent people watching -- don't miss this area!

Stroll and get lost... This is Amsterdam at it's purest. There is no more typical neighborhood in Amsterdam than the Jordaan. Any map will explain you the location, and is very close to the Central Station and the Dam Square.Many small little streets and canals with many little stores, galleries, typical brown pubs and small restaurants. This is my Amsterdam. An afternoon stroll always brings me something new, although I have been there many times. There is always a witty Jordanees available for a chat and a laughter. Fall in a pub and have a beer with the locals. Pay attention to the many hidden "hofjes", kinda inner courtyards, with small living spaces, built by the rich people in the golden ages for elderly widows. A charity thing. Always remember to look up at the facades of the buildings, as they often are beautifully decorated. But above all, loose yourself in this fantastic and typical neighborhood.

Quaint narrow streets with unique little shops.. Well worth a meander round but be prepared to open your wallets as the little shops offer such appealing, stylish and quirky merchandise. Fantastic cafes are dotted all over this area. Beautiful location wrapped around the many canals.
Lovely . Walking in the streets is lovely over there..relaxing and you feel like home...nice shops nice building ! Love amsterdam

Beautiful cobblestone roads, pretty canals and interesting architecture. We went back to this area of Amsterdam several times, selecting different cafes to sit and enjoy a drink, wandering aimlessly along little backstreets and alleys. It is a very safe area of Amsterdam and has a real charm to it. Pick a canal and follow it along, admire the houseboats, the architecture of the buildings, the small second hand clothing shops.

Very nice walking tour. We enjoyed to "Nine Streets" walking tour and the many little specialty shops (like the leather makers - I almost bought a leather hat) and a good variety of restaurants. The connecting canal-side streets were tree lined, shady and cool.

Fabulous Jordaan. A wonderful area of Amsterdam and worth a visit, if for no other reason just to enjoy the experience, theres cafes and coffeshops abound with boutique shops to while away the day. Fabulous atmosphere and a really great place to visit when in Amsterdam.

enjoying the jordaan. wonderful area...it is as picturesque as it is serene...was raining which only added more to its romantic aura...walk down the paved roads and sneak into the alleys and feel experience the quaintness of the area...feels like the heart of amsterdam
Local feel. Lots of interesting small local shops and bars - very warm and welcoming. Loved the dutch bars and felt very safe in this area.

An Amsterdammer in Amsterdam. My first time as a tourist in Amsterdam. De Jordaan is the heart of Amsterdam. We stayed at Brandon Appartements above the famous Brandon café. Here you don't need a car. Everything is within walking distance.
THE REAL AMSTERDAM. Walking around this area and taking canal rides are amazing. We have been all around Europe but Amsterdam is different and exciting.

So lovely. My preferred area in town. Paved roads along the canals, independent boutiques, small restaurants and cafés, flowers on the beautiful houses. Just hanging out here is a pleasure. Maybe this is what they call gezelligheid.

Nice area to explore.... Ventured into the area after visiting the Ann Frank house, not quite the hustle and bustle of the city, plenty of little cafes etc to have a break and watch the world go by............

Quirky and quaint. In The Jordaan I've seen some of the most beautiful streets and houses the city has to offer. Along with the spectacular scenery this area is full of great bars, cafes, shops and grocery shops. Definitely worth days of wandering around :)

Good for an evening walk. Amsterdam is an excting and cosy place, Joordan is one of the best historical part of it. We really enjoyed the voluntary reality show of the citizen on a Saturday night. Non of the cities where we were, was so transparent like this.
The best view. I think this neighbourhood has the best view. Its very nice, and there are so many good spots for photography. If you're into architecture photography, you should walking around here.

one of our favourite neighbor hoods. We picked an AirBNB in this neighborhood and were super pleased to have done so. It's easy walking distance to and from bus and train, but far enough away from the more grungy tourist center. Great restaurants (lots of little Italian eateries on a close by street), cafes and bars and markets in walking distance, and exploring the canals was super fun here. We would definitely pick this area to stay on our next trip.

The "peasant" distict, lots a good restaurants but also lots of lads in tracksuits getting stoned. liked the restaurants, disliked all the groups of rowdy lads out there just to get stoned. If you go to the central and southern parts of Jordaan you'll find the better restaurants.
one of the beautiful places. easy to reach you just walk to the the right from dam square as you are coming from central station one hour wandering there more than enough
Nice District. Nice district to chill out and with lot's of history. Nice street restaurants and great place for a work. Was one of the highlights of our trip.
Pleasant walk through the Jordaan. Enjoy(ed) the Jordaan in Amsterdam by foot. At night, walked through nice streets with plenty of bars & restaurants to visit.
great time!. such a nice experience and relaxing way to spend the day. it's wonderful to see the character of the area

Amsterdam at its best - hip area. Small streets of what used to be the working-classes area, now very up-to date. Small original shops, many different restaurants - and on your way, you will see the best of Amsterdam's architecture too. Tip: take good walking shoes, the pavements can be uneven and chances are you will walk a lot. Tip 2: great area for finding souvenirs.Not very suited for young children.
Old Town. This is a lovely area to stroll round, there are some nice cafe's and there are places which are very picturesque. There's a market here as well
pretty place, lots of shops. was lovely to walk around, lots of little cobbled streets and places to eat or drink, biked through on many occasions

The Jordaan. The Jordaan is one of the most picturesque areas of Amsterdam. The Nine Streets allow for shopping, and there are countless cafes and restaurants to satisfy any craving. It's a lovely area to just wander.

A great part of Amsterdam to explore. Jordaan is a lovely hipster area of Amsterdam with lots of great cafes, restaurants and plenty of places for shopping, it's also much more fun than shopping in the chaos of Kalverstraat and far more unique and specialty shops to find that ultimate purchase you cannot live without!

Worth a visit, don't like the new buildings.. This is a good place to visit to see some lovely old buildings but some of the area was raised to the ground and new, modern buildings, with no soul were built which ruins the approach to the area. Worth a visit, good small restaurants and shops.
Wonderful Neighborhood to Browse, Shop or Dine. This is a very pleasant neighborhood to check out during a visit to Amsterdam. Interesting boutiques, pubs, coffeeshops and restaurants of all types.

Elegant, stylish and peaceful.. We had walked from our hotel located on the Damrak, to visit Anne Frank’s house at our appointed time of 8.40pm on a Sunday evening and we had arrived about an hour early. Therefore, we decided to spend our spare time exploring the area nearby. It just so happened that the Jordaan was located across the canal from Anne Frank's house, so we spent the time wandering around this area and then sitting by the canal, relaxing and soaking up the atmosphere.There was a splendid array of trendy restaurants, cafes and boutiques within the area. We also saw a number of quirky gift, collectors and art shops. However, at this hour on a Sunday evening, most of the shops were closed.After our stroll around the area, we found a nice bench by the canal and spent some time watching the boats go by with groups of people enjoying the warmth and light of the summer evening.We were pleasantly surprised by the elegance and style of this lovely part of Amsterdam and would recommend a visit to the area, for any tourists who happen to be visiting Amsterdam.
Nice district. A really nice district worth visiting. Really big quantity and quality of restaurants and cafes. Also good for walks around the canals.
Lovely peaceful part of Amsterdam. Great area to stay in as it is quiet and picturesque but still east access to the centre of Amsterdam
Prettiest area of Amsterdam . This is in my opinion the most picturesque area of Amsterdam - full of greenery and pretty canals. It is a little expensive though, as one might expect.

We just love this area of Amsterdam. Our third visit to Amsterdam in 12 months and we always stay in the Jordaan area. It's a great area buzzing with some great shops and restaurants. No matter what the season it's great to stroll around the place.

“Great area to walk around”. It's trendy, and an interesting place for a walk and very pretty neighborhood with great restaurants. Every bridge is decorated with real flowers. Be careful with all the bikes and the narrow streets !
Beautiful Jordaan. A great area to explore by bike whilst in Amsterdam, with great 'brown cafes' and eateries everywhere, steeped in history
Very Interesting Area. Great area with nice shops, quaint restaurants and small alleys. Nice area to spend time just getting lost in the small streets.

Best area in amsterdam. If you like small streets with small boutiques and art galleries this is the place for you. In my opinion it is the most picturesque areas of Amsterdam. Perfect for strolling, biking or just sitting by a canal with a beer/wine.
For the young and young at heart.. Very trendy and busy area. Many bars with youthful and social patrons. Enjoyed the views of the beautiful canals and buildings.
Must see this area. Beautiful area, stunning buildings, good relaxed vibe, perfect for strolling around. Nice little cafes and bars along the way, market stalls at the weekend too,

Nice area. The Jordaan is a nice area to walk around and take in the quietness of Amsterdam. It is not as busy as central Amsterdam but they have nice restaurants and bars. We did our own bar crawl throughout the Jordaan and had lunch at Piqniq. I recommend going there for lunch. We enjoyed the drinks at Cafe de Zon as well.

A charming district for a stroll. A charming area just to walk around and take in the surroundings, the houseboats, the canal boats and people watching. Probably better in early evening as people are out and about

LOts to see and do.. As an up and coming area the Jordaan has so much offer. Excellent Cafes and Restaurants. Lots of shops and galleries and when your tired of walking just sit on a bench next to a canal and enjoy life as it goes by. It's a lovely area that shouldn't be missed.

Pick up a memento and great place to people watch. Great area to explore full of interesting eateries and coffee bars. Home to the Northern flea market (every Monday?) where you are sure to find a memento of your trip. TIP Don't go too early! I got there at 9:30am and half the stalls hadn't even set up (the Dutch are pretty laid back) so you don't have to be there first thing to bag a bargain! Great place to browse, chill and relax.

A must see in Amsterdam!. Amazing experience to just walk around the area and get lost within the small boutiques - amazing cute little designer stores with really unique items selling and very friendly people all around. A nice chilled place for a walk in the morning or afternoon!! shops close early though - by 6:00pm on most days so you want to make sure you get enough time.

Beautiful.... Beautiful part of Amsterdam, so nice to cycle around on a sunny day. Was always passing through the area as we spent the weekend in Amsterdam, and was one of my favorite parts of the city, very picturesque.
Well worth touring. We wandered in and out of lots of unique shops in this area. Bought some old blues CD's in a dusty little place, bulbs to take back to Canada in other.
It is okay but a bit overrated. The Jordaan is famous for tourists but for me it is not the best area of Amsterdam for visiting. Try other areas and you will be surprised by the diversity

Fantastic . Great location. Not far from the train station, red light district or dam square.
Great coffee shops, lovely bakeries and nice restaurants. First time staying in this district and would recommend to anyone that's not a group of friends looking for a big party area!
Interesting area to explore. We walked around the Jordaan during a long weekend break in Amsterdam. Lovely houses, interesting market and we found a very good cafe (Boca's)

SATURDAYS ARE BUSY. I had read up about The Jordaan and really looked forward to browsing round in a lazy way. But not on a Saturday when it was packed out with tourists and as usual bicycles. It was impossible to find a cafe with vacant seats at lunch time. So if you decide to go make sure its not a Saturday or you may be disappointed because it is so crowded.

Lovely Area. We stayed recently in the Jordaan area and fell in love with the place. From the quaint cafes and lovely restaurants to the arty shops and views of the canal this is a must visit area for anyone staying in Amsterdam. We spent hours wandering around the lovely streets, taking in all the sights and sounds whilst having coffee and beers. Will definitely be back :)
Beautiful district. I really enjoyed walking around the streets in Jordan - it was so calm and cozy. Regret that I couldn't spend there some longer time
Nice place for a walk.. Canals, old houses, great places to eat and drink beer. What could be better for a sunny fall day? Slow down and lose yourself in the little streets of this area.

Best area of amsterdam. The jordaan is no doubt the best area in the old city center.Such an amazing place, full of canals and bridges, little butik stores from chocolate and bakerys to top fashion designers. Have a walk there and you wont regret

A must go. A must go. What a city, what a neighborhood. You should walk around and forget time. Stop at the stores,, take pictures, feel the atmosphere. Then you should come back and do everything again.

Nice sunny Saturday. We had a very nice walk on sunny weekend. Lots of coffee shops , unique fashion shops . Trendy quarter... Spent here about 1 hour. Just next to this quarter , there's "The 9 streets" area, also very nice. Don't miss it.

nice neighborhood. while it is close to central Amsterdam, it has an entirely different feel. It feels like a place where people live. There are plenty of cafes and coffee shops but not in the numbers you see in Amsterdam. It is quiet enough to sleep at night. And we found a great little restaurant a block and a half from where we were staying. Easily accessible by public transit.

Real Amsterdam. This eclectic area has everything to offer in true Amsterdam style. It's a wide street that allows small park in the middle " Johnny Jordaan" tribute. From the end of the street is the largest indoor antique mall. The endless cafes infuse your nose with a plethora of smells to invite you in. There's authentic Italian, Thai, Dutch,Coffee shops and Cafes that keep you coming back for more. It's a family friendly area that give a real sense of Dutch culture. The side streets are also not to be missed with also a wide variety of shops. This area is a must see , eat and experience it ,as you too will put this as a favorite!!!!

Jordaan. This area is lovely to walk around and taken the picturesque setting. Lots of cafes to have coffee and a break from lots of walking. Boutiques if you fell like shopping. Just take care with the people riding their bicycles they are ruthless!
My fav neighborhood . This is an area where most locals lived. The streets are charming with plenty of small cafes and restaurants. An ideal place to chill and be far away from the tourists.
Cute neighborhood. Walk around the area quite a bit and really like this area. There are coffee shops, cafe nearby so can pop in for a break if you want. Love it :)

great atmosphere , right on the canal .... 2 blocks from the Anne Frank House so you can have a meal before or after visiting that !! Traditional pancakes are the way to go. they are the size of big plates but thin like crepes
Brilliant Shopping Experience. Lots and lots of quirky and fun shops, bars, restaurants and cafes. you can easily spend a whole day browsing the area.

Lovely. Took the canal bus to the Jordaan and wandered around on a beautiful September day. Totally enchanting neighbourhood and a bonus was I found a really good vegetarian café there! There are so many little café and bars in the Jordaan you will never go hungry or thirsty walking around there. I took so many pictures of the houses by the canals, canal boat houses, bikes you name it I took a photo of it. I'm definitely staying on a house boat in the Jordaan next time I go to Amsterdam.

Famous and poor. Many street names refer to flora, hence the name Jordaan (jardin). It was not built to resemble a garden. The people who dug the canals and built the canal houses lived here, most of them in poverty. Famous names are sprinkled: Rembrandt spent his final days on the Rozengracht;mapmakers like Blaauw had their shops on a canal in the Jordaan. Dozens and dozens of small restaurants and pubs.

Beautiful city and very amicable people. Very diverse population.. Places to visit in Amsterdam. The city os full of enchanting places like museums, Plantage park, Historical buidings (Anne Frank's House, Portuguese Synagogue, Jewish Museum, etc.If you don't like any of those options just wal calmly around the tenths of canals and relax.Visiting the sorrounding rural areas is also a must.

Stroll through the neighbourhood. We wanted to see a bit of Amsterdam outside the canal ring so we took a walk in this neighbourhood. It was short, but we saw a bit and it just looked like a quieter version of everything we had seen before.

Real Amsterdam. The Jordaan neighborhood was the perfect place to wander around and take in the scenic canals, homes that used to be old warehouse buildings, houseboats, and restaurants! It's also close to Anna Frank's museum, which is a must. Next time we visit we will make sure they stay around here.

Learned much about Van Gogh. Worth visiting while in Amsterdam. We purchased the headset tour and it was enjoyable to listen and learn about Van Gogh at our speed. Get to the museum early and buy your tickets on-line for a no-wait entrance.

Nice area to stay while visiting Amsterdam.. We enjoyed staying in this neighborhood. We felt safe and it was convenient
to the Ann Frank house which my wife really wanted to see. Nice neighborhood
with lots of good places to eat, but not too busy or noisy.

Great place to join the locals. The street is nice, full of pubs and restaurants. tourists go there, but there is a good chance of meeting with the locals who are very friendly. When in Amsterdam, go there during the night, it is usually crowded and lively

Breathtaking. Jordann is beautiful. We stayed a couple of streets away from Jordan and had a fantastic time seeing all the shops, bars, restaurants and beautiful canals. The houses and everything is gergeous. It's a must. We rented bikes which made it even more fun. Either way you must visit.
.jordaan area. lovely part of Amsterdam...easy walking distance to everything but out of the touristy area. Great shopping, dining, stay on one of the canals.

Breathtaking!. Words cannot describe how picturesque this part of the city is! Truly beautiful and colorful, full of beautiful houses, bridges over canals and extremely cute cafés and restaurants. Don't miss it!

With us in the Jordaan......... Starting sentence of a popular folk song on the Jordanese people. Started out a a neighborhood for services outside the canals, where the lesser well-to-do lived in small houses, that followed the original "sloten" small water channels between patches of land to keep it dry). The canals were dug to supply extra and cheap transport means to the warehouses of the wealthy traders. The houses were small and had wooden stairs instead of the more costly stone stairs. The (smaller) canals running through the neighborhood were also seen as less attractive then the more "main" channels: Singel,Heren- ,Keizers- en Prinsengracht. It grew into a neighborhood for the lowest classes, in the 20/30's of the last century. Riots like Palingoproer (Ealriot) demanded 26 dead. Then Potatoe-riot en Jordaarriot also caused casualties in the dirt poor neighborhood. In the seventies lots of the original inhabitants moved to suburbs like Almere. Their houses were renovated and their place taken by Young Urban Professionals. Now the prices of real estate are sky high and housing is difficult to come by in this part of town, right in the centre.

Journey back in time. When you consider the history of Amsterdam and the Jordaan then it is really interesting. Especially when you compare this area with the Herengracht and the different communities that lived in each.

Nicest part of Amsterdam. The Jordaan is a former working class area, which now holds the best restaurants. It is a place to walk around for hoursand stop every once in a while for drinks, pie or food.

Authentic Amsterdam - Great Area to visit!. This feels like the authentic Amsterdam. Beautiful canals, old warehouse buildings - turned into homes, houseboats along the canals, cool cafe's and restaurants! Also in this area is the original HQ for the East India Trading Company.
Nice area. Seems nice day or night. Plenty of dining, shopping and drinking opportunities. Scenic canals. Good waliking. Convenient to attractions.
Best neighborhood in Amsterdam. Jordaan is definitely one of the best neighborhood in Amsterdam. Walking there, you feel like breathing the true soul of the city.
Cute and quaint part of town. Cool and trendy part of town to walk around and do some shopping, cute cafes and coffeeshops, our favourite coffeeshop was Dampkring.

Our favourite part of Amsterdam. We spent hours walking the beautiful streets here....a cafe or gallery on every corner.
Much quieter and tourist free area of Amsterdam...our kind of place!
Very quaint and pretty.

Nice place to walk. This area it's charming and beautiful. It's just perfect for a nice walk. It was raining when we visit Amsterdam but still we did enjoy the neighborhood. It's close to Anna Frank's museum so you can combine this two activities together
maybe the nicest district of Amsterdam. don't miss out getting lost in this amazing district... full of cozy bars and restaurants. Amsterdam without Jordaan would be less cool :)
Amsterdam by bicicle. You discover Amsterdam better if you take make your trip around center by bicicle.Jordaan is one of the old part in town, nice cafes, small galleries, cosy corners
Lovely area. Lovely area with bars and restaurants. Great atmosphere and beautiful canals. Little antique shops worth wandering around
Amazing!!!. For me this was one of the best neighbours in Amsterdam, everything amazed me, the houses, the canals, the small houses if find around here. I just loved it!
Great area to walk around. We enjoyed walking around this area including the visit to the housing around a courtyard in Nieuwe Leliestraat. The houses are charming and the walk was well worth it.

If you like shopping and cafes - you'll probably like Jordaan. If you like quirky shops for window shopping and actual shopping, exploring cafes, and browsing some of the Bohemian shops, this is the place for you. I also found that it is probably to get souvenirs here than the tourist traps. Great to walk around and explore but watch the bicycles. This would be a great visit after a trip to Anne Frank Huis, as it is nearby.
Lovely area. Beautiful area to walk through. Lots of sight seeing to do. Keep your eyes open for bicycles and motorcycles and trams and cars.......
Great place to stay or visit.. We stayed in the Jordaan. We enjoyed the abundance of restaurants and little bars near by. Easy walk to get to the trams. Quaint, beautiful neighborhoods.

Everything closes early, beware!. Very local but very sleepy. Everything closed early. Also, when you see people on the streets they will make eye contact with you, I would usually smile, say hi, or nod in acknowledgement. They would just stare blankly and move along... cultural differences!

Cool, Artsy atmosphere. Lots of small, cool little businesses and even some pop-up stores. This is one of the older and now trendier parts of Amsterdam. Very close to everything - a good area to visit

DINK paradise. This oId former slum, workers area, then Jewish area is now the haunt of DINKs(double income no kids). It's trendy, expensive and an interesting place for a walk, not Dar from Anne Frank house and some great canal houses to look at longingly.

Good place to stay if you want peace and quiet.. We rented an apartment in the area for the weekend. It was a perfect location - close to major attractions and very quiet. From our second story window, we were able to watch boats go by on the canal. The picturesque narrow streets were easy to maneuvre unless you had luggage.
