The bicycle traffic was very busy and as a pedestrian, one needed to be very careful crossing the street. There is no need to make a special visit to this area if you have limited time in Amsterdam. Good place to stay if you want peace and quiet.
quite place. Jordaan is a very nice and quite place far from the so much expensive and very populated touristic area
A must-see. Typical place in Amsterdam, a must-see for all the tourists.Be careful with all the bikes and the narrow streets !

Not On My Go To List. Just a regular overpriced market with big crowds buying junk and highly priced produce/found. There are much nicer places to go that are less crowded and provide a better experience.

the place to see, if u wanna see the real Amsterdam. if u wanna feel the real Amsterdam, come here for a cozy walk and fabulous architecture....full with cozy bars, restaurants, the saturday market next to Noorderkerk, I love this quarter!
Super cute with all the canals. Lots of great shopping and bars and restaurants. All surrounded by several canals. Make for great picture options. My favorite neighborhood of Amsterdam!
we stayed here. Very pretty neighborhood with great restaurants. Anne Frank is very near and an absolute must. I can't think of any cons I would stay here again in a heartbeat

Best neighborhood I visited!. Such a cool neighborhood on the western side of Amsterdam, really great shopping and restaurants. Come during the day to shop and stay in the evening for the nightlife :)
Picturesque. This is how I pictured Amsterdam - beautiful. Some v quaint shops and restaurants - lovely to walk around

Unique houses next to the canals - picturesque!. Most beautiful walk in the town. Every bridge is decorated with real flowers. If you go out early morning, you ll see the local municipality watering these plants. That's how much they care about plants and keep their city clean and beautiful. You can also rent a bicycle but we preferred walking as I end up clicking a million pictures at leisure. Every building is unique in itself with canal next to them. This is what makes Amsterdam distinguish from other cities. Make sure you see these streets at least once. You ll come back to see them again on your own, am pretty sure! ;)

Loved the neighborhood. We stayed in an apartment in the Jordaan and it was delightful. It was a lovely neighborhood, not overrun by tourists and gave us a true sense of the local community. It is easy walking distance to everywhere and has everything one might need.

good to walk around this district. We spent a few hours just walking around and looking at the buildings and canals and people. There are lots of places to eat or sit and have a drink. There are also the other activites to observe if you are looking for these which we stumbled across but werent specifically looking for. There is a lack of paid public toilets in this area and around amsterdam in general and so we always go to a cafe for a coffee where they have a toioet or make sure you use them if you oay for a attraction.

Amazing place in Amsterdam. Lovely hood in Amsterdam. If I could choose some place to live, this place would be in Jordan District. Beautiful buildings, great markets, shops, restaurants, everything you find here.

Beautiful walking day.. Beautiful area, great for rubber-necking and walking. We love the architecture in these old cities and this city doesn't disappoint. Good lunch at a cafe - sandwich and coffee - can't remember the name, sorry. Cafes are a dime a dozen all over.

Great Place to visit.. The Jordaan is a great place to visit or stay at. Loads of shops and excellent food. Loads of people walking and shopping. Some places are truly Amsterdam, other parts extremely modern shops. The entire area shrieks AMSTERDAM.

Good for a quiet stroll. After the hustle and bustle of the Centre it's a great area to unwind. You can easily imagine living in one of the multi story town houses, sitting on a small canal. Don't miss the Shadow Wall (De Schaduwkade) along Nieuwe Keizersgracht. which is close by. It highlights WW2 residents forced out of their lovely homes and where they ended up.

Shoppers Paradise?. Love the Jordaan! A gorgeous neighborhood. The markets are fun but mostly local produce. The shopping, however, was fantastic, particualrly the nine streets. Lots of small boutiques with great merchandise. Cafes were also plentiful and quite good.
Trendy area with good shops and restaurants. The Jordaan is a pretty area with lots of shops and restaurants. We enjoyed walking through, alongside the canals and had great apple pie in Winkel 43.

Something out of a Fairytale. I LOVE LOVE LOVE The Jordaan. Its just so so pretty. Opening the apartment windows in an Autumn morning to the crisp fresh air, hearing almost nothing through the quiet picturesque streets. My favourite thing to do was to find a very nice bar, make sure there was outside seating and just sit back, admire the wonderful views, people watch and have a beer with my very dear loved one and agreeing this is the most beautiful place in Amsterdam. I could most certainly live here.

Great Area to Enjoy Old Amsterdam. We were lucky that we could wander around the Jordan Area when it was sunny and warm. The outside terraces on the canals are very cute and typical Amsterdam. We walked from one cafe to another having drinks and watching the people, mostly tourists, and boats on the canals. I highly recommend visiting the Jordan to see what a typical residential area looks like.
Best area to visit. Great small restaurants, shopping, wonderful for just walking. Very pretty!Would like to stay here next visit. Great area to just hang out.
cosmopolitan. A really lovely area to walk around, especially on a dry day. Quiet area away from the city center. Maybe 1-2 hrs.

Lovely area to walk . Lost a couple of hours wandering round the streets and canals.
Beautiful houses and architecture. Interesting shops and people.
A place lo loose yourself in. It is a fun area full of little shops, small restaurants and cafes. Nice place to spend an afternoon and finish with dinner when in Amsterdam

Far preferable to the crowded, commercialised cental area. We were fortunate to have stayed in a houseboat on Princengracht, right og the edge of the Jordaan area. Just a few steps away was Princenstraat - an attractive road with cafes, small shops and restaurants. And on the other side of the canal, Jordaan proper with a couple of the quieter and very attractive canals - Bloemgracht and Egelantiersgracht with nice cafes and restaurants to be found close by.The comparison with the central area (Dam Square and surrounding streets is amazing. THIS is the proper Amsterdam. It should not be missed. After a visit to the Anne Frank House, cross the Princengracht canal and head off into the side streets.It will be worth the walk.
Grab a little tranquility.... The Jordaan is an area in Amsterdam which is tranquil and away from the rest of the City's bustle. It's arty and chic and a great place to mooch around.

Historic, Tranquil and Interesting. Loved every moment of staying here-it is simply the best. If you want the local scene and not the tourist hype...This is the place to stay or at least visit...so many sights to see and canals from almost every street!
Beautiful Jordaan. Great area. So picturesque and lots of cute little stores to explore. Great furniture stores too! Love this area cause it's also very close to everything.

Beautiful area. Jordaan is a great neighborhood in Amsterday. Very nice typical cafes, bars and restaurants. A visit to Amsterdam is not complete wthout visiting Jordaan and its nice canals and little streets. Perfect for a nice stroll.

A real experience of Amsterdam. We rented an apartment in Jordaan for one week and enjoyed living and shopping among local people going about their everyday life. The area is located close to the centre of Amsterdam yet a world away from the tourist ethos. Yes, visit the main city sights but make time to wander the streets, cafes and restaurants and encounter one to one Dutch people. We are so appreciative of them and the opportunities. Not to be missed.
nice place to visit in a sunny afternoon. small streets and nice neighborhood; lots of old houses and chic restaurants; nice place to visit in a sunny afternoon

Charming and picturesque . Lovely district in Amsterdam. Very charming and laid back compared to the other parts of the city. Quite quiet comparatively, and many interesting restaurants and smaller museums, such as the cheese museum! Enjoy red wine and cheese, then take a stroll along the canals without having to shoulder check your way through crowds of your fellow travellers. A must see!

Great neighborhood!. I stayed at the Linden Hotel in the Jordaan for a couple of nights and spent most of my days wandering around the shops, cafes, and restaurants in the Joordan and Haarlem. Very cool, young vibe, notwithstanding the obvious touristy character, and tons of good food. I wish I had stayed longer!

Good central area with lots to see and do!. We stayed in this area of the city. There are lots of things to do and see, including various museums, parks and restaurants. It is a very walkable area, as long as you keep an eye out for the bicyclists!
Just over a canal from crowded sidewalks and admission lines. Jordaan was a great area to walk through, relax, eat well .... a respite before engaging with the busier wonders of Amsterdam.
Wonderful suburb. Very quiet and beautiful suburb. We stayed at an apartment there in Dec'14. Several supermarkets all around and flee market as well. You can also haver lunch or dinner in pubs.
One of the best areas in Amsterdam. Take a walk through the 9 streets and the cool shops. Have a coffee and people watch. Mind the bikes, it's a busy area. Plenty to see and do...
Very trendy area with excellent restaurants.. Cornerstoned by the Market and the West Cathedral, this area has excellent local restaurants, and a very Dutch, and intimate, feeling.

So much shopping and food. . The Jordaan is a great area of Amsterdam there are so many quirky bars and cafes. Plenty of shops that have more unique items than the usual shops you find everywhere. Saturday markets are worth wandering around. Apparently the Jordaan people are a little unique and the random festival celebrating the area we happened to stumble upon was highly entertaining to see.

Really nice neighbourhood. We spent quite a bit of time in The Jordaan area because it was so nice and relaxed, away from the crowds. There were a bunch of great restaurants right on the canal so you could watch the boats go by.

Rembrandt Lived Here. Nice area to walk that isn't as touristy. We had planned to eat dinner at the popular Moeder's one night only to find it booked so we strolled a bit longer and ended up at Murujab (Indian Restaurant). Great meal with a very kind and informative owner who kept mentioning Rembrandt. My husband and I didn't understand what he meant exactly until he took us outside on the sidewalk afterwards, pointed upwards and there was a round historical marker on the building noting that Rembrandt had lived in the building at one time (what is now the restaurant was the building's lobby). Traditional food and historical find.
Worth a walk around. Quiet, non touristy area of the city, some nice cafe's and of course canals, worth a stroll through.

Beautiful area. Definitely recommend booking accommodation in this area as you are still not too far from the centre and yet it feels like proper Amsterdam
Lots of Dutch accents and lovely to walk around

An historical gem. We stayed in this area for 2 weeks. The labyrinth of narrow cobbled streets, lined with tall skinny buildings, many from the mid-1600's , creates a charming location. Canal-side cafes, bridges, bikes and waterways .. just picture-perfect Ansterdam

Neighborhood feeling. We stayed here at a houseboat, great experience. This is a great neighborhood to stay at if you want to see a more real Amsterdam. Much quieter than the northern area, great picturesque spots to sit and watch the canals, people, etc. It is not far from the main attractions, only 20-30 minutes walking to the Central Station. There are plenty of little shops, cafes and bars with tables outside (we went during the spring), convenience stores, art shops, etc.

a charming neighborhood.... Beautiful, quiet, historical & charming. Great way to spend the day wandering (or getting lost) or find a cafe & watch the world go by. Lots of different shops, cafes/restaurants, bookshops, bars & studios. Not to be missed when in Amsterdam.

Beautiful neighborhood. We stayed in this neighborhood during our trip back in April. It is beautiful and very nice to walk along the canals. Only comment I would make is that is further away from the center and the attractions. If you don't want to walk/bike/taxi to everything then its better to visit, not stay here. However, if you prefer a peaceful setting as opposed to a city center, then this is a great place to be!
Among the best canals in amsterdam. Best to visit in the morning light on a sunny day, beautiful colors and shooting spots for your camera.

Unideal prices and times . We felt like Jordaan may be preferable to the more touristy locations of the city, to access more local dishes and where the people of Amsterdam actually eat. However many restaurants in this area we found to be over priced eg £16 main and most shut by 10, so be careful if you want to eat here, to go earlier!

Trendy, off centre district. Lovely, relaxed district just away from the centre (15 minutes walk from Centraal Station) with loads of bars, restaurants, shops and smaller canals and streets. I I lived in Amsterdam, it would be here.

A walk back in history. The Jordan is a picturesque area trapped in time. The cobbled streets, laneways and wonderful old houses on the canals transports you back in time. We were lucky to find a great guesthouse in the area and loved the ease of access to all the attractions. We could walk to dam square and the red light district in 15 to 20 minutes. It was wonderful.

Make sure to take a walk in Jordaan area while in Amsterdam. You need to take a walk in this area of the city; you will enjoy window shopping if not shopping (since many stores are quite up-scale) and will also enjoy hopping in the diverse selection of cafe's and restaurants!
The neighbourhood is a must visit. One of most charming neighbourhoods of this lovely city. Pretty streets, quiet lanes, old houses, little studios. You will fall in love.
Hip, fab, and classic Amsterdam!. The Jordaan area of Amsterdam is a quaint, relatively quiet, and picturesque location. I always visit when I go to Amsterdam! It has it's way of drawing you in!

Experience this Unique Neighborhood.. We were so lucky to be able to stay in this neighborhood at the Toren Hotel and experience the uniqueness that it displays about Amsterdam. What a beautiful neighborhood, to walk, to see from the canals, to dine in, to shop, and to sleep in. I hope I can come back and see more.

I loved walking in this area!. The Jordaan is beautiful. It really is.I found we did end up here most days at some point, as we just loved walking the narrow streets and browsing the little shops - most are small independent stores and full of lovely wares. It did get very busy by the afternoon, but dipping into the more narrow streets did help avoid some of the crowds.I loved the Saturday morning markets in the Jordaan, we made it to two and we happily spent a few hours chatting to locals who were doing their shopping and buying some rather yummy foods and teas! There are some great restaurants, pubs and tea shops in the area too... love it! Just go, allow yourself to do as the locals do and you'll understand why most people rave about it!

Great to visit. I went here for a food tour and it was great. It is one of the oldest neighborhoods in Amsterdam. This area was for blue color workers, everyone with a skill learned it form their fathers and grandfathers. You can still see in front of the houses a fish symbol for fishermen, or a cow for butchers and so on.... you get the idea.

True Amsterdam. This area is my favourite. You can see how the locals live. Sipping a tea/coffee/wine outside of their houses on the street and chatting. How nice is that!You will find here lots of canals, bridges, cafes, restaurant, shops selling original pieces. Go and feel the spirit!
One of the coolest areas in Amsterdam. One of my favorite areas in Amsterdam. Small cafes and shops in a local and charming setting.Step away from the Dam and enjoy this unique neighborhood.

Quaint Restaurants Top End Boutiques plus Exclusive Antique Shops and Art Galleries. The 9 Streets Intertwined together plan a whole day starting with breakfast Preamble through the various treasure trove of Exclusive top fashion Boutiques then have Lunch and enjoy he afternoon visiting the Art Galleries and Antique Shops Then end up with a Borral in a Wine Bar or a Cosy Pub Phew amazing Day we had XXX
Our Favorite Area of Amsterdam. Our favorite area of Amsterdam.. Still a lot of "action" yet not the masses of people. Very good shopping area for real gifts. I like the "neighborhood" vibe.

Great neighborhood to explore . Don't miss the opportunity to dine and shop with the locals in this western suburb of Amsterdam simply by crossing the Prinsengracht canal. Easy to find and lose an afternoon in, the Jordaan is a must see for a look at the real Amsterdam
Fabulous neighbourhood. Really interesting neighbourhood with a great variety of shops, bars & restaurants. Easy to get lost - which is great!

It is almost a complete contrast of the old center of Amsterdam. The Jordaan neighborhood shows a different side of Amsterdam. It is charming, tranquil and romantic side of town. Much much! less crowded than the old center area of Amsterdam. With narrow streets and canals, the neighborhood is doted with restaurants and small shops.
In one way, it is acomplete contrast of the Old center of Amsterdam.
nice area. just to walk around the small pittoresque streets with markets and restaurants and cafees is very nice.

Feeling of Amsterdam. Jordaan is how I had always imagined Amsterdam before visiting it. Lot of cafes and nice outdoor sitting areas, narrow streets with a lot of character, small grocery shops... Monday could be a good day to visit as there is an outdoor market (Westerstraat Market).
GO. We gravitated here everyday for good food and great atmosphere. Beautiful neighbourhood, great restaurants, good shopping.

Perfect for a stroll. Lovely neighborhood, as you've surely heard. I made a point to seek it out, and it was beautiful. However, if you've been to other areas of Amsterdam that are not on the tourist circuit, it's not a whole lot different. Still beautiful, but it's not something that you happen across and think "oh my god!"
Away from the tourists . Residential area away from all the tourists, narrow streets, alleyways and of course canals. Much quieter that the main tourist areas.

Canals and more!. We took a walking tour through the Jordaan and loved it. This old working-class area of Amsterdam has been gentrified, and it's a wonderful place to stroll and soak up the city, surrounded by history and architecture.

Don't visit Amsterdam without a visit to the Jordaan district.. I have the added bonus of having lived in this neighbourhood some years ago on a work assignment. I recently went back on a visit which was all too brief to enjoy this lovely relaxed neighbourhood of Amsterdam. Having said that, it can be quite a busy place during the day, with various local markets on different days of the week. However, for me it's at night when the Jordaan appeals the most. Peppered with an assortment of simple local to very nice dining restaurants and bars. Try it, and have your own adventure. I'll be back again, and again.

Vibrant neighbourhood. A vibrant area of Amsterdam full of surprises, with great bars and restaurants on almost every corner. Stroll the canals, soak up the atmosphere, and find somewhere to sit back and relax in true Amsterdam style.
A nice walkaround. A similar feeling to rest of central Amsterdam (to me), the Jordaan Area is a nice area to walkaround for an hour.

Charming Jordaan. An area of narrow streets filled with quirky shops selling antiques, vintage clothing, trendy interior accessories and more. Some great bars to choose from for a more relaxed side to Amsterdam night life away from the tourist crowds.
Walk and chill.. Lovely, interesting, quiet, mostly residential neighborhood beside our Hotel Ambassade. It is great for walking amongst the old houses along beautiful canals.

you have to visit. great area of small lanes and side streets,lots of different small shops and coffee houses,walk along the canals and pop in for a coffee stroll along and take a peek into the antique shops and the designer shops great for a relaxing stroll.

Relaxed and charming 'Old Amsterdam' feel. This is a great area of the city to have a stroll around. It has numerous art and antique shops, intertwined with cafes and restaurants. It is not as busy as a lot of the more established sight seeing areas.
Nice place. As another reviewer said there is not enough time in a weekend to do everything in this area as there is plenty of shops, café, restaurants and does get very busy.
Nice place to stroll. Many places to Eat, cosy streets, lots of bookshops, a marked of books and illustration work, small exciting shop and boutiqes. Interessting part of the City.
This area is peaceful and fun to wander through. We walked and cycled through this area, and would love to have more time to wander around. Clean and safe to be in.

Amsterdam and something else. Tbe only reason why not moving here is sheer lack of cash or laziness. For any town-dweller who seeks to be living in a metropolis while needing some pace and inspiring atmosphere, the Jordaan is the ultimate locality to reside in.
Still, an average red-light-and-beer-seeking briton may wonder what there is to seehere... well... you decide for yourself...

Not enough time to see the full beauty of this area. Only here for a weekend. This area needs the whole weekend to see just this area.
Definitely coming back just for this area
Busy area in Amsterdam. Very interesting area. We really enjoyed looking at all the structures. One suggestion, don't go on a weekend. The place was extremely crowded.

Plenty to see and do. For those looking for something different from the mainstream shopping stores and dining places, Jordaan has lots to offer. Specialty shops, galleries, boutiques. Lots of "coffee shops", so read the signs carefully before going in to order your java. Don't miss the market on Saturday, plenty of dutch delicacies and cheeses, perfect to pick up items for a picnic. Set up your picnic on the edge of one of the canals and enjoy people and boat watching. Ann Frank House is located here which is a popular tourist destination, unless you already have tickets, it is booked months in advance and by 9.30 am there is a line wrapping around the street with a 3 hour wait time. Definitely a must see and do neighborhood!
Beautiful city!. This part of the Amsterdam City is really beautiful. I recommend you to go there if you have some time to see the little stores and places to eat cheap.

A Less Touristy Area To Explore While In Amsterdam. A more relaxed, less touristy neighbourhood in Amsterdam for those that would like to explore, shop, eat and experience the city without all the crowds and tourist hype.
Beautiful stroll. Wish I lived here. Charming. The neighborhood has a nice mix of posh and casual places to eat/hangout drink shop.
Interesting quirky and unspoilt . This area in Amsterdam remains our favourite, independent retail and with bars and restaurants. Great for a casual stroll and meander. Full of character and stylish.

Stunning neighbourhood, very beautiful. Amsterdam is imminently walkable, cobblestone and pavement everywhere so wear good walking shoes. The Jordan is a beautiful neighbourhood that is probably everything you expect Amsterdam to be - canals, pretty houses, boats, and touristy bits mixed in with local. The bars the locals frequent tend to be very good.

A nice area to stay in. I was staying right next to Jordaan, so walked through the quaint streets to get to the supermarket and local shops. A very picturesque part of the city with many interesting cafes and bars.

love this part of amserdam. this is one of the best areas to wander around. love the canals and many many restaurants. we could get a quick coffee and pie or have a nice sit down meal with choices of italian, spanish, indian, thai....................
Nice place to walk and have a beer. We enjoyed sitting outside near the place with the musicians, having a beer and watching people walking and biking.
Cute and less crowded. Had a nice time walking around this neighborhood. Found a great place to eat (Boca's) and liked that it was not as crowded as Dam square and other places we walked through.

Among my favorite neighborhoods!. Lot going on in the Jordaan Neighborhood! Good restaurants and cafes in abundance. Sightseeing and people watching in abundance. Red light areas too! Don't try to take photos of the ladies, they don't like it and will throw water or other liquid at you. Sitting on the edge of the canal walls , eating lunch and watching the boats go by is a favorite pastime. Retail & souvenir shopping are throughout this area. Among the most affordable neighborhoods in Amsterdam if you want to live near canals. This area gives you a good feel for how the locals enjoy their city. Must see neighborhood!

Old area of amsterdam. Used to live in this area of Amsterdam. Love the canals, streets, little "hofjes" in unexpected places, the "gavels" or house fronts with their historic sculptures. Lots of great little restaurants, bars, shops, but also explore the less busy streets.
Beautiful area in Amsterdam. Beautiful quieter area with lots of upmarket boutiques and cafes. Nice place to walk around and escape the busier areas.

For the NON-tourist tour. We downloaded a Rick Steves walking tour PodCast for the Jordaan and happened to have his pocket guide of Amsterdam, well worth preparing ahead -- buy the guide! (we did a second of his tours through the busy part of Amsterdam starting at Central Station). Was well done, great to move at our own pace, pause or stop the presentation when we wanted to look further or just take it all in. We stopped for a Gelato along the way, got some Dutch fries & mayo and to looked longer at some of the sights. Well worth the walk, nice to be away from the trams, cars, bikes for a bit. Worth it!

Cafe Letting. The area is straight out of a dream land... spent hours here wandering the bylanes complete with cafes and restaurants and art galleries.Of special note was Cafe Letting....the food, the people, the service...all make for an ideal brakfast venue.Dont miss the banana orange juice...quite a combination. Loved the tuna melt too.

The personification of charm!. We were staying on the edge of the Jordaan in the canal ring and found it a wonderful place to wander the many side streets and enjoy the ambiance. Many hidden treasures and I wish we had more time to explore. But then that's the reason to make a repeat trip!!
Avoid in the evening. Typical holiday thing of being harassed with "come eat here special offer just for you". We couldn't get past them quick enough
Great canal area with joyful eating. Historic buildings, canals, restaurants. Everything moving upscale. There's a fine market that's been going for hundreds of years.

Pleasant, agreeable, good restaurants, cozy.. Small streets, canals, beautiful old houses. A mixture of living, restaurants, terraces, shops, boutiques, all mixed in a pleasant way. The big 'trademarks' have not yet taken over the area - it's all still small scale. With some very nice, good, cozy restaurants. With a very agreeable atmosphere. Go there. Watch the people, see the shops and have a dinner in one of the many, many restaurants (local restaurants and almost any kind of dish you can think of).

Delightful community. This is the perfect area to be in if you don't want the hustle and bustle of some other areas in Amsterdam. Though there is still a lot going on (summertime), it is quieter and there are an abundance of wonderful (delicious) restaurants, extremely friendly local people. Restaurant recommendations: Vlaming, De Reiger, and for fun, the Pancake Bakery. There are MANY others, and you won't be at loss to find a bar - they are about every few feet. There are canal rides and hop-on/hop-off canal buses in the area and, of course the Anne Frank House/Museum. Jordaan is an around pleasant place to situate yourself and then venture out from. I don't think I would want to stay in any other area when I come back, as I had such a wonderful experience here.

Lovely. This neighborhood was our perfect introduction to Europe, the Netherlands, and Amsterdam. Easy to navigate, and safe to walk around. We stayed at the Hotel Toren in the Jordan. Made for the ideal resting/launching place.

Friendly folks and lots to see!. We walked around this area in the evening and discovered life as a none tourist - interesting shops, local pubs and diverse food options at all price points. If you're not sure where to go, please ask locals - very friendly, insightful & helpful folks.Oldest pub in Jordaan is Cafe Chris - go for beer, game of French billiards & chat with locals.
Lively, colourful. Lots to see, eat, photograph - so many shops, flea markets and eateries, proper grassroots Amsterdam, an essential visit if you stop in Amsterdam.
A pleasant detour. An area to discover. Full of creative people set in the closely connected streets and canals. Lots to delight the eye and you can see the local community.

People watching. Went here to sit and people watch and ended up buying my own weight in cheese to fly back as presents,Nice pale, felt very safe. Great photograph opportunities.Pleasant and worth a visit.
Nice on a Saturday. Lovely Saturday market. Lots of lovely fresh produce cakes fruit cheese bread flowers and general stalls. Lovely pretty area.
Walk and look.. My favourite part of Amsterdam both for restaurant and shops and just for walking and looking. Interesting houses, people and cafes make this an area where I would like to live.
Peace and serenity in Amsterdam. Get away from the hustle and bustle in Amsterdam and go for a wander through Jordaan, beautiful buildings, peace and quite and another side of this many sided city.

Beautiful stroll!. The Jordaan area is a beautiful area to stroll, great and unique shops and wonderful little coffee shops. There was plenty of parking in the area which also makes it easily accessible.
Quiet, pretty and local. It is very close to the biggest park in Amsterdam - Vondelpark. Surely worth to go if you have enough time.

Excellent base for Amsterdam visit. Stayed on a houseboat in this neighborhood. Canals laced with good food, drink, even a laundry. Connected by tram, bus, bike, and foot to Museum Quarter and Central Station.

One of the nicest and less touristy neighborhoods. Our accommodation plans fell through at the last minute and we could only find nice affordable places in the Jordaan area. The area as a lot of the sights you should see but also is home to a host of cute shops, cafes and bakeries and so on! I'd def recommend anyone staying me there. Great for families and in easy walking distance to other areas in downtown Amsterdam

Great Place To Walk. The Jordaan is a nice area within walking distance of the central part of Amsterdam, but is quieter and prettier. This is a good place for a long walk or a more focused shopping expedition.

Perhaps one of the most unique places in Amsterdam. Beautiful and scenic neighborhood in old Amsterdam with lots of quirky buildings and delicious restaurants. Great for a leisurely stroll to see how the locals live.

What is here again?. For being one of the top tourist attractions in Amsterdam, this was disappointing. We went on a Tuesday morning about 11am and it was deserted. No shopping or anything good to see. Would rather have spent more time walking around the canals. Not sure what all the fuss is about.

This is a lovely area to walk around. It is such a lovely area to walk around and admire the canals, houses, cafes etc. The tree lined canals make beautiful photographs too. We were lucky to have lovely weather which always makes everything look extra special.
Beautiful area, less touristy. I used Rick Steves' walking tour of Jordaan and loved it. The walk takes you by the highlights of the area and many charming canals and streets
Lovely. Lovely very cultural amazing architect , walking is the best way to capture Amsterdam in all it's glory

Quiet place to stay. Whenever I return to Amsterdam I fully intend on staying in this neighborhood again! It's central enough to easily walk where you need to go, but far enough from the center itself that it's very quiet and there aren't a lot of tourists around. We used airbnb to stay in a flat, and I am impatient to visit again!
Cute neighboorhood. We stayed in the Jordaan - lots of great restaurants, playgrounds, and this is where all of the cute "Amsterdam-looking" houses are. Very nice!
quiet and peaceful. Lovely neighborhood close to the city center. If you want a peace of quiet, lovely restaurants and nice house, don’t forget to visit Jordaan
Lovely walks and ambience. Lovely and interesting area, the buildings, history and surrounding canals. Nearby exquisite vi tage shopping.

Great neighbourhood. We stayed very close to Jordaan which was about a 20-25 minute walk into Dam Square depending on how well you can read a map once you're lost.
It is very quiet compared to Dam Square but holds a great deal of culture and beauty.
Very glad we stayed here.
Lovely area of amsterdam. Brilliant area to base yourself for a trip round Amsterdam. Walk the streets or sail th canals....fantastic little streets no gardens with great restaurants and cafes
Beautiful old buildings. This is a great walking tour. Just wander around and enjoy the buildings and shops. We were there on a Sunday morning so it was quiet.
Good for a Stroll. We found the area to be quiet and to have a more relaxed feel than the more central parts of the city. We enjoyed walking around and taking in some interesting shops.

Have to visit everytime in Amsterdam. The Joordan is propably one of the nicest areas in Amsterdam. I have to visit it everytime in Amsterdam. The cafes and bars are small and the service is always very friendly and helpful. There are also many small shops where You can buy some handcrafts. Worth visiting!

Cool local vibe, a must visit out of beaten path. Nice market near the church on saturday.
Don't miss the unique courtyard located on Karthuizerstraat.

Take time out to meander, sit and chill. Just a really lovely area to walk around. Lots of different and unusual little shops, cafes and bars. If you want to buy keep sakes, this is the area. Avoid the tacky souvenir shops close to the station and buy something more original that you wont regret when you go home.

It was fine.. You here a lot about the Jordaan when you're preparing to come to Amsterdam. Don't get me wrong - it's a very nice area, but compared to the canal belt that you walk through to get their it feels like a bit of a let down if you're expecting something special. First world problems, I guess - when the city you're on holidays in isn't always breathtaking.
Sit and chill.... If you want to leave the busyness behind, just sit and watch, have beer, have coffee, eat cheese and soak up every moment... A great place top be...

Not Special But Cool. This is a real nice looking part of Amsterdam, but it all sort of still looks the same. However it is very busy in a good way with a lot of things to do in the area. After snapping some pictures you could definitely hop into a fun Coffee Shop or pub. Also check out the Cheese Museum where you can sample free cheeses and then head down to the basement and learn about the history of cheese. Just don't get run over by a bike taking pictures of the Prinsengracht here!

Nice Place to Walk Around. Jordaan is a neighborhood that is a good place to walk around and take in the genuine Amsterdam experience. Make sure you do that during broad daylight, well before dusk. For non-natives, generally, it pays to be careful at night because some parts can get really seedy. This is important if you are traveling with young kids like we did.

The quieter side of Amsterdam. Better area for those looking to relax & get away from the bustle of central Amsterdam & the Green/Red zone. Small shops and cafes nestle in residential streets and the coffee shops in this part of town are far less about the drug-tourist trade than those around the canal corner.
What's the hype about?! . I went around that area throughly between 22.30 and midnight on a Friday evening. It was dead. Few coffeeshop. Few charming bars. Few normal bars...and that's all!

Eclectic atmosphere. An area to relax away from the crowds in The Dam, a bevy of good eating places, pubs and restaurants, very friendly vendors and excellent accommodation available on or near the Canals.

Great neighborhood. We stayed there during our visit to Amsterdam. Very beautiful area with lots of great places to eat! Lots of life around and the best place for apple pie. Good place for romantic walks along the canals.
Good for stroll and spending time. The area has lots to do with shops, restaurants, coffee shops, good views of canals.. Nice place to wander and spend sometime enjoying the surroundings.

Quirky area. Went searching for "The 9 Streets" in The Jordaan and we think we were there. There were no signposts and are map was very basic but we did find lots of galleries, cafes and boutique shops. Wherever we were, we enjoyed our meandering and loved being out of the main drag full of the same shops and fast food places.If you've seen all the " must-do's" in Amsterdam, it's worth exploring!

Quaint, Pretty Area With Lots of Interesting Shops & Cafes.. A hip fun and pretty area with lots of interesting shops. Anne Frank's house is here and so is the Westmarkt Church. It's close to central Amsterdam, so quite a pretty walk to get here. The closest comparison would be to West Greenwich Village. Don't miss it!
A great stroll year round. great residential 'garden' district that's picture perfect in all seasons. There are also nice high end shops and boutiques, bakeries, etc.

Quaint little neighborhood. Jordaan is a lovely, quaint neighborhood for you to walk around especially when you have some extra time in the city (and you're not in a hurry). Charming buildings and streets, cozy cafés, it's all there! Recommended.

Quaint area to walk. A very pleasant area to walk around. The restaurants range from reasonable to expensive. Walk along a canal, stop in the wonderful little specialty shops such as cheese store, bakery, butcher, handicrafts and much more. We found the residents and shopkeepers to be very friendly.
The Jordaan. Amazing area just to wonder around and take in. Plenty of places to visit or just sit and take in the area.
MUST visit. A great place for photos, food and drinks. Walk or cycle around it. Tons of atmosphere to soak in. Safe and many quirky shops for souvenirs.

Where we stayed and played.. We stayed on Rozengracht street, super close to the tram stop. We ate at a bunch of the local restaurants. The shopping district of Nine street was 100m up the road which was perfect. And of course the canals are beautiful!
Lose yourself in the Jordaan. Every single street was unique but still fit perfectly to the neighbourhood as a whole. The most beautiful part of the city.
Lovely area top visit. Great place to visit. Lots of nice bars and places to eat- good photo opportunities. Nice canal bars to sit outside

Quick visit. Went here for dinner at the Vlaming, and its already kinda late, so we dont really have lotsa time to explore, but overall the surroundings was really nice, laid back with not that many tourists.
Nice neighbourhood. To go and come back again! Cafés, restaurants, gardens and nice views over the river! Excellent place to chill out :)

Nice Neighborhood. This is a beautiful neighborhood in Amsterdam.Again, this is very walkable except for bicycles everywhere and they seem to own the roads and sidewalks. They seem to not respect anyone else - even each other. Yet someone pointed out to me that they are just efficient and they actually follow traffic rules.
Hiking the Jordaan. Best neighborhood to walk around. Baskets of hanging flowers everywhere and small coffee houses and small restaurants with tons of atmosphere on every street.

Jordan Amsterdam . This peaceful district with it's small Cafe and restaurants and the narrow canals inspired you of a relaxing vacation and your free time.
Both day and night are great time for relaxation.
Go there
So Beautiful. Walked the streets in awe of the beautiful surroundings. Very safe and so peaceful.quirky shops a plenty!
Gorgeous!. Amazing area with superb streets! You can walk, shop, enjoy culinary experiences without getting bored any moment!

Totally in love . This is such a beautiful area. Still central but residential. Loved having a good nose around. There are some lovely local coffee shops, vintage clothing stores and traditional Dutch grocers. I can definitely see myself spending a lot more time here.

Don't miss this area of the city!. Allow at least 2 hours to wander around this delightful, charming and quaint area of Amsterdam.
It is criss-crossed by many canals and there is beautiful architecture every few metres. Lots of interesting shops, bars, cafes and, at its southern end, places like Anne Frank's House, the Tulip Museum and the Cheese Museum (definitely worth popping in).
Lovely stroll & plenty to see & do. Love this area. The market on Monday morning on Westerstraat is a must, as well as the famous apple pie shop Winkel at the end of this street.

Nothing special to see. I read the reviews and it sounded like an interesting area to visit. We did so and were disappointed. There was nothing special to see.. We moved on much sooner than we expected to see other parts of Amsterdam which were more interesting. Its great place for roaming and see the real city and doing nothing
Nice area. This area is a nice neoghbourhood. It's worth to visit as well as Amsterdam. I recomment ice creams and the typical beer.

It is the heart of Amsterdam. We stayed in the Jordaan area. It is the essence of Amsterdam with the canals and houses with the unique gables. Calm and peaceful walking from bridge to bridge to cross the canals. But watch out for the bikers everywhere in Amsterdam! They have the right of way in all situations. Although our taxi driver warned us we were not prepared. The outdooor restaurants and shops are plentiful. There are also several options for canal cruises from this area.

Nice neighborhood with lots of restaurants. This is a great place to go for dinner some night. Lots of restaurants that are patronized by locals; lots of streets to walk along to absorb the atmosphere of Amsterdam away from all the tourists. Easy to combine with a visit to the Anne Frank House.

Best neightborough in the city. The ancient city is all very nice, with its canals and special buildings. But the Jordan quarter is truly a gem to visit in this city.Stroll along the canals and savour the atmosphere that emanates. You can leave from central station to enter Jordan and walk to Dam square
No big deal for me. Nice residential neighborhood. This was recommended to us as a place to visit. But maybe we missed something? I just couldn't see what the big deal was to walk here.

Great place to shop, amble and watch the world go by.. A wonderful area to shop for vintage and other non tourist items. Quieter than the hustle and bustle of the main central shopping areas, nicer quality of goods and friendly cafes and people. PLus you are never far from a walk along the beautiful canals.
Jordaan district. Where I spent most of my time, walking around, window shopping, and city exploring. A very good district and friendly people with good places to eat

normal peaceful community. maybe because everyone praises this place so i got my expectations too high. The streets were full of litter by noon and the canals bridges did not hang any flowers to decorate it. The area near waterlooplein is much prettier
Amsterdam's West Village. Great neighborhood - felt like the West Village in Manhattan - good shopping - good food - beautiful architecture.

Walk around Jordaan. It's a quiet and peaceful neighborhood to walk around in after the hustle and bustle of the central part of the city (by museums and shopping district). We stopped at an ice parlor for a cone and sat on a bench on the sidewalk for a little r&r. People walking by said hello. Some of the homes had the windows and doors open and allowed us to see how the locals live. We also found pockets of blocks with cute shops and restaurants too. We ended up at Prego for a little appy champaign before our dinner reservatio. It was a very nice pleasant experience
Nice part of Amsterdam. A nice neighborhood in Amsterdam that is perfect to stroll around. Full of cute little streets and shops. Very pretty.

Charming neighborhood for eating, shopping, walking. We spent a delightful evening walking the streets of this area. Twice we ate in the neighborhood and the food was always wonderful. It's lively at night, with more than one place offering beer tastings. Always on view are the canals, old well-preserved buildings, and interesting shop windows. I only wish the shops were open later for browsing and impulse purchases.

Great area to stay or walk. I wish we had stayed in the Jordaan area. This was a beautiful part of Amsterdam. It was away, but not too far, from the hustle and bustle of the center of the city. The streets and canals were clean and quiet. The shops and restaurants were many. There were many interesting attractions in the area too.

A Real Amsterdam. The name of the neighborhood Jordaan leads you from the French Jardin = garden. And the name says it all. Although the planted pieces are small, yet adorned every home with something Flowering. I saw houses that were covered up in 3m height of blooming passion flower (have me worried at the flower market equal to a bag of seeds). What is striking also, is that the area much cleaner and quieter than the city center. Here also quite charming shops have settled, in which one the fashion of young designers (which are not yet known) can buy. They are all hand-sewn unique at affordable prices. Partly mistaken Fummel !!! Also gastronomically, the district has to offer.
a nice spot to roam in. A very Nice part of the old town, With Nice aritecture a the completeness of the trafic on land and the canals

The Bells of Westerkerk. Beneath the bells of the Westerkerk, which chime every 15 minutes, the Jordaan is teeming with small shops, wonderful restaurants and various nooks and crannies to explore, as a couple, family or with friends. We stayed int the Jordaan for a long weekend and my teen daughters identified with the same pealing church bells that Anne Frank enjoyed during her WWII hiding. The Jordaan offers homey pubs, neighborhood grocers, cheese and wine shops, a few chocolatiers, and gift shops galore, all straddling the Prinsengracht canal and not too far from the madding crowd!

Where Dutch people go in Amsterdam. Full of Great food and shopping, I was told this is where people in Amsterdam go. You notice that most of the food menus start appearing in Dutch but don't worry, everyone seems to speak English.

The hidden gem where most of the locals hang. Loved this area and definitely the place I look to stay whenever I visit. Laid back, quieter and free from stag and hen parties! If you want to feel more like a local than a tourist this is the spot.

A jewel . The center of Amsterdam is like a jewel case . One of the jewels is Jordaan. It used to be the Jewish neighborhood. Now it is a very nice area to explore. There are a lot of interesting choices for food and drink nearby .

Real Amsterdam.. De Jordaan is the Real Amsterdam , wonderful area to walk , eat , have a Beer , and just Chill . Still has the old merged with the new and is always the Amsterdam of plesant surprises . Away from the Tourist madness you can really enjoy Old Amsterdam .
unique spot in Amsterdam. Very unique to wanter around the seven little streets in th heart of the Jordaan, with all the tiny shops

Colorful district in Amsterdam. The Jordaan, is the he most colorful folk district in Amsterdam. I could not figure out the name,but after doing some research, and seeing the states of the musicians, I figured it out. There were 5 statues in total, and one of them was of Jimmy Jordaan. I guess,he was one of the most prominent ones.There is also an annual music festival,the "Jordaan Festival" is organised annually here.
Great foodie area. I went on a foodie tour of this area. We visited disperse areas in the region and sampled different Dutch food.

More traditonal.. It's very pretty here, more like what you expect Amsterdam to look like. Less popular with boozy revellers (thankfully). A smattering of restaurants and bijou shops will keep you out of pocket, the canals and traditional architecture will keep you snap happy. Waste a few hours here soaking up the atmosphere.

Wonderful Area of Amsterdam!. During our recent stay in Amsterdam, my wife and I stayed on a houseboat very close to The Jordaan, and we spent much of our time in that part of Amsterdam. While the Red Light District is just embarrassing, and the Rijksmuseum and Heineken "Experience" are a bit of walk (and touristy), The Jordaan area offered wonderful shops, restaurants, and bars, that just seem "classier" (and normal) than some other parts of the city. In a city with so much to do and see, The Jordaan served as a pleasant and relaxing alternative to many of the other parts of town!

Amsterdam's Brooklyn. I got talking to an expat and he described this as Amsterdam's Brooklyn. It's gotten real hip and trendy lately and it's a really cool place to hang out. We went to some really awesome cafes (not coffee shops!). It has a really unique atmosphere.
Charming District. Superb area for walking and seeing the canals, old bridges and old buildings. It is a very picturesque and quiet district.

Beautiful. Jordaan is a beautiful area in Amsterdam right outside what is defined the center of the city. This area is very nice quite and romantic. Walking by the small streets, with the typical houses and the channels is very relaxing and fascinating. There are also lot of small shops where is possible to find nice souvenirs and items of every kind, from jewelry to antiques.

Away from the crowds. A lovely area for walking and seeing the canals, old bridges and canalside old buildings. Some good places to stop and eat/drink in streets around the areaAway from the crowded streets of Amsterdam centre. Our favourite area in Amsterdam
Perfect area to stay. Lively neighbourhood and close to many cafes and attractions but not too busy. 20 minute walk to train station.
Good place to stay. A nice neighborhood, close to city center but still peaceful. A great, safe place to stay if you're looking for a nice middle ground between location and tranquility/safety

Rick Steves walk in the Jordaan. We did the free Rick Steves audio guide podcast which guided us round this pretty area. Lots of interesting snippets on the guide, which takes you around some of the quieter areas as well as Anne Frank house and Westerkerk church (try the local delicacy herring sandwich in one of the kiosks outside the church, my husband loved it!) Plenty of cafes to sit and enjoy the canals and get away from the busy city centre.
Europe vacation . Stayed at an airbnb in Jordaan. Loved this neighborhood. Wonderful shops and restaurants. Close enough to walk or bike to everything. Can't wait to go back.
Nice area to explore. We had our own podcast of a walking tour of this area and really enjoyed learning about it. Lots of cafes

Apartment Rental in the Perfect Location. We rented an apartment in the Jordaan for a week in July. The area is beautiful, with many cafes and places of interest, in a lovely residential area. Close to everything either by walking or taking the convenient tram. From our apartment, we walked to the Nine Streets shopping area, the Anne Frank House, the Bejginhof, the Dam, the North Market. We took the tram to the Museum District, Rembrandt Square, Central Station, all over. Felt like a local and loved our time in the Jordaan.
Lovely strolls and cute shops!. This is a very special part of Amsterdam. I love strolling the small streets and discovering artist studios and cute shops. Be careful for bikers though!
Jordaan walk. Picturesque architecture and canal views, passing many small shops and cafes. Listened to Rick Steve's free audio guide which was very well paced.

Nice carriage ride through the neighborhood. Horse drawn carriage ride through this old and now trendy area of Amsterdam. The clip clip from the horse sent us back in time. Lovely doors, plantings and people.

Most charming district of Amsterdam. Jordaan is so charming you will never want to leave. Unfortunately we only discovered it on our last day in Amsterdam. It's got a great hipster vibe, lots of cafes/bars and just quaint lovely streets to walk around in.

Roads less travelled. We've been to Amsterdam a few times and so have done all the main attractions, so this time we thought we'd venture a bit further away from the centre and check out the Amsterdam that people actually live in. The Jordaan was lovely, beautiful small streets and canals, squares and cafes and a real slice of everyday life rather than the hustle and bustle of the main tourist areas. Thriving street-markets and some lovely 'Hofjes', which were/are courtyards and gardens built for the working classes. Most are closed to the public and only open on special days, but if you do find some open, take a peak (but mind you don't annoy the owners)! Would highly recommend getting yourself a map and wandering off the beaten track for the day.
I miss it already!. Great place where there is lots of cafes, restaurants, wonderful special shops and things to see. Go there to please your senses. See and be seen. But mostly, relax!
Very nice to walk . You have to walk it !!. Hy ! I was walking all over city when i found out that this area is more unique . It seems to be a true part of Amsterdam ! Go there !!
Beautiful. Lovely area to wander around. Lots of things to see and do! Beautiful scenery and the most amazing Dutch Apple Pie!!
Lovely area. Superb area, very chilled away from the city centre with beautiful canals and a great place to grab a beer or coffee. Good district!
Lovely quant area. Lovely area with typical dutch houses and smaller canals. There are a few squares with lots of cafes around them, which are worth a visit.
Great area to explore & visit. Lots of quaint shops & restuarants & the canal views. Take time to walk & explore the area to find some hidden gems.

Wonderful neighborhood to wonder about. Good shops and beautiful canals make this a completely unique and welcoming area. Perfectly located near the train station and accessible on the tram. We did in the area, but it was not far away.

Amsterdam At its best; relaxed, architecturally stunning and slightly quirky. This is the area for strolling and stopping for coffee or beer every few streets. There are lots of amazing restaurants here and the atmosphere is lovely, particularly at night when the cafes and bars spill out onto the streets and there's a real buzz.

Walk it at leisure. We loved this part of Amsterdam. We used the 100% Amsterdam Guide (available at bookstores in the city or on-line before you come) to explore the narrow streets. Great bars, cafes, shops and restaurants to discover.
Yet another great part of the city. Good for a slow walk and exploration. Beware of speeding cyclists popping out of nowhere. Try small coffee places as well as icecream shops
Beautiful area of Amsterdam.. Not as touristy, quiet and pretty. Locals live, work and socialise in this area. Just a great chill out place.
Cool district in Amsterdam. Nice place to get lost and meet new faces ... Beautiful places all around.... The Jordaan is a really nice area...

Fewer tourists but beware the two-wheeled killers!. Far more authentic than the Dam or Old Town area and less rammed with tourists, the Jordaan has the Antique Centre, on the western end of Elsengracht and it has many clothes shops to rival the Nine Streets.But beware the two-wheeled killers! Wherever you go on foot in Amsterdam they are out to get you. Just as you thought it was OK to cross because there is a green walking man light - whamm! You end up being nearly run down by single, duet or hordes of marauding pushbikers for whom the Dutch version of the Highway Code clearly means nothing. The pedestrian, bicycle and vehicle lanes of the roads are sometimes split into three - one for cars, one for pushbikes and one for pedestrians.Before you step off any pavement or onto a zebra crossing, do your Green Cross Code at each segment you cross, because cyclists come at you from left. right, or behind you. Then just go for it until you reach the relative safety of the first next bit of raised paving stone that marks the separation of a segment. There is no escape from them. The only real way of getting around Amsterdam unmolested by the hordes of cyclists who've never been taught how to spell the word 'bell' let alone use one, is by armoured car. Be warned :)
Jordaan. A really nice neighbourhood, very pretty and lots of places to stop and eat. Quite an expensive district but beautiful. More like Bruges or Ghent compared to most of the city.

Fun Neighborhood. Really enjoyed walking around this neighborhood and getting away from the hoardes of people. Ate at a fun and delicious Italian restaurant called Hostario. Good food and entertaining Italian staff.

A different view of Amsterdam.. This area has always been a bit different, and recently is becoming a little more gentrified. Worth a stroll round, and some excellent bars and cafes with a different feel from the rest of the city.Worth a gentle stroll.
Got lost. I ended up getting separated from my group and got lost. I ended up walking around the Jordaan district and I don't regret it. It was a great place to walk around.

Great location. We visited the Jordaan and really enjoyed the bohemian atmosphere. As a family we felt safe and walked around until well after sunset whic in summer is around 11pm. It was a wonderful place to start our holiday.

Great area.. I was fortunate enough to have booked an apartment in Jordaan on Airbnb. It's without a doubt my favourite area of Amsterdam. Very friendly, pleasant area, with great scenery everywhere you look.

The Jordaan. An authentic part of Amsterdam. Lovely to walk around and check out the different neighborhoods. It's a bit of a trek from the city center, but it's worth it. We found a cute place to sit & have a beer and people watch. Right across the street was a place that made pizzas in an old pizza oven, so we ordered one & they brought it over to us. It was a fun, relaxing afternoon.

Nice for a walk and take photos. I walked a lot nearby the Jordaan, you can look to the people there, elegant and good mannered persons, typical dutch houses, nice view on the canals as if you were into this postcard your friend sent to your place when he visited. Highly recommended.
Cycling around was fantastic. Fantastic to walk or cycle around the residential area. Lots to see and lots of cafes, vintage shops to savour.
Nice neighborhood. Nice neighborhood, with lots of restaurants and shops, close to Heineken Experience. Nice place to stay in Amsterdam.
Nice area for eating out. Close to the city centre, yet somewhat less expensive. Lots of small restaurants and cafés between Westerstraat and Prinsengracht.

Authentic Amsterdam Neighbourhood. Best way to explore Jordaan area is either on foot or rent-a-bike and ride along the narrow by-lanes hosting small bars, eateries, boutique shops, small bridges, beautiful canals, old and beautiful buildings in which no two buildings look alike in their stance.
Another must-visit for any tourist who likes Amsterdam for it's canals and boats
A perfect stroll. Not in to shopping, but a nice place to be, gr8 neighborhood, nice restaurants, beautiful buildings & good place to stroll.
Photographer's paradise . Wonderful place to wander around and take photos. Really amazing at dawn and dusk to look through the streets wander around and see this beautiful area of the city.

Great shops, cafes and lanes to wander through. This is perhaps my favorite area in Amsterdam to spend time in. There are wonderful shops, restaurants and cafes and while there are definitely tourists here, it's also an area for locals as it's a residential neighborhood as well. Spend at least an hour wandering through the little lanes and soaking up the atmosphere.
Canal Vista. Quaint part of Amsterdam. Interesting cafes but then most of Amsterdam is great to walk around with the canals. Can get very busy.

Wonderful area of Amsterdam day and night. Staying in this area gives you every opportunity to experience both culture, shopping, biking and great food within walking -or biking- distances. It is so charming and nice with its historic touch of old Amsterdam and the canals.
One of the nicest areas in Amsterdam. Great to stroll through the little streets filled with restaurants and nice unique shops. Also great for biking because there are almost no cars.

A nice area to eat, drink and shop. This area is very trendy, with a lot of nice eateries, bars and shopping. The canals which criss-cross the area is also very scenic. Set aside a day to go and explore this when you are in Amsterdam

A good location for those who like shopping at small stores. I am not into shopping, but my wife likes to browse. This area had a lot of small shops and some very good cafes with rather good sandwiches. If you have a day or afternoon, this is a good place for a more relaxed lunch and leisurely shopping. I was happy with a great sandwich and an excellent local draft. More slender women will find more here. Some shops seem to max at a size 8.

Nice area for a walk. We took some time to walk through the Jordaan neighborhood before our visit to the Anne Frank house. It was very pretty, and quieter than some of the areas right on Dam Square. We enjoyed looking at the canals and old buildings, and spent a peaceful time sitting on a bench next to one and watching the boats sail by. We also ducked into a few of the interesting shops that we found and did some window and actually shopping. I don't think a walk through the Jordaan is a must-do in Amsterdam, but it's an enjoyable respite if you have some extra time. Overall we spent about an hour and a half wandering and taking in scenery.

Nicest neighborhood in Amsterdam. We spent a good part of our day here, and glad we did, as the other areas didn't have nearly as much charm. Cute neighborhood, fairly quiet, lots to see, pretty buildings, good restaurants and shops.
The heart of Amsterdam. This is the area in which our hotel was located and a most charming area to explore, shop, dine, relax and enjoy. In my opinion, the best area to stay in Amsterdam.
Love the neighborhood. This is an amazing neighborhood in Amsterdam. It has great bars, restaurants and is less hectic than the city center.
Loveliest area of Amsterdam!. We spent two days and two nights in a flat we rented in this area. We enjoyed the canal, lovely homes, shops and cafes! Perfect area to stay with you family.

wonderful area. the Jordan has many quirky shops that are very fun to visit.are apartment was very close to the flowermarket and dam square it is centrall too everything including the Anne Frank house
Very Beautiful to just walk around. we loved just walking around, looking at the beautiful old houses, sitting by the canals to have a light picnick lunch.
Great neighborhood. We loved the Saturday market, Winkel's Cafe with great Apple pie, Proust Cafe with great Tostie sandwiches, convenient grocery stores (like Jumbo), great walking.
Nice to walk. I was there in the last day of my trip. There is a lot of cool stores and is a beautiful place to walk and take cool pictures around there.
Take your time and just stroll. Nice to stroll trough the little streets and canals. Very old Amsterdam area, great to feel how the locals live.

Beautiful and peaceful neighbourhood. If you have the chance to afford a room or apartment in Jordaan while in A'dam, don't hesitate! It is a very picturesque place with lots of little resto, sightseeing, and markets (especially on weekends). It has all the advantages of living in a quiet district (it's near the museumplein and A'dam Central Station).In any case, it's worth wandering around!!

Wander Lust. This is an area perfect for wandering and where we stumbled across the amazing Daalder Cafe, which was indeed a dining highlight. A less touristy part of Amsterdam with wonderful cafes and bars and great people and bike watching.

Postcard perfect everywhere you look. if you have a picture in your mind of Amsterdam and it includes something other than the red light district and coffee houses then this is it. I spent a whole day wandering around taking pictures of beautiful buildings and canals and hanging out in little parks and cafes.Only downside is that it is full of other tourists since it is not a well kept secret at all.

Such a charming area of Amsterdam to wander around.. Really lovely area, criss-crossed with canals and beautiful little streets with flowers outside many of the houses and plenty of little shops, restaurants and cafes to visit.

So quaint. We stayed here and spent many hours strolling around Jordaan. The area oozes charm and personality. The narrow roads burst with people in the evening enjoying a meal at one of the many exceptionally good restaurants!! There is an ice cream shop that has a queue standing outside 24/7 - yes definitely put this on your itinerary if meandering and people watching is something you enjoy.

Fun neighborhood. The square has a fantastic flea market on Mondays. Not to be missed. Different vendors covered the square and ran down a side street for blocks. You could get everything from juice to silver.

Lovely!. We were fortunate to stay in Keizergracht when visiting Amsterdam. This area is very central and very sort after. We stayed on the canal It is very central and easy for transport. All shops and attractions are within walking distance. Best stay.

Well Worth Exploring. Lovely, fun and far more off the beaten path. Dam Square, the Red Light District, etc. are certainly lively but this is a more purely Dutch experience. You don't feel like everything is set up to attract and please tourists. There are locals enjoying the sunshine on the Prinsengracht, bicycles zooming over canal bridges, architecture and buildings that are so distinct. It is a wonderful area to just wander - get lost, stop and enjoy a beer in a canal-side cafe (there are many). On my first morning in Europe I awoke at 4:30 am and wandered this area alone, before the city came awake. It was the highlight of my trip!

DON'T GET TOO EXCITED ABOUT SHOPPING IN THE JOORDAN. after a canal hop on hop off, it was suggested we go to the Jordaan to browse the shops. one that caught my eye was HESTER VAN EEGHEN. their handbags are handmade in Italy and come in delicious colors that are mostly 2-3 tones. they are priced well once the salesperson gets to look it up. nothing has a tag on it so it's a bit frustrating. the other streets in this neighborhood are just so so, nothing upscale or unusual.

young and hip. i was in the jordan district for the orange festival which actually is city wide.. but we ended up over in this area it was close to our apt. and my husbands work they also had this fabulous indonesian dinner place that was well worth the walk over.
A great afternoon. Really fun place to walk around - lots of little shops, places to eat, busy but not super touristy. Definitely a nice way to spend an afternoon exploring.
Amsterdam's history book. A good neighborhood, with plenty of interesting houses to look at. What a great way to spend an afternoon!
Another neighbourhood. Another neighbourhood in Amsterdam. There are many more interesting neighbourhoods in Amsterdam. The canal area and inner city are much nicer.
Beautiful!. Beautiful part of Amsterdam! Romantic streets, good restaurants and people who are straight forward!

Beautiful, relaxing neighborhood.. Great area for shopping if you don't want all the big commercial brands, there is a taste for everyone, bars, restaurants, you name it. Very relaxing and quiet, worth strolling through on a nice day.

Nothing special. I thought Amsterdam was gonna be super cosy, and fun, but instead it was dirt, grey and overcrowded. The Jordaan included. It was better than the city centre, but nothing special. I was really disappointed with this, and with Amsterdam as a whole!
great vibe area. just wander and discover - lots of little cafes and restaurants plus obligatory churches and small museums

Traditional Amsterdam area - go here and avoid the crowd!. Traditional area in Amsterdam where a lot of lower-and middle class families used to live.
Tip: allow yourself to get lost in the tiny streets and canals that is the best way to explore the Jordaan!
A must have experience in Amsterdam. The small streets, small shops, tiny buildings from 17th century - a must-have experience in Amsterdam.
Pleasant afternoon.. Lovely area to stroll around, put us very much in mind of Kensington, London. Plenty of inviting bars and cafés. You do need plenty euros as quite upmarket.

Amsterdam's life. When going through Jordan you can really enter into a typical Dutch day. There are a lot of offices nearby and small cafés and you can see people going to work on their bikes and get to know the typical Dutch architecture.

Great to stroll around. This area is great for wandering through and enjoying the atmosphere. Great places to eat and shop. It has a relaxed less frenetic feel about it, wander like a local. You get a chance to peep into some of the great old and new houses in the area. The Dutch don't have the desire to escape prying eyes so on a sunny day tables are set on the pavement. Highly recommend

Great neighborhood to visit and stay. It was a great location to stay with easy access to shopping and wonderful resturants. We stayed a week on Herenstraat Street and had easy access to all parts of the city. Highly recommend renting a bike as walking can be quite taxing no matter where you stay in the city.

great for a stroll and brown cafes. Full of modern art galleries, restaurants and classic brown cafes, this Amsterdam neighborhood is now very popular and expensive to live in. It's a great place to walk.

Eating Tour. The eating tour in the Jordaan neighborhood introduced a variety of local food within 3 hours time. Tried the apple pie and it was one of the best. Bill Clinton had eaten the apple pie there. All the food stops offered delicious local specialty.

One of the must visits. Those who come to Amsterdam cannot stay away from the charm of Jordaan. With almost everything at equidistant from here, Jordaan becomes a part of your itinerary. There is lot to see and experience around here and moreover is also one of the popular places for tourists . They got canals, views, restaurants shops and lots of attractions around to make this an unavoidable stop

Walk walk walk. Wonderful wandering around neighborhood with overwhelming friendliness and choices of eating and drinking. Charming architecture, canals, flowers and everyone just so happy and relaxed.

Great walking neighborhood. This is just such an interesting part of Amsterdam. The architecture is interesting and there is a very positive vibe in all shops and restaurants. There seems to be a solid mix of residents and tourists. There are several small museums in the area to visit as well.
A lovely place for a walk. This was one of the most interesting neighbourhoods in Amsterdam. The farmer's market was really good, and the streets were great to just wander and explore.
Fantastic place to go and see. Brilliant area to visit and see, lots of interesting buildings around there, plenty of restaurants, bars and cafes.
Lovely place for a walkabout!. We were in Amsterdam only a short time but we thoroughly enjoyed walking around this charming neighborhood! Lots of interesting architecture!

Quaint Neighborhood. Lived in this neighborhood for about 3 months when we first arrived in Amsterdam in 2007. VERY charming, mostly quiet with small shops and restaurants. A delightful stroll for those who have time in their vacation that allows for a deeper exploration of this gorgeous city.

The Jordaan Area - A Tourist Mecca. We stayed at The Hotel Pulitzer located in the heart of the Jordaan district. A great hotel in a beautiful area that is full of shops, restaurants, coffee shops AND is within walking district (sometimes a long walk) of many Amsterdam sights, smells & tastes.
A great place to shop!. There is something for everyone to look at here--gifts, souvenirs, eats, books, window shopping. A lovely area!
Home away from Home.. my home away from home. Eclectic, peaceful, carefree and simply one of the most lovely areas in Amsterdam. Spent many a happy evening here.

This is THE Amsterdam. Jordaan is one of the nicest areas to explore. The picture you get when you think of Amsterdam - it's here.
Lots of cafés, coffee shops and cute places. Lots of people even if it less than around Dam.
Beware of fast riding cyclists! They are everywhere.
Most beautiful area. Spend as much time strolling, eating and shopping in the Jordaan as you can - it's magical. Best area in Amsterdam.
Perfect area to stay in Amsterdam. Perfect area to stay in when visiting Amsterdam! Really good location, you can reach everywhere on foot and its lively and has great places to eat also!

Nice place for a walk. This is nice quarter of Amsterdam in which you can do shopping, go in some bar or just have a walk. It is near all other attractions of Amsterdam, therefore you can go there many time just in few minutes.
Suggested.
Beautiful. The Jordaan is a Beautiful district. We hired bikes and cycled around the area. The cycle lanes are very safe.

Westvleteren. Beautiful area of Amsterdam. We toured after visiting the Anne Frank museum. Great places to eat and view. We found a great place for lunch and they had Westvleteren beer for sale. Grey or black market, but it was a great lunch and an opportunity to try the world's best beer.

One of my favourite spots in the Dam!. During a recent visit to Amsterdam, I think we must have spent a decent part of the time we had in the city wondering around The Jordan. We found some really nice places, to stop for a drink and a couple of good restaurants, which I will review separately. What I enjoyed most is the fact that it is not too crowded with tourists for the time being, at least, so it feels still very authentic.
Worth a visit. If you are in Amsterdam then check The Jordaan out, especially at weekends. It's a vibrant, left field place with some very nice shops

What Nine Streets?. We were disappointed in this whole area. The shops are somewhat trendy (at least they are not souvenir shops), but the cafe's were not impressive and there were not that many of them. It took us two trips there to even find it and we had maps! It was a "you can't miss it" thing, even on the maps, so of course we missed it. And we never actually found nine streets anyway. Don't go out of your way -- that's our advice.
todo.... The area, the bars, the music,...the People, ... no words....anymore, because it it a little bit to much afterwards.....

Great Place. Is a great place to go even you were with your family, friends, is a place to relax and see how fantastic, clean and calm the city is, I've rent an apartment in this region and it was just amazing, for sure if I come back to amsterdam one day I will stay in this place again, because is a quiet neighborhood different from the Wallen that is a nightlife place. So if you go to amsterdam, stay in Jordaan and spend your nights in the Wallen.
Great to Visit. Great place to visit and explore yourself. Unfortunately, we missed the markets. Wasn't interested in visiting the museums. It is a trendy area.

Wonderful Neighborhood. Quiet, gentrified neighborhood with small shops and cafes of all kinds. Populated by locals and ex-pats alike. Wonderful wandering for a taste of what it might be like to live in an Amsterdam neighborhood not flooded with tourists.
Jordaan. Great place for walking around, nice quiet canals, good cafes and bars, very nice area. Liked that it was central but quiet.

Great area for everything. Probably the nicest part of Amsterdam for shopping, eating and walking. This is the exact opposite of "The Red Light District" :)
Recommend to visit during a trip to Amsterdam.

Lovely walking area, great cafes. Lots of small canals and streets full of flowers and trees, some of the canals have small iron bridges from where you can take great photos - some very interesting cafes as well !
Great shopping area!. This area is really changing! Great boutique shops! Markets are fun and eclectic! Great eateries! You need to visit To feel the great vibe going on here.

Stay here. We stayed in the canal district and walked to Jordaan. When I visit Amsterdam again I'll stay in this suburb as feels much more authentic Amsterdam & it's lovely & away from the crowds. Can easily walk to the canals from here
Nice neighbourhood. Nice neighbourhood indeed, but I prefer to walk along the 3/4 main canals to see the city at its prettiest.

Upmarket realness!. The Jordaan area is my favourite part of central Amsterdam, treelined streets with quaint houses loads of restaurants and some lovely architecture. It has a very upmarket feel to it, far from the hustle and bustle of Dam Square.

trendy. Trendy neighborhood with narrow streets, canals and unique shops.
Very nice place to stroll, eat and shop.
Be prepared to face a great coming and going of tourists.

Lovely neighbourhood. We always stay in The Jordaan. It is trendy, respectable and clean. Boutique shops for most things it is always interesting shopping. Restaurants cover most food from the globe and top wines for not a lot of money. Museums close by, top markets many days of the week, canal boat rides, trams.

Cultural, beautiful and romantic. Jordan is the most famous area of Amsterdam .. It's a beautiful quarter of Amsterdam with the famous canals, 9 streets with boutique stores and wonderful cafes! Exploring this area on foot and cycle are best. Renting a boat is excellent on a beautiful summer day!

The Only Place to see and Stay. This area is the best representation of old Amsterdam as it was 200 years ago. Canal houses, small restaurants, art galleries, tree lined streets, and friendly people. This part of town is the only place I stay when visiting.
