Follow Rick Steves' walking tour. Delightful neighborhood. More upscale than the area around the train station. Talk Rick Steves' walking tour of this neighborhood after you visit the Anne Frank House.
Chilling in the authentic part of The Dam. Enjoyed the history of the buildings and the local non tourist shops worth a walk lots of places to stop for a cold beer or coffee and people watch
Great area and great shopping. Visited here with Local State of Mind tour company. Some of the best shopping and oldest houses are located here.
Great neighborhood. Great neighborhood with a lot of different little and specialized shops to see or shopping. It definitely is worth de walk around
Off the beaten track. Buy a guide which takes you on a 2 hour walk around the most beautiful unspoilt area. Secret alleyways, tiny squares and mostly deserted.

Quiet, beautiful district, near to main attractions. Good variety of restaurants. You can walk to Reiijksmuseum along beautiful Canals - just watch out for those bikes, they don't stop for anyone! Area felt very safe, clean and peaceful.

Convenient and charming. an excellent area in which to stay in Amsterdam. It may be a bicycle city but it is also a walking city and this area enables you to to head off in all directions . Excellent and interesting shopping.If you stay in this area it is not necessary to do a canal cruise. In fact the canals look rather seedy and disappointing from the water.

Nice neighborhood in Amsterdam. I rented an apartment in the Jordaan for the weekend. The neighborhood is very nice and is conveniently located to most of the attractions. I walked from the Jordaan to the museums, Vondelpark, and the city center.

Worth a walk or ride theigh. We rode through the area via bike. It was definitely worth a look. We stopped a couple of times for some pictures. We didn't do it but there is a Rick Steves audio guide (free) you can download for this area as well. We chose to do others just for the sake of time.

Lovely place.... The Jordaan is a lovely area to spend a sunny day walking around. Slightly off the beaten -Centraal - track, you'll find yourself coming across gorgeous little tree lined canals and streets with some of the prettiest views and dinkiest house architecture. Truly a delightful way to spend a sunny afternoon. Only use a map to get there and find your way back, whilst there just lose yourself.

Not my most favourite section of Amsterdam, but I guess a must if you are visiting the city. Amsterdam has so many interestiong sections and areas that I would not say that this part, packed with tourists is my favourite one. It is very central thoug, so I guess that for most of the people visiting this town it is a must.

Nice little area. If in Amsterdam it is a must to take a tram to this area, plenty little shops to explore and quaint bars to visit, a must is the street market where you can pick up some old and new items, not the bustle of Amsterdam centre, and not too many tourists around, found it very safe to walk around, take a sandwich and sit at the canal
Great shop. The area was pretty busy while we were there. This area was great for shopping small stores. The architecture on these buildings was beautiful.

Authentic part of the downtown. Cozy place with bit less tourists and more small design shops. Good when you are already tide from landmarks and ready for quiet break at the table just in front of a canal
Very interesting. All were so interesting, a pleasure to the eyes!!! Also, very attentive to people that need attendance.

An evening well spent. It was our first stop in Amsterdam, and it did not disappoint. The houses, the flowers on the porches, the streets, the bikes, the canals... Everything adds up to give a fantastic feeling of what living in Amsterdam may feel like, without the sea of turists that floods the mainstream areas of the city. Do give it a go.
Interesting Stroll. Was interesting to see the different shops in the area. Found it very pleasant to walk the canals. Of course, a must is a canal cruise.
Cool. It is my chhoice when I go to Amsterdan. It's is cool, with a plenty of small different stores. Perfect to lost yourself!

Stay here, You won't regret it. We stayed here for our 4 nights in Amsterdam, selecting an Air bnb apartment--it couldn't have been better! A great location for tourism and short walk from central station, the neighborhood is charming, safe, and quiet. Tons of great bars and restaurants, and a cozy feel make this the perfect neighborhood for a visit!

Houses and canals - what a great combination!. The Jordaan area is brilliant to stroll around, just enjoying the sights, while avoiding being knocked over by the ever present cyclists. There are quirky shops and cafés around each corner and plenty of lovely houses to imagine living in.

Worth a visit with nice little shops and coffee shops etc. We went there after our hotel repesentative said that is place is the new part worth a visit.
Enjoyed walking and walking.
I think it is best to hire a bicycle that way you will not get tired and if you got small children even the better with bicycles.
Well enjoy.

Superb!. Jordaan is an extremely pleasant district with its tiny cafe's, restaurants, designer shops and Hofje's (courtyard with almshouses around it,since the Middle Ages). I am sure you will desire to spent most of your time in Jordaan (like I did)!

Lovely Neighborhood. Wish we lived there. Stayed in an apartment on Westerstraat and thoroughly enjoyed the small city feel in central Amsterdam. Felt very safe and happy. Lots of good restaurants and cafes and easy to walk and visit. Found two open air markets and it was totally non-touristy.
Great part of the city to walk.. This is a beautiful part of AMS. It is great just to walk around and see the buildings, people and stores.

Lovely tranquil area on a Sunday morning. Walked around this area before our visit to Anne Frank Huis. Less hectic than main canal areas of the City. Beautiful quiet side streets with interesting shops, buildings, bridges and lovely trees and planting all around.

Bairro bonito - Beautiful place. Bairro bonito com arquitetura típica de Amsterdam. Quando se vai de ônibus do aeroporto para a cidade passa-se por ele, então não vejo a necessidade de se deslocar apenas para caminhar no bairro pois não há outros atrativos.Beautiful neighborhood with typical architecture of Amsterdam . When you go from the airport bus to the city goes up for it, then I do not see the need to travel just to walk in the neighborhood because there is no other attractions.

What's not to like. We stayed in a B&B in this district. Its a pretty and quiet residential area with interesting buildings, tucked away cafes and restaurants. Walk around and then find an outdoor café by the canal and enjoy a beer.
So peaceful. Amsterdam is a lively, vibrant city full of noise, movement and thousands of bikes. As much as we enjoyed that it was lovely to come to this peaceful and beautiful part of the City
Fantastic views of the canals. Perfect for quiet romantic strolls around the most beautiful part of the City. Also hire a bike to see the canals as the locals do....

Beautiful buildings, nice place to walk.. Nice to take a walk. Not much a drunk. Not many people. There is a nice garden too. We have a short to spend there but we think we will come again next time to explore more.

An 'up and coming' neighbourhood worth a visit. Our hotel recommended us to visit this 'up and coming' area and we weren't disappointed. It is a really serene area with a calm and relaxing atmosphere and a great place to walk around. There are lots of restaurants, bars, cafes and shops to look around and each place is unique. Definitely worth a visit.
A walk through. if you enough time walk through Jordaan and stop at one of the Restaurants. Nice photo opportunities.
Definitely the best area in Amsterdam. This famous neighbourhood is beautiful, calm with cool atmosphere. Nice shops, restaurants and bars around. Just even walking in this area is great!

Best neighborhood in Amsterdam. Very relaxed; quiet and peaceful. You can hear the birds chirp in the trees and see families out and about enjoying their community. Food is reasonably priced and each little shop has its own unique aspect. We went with a local tour operator - just us and so we stopped at the shops and restaurants that interested us based on info provided in advance - booked through Omy Amsterdam Jordaan Food Tour. Well worth the money to have a knowledgeable guide.
Good to walk around and appreciate the city. This neighborhood is really beautiful, with a lot of cafes, boutiques, people (and bikes) walking around... It is really nice to go with no time to back!
excellent little bars. This was the best little neighbourhood in A'dam to go for a drink. Really enjoyed the diverse pubs in this area, also the 9 streets were very nice.
Beautiful Neighbourhood. Very quiet and beuatiful neighbourhood in Amsterdam, perfect place to go bike, and have lunch or a coffee. Beautiful streets with the characteristic architecture.
Nice area. We loved this area. It appears to be the artists area - very relaxed. The food is more reasonably priced than the center of Amsterdam. It also appears to be frequented by the locals.
Buay City. Busy city and quite neighborhood. Children playing, mom and dads taking children to parks, locals enjoying a quite dinner at a local restaurant. Refreshing experience.
very nice neighborhod. lovely, safe easy walk to night life and museum churches shopping also reccomended by rick steves . loved our hotel Lindon

Very nice area in Amsterdam. The Jordaan area is one of them gems of Amsterdam. There's lots of cute bars, cafe's, restaurants and shops, so you won't be bored wandering the streets of the Jordaan. Also this is the place where all Amsterdammers want to live. Don't forget to get the best apple pie in Amsterdam at winkel 43 (Noordermarkt 43, Amsterdam).
The beautiful side. I visited Amsterdam for the first time and i fell in love with this part of the city. Quiet, charming, full of vibrant markets. It's the perfect place to enjoy a long walk.
Quieter area of Amsterdam. We enjoyed this part of the city as we walked to and from the Anne Frank House. The small shops, canals and bridges were very nice -- lots of photo opportunities!

Nice Area. Just visited Jordaan area for dinner after reading the reviews in TripAdvisor. The area is nice and seems well organised compared to the tourist areas. There are plenty of eating places and old buildings.
Perhaps spend some time here after visiting the Anne Frank's House.

pubs pubs pubs!. Great place to wonder around and work up a thirst. This area oozes character and so do the locals. They have a truely off the wall sense of humour and are not scared to share it. Those pubs, oh those pubs. One of a kind , man what a party!!! I mean it, all are there to have a great time and these pubs are one big melting pot. Everyone is welcome, be yourself and let your hair down. Like everyone else there! And then off to the next pub for more, then the next and the... You then start recognising faces from the earlier ones and you are now part of the locals. And that's even more fun. You never know who you are going to end up having a bite with, and any crowd I ended up with was great company. Great food there too, and not expensive. Friday and Saturday evenings are best and don't start too early!

Beautiful Amsterdam neighborhood.. Make sure your plans include a visit to this beautiful neighborhood. There are lots of outdoor cafés in which to grab a bite to eat. Accessible by canal boat or public tram.

Loved exploring this neighborhood. This is off the beaten path and is not touristy. We loved exploring the streets/boutiques/restaurants. Definitely better than the typical touristy spots. Great, small, restaurant choices.
Nice area. I like this area of Amsterdam very good. It is a lot of small independent shops and a lot of nice little cafees to visit.

Simply too charming to miss. The only thing you want to have is nice weather, the rest is guaranteed - walking around this neighborhood is never boring, allowing you to discover many charming details, enjoying simple things - architecture, bridges, cafes and original shops.

Quiet pocket of Amsterdam. Loved the area - lots of character and a quiet spot in a hectic city. However, if you have a short day and plan to see the sights, stay closer to Museumplein or the like; it is a 1/2 hour - 40 minute walk to most sights in the center.

best hood in AMS. Can't say much about this area od amsterdam, just that it's lovelly, less turistical, various organic and super food shops, nice coffee shops also, nicer than the touristic ones at least. The people that live in this area are also cool and respectfull. It's a different area ... its better than other areas of amsterdam city center.
Loved Amsterdam. Vibrant neighborhood with plenty to do, passed here on my way to Anne Frank's house. Try not to miss this one.

No longer edgy. When I lived in Amsterdam, you just stayed away from the Jordaan. In the 80s, many of the old houses were torn down and replaced with ugly modern apartment blocks, many of which didn't preserve the look of the neighborhood. The Jordaan is still being gentrified, but the old structures are being preserved instead of destroyed. It's worth walking through here if you are near the Westerkerk or the Anne Frank Huis.

Excellent place to visit and to learn the development of Amsterdam. There are changes of development you can observe. I liked the place very much. Those who interested in city development should not miss this old city. You also can learn the history of glorious time of the kingdom of the Netherlands.

great market, best appletart, great walking, strolling. had a great cappucino at Cafe de Tuin, then apple tart at Winkel near Nordemarkt, must go to the Monday market- great clothing market-can get designer clothes for cheap, and fresh fruits and vegetables...lots of great little shops, and a great health food store too.
Real Amsterdam. For people who want to see some real old amsterdam not to many people this is the area to go walking around in. Beautifull canals.

The Best of Amsterdam. If you want to get a feel for the real Amsterdam, this is the area you want to stay in (see my review of the Jordaan Houseboat) or at least wander around, eat and drink. It's got history and it's got some great canals. And... LOTS of bikes. :-)
Lovely neighborhood. A beautiful neighborhood packed with cute shops and restaurants and families going about their days.

Lovely Place!. Allow yourself to stroll along the streets of the Jordaan and discover its houses and streets in a most pleasant walk. There are many cafes and bars where you will enjoy a warm cup of coffee or a jenever and enjoy the amsterdam way of life around you. Not to miss and come back many times to this place.

Apple pie. We were staying in the Museumplein area but we knew that The Jordaan was thriving with locals so we decided to take a little trip there. We got a tram there and asked a local where to go and he told us the way. I can't remember the name of the cafe but he told us they sold the best Apple pie so we had our breakfast there and it was delicious. It was just a small, quaint corner cafe situated next to a few others. After breakfast we had a little wander. Not sure whether we treaded the right way but it was nice to have a wander around the area nonetheless.

Interesting Shops. It is always pleasant meandering around the canals in Amsterdam. The Jordaan is a particularly interesting area for shoppers. This area includes the 'nine streets'. These are marked on tourist maps and include a wide variety of unusual shops. Great for browsing and, perhaps, buying a little souvenir to remind you of your visit though some prices are high. You will be able to pick up a free 'Nine Streets Guide' in many of the shops.Definitely worth a look if you are in the area.
Jordaan. Nice area to walk around enjoy the day, less people in this area so you can enjoy it more. Lot of interesting thing to see here.

Beautiful, quaint area for strolling.. We loved walking alongside the many canals. The homes are beautiful, the shops and cafes very appealing. We spent several hours just strolling with occasional stops for coffee. Great for photos of Amsterdam.
Interesting shops. The area has interesting shops, but prices are just unreal, its a nice place to wander around if you have the time.

Nice an cosy envirement. it was a nice visit there, went to a local bar/pub for having some late lunch. It was nice to sit there together with people who live in the area and they were easy to chat with. It was like you just come to there living-room and sat down. Not to many tourists in that area!

not secure city. Despite being a nice city, security seems to be a big issue. My husband and me have been robbed in the daytime in the real center of the city, Jordaan, by a dutch guy that thretened us with a knife. All this with no cameras recording it so that the thief could escape with a motorcycle without the police being able to catch him. From a developed society like this i wasn't really expecting something like that. Freedom means also safety. I'm really disappointed.

Beware. No cameras on the streets in this pretty nice neighborhood allowed the guy who stole my wallet after stopping us and showing us a knife to run away and never be recognized. Probably that's another side of the freeland they're so proud of.
Fine walk. The Jordaan has a strong reputation as a great place to wander around. While we enjoyed our walk, and thought it was nice, I felt as though the area was overrated.
Great area to stroll. Much less crowded but still close to main attractions. Good food and cute shops and again....less crowded. One of our favorite areas of Amsterdam.

Quiet Neighbourhood. I think the best thing about Jordaan is that it's quiet and peaceful and not overrun with thousands of tourists, as you'll find in the more central area.Nice architecture and buildings -- some nice shops scattered around. I didn't think there was that much of notable interest, aside from the fact that it was a nice stroll away from the crowds.Personally, I think Amsterdam's "9 Streets" are more interesting. I'm not sure if this is technically a part of Jordaan, but it's really close by.
Great area. Great area for walking. The restaurants, pubs& cafes are endless. All the locals speak perfect English and are very welcoming and friendly but not pushy at all. We will be going back.
our hood. This is such a great little neighborhood. It’s close, has wonderful breakfast restaurants, grocery stores (organic, included). A fun place to hang out, window shop and chill.
Allthough tourist know, still quite authentic. Nice pubs, restaurants and shops. Use a bike to explore the city, as you get to see more and you blend in with the locals
Great Neighborhood. Our hotel was in the Jordaan District, which is very residential, but has many great restaurants and bars. very safe to walk at night.

Great location to stay in.. Booked a hotel in this area and it turned out to be an excellent choice. Besides being the location of the iconic Anne Frank house is also filled with stores and shops worth browsing and it is not an oppressive walk to the major museums.

So peaceful and yet so beautiful !!. Our Jordaan walk certainly lived up to our expectations. Before going to Amsterdam, I had heard so many good things about this place from all sources including Rick Steves' book/DVD, Eye witness travel guide, and Frommer's guide etc. We did the entire walk in about 2 hours, taking plenty of time taking pictures, listening to Rick Steves' audio that we downloaded to our Samsung SG 4. There were numerous sceneries where we simply had to stop just to soak in unbelievable beauties all around us 360 degrees. Too bad we could not get into Ann Frank house despite owning the Museum cards, due to the outrageously long line. I would definitely recommend to anyone visiting Amsterdam to explore this neighborhood if at all possible.

Great neighborhood, even better food. This was one of my favorite places in Amsterdam to walk around. It was quieter than any other area I had been and the food here was great. We ate at several places here and we're never disappointed.

Tourist crawling all over. We live in the Jordaan, a small village inside Amsterdam. However no one speaks Dutch here anymore. The place is packed with tourists and trolleys these days ruining our relaxed daily life. Please stay away.

Pretty neighborhood, convenient walk . The Jordaan is completely worth the visit. This is a neighborhood very near from central Amsterdam, and you can just walk around and experience a new side of the city.

Strolling thru Jordaan. To fully enjoy the Jordaan you must do a little research. We knew it would be quieter and a lovely walk but we searched out the ceramic plaques that were used to describe the local business - it made the experience just that much better!

Lively neighborhood.. We enjoy staying in the Jordaan. Lots of restaurants, shops, and markets. Nice to wonder around, there are several markets different days of the week. The best one is on Saturday at the Noordermarkt. It's charming and lively!

Vintage shops galore. A beautiful area full of quaint cafes, bars and vintage homeware/clothes shops. The majority of the streets are quieter than the tourist areas. A nice escape from the hustle and the bustle.
Lovely area. It's just a very relaxed and easy going area to wander around, have a drink, people watch. There are lots of little bars and restaurants and shops to frequent.

Blissfully relaxed.. Away from the hustle and bustle of the busy city centre streets, this area is a peaceful oasis of pretty houses, canals, wonderful independant shops - selling good quality wares, combined with fabulous bars, cafes and restaurants. Treat yourself and take a gentle stroll around the area.

Enticing. After a nap upon arrival strolled Jordaan for several hours, taking in the sights and shops. Bakeries, food shops galore. See review on Ibericus ham shop, bought a jxxx at local coffee shop after conferring with bud tender. Eat fresh garlic from outdoor market, saw the long lines at Anne Franke House. Didn't have time for canal tour, yet. Great first day in Amsterdam.
Our Favorite!. We were here for Kings Day, which was outstanding! Jordaan was our favorite neighborhood. Friendly people, not so "touristy" and great good. The beer isn't too bad either.

Nice stroll away from the tourist hordes.. This area of Amsterdam is full of tree lined streets and canals with neat buildings interesting shops and eateries. A nice way to spend an hour or two to get away from the regular bustle of sightseeing and the crowds that are there.
Nothing special but beautiful. I really don't understand why is the Jordaan recommended by the guidebooks. Nothing special, the same like the other streets in Amsterdam, but beautiful.
Fun and Casual . This is a fun and casual area to eat what the locals eat and do what the locals do. It's a great spot for casual dining and drinks and also some interesting, non touristy shops.

Take a food tour. We took a 4 hour food walking tour of this area. Great history and interesting local food purveyors along the way. Anne Marie was a great tour guide. Book ahead if you are going on peak season.
Wonderful neighbourhood. Lots of cafes, bars and restaurants in a lovely area. We find something different every time we visit. Try to go on a Saturday - wonderful food market
Charming neighborhood. Full of little unusual shops and charming row houses. Worth the short walk in town. Easy to get to, especially before or visiting the Anne Frank Haus.
Great neighborhood. I stayed for a week at an Airbnb apartment and loved the neighborhood! It is homey yet stylish, beautiful and very convenient -- almost everything is within walking distance.

Great whatever the season. So we visited Amsterdam again and stayed in the Jordaan area because for us it is The place to stay. Some of the best hotels in Amsterdam along with some great restaurants and shops why would you not stay there or at least visit.
Great neighbourhoos. Has many great restaurants, clean streets. The best part - it's quiet, no tourists lines; mostly locals.

so chic and boho. with lovely cafes and architectual interests
Have an easy day and enjoy old Amsterdam without tourist shops and relax as the locals do with coffees and beers from smaller breweries of worthy note.
Nice neighborhood for a stroll. We went for a nice stroll through the Jordaan and it was very nice. Great restaurants, shops, and sight seeing. I highly recommend it if you get a chance.

Alive with shops, restaurants, and tourists. We took a self-guided tour while waiting to board our cruise ship. Found a cheese shop that made sandwiches and a chocolate shop that made some amazing creations that served as dessert. The Jordaan has all kinds of shops and restaurants. It also had more tourists than I expected after reading my guide book. It seemed to be another nice neighborhood in Amsterdam.

A quieter part of the city. This area, to the west of the city, is quieter than the hustle and bustle of the city centre. With narrow streets, and a few smaller canals, this is a nice place to wander through - but still watch out for the bicycles!!!

Perfect part of Amsterdam to stroll. This is a great area to wander around and soak up the atmosphere. Beautiful houses which are all a little different and unique and which make me want to plan my retirement in Amsterdam to come even more quickly!

The most famous neighbourhood. The Jordaan is a neighbourhood of the city of Amsterdam, Netherlands. It is part of the borough of Amsterdam-Centrum. The Jordaan is probably the most famous neighbourhood in the Netherlands. is a district in the centre of Amsterdam. Originally a working-class neighbourhood, the Jordaan has become one of the most upscale areas of the Netherlands, known for its art galleries, speciality shops and boutique restaurants. Among the Dutch, the Jordaan is known for its folk singers; several of its most popular musicians
Hip, cool neighborhood. Great to bike around, you really feel like you are in the local, cool scene. Very chill. Things more spread out. less traffic, great for biking.

An upscale and trendy non-touristy neighborhood in Amsterdam. We walked from De Halen (think Chelsea Market but a former tram station) to Jordaan.There were wine shops, my favorite cycling apparel store, Rapha just opened 5 weeks ago and is bigger and better than the one in San Francisco, Dutch women's apparel stores and more. We love the statues and canals. A very nice neighborhood to walk around that is off the beaten path. Highly recommend a visit!
Beautiful area!. Small streets, quiet canals to sit next to, trees in bloom in May.... it's a very picturesque spot with lots of lovely food options and plenty of places to drink by the canal!
Where you wanna be. We have spent 3 days in Amsterdam and keep returning here to eat and walk. Comfortable and pretty. Great bRs and restaurants.
Best neighbourhood in Amsterdam. Lovely streets and houses! Even prettier during the warm weather! Must visit as I believe it shows the true spirit of Amsterdam!

A pleasure to the senses..just walk.... We were a group of friends and have spent five days walking all over Amsterdam... this area is no exception in beauty to the rest of Amsterdam.. you pass by shops every now and then and the whole vibe is just so vivid...

Nice to walk around. Very nice and quiet neighborhood to walk around. If you use tour books, Fromer's Day by Day has a nice walking tour of the Jordaan area pointing out different houses and architectural points which I probably would not have noticed otherwise. It is a contrast to the more touristic areas of Amsterdam

I'd move here in a blink.. Swirl about on your bike, or just wander aimlessly in the quiet and streets. Loved the area - peaceful, beautiful and every house unique and full of character. Loved nosily peering into the beautiful ground floor flats.. house envy!

quirky shops and eateries. Was recommended by our hotel reception to visit Jordaan, however we had difficulty finding it until one day we stumbled across the area whilst walking through the back streets. Lovely area with lots to do!
Not as nice as billed. I was expecting great things from this area and was disappointed. Some nice architecture but too many bikes parked on pavements and not safe to walk in roads.

What a delightful neighbourhood . For our first visit to Amsterdam we decided to stay in De Jordaan. This is a leafy, canal lined suburb which is quite gentrified - belying it's working class roots. Even in the cold and drizzly weather it is a delight to stroll around with numerous cafes and bars scattered throughout the neighbourhood. There is very little road traffic, and lots of bikes...silent and potentially painful if you forget to look before you cross!It's brilliantly located within an easy walk of the Centre, Dam Square, Red Light District and shopping but just far enough away to avoid being swamped with tourists. Highly recommended as a place to stay.

Great neighborhood. Just take a map, go out and discover! We wandered around, with no particular destination, and found ourselves in all sorts of adorable streets and alleys. Lots of boutiques, cafes, shops selling everthing from herring to chocolate to flowers. A great way to spend several hours.... or days!
Breathtaking!. It's probably what you have expected to see in Amsterdam! Tiny little stylish streets with amazing architecture, bicycles and the canals! Not to be missed when on a trip in Amsterdam!
Magic place. It looks like walking in a dream world: so nice wondering around without cars, listening to birds tweeting <3

A must see neighborhood. Close to Central Station, the Jordaan is a lovely, quaint part of Amsterdam that we were so lucky to have been able to stay in. We rented a flat through Frederic Rent a Bike in the heart of Jordaan and loved being a tourist mixing in with the residential neighborhood. With many shops and adorable restaurants, this is a must-do for those in search of a great afternoon strolling around!
Afternoon at the Jordaan neighboorhood. Beautiful and eclectic neighborhood ! worth a stroll . Nice shops and restaurants, beautiful people!
Great Neighborhood!. We rented a houseboat in the Jordaan district and loved every minute of it! I would highly recommend staying or at least visiting this charming area.

Old area. This area is quite trendy now, with expensive apartments and lots of places to eat different kinds of foods.
We will go back and explore this area more next time !

The most beautiful of Amsrterdam. Jordaan is just in the centre of amsterdam, very close to the Centraal Station but when you step inside that quarter you are in one other part of town. Many beautiful houses and streets full of flowers everywere. Many canals and small bridges crossing through that neighborhood. Good restaurants, galeries, caffee's and nice and friendly people around. The must if you like greenery and the old charm of the city.
Spring in the Jordan. Trees were just starting to bud. Flowers boxes and bikes along the canals. Just loved walking in the moring while the streets were quiet. Beautiful neighborhood.
lots of shops and culture. Amazing place to bike through. Go have breakfast here, but warning - things were closed when I biked through at around 9:30am on a week day.

Village in a village. Amsterdam itself being a village, this part also is a village on its own. It has narrow streets, cosy cafes, tasty restaurants of all origins, charming shops and flashy bikers going around. DO go and see!
Great area for shopping and walking. this is a great area in amsterdam to look at boutiqyue shops and walk around. It has nice galleries and other things to see for just chilling in amsterdam
Loved this area. This is where we mostly hung out, great bars, shops, restaurants. Sat and people watched all weekend!
the jordaan. Its in the centrum of Amsterdam ,and one of the oldest places in Amsterdam very nice old cafe and markets if u there on a saturday or Wednesday

Scenic Neighborhood With Less Touristy Crowds. We stayed in Jordaan during our visit to Amsterdam, so it was rather easy for us to explore this beautiful area. Tourists who are aiming to visit and accomplish the one cliched tourist snapshot (paris' eiffel tower, brussels' pissing boy, etc) would be a bit disappointed here, as the whole neighborhood is the attraction with no major one iconic standout. Those wanting to stroll and absorb the less wild side of dutch culture would love it here though. It was thankfully less crowded than other more touristy areas with enough touristy amneties for your convenience. Just watch out for the bikes!

Loved this neighborhood. We were staying on the edge of the Jordaan neighborhood (near the Ann Frank House) and we were so lucky that we did! The area is full of cafe's, restaurants and real people :) We took a Food Tour and got to go into 8 of the little shops specializing in everything from cheese to licorice. It is one of the prettiest parts of the city in my view.

Air b&b gem: multatuli-apartment.nl. We recently traveled to Amsterdam and stayed in a rental apartment located in the jordaan area: 5 binnen brouwersstraat. It is the top floors of a row house in the Jordan area. Location was perfect for exploring this vibrant city. On the corner was an Iberian ham store where you could purchase a paper cone or a roll filled with shaved pork goodness. Numerous restaurants and interesting shops interspersed with the numerous "koffee " shops selling space cake and weed.

Nice area of old amsterdam. Very nice area. Less busy then the tourist trap of dam square. Nice shops and dinning opportunities lots of fun to experience. Highly recommend the canal cruise of Amsterdam
Very Chilled.... We didn't get to explore a huge amount of Jordaan but what we did explore seemed lovely! Certainly a nice place to live if residing in Amsterdam! Nice selection of café's and bars.

A charming part of Amsterdam. A charming part of Amsterdam and really worth some time. There are several walks available around the area and in the 9 street area.Many galleries, small shops and cafes to relax in.

Interesting part of Amsterdam. Very interesting streets.Good market.little bit of everything.many Nice small restaurants.just wonderful to walk around in sidestreets and find surprises.its an interesting part of Amsterdam
Did we miss something?. Visited and explored, but felt as though we'd missed something...Just another part of the city?? Or is there more to this that we didn't find?

Natalja from Latvia. It is one of the most quiet and prestigious districts in the city. Drink a coffee cup in one of local cafes, walk along the channel, look at surprising fasfda and visit the Roman catholic church (great Rembrandt is buried there).

Authentic and fascinating.. This is such an interesting and charming part of Amsterdam and really worth an action of tour time. In the Eye Witness guide book, there is an excellent walk around the area which I would strongly recommend. Look out for the yellow submarine!

A taste of gentle urban life. The guide books recommend a visit to Jordaan - which is worth while for those moments of window shopping in independent shops and cafes and thinking how nice it would be to live here. Without the opulence of the main canals or the sleaziness of some parts, this is a pleasant part to wander. Cheese enthusiasts should stop at TROMPS- wide range of free samples and they vacuum pack your purchases.

Quaint section of Amsterdam. While there is no distiguishable seperation between the Jordaan and surrounding sections of Amsterdam, it is removed emough from the center to be quieter and more quaint. As everywhere, narrow streets are lined with many shops and cafes. There are many cafes with seating right on the canal. To get away from the tourist crowds in the other areas wander to the Jordaan and enjoy a more serene experience.

Really nice, slightly arty area. It is well worth taking the time to walk around this area. There are quite a few nice cafe's, restaurants and shops that are worth looking at. There is also an open air bar on a boat - on the Prinsengracht I think.

Old Amsterdam. The Jordaan is a piece of old history in Amsterdam.
A lot of folks singers are born there.
The most famous Dutch artist are born there.

Nice area. Nice area to walk around, smal cafés and bars. There is also a lot of smal shops with international brands, national brands, cheese, flowers and much more. Lovely with the canals and beautiful buildings.
Less crowds, lovely area. A very pretty part of Amsterdam a little more of the beaten track (if you skirt the queue for the Anne Frank house!). Worth a stroll.
Lots to see in a little visited area of Amsterdam. We loved seeing the private courtyards within Jordaan but didn't have enough time to do much else there.
Great neighborhood. Our hotel was in the Jordaan. If I ever go back to Amsterdam I will stay in the same area. Upscale, quite, but there are plenty of shops and restaurants.

Highly Recommend. I fell in love with this place staright away. Stayed here for four days in January. A really nice peaceful vibe. Some good shops (and record shops), places to eat and a couple of great Cafes/ Pubs. Brilliant market on a Saturday and Monday morning. The waffle store near the Linden Hotel (well it was on my visit) do good waffles. Winkel 43 do apparently the best apple pie in Amsterdam. I liked it too. Worth visiting Cafe De Tuin for some nice beers

A nicer part of town. Really enjoyed wandering around this area with a great selection of vintage clothes stores, specialist shops, restaurants with coffee shops dotted around also if this your thing. The nicest part of this area is that it isn't the main tourist thoroughfare so if wishing to escape the boys on tour groups this is area for you...
Lovely trendy area. There are many shops and restaurants and it is a wonderful area to walk around just to enjoy the environment and ambiance.
Vibrant area. Vibrant area with lots of shops and restaurants, perfect to sit out in the sunshine and explore walking around.

A perfect location to stay..... We rented an apartment for two nights in Jordaan, and it was ideal.
It is a bustley friendly neighbourhood, with local shops, supermarkets, markets, restaurants and busy outside cafes. Sure it's becoming more touristy, but it hasn't lost it's community feel.
And only a pretty 20min walk from station or 15min from Dam.

Being restored and yuppified. Historically, this area was for Amsterdam's poor---but is being restored and developed into a newer tourist area with plenty of shops and restaurants. Still mostly homes, but plenty to explore. Try Rick Steves' walking tour of the area.

The Canals. Lovely walk around the canals, pretty streets and quirky shops.
Beware of cyclists when crossing roads and you must visit the Anne Frank House

A good area to stay in. Our apartment was located in this area which has proved to be very pleasant, quiet and convenient for bars (Arendsnest) and restaurant (De Eetkamer) and near the western canals.

Restaurants, fun shops. My impression of Jordaan is that it's a place with fun shops and good restaurants.
I found many nice places to visit during my holiday.
Also a safe area to visit. I travel by myself and felt comfortable and safe after dark.
fabulous Area. Fabulous area everything is there fabulous shopping store, restaurant, old houses, and canal everything are fabulous. Ik hou van Amsterdam!
A great neighborhood. We were lucky enough to have an apartment in this comfortable neighborhood. Lots of restaurants, cafes and just fun to walk around. After give days it felt like home.

Lots of activity and variety. Great bars, restaurants and especially the cheese museum. Street market has lots of individual foods and handicrafts. Look across at the queue round the block for Anne Frank Museum; decide 'another day'; and stroll off to a real cosy, neighbourhood cafe.
Great Area. Excellent Area for bars, shopping and restaurants, the best area for Amsterdam which is also worth the visit too Rembrantsplein.

Restaurants and pubs. There were lots of nice and trendy restaurants and pubs around this area and its nice to hop. And it wasnt too far away either as you can jump on a tram & visit wherever you want.
Real feel of Amsterdam. This neighbourhood features many great restaurants and hip bars. Wander along the maze-like streets to get the real feel of Amsterdam.
Calm, bohemian and beautiful.. A perfect area to visit if you don't want the bustle of the centre of the city but do want excellent restaurants and quiet cafes and bars.

Really enjoyed strolling around. This area was a joy to visit. We got away from "touristville" and into something which felt far more authentic. We were not far from the main city centre but the atmosphere was completely different - less frenetic. It was great to escape the chain stores and see small independent shops and businesses. Glad we made the effort.
Great for people watching. Lovely area, lots of good restaraunts. Nice shops and lovely traditional canal houses. Good photo opportunites.

What Amsterdam is famous for. The Jordaan is atmospheric and absolutely typical of Amsterdam: you can stroll across the various bridges, taking in the views of the canals and the distinctive houses. The area is also justly renowned for its selection of cafes, bars and little restaurants.
Atmospheric. It's a cute space of lanes (much like Brighton). Lovely boutiques and a lot of very good restaurants. Probably the nicest place to amble through in Amsterdam.

Not what we expected. We had high expectations of this part of Amsterdam. Either we misinterpreted the information or we did not find the right parts of this area. There were quite a number of independent businesses but our main impression was that this was just a working area, nothing wrong with that. Nothing we found exciting however.

Nice neighbourhood. I caught the tram so that I could explore this ares. The residential area is actually a lot quieter than other parts a tourist might visit. It was actually nice to experience something a little different.

Lovely neighbourhood. I actually liked this part of the city so much. It is so different from the rest of the neighbourhoods, you can actually see the differences.
It looks like we're in a movie.
Great neighborhood with tasteful options. Anne Frank House, Hotel Pulitzer, lots of great shops and restaurants and activities (canal tours) in walking distance.
What a great neighborhood. we walked all of Amsterdam. Loved this neighborhood with all the shops and cafes. the #2 tram was a great way to move around the city
Lovely and not over run. You can enjoy lovely little pubs and walls around here it is alot nicer than central Amsterdam and out of the way from the red light district.

This is still "old" amsterdam with all ingredients not spoiled yet by tourism!. - small streets, nice homes, well restored.
- no high brow people but genuine!!!!
- visit Noordermarkt and
- cafe Finch or Winkel with the best apple- pie you can imagine.... Delicious.
- smell real Amsterdam and enjoy the typical Amsterdam cafe's....all around.
Everything you need (non motor related). Many shops, cafes, canals, and just perfect people watching. Quiet and lovely, you will enjoy looking at the old leaning Dutch homes.

An authentic look at Amsterdam.. A lovely area full of small shops and cafes, the nine streets are well worth a visit as is the restaurant Moeders, amazing place. Other small ethnic restaurants give a warm welcome and delicious food.

Truly the best place to stay. Following all the forums' advice, we stayed in a lovely apartment in the Jordaan. A truly eclectic neighborhood with shops, apartments, small intimate bars and colorful people all together! It is ideally located along all of the main walkways. Truly authentic.

Unique. This is probably one of my favourite parts of Amsterdam. I find it soothing. Off the beaten track of the central streets, it is a funky slightly bohemian area full of uniqueness: cosy little cafes, vintage shops, art galleries. I tend to forget my worries when I am here. The architecture alone will have you wander the streets for hours not finding two identical buildings, spotting one of a kind decorations and arrangements here and there. You cannot help but wonder what sort of person would live in there.Have a drink in one of the many little bars or just sit on a bench, look at the buildings and people watch. It’s calm and almost tourist free in most parts. I find shopping just out of this world good in this area, as it offers handmade and vintage pieces you will never find anywhere else in the world. Be prepared to spend a bit more money here than in most parts of Amsterdam. It is 100% worth it.
Wonderful neighborhoo. Up market part of Amsterdam , great litle coffee house, quiet, clean, plenty benches, , nice shop, wonderful duchess architecture, many houses leaning.......so interesting
Interesting. It is nice area.lots of places to eat and shop. Observe the architecture of the houses some are leaning...some are narrower than the other.
My favorite neighborhood to meander in. Great little coffee houses, boutiques, etc. Quiet and lovely. Love the Dille & Kamille is the Dutch answer to Crate & Barrel! Great store in the Jordaan.

Nice Place to walk. Upmarket part of Netherlands. Pleasant place to walk with all those canals. Nice place to sit on a bench and do some people watching. Or go to a cafe and spend a few hours - choice is yours. Expensive shops and some weird ones. This is a must-visit place.
So charming! Different stores! Good inspiration!. You can walk a lot and you see so difffrent things and stores! Since cheese stores to shoes stores. Enerything is so charming but modern!!!
More local feel. Less touristy type experience and more in the grain of the local community. Less expensive drinks and coffee shops. I'd highly reccommend Jordaan.

Nothing much to do at night. I went to the Jordaan twice; the first time on a boat tour through the area and the second at night for a walk. The area is certainly very pretty along the canal. The houses are nice and it had a quaint community feel. At night when I went there was no one out at all in any cafes or shops, and it felt different. There are cool places to look into, like shops and galleries. I would recommend going in the afternoon; you can skip it at night unless you're going to eat.

Best neighborhood in Amsterdam Centrum. It’s a real neighbourhood. Saturday all day outdoor market includes an organic food area, monday's market until 13:00 on the Westerstraat, cheap clothes, fabrics, vintage, shoes.Good diverse restaurants, art galleries owned by artists, many outdoor patios for coffee or drinks, nice walks, it’s the heart of Amsterdam! Just looking in the windows and store fronts will entertain you for hours for no money, then stop at a terrace if it’s sunny.

Funky hipster area with lots of cool shops and restaurants. Every city has an area like this- Greenwich Village ,Old Town in Chicago, The Castro in San Francisco--- this is that area for Amsterdam.The ONLY way to see it is by foot-get out your walking shoes.
Chic. More or less a neighbourhood with very trendy bars and boutiques.Worth a wander through maybe late afternoon.Gorgeous buildings.Lovely.
The Jordaan. The Jordaan is a nice place for a walk and enjoy the Amsterdam atmosphere, also it's a nice area to take some nice photos. Also here you can find some nice coffees and restaurants.

Super neighborhood. Great location and beautiful area to stay. Highly recommended.One of the 4 areas located on the main canals. The neighborhood has everything , canal tours, wonderful restaurant's and small pubs. Try Winkels for a great piece of apple pie ! Just minutes from the Ann Frank house.....you can pretty much walk anywhere inside the city from here.If you get tired, Uber works great.

Disappointed. We had planned to include a walk through Jordaans as part of our stay in Amsterdam becuase it sounded like an interesting area to visit. We did so on our last day in Amsterdam and were disappointed in what we saw. We moved on much sooner than we expected to see other parts of Amsterdam which were more interesting.

nice area. perhaps the best for pics... go at the end of the day when the sun is low , the light is great. interesting shops and markets to wonder upon. less crowded than the red light, central station area and much better pics.
Pleasant Neighborhood. We wandered around, window-shopping and people-watching. But it's basically just a neighborhood--not a "must-see" IMHO.

Very creative. The Jordaan area is very cool, creative and has a good feel about it!
Loved the graffiti and found some very lovely cafés and good food.
Great area for eating. This area gives you a really good feel for Amsterdam. we explored , it seems like ,each street which took the full day. Unusual shopping area.

Quiet. A nice quiet area with nice architecture and views.
It would be a nice area to stay in if you don't want to be amongst the noisy centre.
We stayed in the Plantage area which was also quiet and felt very safe.
A must see in Amsterdam.. Try the canal ride and prepare for clothes shopping there, because the Dutch have really good taste for trendy clothes.
Beautiful place. We took a cruise on the canal and this area was very pretty , worth going if you have the time to see it but not an essential place

great. liked every things here. had an awesome time with my friends. loved this journey a lot. I am going to visit this place again and again. And of course, going to tell my friends and family about my experiences.
Scenic. The quiet part of Amsterdam with its beautiful canals and Dutch homes lining them---must walk the area and pay attention to the architecture. Couldn't stop taking pictures!

great place to stay. lovely area away from the super touristy stuff. We rented a house bout here and loved every second of it. Close enough to walk into the city center but far enough away to have a more authentic feel
Lovely neighborhood.... We walked through this area quite a bit - l lots of nice shops and restaurants. Beautiful architecture.

Jordan Weekend Markets. Absolutely great local markets easily accessible by foot from most Amsterdam central accommodation. Organic growers market on one side (in the church grounds) and a street market with various product stalls (including produce, local arts & craft & general goods) just down the road. A must do for all travelling "market lovers". Surrounded by great cafe's serving local food and beverages.

My favourite neighbourhood - Gezelligheid!. The houses, narrow streets and endless shops full with handmade originalities, the markets and Hofjes combined with lovely people leave you plenty to explore.It is home to many great restaurants and most importantly - great people who are friendly, helpful and always up for a laughter. To sit down and have a beer with strangers is just one part of the Dutch gezelligheid and Jordaan is definitely very gezellig!

Beautiful place!. Nice architecture! Polite people , very interesting little shops and designers shops too!As you leave the park , it is very close and it's worth to walk around and stop in one of the nici coffee shops to drink a tea or a macchiatto !

A district with a distinct character.. We stayed in a houseboat on Prinsengracht, so taking a wander into the Jordaan was essential, to find food, cash, stamps etc. It's really just a residential area, bordered by canals. What makes it different from the rest of Amsterdam is that it has a quirky, arty, and knowingly trendy feel. There's similar places in England, for example Oldham St in Manchester, Brighton or the gentrified parts of North London where it's an offense to buy anything that's not organic. This place has shop windows full of the stuff that I gladly sent to landfill 30 years ago. This sounds like a negative review, but actually it's a fun place. If you're short on time it's not an essential thing to take in, but if the sun is shining and you've got a spare afternoon to wander about, then this is a good place to do it!
Great neighborhood, great food.... Title says it all- have a nice walk, or bike!Title says it all- have a nice walk, or bike!Title says it all- have a nice walk, or bike!

Lovely place to just walk.. Download the Rick Steves podcast and take the walk through the neighborhood. It is time well spent. The neighborhood is beautiful. And stop here to eat at one of the cafes.
Always fun to walk in the Jordaan. My husband and I walk there once a month to look at the shops, eat in a nice restaurant, have a drink in a cafe and we always end up smiling.

Beautiful neighbourhood for a walk. Me and my husband had heard a lot about this quaint must-visit neighbourhood in Amsterdam. We got off from the tram right at the beginning and started the walk. You can see the canal running right in between with buildings on both sides.There are interesting things happening all around. Be it a cheese shop with a small educational tour or the Anne Frank's House, there's a lot to look around. The canal remains the prettiest things with beautiful bridges over it. You can also treat yourself to some apple pie at the end in the square at Cafe Winkel.
Lots of cute streets. Don't forget to visit the Cheese Museum :). And just walk around for a bit, there's lots of cute little streets.
So pretty!. A very trendy area - lovely to just take a stroll around. Great bars, cafes and restaurants. Dont miss this!

Wandering in the Jordaan. We stayed in the Jordaan when we visited Amsterdam. It is quiet, lovely and has lots of great restaurants. Just take some time to wander the streets and you'll find interesting sights to see everywhere you look. The Saturday markets were also fun.
Lively!. This place has a great vibe and is filled with restaurants and bars! Very lively and buzzing with people!
Beautifull. visiting jordaan is very beautifull and romatic, recomend to go as a couple. nice dutch bars to have a few drinks
Lots to do. Great area lots of local stores and restaurants, Best apple pie at Winkel 43, great markets lots to do and see, live like a local.
Tree Lined streets in a quaint and quirky neighbourhood. Gorgeous neighbourhood of Amsterdam filled with interesting shops, art, restaurants and architecture. Wonderful to wander and browse.
Great part of Amsterdam to relax. If you want to cool down, this is the place to go. With grea cafees and restaurants you will find your place.

Fantastic base for our Amsterdam adventure. We stayed in The Jordaan for 4 days and found it to be a great base for our day and night excursions, not too far from anything but yet much quieter than some of the other areas of Amsterdam. Great cafes and restaurants and of course the famous antique shopping area. Close to some of the attractions and near to public transport for the rest.
jordaan. lovely area nice to walk around and explore to get lost and just experience it, great bars old and nice beers
nothing fantastic. small shops and bars where you can sit and watch the world go by.Very good for people watching and watching the bikes weave their way around people and cars etc
Trendy little neighbourhood. This neighbourhood does have a slightly different feel to the rest of the city and it is worth an amble through if you have the time. It is filled with trendy boutiques.

Quiet neighborhood to explore and relax away from the masses. Rode our bikes over to this neighborhood (you could easily walk) and spent most of our afternoon here. There a lots of cafes and bars, but they seem to mainly cater to local crowds. It was a very quiet, peaceful experience winding through the different streets; it has a village/provincial feel to it, where you could imagine life as it was 200 years ago (except for the advent of indoor plumbing). Recommend it for a few hours respite from the museums and drunken stag parties and hen nights!

Old workers neighborhood. This place is the old workers neighborhood today you not notice so much of that anymore but still a nice neighborhood the various bars you will have there are nice and if you are there you still notice a little bit of that old tradition of the old workers neighborhood where problems and happiness are next to each other.

Such a beautiful part of Amsterdam . We visited the jordaan area because we had tickets for the Anne Frank museum. The neighbourhood itself is stunning and the prinsengracht canal makes for a beautiful walk. Here you can also find the Westerkerk church and climb the church tower for panoramic views across all of Amsterdam. The church tower can be climbed from April-September.
Fantastic!. A beautiful area in one of the most beautiful cities of Europe! Lot's of traditional houses, channels, restaurants, cafes etc. Must visit and walk it!
Walk, coffee, markets . Great place for a stroll. Nice shops, including unique places. Great market on Saturdays with fresh produce, clothing and crafts. Great cafes.
Well worth the time spent walking around this intriguing district. Stunning architecture and an area redolent with history it is an area not to be missed on any visit to Amsterdam
Great place for wandering. Very pretty part of the City with places of interest for travelers - Anne Frank museum , local food market , Nine Streets shopping area - easy to walk around or cycle

The best Amsterdam neighborhood. Quaint. Quiet. Cute. Fun shops. Great food. Get lost and just wander the canals taking in the lovely neighborhood. Great restaurants on every block. Shops close very early so plan accordingly if you want to shop. Beautiful at night too!
Just a few minutes away .... .. from all the touristy areas and home to independent shops, cafes and galleries. A great place to stroll and with a good guide book, find a few hidden treasures :)

a must see walkaround neighborhood in a'dam.... LOTS of great shops...great atmosphere...some things are a bit pricey, but there is something for everyone, pretty much, in this neighborhood. including some great pubs/cafes/restaurants.
The village in The city. This is a lovely area with more of a village feel. Restaurants, and specialist shops are found here. A lively market once a week also.

Nice district. This was my favourite part of Amsterdam, a little more upmarket and less touristy! Nice buildings and found some nice gastro pubs.
We spent a whole day wandering the streets!

Good place to get lost. We meandered through looking at shops. Every sightline is more interesting than the last. Coffee shops are all super cute. Watch out for bikes. I was so busy looking and taking it all in that I forgot to pay attention to all of the bike traffic. Worth the risk.

A great way to spend a sunny morning. This is a beautiful part of Amsterdam with a ton of history. We used the Tripadvisor Joordan itinerary as a guide and found some really wonderful, hidden gems that you would not see any other way.
Highly recommended

the real Amsterdam. We love to take a walk around this beautiful part of the city,the superb canal way's,long narrow building that some times you have to pinch yourself that your not that far from the hustle and bustle of DAM SQUARE. If you enjoy taking photographs, you can truely capture some stunning images, at sunset the views are magnificent. We like to spend the whole day around here,popping into various bar's and restaurant's, of which there are many around this area and just chill out.If you want to relax, a great day out is assured around this very lovely area.

Cool area to spend time in. While in Amsterdam for the weekend, my friends and I routinely found ourselves drawn back to the Jordaan. A great part of the city to walk around and experience the culture away from the city with the right balance of local and tourist.

Beautiful old part of Amsterdam to walk along the Canals. The Jordaan is a great place to meander along the canals and admire the lovely looking old houses. Some of the houses are leaning so much they almost look comical. There are nice coffee shops here and there as well as some funky art and craft shops.A much better way to spend three hours rather than standing in line for a museum!Keep in Mind: Bike and scooters are constantly buzzing around so ensure you maintain some situational awareness, otherwise you will either end up in the canal, or worse, in a collision with an oncoming commuter.

Our favourite area of Amsterdam. We have always rented an apartment in Jordaan (usually on Prinsengracht) for our Amsterdam visits - it is just so incredibly attractive, close to the interesting things we like (eg. Nine Streets and other shops, bars, restaurants). We seldom stray far outside the area in our 4/5 day stays. Walking back at night, with all the interior lights on, is magical especially in December.

This is a definite place to walk/eat in. Jordaan used to be where the lower working class lived, now it is one of the higher-end, more cultural parts of Amsterdam. I chose to walk around Amsterdam during my four day trip and found myself coming back to the Jordaan area for food, shops, and general sightseeing. It was also my favorite part of a biking tour that I paid for.
A neighborhood like a painting. It is a very beautiful place where you can find everything you need, shopping, coffe, museums. Next to the team station and really close to Dam square.

Wonderful Monday market and clothes market.. Excellent lady with her own label who has garments made for her in Thailand.
Flea market in the end square. Specialist vintage sunglasses dealers. Not cheap but good stock.

Typisch Amsterdam. This is really the heart of Amsterdam. Beautiful Dutch houses and the canal, I loved it there. I used to bring my lunch and eat in one of the benches next to the canal when the weather is nice.

My favorite neighborhood. A charming, quiet neighborhood with excellent bars and restaurants. There are interesting shops, and even though you're not interested in shopping, the pleasant walk justifies the visit.

Graet area to spend time. Just walk between the little nice streets, enjoy the little shops.
For day and evenning time.
We also took an appartment at the area "no.56 bed and breakfast" - great place

Love it!. Around every corner there is another surprise. Take your time and let the area soak in to your soul, enjoy the canals, the Noordmarkt and the 'brown bars'. If you do nothing else in this city, find an hour for the Jordaan.

Quiet and clean.. This area of Amsterdam is much quieter than other areas of the city. It is clean and tidy and very picturesque. Little shops and café/bars are dotted along the route and no smell of the wacky backy!

Quaint, picturesque and welcoming. In May of 2014 we stayed for three nights in the Jordaan. There are a multitude of houseboats moored along the canals and we stayed in one courtesy of AirBnB. We immediately felt like locals and discovered local restaurants, markets and a wonderful cheese shop. This area is a photographers delight.

Everyday interesting. There are no historic sites, no tourist attractions, no canal boat routes, no star restaurants in the Jordaan. There is only the most genuine and lived-in feel in all of central Amsterdam. Real people live here, in real canal houses not only for the super-rich. The bars and cafes are sociable places where locals gather and where tourists hardly ever come. Go there to experience the real Amsterdam.
Best area in the city. I would recommend the area, it has great shops, restaurants, great area to walk in but it is not overrun by tourists and shops catering to them, more of a neighborhood

Very friendly local area. As there were 5 adults in our party,we rented a house in this area, and would do so again. There are lots of interesting little bars, cafes, shops etc and we felt it was the best part of Amsterdam to stay in, and we felt very welcome wherever we went.

The Jordaan is a very nice special cosy area for living, a beer and good food. The Jordaan is a very nice cosy area for living, a beer and good food. In the past this area has been a low income neighbourhood and many original dutch folk singers are born here. Now experience this area that - like Nothing Hill in London - has become expensive to live in. But you can eat and drink at a reasonable price at cosy terraces, bars and restaurants. So enjoy your visit!
Nice streets to stroll along. A nice place to wander with some pretty canals and streets. There is a tulip museum and small cheese museum which are worth a quick look .

The typical Amsterdam. Discover the most typical and local part of Amsterdam. Try this area to be away from the messy touristical center, enter in the local bars and pubs... But be shure to eat before 9pm (yeah I am from South of Europe :)

By Far the Best location in Amsterdam. If you want quality, quiet, location, browsing shops, cafes or restaurants for a break; look no further. Easy walking to city centre and superb transport by bus or tram. You may pay more; but it makes all the difference .
this hood is made for walking!. I never get enough of the Jordaan!!!You feel the 16th century atmosphere dripping from the walls into the canals..
Fashionable Part of the Dam. I always take time to wander around the streets of the Jordaan when i visit Amsterdam, i love the atmosphere, the quirky shops and cool little cafes, highly recommended

Best part of traditional Amsterdam. For those really interested in the old traditional part of Amsterdam, take a tour through 'de Jordaan" area guided by a local.This is where the typical Amsterdam music originated from which is still shown by all the small bars and shops in the area.Must see if you have some free time.
Great place to stroll. Quitter and less crowded than the area between the station and Dam square, we enjoyed some great bars and sneak peaks of some beautiful residential streets.

Nice area that locals use and less commercial. Some really good little places to eat here and the friendliest welcome in all Amsterdam. Don't miss the cheese tasting and have eggs and bacon to set you up for a day gawping at beautiful canal side buildings

How the locals live.. This is a local area, with local people living their normal lives. You'll find that cafe's in this area tend to speak less English, but are cheaper. If you walk in looking like a tourist you'll get weird looks too.

true amsterdam. You have not been in Amsterdam by missing out on the Jordaan. Get a good guidebook for finding the right streets, markets, shops, churches etc. This is because some parts are mainly residential and others f.e. streets with great small shops (check http://www.de9straatjes.nl/nl/home) . For general info please check http://www.jordaaninfo.nl/index.php?option=com_content&view=category&layout=blog&id=39&Itemid=12&lang=en .Using Google translate you can use the dutch site http://www.jordaanmarkten.nl/ for info on markets.Just stroll alog the canals and beautiful gablehouses and take a rest at at typical cafe.Njoy

Lovely area. Lovely area to stroll, shoot pictures, explore lots of exciting small independent shops and cafes. Much more genuine then over touristy areas in town. We consider staying in this area next time in Amsterdam.
Enjoyable area in Amsterdam. Great for exploring galleries and shops. Excellent restaurants in the area. Beautiful streets along the canals.

Great area for strolling. This area is the old Amsterdam with lots of brown cafes and friendly people.There are lots of little streets that meander around. Also a great place for dinner is Toscanini but you need to reserve.

Real Amsterdam. Not the highstreets are Amsterdam, the Jordaan. From the Elandsgracht to Brouwersgracht. Along the canal, walking, biking. The small streets between the canals. The shops in the Prinsenstraat or Herenstraat (must see). And there is the aeria the 9-small streets. This is full of shops and where you van have a drink. ITS between Raadhuisstraat and Leidsestraat.
Pictoresque area. Great neighborhood around Prinsengracht canal with small tasty shops, cafees, art galleries,... Nice to walk around and admire beautiful shop windows and quiet streets.

Amsterdam City Guide Walking Tour. We did the Jordaan walking tour on the Trip Advisor Amsterdam City Guide app. Gorgeous little streets, bars, cafés, the oldest pub in Amsterdam, churches, history, courtyards...start at Westerkirk on Prinsentgracht. We walked around Jordaan for about 3 hours, and we could have kept going!

Happily lost in Amsterdam. It was our second visit to Amsterdam and just like before we found that the best way to enjoy the city was to wander happily around these lovely streets, gorgeous architecture, picturesque canals and plenty of funky bars and cafes to enjoy. Great way to relax and unwind.

Pretty but not much going on. We decided to stay near this area because of all the rave reviews on tripadvisor. It's a nice neighbourhood but not what we expected. There are a few little shops and cafés but that's about it....
Arty area.. Nice area to visit with the usual selection of art galleries and quaint shops. Also nice area for sitting outside for coffee or a drink and people watch.
Amazing neighborhood. Pretty calm and charming neighborhood, with a lot of great restaurants. You should really try to stay there.

So lovely!!. My boyfriend and I stayed in a small apartment in Jordaan for valentines day and absolutely loved it. The area is beautiful with canals everywhere and little restaurants and cafes on every turn. It is also incredibly close to all the other sites but far out enough that it isn't really touristy or commercialised (which we found with a lot of the rest of Amsterdam). You can walk to the main museums in about 30 minutes and the Anne Frank house is very near this area. Would definitely recommend!

Charming neighborhood with small shops and restaurants.. The Jordaan is a peaceful neighborhood with nice shops and restaurants. Many beautiful bulidings and front doors for those who are interested in architecture and design.

Great place. A group of 5 21-25 year old girls stayed here in October we booked an apartment here as it was cheaper than a hotel, then looked at the maps and realised we were out of everything so got a bit panicky. But this place is beautiful, it's so quite and a far cry away from where you step out of the train station, it's a very local area we found with nice bakery's for breakfast we only managed to find 2 coffee shops round near this area which was probably the only downfall, was only a 10 minute walk to the strip of bars and also had a tram stop right near which we didn't discover until the last day but if I ever went back I would 100% stay in the same area it was peaceful and safe, a lot different to the red light district

beautiful. Don't miss the chance to get lost in the canals and lovely streets of the Jordaan while you are in Amsterdam. The scenery is lovely, good pubs and eats! Perfect way to spend a day in Amsterdam :)

The most beautiful part of Amsterdam. I fell in love with The Jordaan, its just so beautiful. The community here seem a lot less bothered about tourists, the shops are for locals mainly and everyone just gets on with their lives. The coffee shops here are quaint, rather than tacky. We visited our favourite as the new years parties were winding down and were invited in for the house party. So friendly. The houses are stunning, I could definitely see myself living here. Real old school Dam mixed with modern fun. Gorgeous.

My favorite slice of Amsterdam. The Jordaan is the quintessential Amsterdam neighborhood- canals and canal houses, more residential than touristy and wonderful, quaint shops and restaurants. The shops along Haarlemmerdijk are quirky and wonderful- and include several grocery and pre-made food stores if you are looking for picnic supplies. Well worth a visit, and even better- book your accommodation here.

Great area to walk round and enjoy. Much quieter than the areas around Centraal station and the red and green light districts, we always enjoy a stroll around this historic area. Great selection of shops and places to eat or just sit and have a coffee. Plenty of ethnic diversity means some excellent foods that you don't see anywhere else

Best area of Amsterdam. If you want to visit Amsterdam the Jordaan is by far the best area to stay! The Jordaan is a neighbourhood of Amsterdam-Centrum. Originally a working-class neighbourhood, the Jordaan has become one of the most expensive, upscale locations in the Netherlands. It is home to many art galleries, particularly for modern art, and is also dotted with speciality shops and restaurants.

An interesting and delightful area to wander round. This is an area of small streets where you can find all life and more besides. There are small, interesting and at times bizarre cafes and shops that sell basic and exotic things. Every taste is catered for and it is worth devoting a full morning or afternoon to just wander and be amazed.

Skip the tourist hordes and head to Jordaan. Its so very close to the central boulevards and lanes that are chock a block with tourists. But this is Amsterdam at a more genteel style. Slower paced, unique small stores with quality items, cafes where the locals drink and eat, all in all worth a visit.

Bij ons , in de Jordaan .......... This is a famous song . Same as The Jordaan its self . It is Amsterdam at the best . Every time when i in our Capital City , i walk allong the old Streets/houses .I realy love the place.

Relaxed, attractive ambience good shopping. We were staying for the week in a lovely houseboat in the Jordaan a quiet leafy residential area. Much of our time was spent in the marvellous museums and at a concert but we also spent a relaxed afternoon shopping in the Nine Streets. The shops are individual and the small streets a joy to walk around weaving both sides of the canal. I never felt pressured in any of the shops. The assistants were friendly and knowledgeable. I bought some beautiful jackets at a dutch designer shop ML and perfect fitting jeans from Denham another Dutch firm. It’s perhaps as well I don’t live nearer, I would be a regular shopper here.

Lovely, gentle area of Amsterdam. Walked around the Jordaan area of Amsterdam during a weekend spent in the city and it was like finding an oasis. It was far less touristy than other parts of the city and had all the beautiful aspects - canals, wildlife, bridges, individual cafes, bars and little shops as well as art galleries and antique shops. The people were friendly and very helpful - well worth discovering.

Beautiful & peaceful. If you're in Amsterdam, definitely wander over to the Jordaan for breathtaking canals and lots of cute independent stores and eateries. You can spend an afternoon here weaving in and out of streets, stopping for vintage shopping or treats, and then head out to the 9 Straatjes for a very hip Amsterdam scene with lots of pop-up stores and restaurants.
its a Good Experience. Hi,We visited Jordaan by Bike, its a beautiful place and do shopping and it have lot of shops to look for and shopping
Good food. Great food options, although expensive and slightly pretentious. Best to plan ahead with Amsterdam, particularly if you have gluten intolerance.

Great place to visit. I loved wandering around here. There is something for everyone! I liked the traditional dutch shops rather than the typically tourist haunts. Lots of places to eat makes it difficult to decide where to go! Definately worth visiting.

Now getting gentrified. Mixed emotions, the Jordaan was real Amsterdam, a local place for local people, now it is becoming more a local place for beautiful people, it is chic, picturesque, arty, foods and becoming expensive, but it is clean, atmospheric and still unique

Great. This area is one of the best and must see areas of Amsterdam. Lots if small antique shops and other oddities alongside cafes and bars. It seems s more chilled out area of the town and a lot of artists live and work in this area

Must See In Amsterdam. Those quirky shops and labyrinth of streets, that is Jordaan. B'ful neighbourhood in Amsterdam. Amsterdam in itself is quite a small city and hence relatively Jordann might seem a little far but then its totally worth it. Beautiful Buildings, Dutch Architecture, nice coffee shops, it has all what it takes to make an awesome day!

Great Neighborhood. Another great area along with several other historic Amsterdam neighborhoods. Great Architecture, canals & bridges. Plenty of cafes, restaurants, souvenir shops. Well worth exploring the area.

Nice to walk around. With stores every where and The tipycal houses around it is a nice area to walk a round and get an idea of Amsterdam!, you will walk among the Amsterdams Channels and will Pass though thr typical city bridges, you can Also get Some souvenirs at The stores!, this is a must go!!
Worth the walk. All of historic Amsterdam is beautiful with its architecture and canals and no less the Jordaan district. Full of coffee shops and individual stores its worth a good long explore.

When in Amsterdam....visit 'The Jordaan'. In my opinion, one of the nicest parts of Amsterdam. Lot's of cafes and restaurants offering amazing food, traditional and not so traditional. I imagine this area of Amsterdam is wonderful throughout the year, unfortunately I only got to see it in Autumn and it was breathtaking in terms of the view. Can't wait to come back!

The best part of Amsterdam. This time we were lucky enough to be staying right in the middle of this amazing quarter. The Joordan has everything: cute shops, cosy restaurants and cafes and pubs, beautiful houses, a fantastic market and an interesting mixture of people strolling the streets.
Great neighbourhood. Lovely aesthetics, great atmosphere and full of lovely surprises in the form of art galleries and cafes/bars

Quirky area. Quirky area right in the middle of the city centre, full of cafe', restaurants and nice shops.
Definitely worth to take a nice walk around this area.

A Nice Place for a Stroll. Enjoyed visiting and walking through the Jordaan area of Amsterdam. The surrounding canals are truly beautiful. I strongly recommend a good camera for photographing this place. I happened to visit in the winter when it was drizzling outside. That created a special photographic effect. Will be revisiting this place when I return in the summer.
Great Neighborhood.. Lovely area that is full of great cafes, restaurants and small independent shops. Also lots of historic buildings - a lovely neighborhood to walk around and people watch.

bijou shops and lovely restaurants. ate here a few times lovely places to eat and houses fab to look at long the canalside. Really close to the station and a good stopver en route to the Anne Frank house. Shops are closed on Sundays here.

What you'll expect. After watching numerous videos online on attractions, lifestyle etc on Amsterdam you'll start to question whether it was all completely dressed up. Once you visit this section you'll be happy to know all those recommendations held true. It is very busy, old (in a good way), endearing part of time. Plenty of small restaurants and and things to do, take your time as there is no two similar things in this section.
