The essence of Amsterdam. We had been told this area was like the Greenwich Village of Amsterdam. It was better! Such beautiful architecture lining the iconic canals. Simply lovely! A must see!

Cool area. We spent several hours walking around this area. Unfortunately the weather was poor and it was fairly quiet, however we still enjoyed looking in nice little shops and having some quiet coffee and lunch. A cool suburb to walk around, but maybe not a distinct attraction in itself if you were short on time.
Quite authentic. A very authentic place next to the center of Amsterdam, just after the famous arch-shaped canals. Better to see it in a sunny day though.

Great area to stay and fantastic restaurants in this area.. We've been to Amsterdam 5 times now. When we go, we now stay in the Jordaan area. The last time we rented an apt that was located on a residential/commercial street, on the second floor. Jordaan district is the perfect jumping off point to explore the city on foot. This area is filled with delicious restaurants, and activities to pursue.
Amazing!. I just loved walking through this part of the city! The architecture was amazing and it wasn't nearly as crowded as other parts of the city - a must visit!

The Saturday Lindengracht market is a must!. While the entire Jordaan ( as the Red light district, on of the oldest parts of Amsterdam)is an amzing experience, full of restaurants, coffeeshops, terraces, pubs, shops with unusuall and vintage itemsand ofcourse the almighty canals, please try and visit the every saturday market on the Lindengracht and accompanied 'GreenHealth food market' on the Noordermarkt as well.You'll be pleasantly amazed!
Lovely neighbourhood. This part of Amsterdam is worth a visit! Away from the junky crowd in the center, this neighbouhood offers you lovely cafes and small boutiques. We felt like a local.
Great neighborhood . Great place to visit while in Amsterdam. Full of restaurants, cafe's, bars and amazing architecture. Beautiful presentation of traditional Amsterdam.

My favourite neighbourhood in Amsterdam. Beautiful neighbourhood to stroll through over bridges and along canals. Heaps of lovely cafes and restaurants and independent shops. Recommend having a cycle round Jordaan if you hire a bike.

lovely. Pictureque! a really lovely place to go. beautiful bridges, lovely river walks. Great cafes. Wish i could of stayed longer. Though do watch out for the bikes! they tear around at incredible speeds! Would definately go back

Away from the tourists, a real feel of Amsterdam. We wandered the streets for quite a while and took in the beautiful buldings and gardens. A group of houses had closed off part of their street to traffic and were decorating it for some sort of celebration. Gave a wonderful sense of the city's true inhabitants.
sightseeing. Iloved the individual shops and very friendly people.Just look out for the bikes they are everywhere and don't give you much time to get out the way
Beautiful neighbourghood. Jordaan is a very nice neighbourghood, it has beautiful canal walks, cozy cafes. Not touristy, no neon signs, no smell of the week - perfect!

Great neighborhood for sightseeing and shopping. If I could live in Amsterdam, I would live in the Jordaan section. Beautiful bridges over the canals, delicious restaurants and practical to funky shops. Oh, and a few tourist attractions too. I prefer to stay in this neighborhood and explore all of Amsterdam from here. It's great to come 'home' to at the end of the day.

Feel like local. I visited Amsterdam for holidays in December and although I stayed about 20 minutes on foot far from The Jordaan area, I went there quite a few times. I believe this neighborhood is one of the most genuine of the city, with lots of "brown bars", where you can drink a Dutch beer and have a snack. If you seek for an escape from the crowded streets and the shopping areas, this is the best place to feel more like a local.

Lovely neighbourhood. We stayed six days in Joordan area in January and I think we could not have chosen better neighbourhood to stay in Amsterdam.Joordan has lovely houses, cafes, restaurants and shops and it is still not touristy neighbourhood, it is full of everyday life.

Special atmosphere. Stayed in the Jordaan thru airbnb in a lovely 2 bedroom home central to everywhere lived like a local out side of the tourists hordes ate at local restaurants the Jordaan is a wonderful place with great shopping eating sightseeing
Real Amsterdam. I recommend to hire a bike and see the area . Too many narrow alley with beautiful flooring and canals with nice boats with flowers . I think this is real amsterdam

Would like to go back. In our wanders around Amsterdam the Jordaan was one of the nicest, albeit quiet, areas (at least at Christmas time). I would definitely like to go back and explore it a little more.

Nice spot! but too expensive.. we went to the "9 straatjes" it was really nice, cute stores, everything you imagined when thinking of europe. I certainly recommend it. BUT i think their prices are ridiculous expensive. Even the second hand stores are way too expensive (22.50 eu for a USED blouse). They sell the "hip and trendy" concept. Be smart, and buy elsewhere.
Beautiful spot in Amsterdam. Recommend all visitors come here to get away from commercialised centre of the city. Little cafés, independent shops and attractive residential area too.

Hip Area. I enjoyed walking this area (probably wonderful in Spring, Summer and Fall, but pleasant. There are many fine restaurants in the area (do go to Restaurant Luna, an Argentine Steak house) as well as specialty stores (old record store) and numerous cafes.
Very nice, great shopping. Lovely neighbourhood, charming cannals and the best shopping (if you like original clothes and other items...).

Great place to wander around.... away from the mad crowds on Damstraat. Pleasant residential district with interesting boutiques and some nice cafes. Some postcard views of Amsterdam can be found in this area.

Lovely architecture, Great escape.. We went to the jordaan on a yellow bike tour. 2 birds 1 stone. Who doesnt want to get on a bike in amsterdam and have an informative tour for less than £20 and see where the locals live all at the same time. The streets where so quiet and it honestly felt as if we were in a completly different city due to the atmosphere here. I would really recommend a visit to the Jordaan. Have a great time in Amsterdam!
Trip back in wonderland. I been here many times..i found some changes..i think amsterdam still the place where have fun!I hope to come back soon here!

Completely charming!. Somehow the Lonely Planet made this seem like some twisty little medieval village within the city, but it's just a more modest and homier version of other neighborhoods. Dozens of cozy-looking cafes and restaurants - people seem to start eating at about 4:30 in the afternoon - and within walking distance of the Anne Frank house. Can be walked in just a couple hours!

A quiet area.. I expected so much more after reading other reviews. It's just a quiet area, nothing to see really. I wouldn't bother, especially if you only have a limited amount of time in Amsterdam.

Gorgeous. I find this section of Amsterdam to be wonderfully beautiful. There is plenty of shopping, galleries, and other things to see and do such as the Tulip Museum and Cheese Museum, but don't go there for these. Go for the lovely street views, and the wonderful walking.

Most typical and great vintage shopping. Definitely the most typical part in Amsterdam and it also has a lot of small streets with great shops, bars, restaurants, etc. A fantastic way to discover Amsterdam.

Great shopping area, nice little butiques and bakeries. Loved the boat houses on the canal, the special shops and the Thai restaurants. Nice market on Saturdays. Lime market. Also good farmers market called MARQT
Very nice market!. We really enjoyed walking through the market and seeing all the merchandise. We also bought a stroopwaffle and a fresh juice that were amazing! Totally worth it!

Beautiful. A BEAUTIFUL quarter of the city, authentic
No international shops just some artists and amazing shops and restaurants
Good Bio markt in Jordan. Visited jordan market yesterday,, especially came for this market, and found what i was looking for,, it was a big crowd,, but worth a visit..
Beautiful and cosy area.. The Jordaan is beautiful. Tiny little streets and 'hofjes' everywhere. Loved the houseboats and canals and bridges. One of my favourite areas in Amsterdam!

My favourite part of amsterdam.. From the quirky Streets,fabulous places to eat and the hours of wandering around....its my favourite part of Amsterdam. I love the atmosphere and the relaxation of it.

Beautiful. Beautiful and picturesque area away from the busy tourist parts of Amsterdam. Lovely walks right along the canals and seeing the houses and houseboats makes this a really wonderful area to walk and explore.

Beautiful neighbourhood.. By far my favourite neighbourhood in Amsterdam, beautiful canals and bridges and lovely little cafes. This is what I was expecting from my visit.
A visit to Amsterdam isn't complete until you've wandered around this area and got lost in the many narrow streets.
Charming and Romantic. The walk along the canal ring in Jordaan is amazing in the morning when its less busy. Cute cafes and art galleries make for a tasteful experience with a great view!
Born here, nice to be back. It was nice to see the place back were I am born. I explored the Nine Streets with the special shops and bars. Felt good to be back home again.

traditional. Stayed at Brouwersgracht and wake up every morning to the beautiful view of the canal, with the house boats and the architecture in the background. actually this area is full of beauty,,, nice canals and flowers in every canals..
Nice area. The oldest area in Amsterdam. Away from the main tourist paths, and hence very peaceful and nice. Amazing canal walks. I loved the place
Trendy. It's trendy and colorful. There are great shops full of art, design and taste. I loved walking around this part of the city, so charming!
Lovely Area. This is a must visit if in Amsterdam. Away from the crowds, just wonder around the roads, alleys and laneways. Lovely bars and shops in the area as well.
Meet-up area. It is nice and colorful district, with lot of restaurants. Perfect place to hang out with your friends.

Beautiful Brouwersgracht. Stayed at Brouwersgracht and wake up every morning to the beautiful view of the canal, with the house boats and the architecture in the background. It is a quieter neighborhood about 20 mins walk from Centraal. I've walked along the streets late at night and felt safe. Many cafes. The area is not touristy.
Amsterdam away from the tourists. Spend a couple of hours wandering the streets in Jordaan. Lots of lovely boutique type shops. Loads of bars, cafes and restaurants. Relaxed and friendly

Best organic market. Did a cycling tour and came back to the organic market after. The market is only on on a Saturday but you could quite easily eat your way through it.
It's a really lovely part of Amsterdam and very popular with the locals and not yet completely over run by tourists the way some of the other parts are.
Quaint shops and cafes. Come here for boutiques. The 9 little streets is over here and fun to just wander around. You'll wonder how these boutiques stay in business but they do!

Awesome neighbourhood. I must say I can't stop staring at the beautiful architecture. I just walk and walk, lost in time.
So interesting!!
Nice neighbourhood. Interesting sights & shops in a quiet & peaceful neighbourhood. I would strongly recommend a walk here to destress.

The place to be.. This is the real heart of Amsterdam. You can wander, get lost, and absorb the spirit of the city. It is safe to wander even after dark. Cafes of all kinds, unusual shops, and interesting architecture.

Nice Area to Walk Around. My purpose came to this area is to visit the house of Anne Frank. But, once I saw the queue lines, I changed my mind. Instead of waiting in the lines for hours, I prefer to walk around the neighborhood and see what it's there. The neighborhood is quite different from other areas in Amsterdam. Along canals, there are many boat houses. Some of them become restaurants, and some of them are still house, I guess. There are many boats with flowers on the terrace and some curtains on the window. Many coffee and souvenirs shop around. The bikes are parking everywhere. The spring started to come on that time, and many flowers are blossom. Even I could find tulips there. If you have any chance to visit Amsterdam, you won't regret to come to this neighborhood.

Definitely a must must see. yeah, you must see this place, it is very and absolutely Amsterdam. I was there in the autumn and it was beautiful everywhere. Bridges, flowers, bicycles, water, sunshine, quietness, old people reading newspaper on couches in front of their houses. It is like a different world, opposite to the weed smell and souvenirs printed with sex postures just a few streets away.I was wandering for nearly 2 hours in this place, just wandering, and I still wish I had more time there. Would be great if you spend some time in a vintage coffee shop. Lovely!
great area of the city. lovely area of the city, with some nice bars and coffee shops (coffee). The Ann Frank haus is a must

Interesting area for meandering. Loved walking through these small streets (9 Streets) with eclectic boutiques, vintage shops, cafes from 1690s! You need at least 3 hours to meander. Got great red hat in consignment shop for 5 Euros!

Agreed, worth the short walk. After the hustle and bustle of the Dam, city center, Central train station and shopping on the streets, head off to the west to enjoy a short walk to a quiet, quaint and fun aspect of the real Amsterdam. Try the Rick Steve's Europe podcast that he has for the area, one of three audio tours that you can download for free from his website, with a map.Enjoy the canals, the streets, the cafes, coffee shops, sounds of children playing, the absence of trams and crowds!
Best part of the city. Definetly it worth a walk. Shops and coffees, markets, not a lot of turists and lot of nice restaurants where u can eat without spending too much. Go enjoy the dutch amsterdam!

Didn't want to leave. This is a really nice, chilled and unpretentious neighbourhood. We spent our last day here as we booked to go to the Anne Frank huis in the afternoon. We had a wander around, took photos and found a lovely cafe to relax in. We spent hours just relaxing and enjoying blending into to local life. This was a great way spent our last hours in Amsterdam and we would've loved to have stayed longer but when we had to leave to catch our flight.

amazing neighbourhood to stay in!. safe, good value for money and a step away from all the hustle and bustle.Go to bar brouw, the breakfast club and the new mews just a few doors from Bar BrouwThe number 17 tram takes you straight into the town centre in 10 mins and central station in 15 mins
Great place to roam around.. Worth a trip to visit this bohemian area. Linden market is here and westerstraat market . Both market worth a wander around.

Pleasant place for a walk. The ambiance of this neighborhood is ideal either for a walk with your family or for a couple to spend time from corner to corner... get lost in these streets to be surprised in every corner with a great view..
Old historical place. We enjoyed visiting the Jordaan . We felt like we were locals for a short time and were grateful to be away from the hustle and bustle of the tourist areas in the evening.

lovely neighborhood. We rented an apartment in the Marnixcade area, on a canal, close the bus and tram. Wonderful area with the feel of locals coming and going from everyday life. Very safe, friendly and convenient. Shopping, restaurants and other conveniences accessible. Easy to travel within Amsterdam and to the outside.

Every weekend, worth a stroll. Living now in Amsterdam, my weekend ritual begins with a stroll through the weekend market that begins on Lindengracht and ends at Noordmarkt. Buy flowers, have a sausage, herring or crepe and then by late afternoon enjoy a beer outside if not too cold. Saturdays can be crowded all over the center of the city, and certainly in the Jordaan. But don't let that deter you. Keep a mindful eye for cyclists, stay on the sidewalks. Amsterdam is magical all over, but the Jordaan truly stands out. You won't regret it.

Great Neighborhood. Best place to rent a barge and watch the boats cruise around. Super close to everything, yet quiet at night. Easy from the train station. Cool flea markets, although sometimes the hours are very random.

Do not visit Amsterdam without wandering around the Jordaan!. The Jordaan is the heart of Amsterdam - wander along the canals and intersecting streets filled with interesting artisan shops, drink a 'koffie verkeerd' and enjoy the atmosphere. If I had only 1 afternoon in Amsterdam - this is where I would spend it (and I'd visit the Anne Frank museum whilst there)! There are lots of touristy things to do in Amsterdam but the Jordaan really should never be missed.
Jordan, the real Amsterdam. You can not get more "local" than in the Jordan area! Walk the streets, talk to the people, have drink.

beautiful restored, arrogant and bad tempered inhabitants. The Jordaan was an area of Amsterdam where the poor people who 'just arrived' in Amsterdam lived or were being 'explored'..... of course most inhabitants made up their mind and left this area, but the real Jordans still feel gruge towards the better off, living in the 'Grachtengordel" (the better off) or the people of Zuid (South). So they sang together about their unhappiness (tante Leen and Johnnie Jordaan) and suffering in their cafe 's, but started as well making jokes about eachother. Lukely social benefits were given to these inhabitants, and lifes ( housing,health facilities & schooling) improved. Nowadays young parents buy these small houses and the always-complainers/ misusers of the social bennefits are getting less. But the area is getting overcrowed by the tourists through RB&B and the youg couples/parents with too many cycles dumped everywhere. So agian the inhabitants starts to complain/ cry out and I think they are right. They should have the feeling that they live in 'a museum', so they misbehave to clients/tourists sometime. Now you have been warned............but it is a safe and very Amsterdam district with beautiful nice shops, beautiful art galeries and delicious resto's. The inhabitants, the origanals have a special 'language' with many Judiac/Jiddiac words. Jordaan comes from the French word: 'jardin'/garden. Upperclass people from teh canalarea loved to speak French and these were the gardens for the innercity, untill.......many refugees came to the (once?) liberal city Amsterdam.
One of the place area of Amsterdam. If you want to discover the most traditional part of Amsterdam you cannot miss to walk in the Jordaan area.that's were local people haver fun !
Great area!. I stayed there in a great apartment and i must add that this area is so close to the city center and a great neighborhood too. it is a quiet part of the city

Living like a local. We enjoyed living in a rented apartment in the Jordaan for a week. We felt like we were locals for a short time and were grateful to be away from the hustle and bustle of the tourist areas in the evening. Yet it's not completely quiet - there are a ton of great restaurants and pubs in the area.
my favourite area of Amsterdam. all times I come to Amsterdam, I go back to this area...so lovely, so lively and colourful!!!a must see if you like bohemian style

Not really noticed the Jordaan before. But went as part of a tour, and really liked the markets, the backstreet homes and alleyways, and the slightly different feel from the rest of the city.Much to see, recommended!

A picturesque neighbourhood nearby the heart of the city. Whether you are out for a stroll or breezing through by bicycle, this is an area often favoured by visitors as all of the streets are clearly picture-friendly. What is nice to have in mind: a clothing market is on every Monday morning and afternoon, called the Noordermarkt, which includes piles of second-hand clothing to sort through, fabric for sewing, used books, and various other antique gems. Every Saturday, the biological and fresh produce market is present. This is something very special to see and taste if you are a foodie! Plenty of cheese to sampled, croquettes to be eaten, flowers to be smelled, and conversations to be enjoyed. Especially a nice visit on a sunny day! Big favourite of the locals who visit each week, and naturally popular with the tourists.
My favorite Amsterdam neighborhood.. If I were to move to Amsterdam this is where I want to live! Cool little shops. Quiet and beautiful at night. Great area to walk and explore.

Amsterdam's most beautiful community!. Got a guided tour through this lovely part of town while doing the "Eating Amsterdam" tour, which primarily takes place in Jordaan. We got to meet a lot of the locals that make this community tick, from the butcher, to the lady behind the drop counter, to the fish monger. I highly recommend taking a stroll around this once working class neighbourhood.

A lovely chilled out area to stroll around. A real Dutch area,Very nice cafe s with friendly local people,lots of hidden secrets when you stroll around,Galleries, Unusual shops,Quaint Streets.Green area too
street with upmarket shops. easily accessible, great place to browse shops and spend time sipping coffee and watching the world go by.

Definite Must. Love this area...super cool and trendy
Lots of people watching, walking around, restaurants and great architecture

Great area for a walk. beautiful area for a walk, nice buildings, shops, and heritage. Not the appearance to be a touristy area, but a local community. We took about an hour to walk thru the area, and enjoyed the time we were there.
Laid Back. The Jordaan felt less touristy than other parts of central Amsterdam. There were lots of fun little streets to explore full of shops and markets.

loved the walk. beautiful homes, nice boats, friendly small local eateries - the walk felt like a heritage walk and yet kids playing, cycling and elderly people basking in the sun added a lively, warm atmosphere. the windowsills in many homes were decorated with taste and effort! the canals were lined with boats that seemed very lived in -in fact saw one with beautiful cats!

dont miss. If you are in Amsterdam, this is the place which you visit , this is the old city of Netherland with the huge history of the city. old people are living here. unique buildings ,,, recommended

A tribute to the oldest Job in the World!. I walked around the RLD during the daytime and found the whole area very interesting and it made me chuckle on several occasions! If I had to liken this place to a Film it would be.... The Good, the Bad and the very very Ugly!! Have fun people!!!
Great area for a wander. An interesting area to wander around, people watching. Many photographic opportunities also, with the picturesque canals. Well worth a visit.

Great area, little quiet. The Jordaan is great, central area. I walked there alone after dark and didn't feel much discomfort (other than coming across the occasional drunk bachelor party... which is common anywhere in Amsterdam). It has a lot of little cafes and restaurants, and of course, there is a maze of canals lined with beautiful houses and bicycles throughout!

Great . We arrived to the neighborhood after visiting Anna Frank house (really close) and really like the atmosphere of the streets, so many shops and restaurants.. Don't come hungry between 15:00-17:00 because all the restaurants were close
A little gem!. This was our favourite area in Amsterdam. A bit quirky, more sedate with great bars and restaurants.
Great Neighborhood. if you are looking for real local and not tourist neighborhood this is the place. many small cafes and restaurants, nice gallerias as well.
loveliest of all the amsterdam. streets, canals and countless coffes all come together to give you great pleasures, we like everything about jordan
Not TOO Trendy. A nice alternative to De Negen Straatjes. Less commercial, very charming, but less to do and see in terms of shops or restaurants.

Nice walk. Walked around the streets for an afternoon and had a very nice time. The canals are beautiful. I watched a big boat drudge the bottom of a canal and pull up hundreds of bikes. Took pictures of beautiful balconies and wandered into art galleries. It is worth the stroll over.

Fav part of Amsterdam. so pretty, quaint, with nice cafes and restaurants. Stayed at a hotel here too called Hotel Von Onna. Walking distance to the centre (10min), but removed enough for peace and quiet.
I don't get it. What is there to see? A place with a few shops? Did I miss something? Skip it to save some time it's not worth it

Nice place for walking and shopping. Good place if you don't have much time but need to shop and grasp a bit of Amsterdam's climate. Lot's of little, traditional restaurants and coffee shops. Some of bars (fast food boxes) sell herrings with an unrepeatable taste - highly recommend.

Very pretty place, if you have time for a walk around the city, stop by!. The Jordaan is a very pretty part of Amsterdam, similar to Greenwich Village in New York. Picturesque and unique considering nearly all streets in Amsterdam are identical. If you have some spare time for a walk around the city, walk through Jordaan and admire the flowers and pretty buildings
It's just a lovely area to walk around. I don't really have anything to add to my review title but tripadvisor insists I write at least 50 characters. It's a nice area. Nuff said.
The knotting hill of Amsterdam. This is clearly the place to stay. Bijou hotels, bistros, small trendy shops, fresh bakerys surround you. Much better then staying in large faceless chain hotels

we didn't take the walking tour but the neighborhood is awesome. We stayed in this neighborhood on our trip. It was awesome. Very traditional neighborhood with lots of great little restaurants, shops, and parks within walking distance. The Ann Frank house is in the neighborhood. Great bus connections to many other attractions or rent a bike and tour the city.
Great wander. Had a great time exploring today. This area has plenty of restaurants and quirky shops. But take a map, really easy to loose your bearings, especially if it cloudy.
Charming Area. An area a bit different from city centre Amsterdam. Definite worth a visit. Very charming and interesting area.

Picturesque and relaxing. Gorgeous lines of houses, shops, restaurants, bars and cafés. All unique and beautiful to look at. Such a relaxed place, can really appreciate your surroundings here. Had some lovely walks along the canals, perfect for taking pictures. Local people were very polite and welcoming. I felt very comfortable and happy here.
Historical area. Very typical dutch peoples leave here, old nordern church is additional part of jordan. your visit in amsterdam will be incomplete without this.
Historical area. old local lives here, big market saturday, people from different cities of Holand visit this place on saturday.there is norden church here, recommended.

Such a beautiful part of town. This is definitely one of those places off the beaten path. It was such a quiet part of town with many quiet communities. There are some amazing restaurants and places to see and I definitely recommend it.
Really beautiful. The Jordaan is a really lovely area of Amsterdam. Great for wandering with some great bars, restaurants and shops.

Pleasant, relaxing place to wander. Jordaan is the once working-class, once radical quarter of Amsterdam. Now gentrified (and expensive) it nevertheless contains a lot of surprises - bars, cafes, coffee shops, shops and interesting and attractive buildings. Just let yourselves wander and take in the sites. Rest assured, if this had been England, it would have been razed to the ground and rebuilt in ghastly 60s concrete (witness St Ebbes in Oxford, destroyed in just such a fashion). Not the Dutch, though.There are, of course, modern buildings, but many, many more old ones, and astonishingly well-preserved ones at that. And the canals that criss-cross the area and indeed the whole city, add to the attraction. Just immerse yourselves (but not in the canals!)
Check your dates. went to visit the street markets on a Wednesday to be told its only Saturday and Monday. Nice area for a stroll which we did.
Nice neighborhood. wonderful coffeeshops, nice small restaurants, very good place to walk on by. I saw a park for children play, the floor was covered with rubber to protect children !

Lovely Residential Area - Good spot for an airbnb apartment. We rented a private apartment, through airbnb, in the Jordaan, and it is a great spot to be based. There are some lovely cafes and markets at the weekend. We had some lovely walks along the canals, it is a world away from Dam Square and the other tourist spots. Check this web site for more places to go in Amsterdam: http://www.cityspotmaps.com/amsterdam.html

Wander the streets of Jordaan and enjoy!. It's just lovely...and quiet. The tourists are in the Red Light District, Dam square, the Museums or Vondel park, which can all be great, but the Jordaan is where you go to get away from all that. Wander around and check out the architecture, the shops, the canals...the beautiful Amsterdam I've come to love. It really is all that!

A pleasant area for a long and interesting walk. After spending a lot of time visiting historic sites and museums, this was a good area for a long, enjoyable walk. There is a good assortment if shops, businesses and architecture. It felt more like a small town with lots of trees and people out and about who were not in a great rush.

Nice for a sunny day!. An elegant neighborhood , full of funky stores, cafes and beautiful people . Many bridges and well preserved houses make you forget the confusion of the red light district. be lost .

Beautiful. If you have time for nothing specific or are on borrowed time, then pick The Jordaan to be your ultimate destination. The place is breathtaking with the views. It is perfect for taking a stroll or even boating and even visiting any of the wide spread restaurants or cafes around the place. I love visiting this place for its charm, view and the people.

Old Amsterdam. This is the place when you want to taste the real local Amsterdam. Small specific shops, galleries, antique shops, "bruin"cafes, old style bakkery. People talk to each other like everybody knows everybody. Someone hangs on the window and talk to the neighbour downstair. A lot of 'hofjes' (courtyard with houses around it) that you usually don't notice it. Many houses with history. Visit this place and stroll in this area, you will love it.

Get Lost in the Jordaan. Get off the Nine Streets (Negenstraat) and get lost in the back streets. This is a great area to get a feel for what it is like living in Amsterdam. Lots of boutique shops, some that never seem to be open but are still interesting to window shop. Great little cafes as well as beautiful architecture and canals. Walking or cycling so much better to explore than fighting it out in the more touristy areas

What a beautiful place. Pretty canals
Beautiful architecture
lovely cafes and shops
Perfect
take walking shoes as this is a place best visited on foot
Very cosy and typical Amsterdam neighborhood. To see and feel real Amsterdam. Also nice little restaurants for eating and drinking. Walk around and look around

Delightful. This is a mainly residential area of Amsterdam, originally the Jewish quarter. Many lovely shops, jewellers, antiques cafes. A delightful area to wander around. The Anne Frank house is across the canal, if you wish to visit this go early, the queues are awful later in the day.

The Jordaan. We used a tourist guide with a walking tour to explain where we were and what we were walking by. What a beautiful way to spend the day! There was a market in the center, and lots of restaurants and coffee shops, one of our favorite days in Amsterdam!

Quiet neighborhood of small shops and restaurants. We stayed in the Jordaan and it felt like we were part of a neighborhood. Families biking with their children, people walking their dogs, etc. Many small, inviting restaurants and cafes.
Awesome!. The homes, the people...the cobbled streets! Both historic and modern at once. Can't wait to return.

Slice of Amsterdam history. The little streets, architecture, great shopping and fantastic dining options make Jordaan a great place to visit. It is also one of the best locations in Amsterdam to stay, with plenty of great accommodation options.

Walk through this neighborhood and enjoy architecture!. This is a great neighborhood which gives you a wonderful understanding of the historical architecture existing in this wonderful city. There are great restaurants in this area as well as hotels.
Mysigt område. An incredibly cozy area in Amsterdam to stroll around in with picturesque houses along the canals and nice little cafés and restaurants. Don't miss out on the markets on Saturdays.

spend a little more time than you planned. I just wished we had longer to linger in Jordaan. Some great vintage shops with different things than the UK - lovely cafes and quirky places to eat. Very picturesque and lovely market on Saturday morning.

How to soak up Amsterdam like a local.. A beautiful area of the city. Lots of cobbled stone, tree lined streets with stunning architecture, tea rooms, vintage shops and opportunities to browse with no pressure.
Soak up the old Amsterdam. if it is just to see a brown cafe and have a beer and a cold gin or just to wander the streets a great place to wander
Lovely. We wandered around on a rainy day, walking in and out of shops. It's what I imagined when I thought of Amsterdam, very quaint and picturesque.
Nice place for a walk on a sunny day. Nice and atmospheric - Take time away from the more crowded areas of the city to enjoy something a bit more bohemian.

picturesque, but not moreso that other areas. This area is quietly picturesque, but not prettier than otherplaces egthe princes canal.its worth a few photos if you are near the area, but I wouldnt spend ages getting there

THE place to stay. This is a wonderful neighborhood. Not touristy. You get a view of how the locals really are.
If you want touristy stuff....hop on a tram or walk. It's very well situated.
If you're there Saturday, visit the street market. Anyone can tell you where it is. Wonderful fun and great street food too.
Enjoy!!

More quiet than main parts. We enjoyed wandering through this pretty area of Amsterdam. More peaceful than a lot of areas and the architecture was very pretty. Lots of small independent shops and eating places.
Wander and soak up this 'gezelig' part of Amsterdam. Lots of interesting little streets, shops and cafes in this part of A'dam. Join in with the locals at places they shop, eat and enjoy.

Beautiful. We loved this location and were so pleased that we chose to book a hotel here. It was very quiet and to wander the streets on a beautiful Autumn day was perfect. The houses here are well kept and very interesting, lots of photo opportunities and there are lots of one-off shops, restaurants and bars. A lovely place to retreat to after a busy day in the town centre.
Great to walk around. Full of small boutique shops and places to eat. Very picturesque. Crammed with interesting buildings.
Enjoy this district. Great place to walk along the canals and enjoy the beauty of the houses, streets and bridges. Lots of nice places to eat and drink.
Nice Area to Walk around in. We went thru this area as we were left the Anne Frank house and we just took our time enjoying the scenary and the area. An area to just enjoy Amsterdam.
Away from the hustle and bustle. Well worth leaving the busy centre and walking or cycling to the Jordaan area, great cafe's, outdoor seating areas, markets on some days too.

Quirky Local Neighborhood. If you're looking for a quiet place to stay that's still close enough to the night life and Red Light District but offers up a more local experience, check out - in fact, just stay in Jordaan. Right near the Anne Frank House and a tram stop away from everything (including Van Gogh, Red Light, and Verzetsmuseum), the Jordaan is the place to stay in Amsterdam. A few streets down you'll find shopping, restaurants, bars, and coffee shops, and with local neighbors out and about all times of day, you can simply ask them to recommend their favorite places. Jordaan is also home of the Electric Ladyland flourescent light museum and the highly-recommended coffeeshop Paradox.
Pretty area. This was a very pretty district but it was marked on my tourist map as a shopping area, I don't think it's great for shopping.
The Jordaan. Favourite part of Amsterdam. Great bars, lovely quiet streets/canals to wander along and friendly locals.
Cozy neighborhood. I have a friend who lives in the Jordaan and I've watched it change over the years. Every time I come back I find a new shop or restaurant to fall in love with.
Best area in Amsterdam. This is the coolest area in Amsterdam, would love to move here. Little boutiques and cafes, all in their unique style makes it perfect for a Sunday stroll
Very pleasant neighborhood. The streets here are quiet and pleasant and there are a number of good restaurants. It's definitety worth exploring!
Take a Walk. Amsterdam is a walk about city and Jordaan is the perfect place to do it. LOts of shops. Many restaurants and few cars
Attractive neighborhood filled with families. Charming, unpretentious area with many fine restaurants and galleries. Make reservations for diner at SeatMe.nl
Love the Jordaan. Quirky shops, quaint streets and lovely eccentric people very pretty and picturesque as well. hire a bike and explore this area you won't be disappointed

Great Neighborhood for Visitors. The Jordaan is a great area in Amsterdam to stay (lots of small hotels) and eat (even more small restaurants) and just stroll around. Life is going on all around you. It's a bit like a calmer version of Greenwich Village, calmer because there is very little car traffic since the streets are extremely narrow and not all that easy to navigate in a car. Bicycles are another matter. They swarm through the streets with little regard (so it would seem) for anyone in their way. It's just the way it is in Amsterdam. My favorite are the cyclists who pedal fast while steering with one hand and doing their iPhone texting with the other. Regardless, the Jordaan is THE neighborhood to stay in Amsterdam so far as I am concerned.

Great walking space. Fun to take a long walk through this unique area. Take a map. Maybe even a compass.The shops and cafes make it worthwhile and you get to see more of the city than you usually would.

Best neighbourhood. A friend living in Amsterdam recommended that we stay in this area, and it was really the best bit of Amsterdam we found, with plenty of canals and pretty buildings. Lots of bridges and bicycles too! We saw it in both sunshine and rain during our stay, and enjoyed it all. Sat out for some great drinks by the canal at T' Smalle, and had great meals in Seasons. Also heavenly apple pie in Cafe Winkel - do it! Very pleasant rainy afternoon spent in the 'Amsterdam Tulip Museum' too. Plenty to stroll around and get lost. Watch out for the bicycles as you're walking along gazing at the sights though!

Great neighborhood. It is trendy, picturesque and has some of the best boutiques and restaurants in Amsterdam. There is a market there on the weekend with great produce, cheese and baked goods. Buy cheese, bread and have a feast on the edges of one of the many canals. Go back at night for a great meal in the cozy restaurants.
Beautiful Quarter. Lovely atmosphere all around, great architecture... even better with good weather. Go to Winkel 43 to some superb apple pie.

Disappointed. Well, we are familiar with the real Greenwich Village in NYC in the 60s. We went out of our way to visit this neighborhood based on the Trip Advisor review but it was not worth it to us.
get lost. Get lost in the Jordaan and discover great beer pubs, restaurants, outstanding food, fascinating shops. Best part of Amsterdam, IMO.

Fun area. Beautiful and quaint area. Lots of bars and restaurants. Lots of shops for unusual gifts. We ended up having dinner in a tapas bar, but there were many other types of restaurants to choose from. Definitely an area to explore.

Nice area, a bit dissapointing. This was one of the places we were waiting to go to. not for shopping but for enjoying a more relaxed and unique place in Amsterdam. overall it was a very nice stroll, and we went through some great and unique shops. It was rather noisy and over-occupied and while we thought we will go through an area full of different and interesting people and shops it looked quite the same as everything else.. it's worth an hour stroll and maybe sit in for a coffee in one of the resturants...
Easy life. I could get used to this way of life, as people are relaxed and just enjoying life. Plenty of sun, riding bicycles and smoking weed.
IAmsterdam. Not really a touristic place, but definetely worth seeing if you want to catch local atmosphere of Amsterdam
Great area. I would stay in this area next time because it is lovely and safe. The Anne Franke house is here and the shops and restaurants are great.
Absolutely Idyllic. Wonderful neighborhood. Less touristy than other areas, and reminds me of Charles Street in Boston, but huge and with canals. If I could move here I would.
Romantic stroll in the Jordaan... beautiful old canal houses..take a break at a café on the canal and enjoy the scenery. Great for a nice walk.

Enjoyable walk in a quiet neighborhood. The Jordaan District is where you find the locals. We thoroughly enjoyed just strolling the neighborhood, walking by the homes, and sitting on the benches watching the water traffic on the canals. While you're here, check out the Anne Frank House since it's in this neighborhood too.

More peaceful than central Amsterdam. This is a very nice area for a stroll. It's not as crowded and frenetic as the centre of the city. Much quieter than the area around Dam Square. We walked from here to the Red Light District and back. It's such a different atmosphere. If you don't like crowds, this is a good area.
Fun shopping. Great neighbourhood - lots of cute shops (expensive) and cafes. Just watch for cyclists and cars speeding by the narrow streets.
popular area. Lots of tourist here, as it is an old and popular area of Amsterdam with interesting architecture, narrow streets, cute canals with boats and bridges.
Lovely part of the city. We actually were lucky enough to stay in the Jordaan and we loved it. It is peaceful, pretty and full of wonderfully creative people. There is much to do and to see.
just lovely. The bes neighbourhood in Amsterdam. Amazing culinary spots in a very cosy and fairytale like atmosphere. Best seen between 18 an 22 hs.
Go to the jordaan. so much to see in the jordaan loved it!the atmposhere is great at weekend and there are so many little cafes and shops to go in and out of

Worth a wander. Lots of shops, art, and . . . the streets seem to embrace you and invite you--in a near romantic way--to just wander. You won't be let down, for sure. Someone is always out, and the window views are cute to amazing.
Fabulous area. Such a diverse collection of shops and restaurants, alongside lovely homes and gardens. Don't miss it.

Trendy and Far from the Madding Crowd. Any visit to Amsterdam needs a stroll around the Jordaan. Away from the hustle and bustle of your typical shopping areas and the Red Light District this area is more laid back with independent shops, some great places to eat and drink and other areas of interest.

Pleasant and peaceful. I found this area to be very nice for a wander. For me, Jordaan is old school traditional Amsterdam and a pleasant and peaceful place to visit for a coffee and lunch. As most things in the Dam, easy to find and get to and it gets you away from the swathes of tourists.

Amsterdam's finest. The best place to stay or just visit, this area is an authentic slice of Dutch life. Lots of shops and pavement cafés, street organ players and flea markets. It's a quiet retreat from the busier parts of the city.

always pretty. .. and, of course, it costs nothing to wander around and take in the pretty houses and canals. Take your time and look at the
gable ends and the frescoes.
Trendy area. Lots of art shops and restaurants. A nice place to roam around. We had a delicious apple pie in Winkels - give it a try!!
Nice Area. Nice area to stroll around away from the most of the other tourists. Plenty of nice shops and boutiques.

The best part of Amsterdam. This is the most picturesque part of Amsterdam, and the only place I want to stay anymore when I come in for a stay. I love the charming canals, streets, bars, and restaurants.
Definitely worth a visit. We spent several hours wandering around this area - looking at the shops, buildings and then just sitting in a cafe along the canal banks.
A real discovery tour. Shops, cafes, architecture and a sense of what a city can be. Worth the effort to stroll about. Take your time and enjoy.

Very pretty area. Nice shops, cafes and restaurants in this area. We visited on a lovely sunny day so we saw it at its best. Lots of things going on in this working area, lots of graphics and the like. Really enjoyed it. Has some lovely looking restaurants but only went into one bar and one coffee shop.
Charming place!. Some really old canal houses, a houseboat museum and some great little galleries, shops and cafes, it's a must see whilst in Amsterdam.
Very nice shopping venue. Not a "must see" but worth a stroll if you have time. Some very unique shops worth visiting. I was impressed with the number of owner / artist shops.

Best part of Amsterdam. The Jordaan is a beautiful part of the city. It has independent, quirky shops, cafes, bars and restaurants. Wander along the canal banks and get lost - it's the best way to stumble across fantastic places. The buildings colourful and interesting. We loved it here.

A stylish area to counter the crappy red light district!. We just wandered from street to street, bouncing off one canal to another and criss- crossing blindly, past cosy cafes and classy boutiques. No two streets are the same, each having its own unique character and aura. A lovely area to spend a couple of hours. Our favourite cafe lies in its southern part - Festina Lente!
Beautiful area.. A lovely area to take a walk, the houses and little shops are beautiful. You can stroll for hours along the canals and the narrow streets.

lovely neighborhood to meander around. lovely little neighborhood to just wander the streets and meander with no direction or purpose in mind. Visited here while visiting the Anne Frank Haus. Lots of shops, cafes, and quaint little flower gardens adoring windows of houses. Seemed like a quiet little oasis somehow.
Interesting. Don't miss a walk in the once workers quartier: interesting and pleasant, quiet and partially historical, mostly regarding the buildings along the canals.

Fantastic district close to Amsterdam centre.. Beautiful houses, great restaurants and fashion a plenty. right in the middle of the canal region. Very laid back close to the hub of Amsterdam. Rental accommodation is readily available and of a high standard - not hotel service but great none the less.
Well worth a wander. Liked the number of independent shops to stroll around. Good stops for coffee and cake. Close to Nine Street shopping area
Neighborhood fair. We visited upon a recommendation from staff at Cafe Remember and were there the weekend of a neighborhood fair. Music, food, shopping, drinks and coffee. Great local experience
Great historic area with good restaurants. This is an area to just relax and have a beer and stroll through a historic neighborhood. Its quiet and not crowded.

Fantastic area to hang out in. walk, sit, drink, eat, shop... feel the architecture of the old world. I loved the canal boats going through everything. this city is alive with fresh new art and design... dig for it. don't be a tourist!

my favourite part of amsterdam. the last time i was in the city i had only little time for walks so i had to choose where to go. the jordan was first on my list.
really beautifull part of amsterdam, with all the canals and a boheme atmosphere

Quiet area worth walking around. We followed Rick Steve's walking tour of the Jordaan neighborhood and enjoyed the architecture, canals, shops and restaurants. Definitely worthwhile to explore this area, especially on a nice day.

Beautiful place for a walk. The Jordann neighborhood is one of those previously run-down areas that has been gentrified into a hip and trendy place. We took a wonderful stroll from Dam Square into and through the Jordann and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Lots of young people zooming around on bikes, scenic canals, outdoor cafes and beautiful homes. And a tip, if you're going to the Anne Frank House it's almost in the middle of the Jordann so you can combine a walk with that important house (but get tickets online in advance)!
Old Amsterdam. This area was very pretty with all the little shops and cafes . Each one had a picturesque view of a canal to enjoy some sun , a view and a good beer or coffee.
Must see neighborhood. We stayed in Jordaan and loved this neighborhood. If you are visiting amsterdam be sure to get away from Dam square and all the tourists and see this locals neighborhood !

Cute. Cute town, but I think a bit overrated. Very, very small area that would draw tourists. A main street sprinkled with cute little restaurants and shops, and quite a few second-hand and vintage stores. Some really nice jewelry stores and good ice cream, but I wouldn't spend more than an hour browsing there.

A place to relax. Amsterdam is a busy, hectic city but this neighbourhood provides a sense of quiet and relaxation. Following a walking guide is helpful as there are so many interesting homes and vistas.

Lovely neighbourhood. We enjoyed walking around this neighbourhood and exploring the restaurants and shops available here. It is a pretty and quiet neighbourhood on the canals and we recommend a stroll through here.

Pretty little district. 'Up and coming' said the guidebooks- not sure if we went to the wrong area but it was lacking in people and looked much the same as other parts of Amsterdam. It was pretty enough with its old canalside houses but nothing special!
Probably the best neighbor near Amsterdam Cent.. This was the best Amsterdam neighbor I've visited. Quiet, at least compared to the touristy RD and really beautiful streets & canals.

Absolute delight!. This is a wonderful neighborhood, so pretty and unique. Flowers on stoops, canals, farmers' market: a combination and feel unlike any other I've ever seen. Amsterdam is very cool, and The Jordaan district seems to be the coolest of the cool.
Instructive. Beautifully laid out and explained, but missing a lot of famous of his paintings which are in other museums.

This IS amsterdam!. The Jordaan is a great neigbourhood, famous for its local singers. When you are walking around in these streets you get the perfect amsterdam experience. The local bars are very special and all food options available.
Beautiful traditional area.. Lovely traditional Area - very close to Anne Frank House, beautiful unusual boutique shops. Take a few hours to wonder around the back streets.

Nice area of Amsterdam. It was very nice walking around the area, sitting in little cafes, enjoying the beautiful canals, and seeing all the people. Much mellower than other parts of the city and well worth a visit.
Best place to stay. Quiet but interesting, a lovely vibe - very chic - real Amsterdam, not the touristy invention around the flower market - if you are looking for a real experience - stay here...
Jordaan. The songs that only belong to the "Jordaan", the small neighborhood cafe's, their own language and manners, as if they have their own world within this world

Quirky area. A very picturesque area,with nice shops, restaurants and cafés everywhere . We stayed on a houseboat and it was so good to be right on the water - albeit noisy at nightie there is a doo at the local bar

Cozyness (gezelligheid) amongst the colorful locals. Enjoy an authentic AMS experience by combining Jenever (the local gin-like drink chased with a draft beer), Andre Hazes (folk singer), and conversation with the colorful locals (soccer is a great opening topic!) and you're in for a Brown Cafe night to remember!!! Cheers!!!

Our favorite area of Amsterdam. Amsterdam has a lot to offer and most of it seemed to be in the Jordaan area for us. We kept finding ourselves back here in this quaint neighborhood. Even did the Jordaan Food Tour with Eating Amsterdam Tours. Great shops, great restaurants, away from the blight of the redlight district.
Wonderful. What a great area to explore. We wandered around all the streets and canals and were not disappointed. It's a beautiful part of the big city of Amsterdam and worth a visit.
Great Area. A wonderful representation of Amsterdam. A beautiful and classic neighborhood and a must see for all visitors. Our hotel was in the Jordan so very easy and convenient. Loved it!
Cozy place to walk around. Stayed in Jordan and I am glad we did. Very cozy to walk around it esp in the evenings. Lots of restaurants, cafes, bars and attractions. Would love to visit again.

Pretty part of Amsterdam to stay at or just walk through. this gentrified former working class are provides many canals old houses and pretty views. Accommodation such as Jackie O's is also in the Jordaan and recommended.
Just beware of bicycles and especially motorcycles as many do not obey road rules or common courtesy. Unfortunately they can spoil the peace of this nice area ( and the rest of Amsterdam).

Fun neighborhood and a lovely relaxing stroll. We spent an afternoon wandering through this area of Amsterdam, enjoying the canals, houseboats, wonderful architecture and having a lovely lunch at a cafe overlooking a canal. Really charming and a wonderful way to spend some time seeing a charming city!

Feeling at home again. Absolutely loved the atmosphere and haveing been born in Amsterdam but living in Australia, I always regard Amsterdam as my home. Love the canals, buildings and friendly people. I can sit on a terrace and dream for ever or ride a pushbike and feel safe.....
Old area of Amsterdam. Jordaan area is worth seeing after you have examined Amsterdam canals. Also having old buildings but still differs from what you can see along canals.
Local beauty. I was charmed the picturesque views of Jordaan.The streets are impeccably clean and original.The fine fronts of houses.Silence and quiet.
Good place to explore. Walked the Jordan and enjoyed the shops and variety of restaurants and cafes. Definitely worth strolling the area and stopping to grab a coffee.

Nothing much going on. Nothing much to do here really. Worth a wander for 30 minutes or so but there really isn't much going on. Across the water from Anne Frank's house, so you may end up here anyway, but I wouldn't devote masses of time to it.
Not much to see. I had heard great things about this area on trip advisor but was thoroughly disappointed. What's everyone going on about? Would definitely give this attraction a miss

The coziest canal neighbourhood!. The Jordaan area of Amsterdam is where you can find the more narrow canals of the city.
There's a mix of small businesses, shops, coffee bars and several tiny art galleries.
Make sure you're wearing good walking / hiking shoes because the sidewalks in these streets often aren't in the best of shape.
Unique neighbourhood. !Wonderful area where the locals hang out, many good places to eat, Not as touristy as other neighbourhoods, great place to walk and people watch

Beautiful area..... I found myself in this area a lot while riding the bike. I really enjoyed it. Especially at night when the streets was quiet. There is a couple of buildings worth taking night photos of. When I go back, I plan on asking some locals where some hidden gems are located.

Amsterdam's very own Chelsea. I was pleasantly surprised at the amount of decent art galleries and shops in this very hipster-like area. Very pleasant for a walk and viewing because the prices of the artworks were well beyond my student budget.
Great safe fun neighborhood. It was fun to walk around and see local unique shops. I really enjoyed the winding roads and restaurants in this neighborhood. Just watch out for bikes

Lovely. A beautiful area and somewhat refreshing from the very different feel of the red light district!
A highly recommended place to spend half a day - plenty to do and some very nice places to eat.

My favorite part of the world. I always stay here when I'm in Amsterdam and that's at least 4 times a year! Very beautiful, tranquil, clean place. A typical Dutch neighborhood with amazing canal views.. Also a great place to be at during events like Kings day, gay parade or New Years eve. Lots of fireworks, canal boat shows and parties. Expensive to reside there but worth it and I really hope to relocate here some day. It's just magical.
Cool area. lots of restaurants / cute streets to explore. two main streets are the best to travel down. Sometimes there are musicians on the weekend

A Village Inside a City. We rented a canal house for a week in Jordaan and truly felt a part of the real Amsterdam experience. Living in the old city, you feel like you are in a village not a major city. We were able to walk to all the major attractions and had a great variety of shops and restaurants to choose from. We loved strolling along the different canals as we went on our way. It is also very close to the train station if you want to do day trips or take the train to and from the airport.

The best neighborhood of Amsterdam.. I loved this area. Me and my girlfriend had great walks around the small streets and the canals. Near the 9 streets was amazing. We had great coffe and paninis at the sourounding caffees and bought a lot of stuff, from vintage clothing and home accessoires to second hand toys and baby clothes for my nephew. Great place that you MUST visit while being in Amsterdam
Pretty. Very relaxing and pretty area that is filled with exquisite shopping and restaurants. Worth visiting.
Active and fun but not crazy. Beautiful gabled buildings along canals. Small shops and some very good restaurants. But watch out for the bikes that do not yield right of way.
cute district. Cute district, nothing special about it. So I can't understand why it is here regarded as a touristic attraction.

If you don't know where to eat.... ... just walk around in Jordaan for a few minutes. There's a great choice of all kinds of restaurants and bars and it's also worthwhile just to take a walk in the neighborhood. It also feels miles away from Amsterdam's city centre, as it is more relaxed and not as loud and exciting.

Great neighborhood. Great area to go wander through if you're trying to get away from the majorly touristy areas of the rest of the city. Plenty of shops and bars. If you're in the area stop by Universe on a shirt. Cute little boutique and the owner is a sweetheart!

Best Food at Best Prices. Dining in the Jordaan is an absolute must. A vast array of restaurants at affordable prices. It is a residential area, therefor pretty quite and very safe. Some very quaint little shops as well, even if you are just window shopping.
A great neighborhood to visit. This section of Amsterdam has a lot of activity. There are numerous shops, bars and restaurants and it is away from the main tourist places.

Heavenly walk around the Jordaan. I could spend hours gazing at the architecture, looking into the beautiful homes and admiring the canals in the Jordaan. one of my favorite places in the world to get lost...

Ab fab. One of those amazing neighborhoods like Le Marais or Chueca, but of course, with its own unique soul. A mixture of laid-back, hipster, good-way-retro and fancy areas with lovely shops, silent and busy streets, bakeries and ice-cream parlors, absolutely lovely to spend an afternoon or get lost in. Sometimes on the edge of scary, but totally innocent in the next moment, you're going to love it.And don't forget to watch people.

Lovely Area for a Wander. This is a lovely part of Amsterdam. Lots of little boutiques/shops (9 streets) and restaurants & bars. There is a market at the northern end but is is usually over by 2pm. Three canals Prinsengracht, Kiezersgracht, Herengract run through this area all of which are very pretty & peaceful making it a lovely place to just wander.

You can walk around for hours. Jordan is an absolutely amazing place. I lived there for 4 years and I never got tired of just walking around with my dog in the area. Beautiful and quaint, its the perfect place to spend a day. Cute little shops, markets on saturdays and tuesdays (at least when I lived there) endless of Brown Cafes and a wonderful atmosphere. Enjoy!

Nice city stroll outside of the city. To be perfectly honest, I was underwhealmed. A visit to Jordaan gives you a much better feel for Amsterdam outside of Old and New Town and the channels/houses are indeed pitoresque. However, it's still just a bunch of houses. :)

Boutique shops and canal side bars. A beautiful area of the city with hidden spots and fabulous canal-side bars. A great place to come to sit and enjoy a beer and some bitterbollen and watch the world go by.

Such a lovely and charming quarter of Amsterdam. Leave the modern busy main station behind you and walk the nine streets, roam around in small shops and enjoy many many coffee breaks. Colourful, charming and relaxed this reflects true Amsterdam, atmosphere is appealing.

our favorite in Amsterdam. If we visit Amsterdam ( only 40 minutes from home) , always walking through the Jordaan. Visiting antique shops, sitting on a terras , eating somewhat, enjoying the canals. We always so happy , when visiting

One of the best part of Amsterdam. I like Jordan, the neighborhood is nice, easy going with good restaurants, pubs and flee-markets and café. This is so much better than the touristic part of Amsterdam, which is so boring and awful.
So I would book a hotel close to Jordan, I would shop in the small shops there and just walk around discovering the neighborhood.

A vacation within a vacation. The area of the city has everything --and it's local, quiet nature gets you away from the 'touristy' areas while providing excellent places to eat, shop and enjoy the cool vibe of Amsterdam. We visited the area a few times over the course of our stay and always found something different to excite the senses!

Great nightlife. This area is charming and has the most quaint collection of bars I've found in Amsterdam. It's fantastic for strolling the canals and enjoying many a pint at all the local watering holes.
Lovely. Fab part of Amsterdam a must visit interesting and laid back got a good vibe to it. Not over busy nice place to stroll around.
Full of life.. The streets are alive. Walk and walk and walk to enjoy what the neighborhood has to offer. Charming and more.

Loved the Jordaan. We booked a small apartment next to one of the canals in the jordaan and had a lovely couple of days wandering around the local area. It was fantastic to chill out in such a lovely place, it was very quiet but close to the buzz of the bars, restaurants etc. So nice to get out of the touristy vibe of the centre and walk/cycle round here

Gorg part of town. This is a great part of town, great to wander around, grabbing coffee and seeing the unique boutique shops all over the place. Really quirky but as all over Amsterdam, watch out for the bikes!
Nice neighborhood!. A lot of cozy restaurants and a very good place to walk around. Near to the channels it´s even better. Nice neighborhood.

Quaint and Quiet streets with excellent shopping!. A great neighborhood of Amsterdam that's not as touristy so it allows you to enjoy a stroll without all of the hustle and bustle. Very similar to NYC's Greenwich Village, with narrow, cobble stoned streets and lot's of great little bars restaurants and boutique shops around.

Self-guided walk in the Jordann. We used Rick Steves book about The Netherlands to guide us through this neighborhood. We had such a great walk that we returned another evening for dinner. This neighborhood offers really great views of Westerkerk and the canals. The area is quite lively too with all of the outdoor seating.
A trendy cosmopolitan area. Great bars, restaurants and independant shops make this area a great place to visit for quirky one off buys and trendy bars were the hipsters hang out.
Quintessential Amsterdam. This is such a beautiful part of town. We rented bicycles and rode through the streets. Must do! Check out De Prins cafe, too.
For locals. Its a lovely traditional Dutch bar and is known especially for the Dutch music they play there. For foreigners its nice to see but don't expect to know any of the songs...

Good for a visit. We wanted to go to a shopping place a bit out of the center of the city. Well we found it. Not very spectacular but this was not what we were looking for. Just a little bit of shopping away from the the bustle of the general shopping areas. It was ok but I guess that there are a lot of other areas that are just as good.

Pretty neighbourhood. Pretty neighbourhood with some cute shops but I wouldn't go out of my way to do this area thoroughly ie. walking through the alleyways and deeper into the neighbourhood unless you were visiting Amsterdam for 4+ days. If you're visiting Anne Frank, go for a walk along Prinsenger Canal which is the outskirts of this area for the buildings and canal shots. If you do make a point to go Jordaan, make sure you try and find this ice cream place that the locals go to called Monte Pelmo on Tweede Anjeliersdwarsstraat 17 and they make great ice cream for 1.50 euro for a scoop on a cone.

A quiet and stylish Oasis in Amsterdam. My husband and I wandered the streets around the Jordaan area for a few hours. We loved that the streets weren't full of tourists and you didn't feel caught up in the hustle of normal city life. The area is filled with design stores, cafes, bookstores and other little pop ups. I'd recommend spending half a day just enjoying window-shopping and watching the world go by.
We lived there the second time.... ... and it is nothing but nice. Beat to centrum, nice colorful people, good infrastructure and shops. If you can get a roof over your head here you wont regret!
Nothing amazing. not quite like Greenwich village like they say - its a pretty area but nothing amazing. would really waste too much time to wonder round this area
Charming area. Slightly away from the busier areas, this part of Amsterdam feels much more relaxed and has some interesting looking houses, as well as some upmarket looking restaurants
Great shopping. Away from the run of the mill boutiques which provided a realistic view of Amsterdam. It was lovely to get away from all the brands that you see elsewhere. The area had character.

Didn't blow me away. Pretty much everyone I talked to and every guide book I read raved about the Jordaan, so naturally I had to visited.Sure, it's a nice area with some quirky shops and good cafes/restaurants, but I didn't think it was amazing.Perhaps it's worth a look if you're in no rush, but i didn't think there was anything particularly noteworthy or memorable to see.
Cool neighbourhood. Unfortunately was not snowing when i went there, i bet it's even better and magical, you have some options to eat and drink, another must on the city

Great for a stroll.. First, nearly all the upper portion of Amsterdam is touristy. However, there are spots that are less so and this can be one. It is a great area to find small shops and cafes and see great views along the canals. The architecture is excellent in this area as well. Take your time and I think you will find many somewhat hidden treasures.

Lovely neighborhood. Beautiful residential area with hidden treasures if you are willing to explore beyond the usual touristic area. Found a lovely antique shop and local eateries that were well worth the experience!

Beautiful in the winter and in the summer. The pictures do not relate exatly what your eyes see! The place is wonderful, specially in the srping, when many flowers color the street. Take care with the bikes, because you are going to stop many times do appreciate the view!

Charming Streets and Interesting Shops. Worth a couple hours of your time to explore the charming streets and interesting shops. Also appreciated the shady parts of the street as it was very warm afternoon.

It was our favorite part of Amsterdam. We stayed near the Jordan at Le Quartier Sonang and walked there several times during our one week stay. I couldn't get enough of the wonderful little shops and local cafes surrounding the canals. From the Jordan, the next section is filled with little shops, heading back into the central Dam part of town. Just walk it, enjoy it, and if you get tired, take a water taxi or tram back. You can't get lost in Amsterdam.
Old Amsterdam. Quaint area of Amsterdam.lots to see and eat and drink and watch people go by.usual old Dutch architecture

Best area in Amsterdam. Artsy neighborhood with plenty of cafes, restaurants, shopping and beautiful scenery. Walking distance to many attractions and quite safe. Best neighborhood in Amsterdam in opinion!
Beating heart of Amsterdam. A beautifull part of the center of Amsterdam. Trendy shops, nice bars, restaurants and lots of culturale events. A must!
Jordaan. Still a charming, diverse area [30 years since my last visit] and one of the few areas that has kept its character. A delight to walk around and explore.

A beautiful area of real Amsterdam. Plan to stroll around the Jordaan and get lost. Check out the hidden courtyards of the beautiful 17th century alms houses. Respect the residents - people still live in them - but do check out these lovely tranquil hidden gardens.

A good neighborhood to discover, there's something for everyone.. We did a small walking tour based on the one here. It was raining heavily so took our time as we ran for cover every few minutes. A good few attractions but the best parts were the streets by the canal, nice places to sit and eat n drink , and some fab design shops for home products and clothes on Haarlemstraat. A must do in Amsterdam.
Great neighborhood. Neighborhood very pleasant walk, a lot of cafes, designer shops, beautiful homes. We walked quite a bit of rain and yet very much enjoyed.

Like Hayes Valley in SF. Lots of quirky little lifestyle shops, boutiques, and eateries. Loved it.We visited around 7pm, though, so many shops were closed and most restaurants weren't busy yet. Go earlier or later.

Nice part of Amsterdam. After seeing the que to Anne Frank's house, we decided to return another time and walked up a little further into the Jordaan. We found a lovely cafe and stopped to have a coffee and a croissant (or two!) Lovely buildings and a great atmosphere.
Good restaurants far between.. We were told to go here to eat. However, be prepared to walk distances between restaurants. Good for bars.
Nice neighborhood. nice walking there and look at all the old hoses, many nice restaurants, would recomend to get of the dirty streets down town and take a look at The Jordan

Beautiful area of Amsterdam - hidden gem side streets. Recently stayed in an apartment in the area of Jordaan and absolutely fell in love with it. Every way you turn you come across another picturesque street full of trendy bars, restaurants and independent shops selling everything from art, clothes, homeware, gifts etc. We spent 2 days exploring as many of the streets in this area as we could and i'd love to go back in the future as there was still a lot that we didn't get to see. If you are spending some time in Amsterdam and want to be away from the hustle and bustle and rowdy central area id recommend staying in the Jordaan. if you want to spend some time in the centre its an easy 15/20 minute walk so you get the best of both worlds!
Interesting Walk. We walked around this area and almost got lost! Interesting architecture and neighborhood with quite a few restaurants and shops. Lovely canals.
Lovely part of Amsterdam. Quiet residential streets, lots of photo opps with the sounds of Westerkerk carillon in background. Plenty of restaurants and shops.
Pretty!. I stayed at this neighborhood: pretty place to walk around and smell the typical local activity. Cute small shops. Not a great place to eat at, though.

Thoroughly enjoyed living in this neighbourhood. My girlfriend and I stayed for 6 days in this beautiful quiet neighbourhood of Amsterdam. This neighbourhood really gives you the best of both worlds; quiet and authentic while being close to dam sq and many popular attractions.

Cosy but too crowded. The Jordaan is full of bars, restaurants and nice shops, but what I like most is just strolling through the canals and small streets and enjoy the cosy atmosphere. Don't miss the biological market on Saturdays.

Such a lovely part of Amsterdam. We only had to walk a short way from the hustle and bustle and this was such a contrast. So quiet and peaceful - beautiful houses and little streets with very interesting shops.
Great for walking. A really great area to look at some great architecture and better restaurants than the main tourist areas.

A very pretty, quiet area. Stumbled into the Jordaan neighbourhood by accident but am so glad we did! Very pretty typical Amsterdam canal setting with quirky and small local shops. Great for pictures and if you want a relaxing way to spend the morning/ afternoon!

As good as it gets in Amsterdam. I've been to Amsterdam a number of times and stayed in several locations in the city. The Jordaan offers the best of everything: very near the center but blissfully quiet. Great restaurants representing everything AMS offers: brown cafés, higher end Dutch food, Thai, Indonesian. As much nightlife as you'd like including highly reviewed coffeeshops. Cute shops. I'm not sure there are hotels proper in the neighborhood BUT there are apartments to rent and that's what we did. and you should too, when you have a chance.
peace and quiet. This area of Amsterdam is a complete contrast to the busier tourist areas, quiet streets and canals, restaurants.

Lovely neighborhood. This is a beautiful old neighborhood with old homes that are of modest size in comparison to many other canal streets in Anmsterdam. It is shady and quiet with the feeling that people really work and live here. We very much enjoyed strolling the lovely streets of the Joordan area.
Beautiful Amsterdam Area. Nice area to walk around in amsterdam, the canals in the jordaan area are also very beautiful, lots of small shops around there and great restaurants
Fantastic. Great district lots of bars and cafés shops, fun time walking around relaxing outside cafés people watching

Awesome neighbourhood. This is a really trendy, local neighbourhood full of atmosphere, quirky and nice shops, and probably the nicest restaurants in town! A great alternative to the touristy centre of town.

The Jordaan ~ Amsterdam, The Netherlands. Took in the peaceful ambience of this charming neighborhood on foot. Dotted with canals and historic 17th century architecture, this upscale locale is home to many art galleries, specialty shops and restaurants. Most streets and canals in this district are appropriately named after trees and flowers ~ for it offers plenty of shade and window boxes in full bloom. We strolled past quaint inner courtyards, bicycles leaning against ivy-covered walls and a horse & buggy clopping down cobblestone streets. If you're looking for a relaxing respite from bustling Amsterdam, The Jordaan is worth a visit!
Beautiful!!!!!!!. Beautiful neighbourhood! Walking around here is a must! Very romantic and very relaxing. There are some nices places to eat next to the canals

Jordaan Neighborhood is a beautiful stroll.. While discovering the incredible streets of Amsterdam you must go to this neighborhood. Take a leisurely walk through Amsterdam's most beautiful and storied residential neighborhood—the Jordaan (pronounced Your-Dahn). This 2.5-mile walk will guide you through hidden courtyards, cozy cafes, beautiful canals and 17th and18th century architecture.

Great Area in the City. The Jordaan is a wonderful neighborhood. It was great cafes, lots of local charm with bikes and wonderful places to explore everywhere. Its actually my favorite part of the City to stay. The only problem with the neighborhood and, in fact with all of Amsterdam, is the fact that its gotten very dirty.. lots of litter and trash everywhere. I cut my foot on one of the many bits of broken glass that are left after outdoor parties along the canals. They really could do with more trash cans and should pick up the trash a bit more often.. Other than that, its a great City.. and the Jordaan is a wonderful vibrant part of it..

One of the most fun neighborhoods. Jordaan is undoubtedly one of the most visited and popular neighborhoods in Amsterdam. The place has a whole lot of restaurants, cafes and shops for dining and shopping. The place can be enjoyed with a little bicycle ride or a simple stroll through the neighborhood. With the canal and the streets aligned along it, this place is unmatched in its character and aura.
Home. Stayed in this area for a few days, and we love it. Nice people and its quiet. Try to find a B&B to stay in and you will get the true feeling of the area. Felt like home to us.

Wonderful neighborhood. We spend four nights in the Jordaan and loved it. Canals and bicyclists everywhere, cozy streets, lots of cafes, close to the central train station, and the neighborhood just oozed character. We stay in the area again without question.
Lovely streets. Take your time and wander off the beaten track and you will find quirky houses and empty local brown bars.

Excellent Restarants. A charming neighborhood of small shops and excellent restaurants. Like other neighborhoods in the old city of Amsterdam, most of the streets are pedestrian only which creates a thoroughly pleasant environment. A bit off the beaten track so not so crowded as some other areas of the city.

Wandering around!. I wandered around the little streets in the Jordaan area all by myself and it was delightful! Charming and fun to stroll around. However the 9 straatjes(streets) I found was way charmer!LOVE Amsterdam and it's people! Would have loved to have lived there in my youth, must be fun!
Quiet but trendy neighborhoods. Enjoyed the cafes by the canals and seeing the trendy shops. The residential streets, especially those bordering the canals are charming. Fun to stroll through.
cool area. this is a very nice zone where you can find cosy concept stores, very good location for design shoping,
