It is a part of the city where the real full-blooded original Amsterdammers live and stay living.It is a fun, lively, friendly, and historic folks-suburb.The "negen straatjes" in the Jordaan is definitely a part one should visit. These are nine streets filled with all kind of nice, exceptional and local shops.It is also apart of the city well known for its "bruine" cafés, bars and good restaurants.In my opinion it is the best place to shop, eat and drink and meet the local folks.
Great place to whizz around on a bike. We went around on a bike on New Year's Day. Lots of trendy shops and coffee bars etc. Worth a visit if you have the chance

Quaint area in which to watch the world go by. More residential than other parts of Amsterdam. Small bars to sit and enjoy hot chocolate and gluhwein in winter (sure just as good in summer when the sun shines too). Fascinating flea market on Saturdays with everything from old books to a fur coat!
The garden. amazing architecture and a beautiful area, we went through on a canal boat, the view from this perspective is definitely something to see.
Creatina placebo to shop. Great and exclusive shops with lots of nice design gifts. From chocolates to shoes and clothes. Fantastic antiques, and new fashion clothes.
Trendyish area full of shops aplenty. Nice part of AmDamLoads of bars n cafesGreat if your visiting Anne Frank HouseSome pretty houses to view too

Explore the city. Wander through Jordan's canals, bridges, and beautiful Dutch architecture. You can spend days just walking around and exploring the city. Don't forget to stop at some pubs for a pint or some fresh mint tea.

For wandering. Come to wander. Start on any small street and wander without purpose or clear destination dictating your steps. There are beautiful small quiet streets to take in, bridges to pass over, house boats to admire. Wander in the early hours for solitude and time to think or wander in the afternoon and pop in and out of the shops that nestle in among the streets.
brilliant!. well worth a visit! keep you entertained for hours!!wear flat shows though or your feet might ache haha
Bridges. biking in Jordan is adventure for it self...Nice houses,house boats, bridges, flowers....amazing. No crowd, no traffic, just bikes
lol. funny and interesting place to go with many attractions and places of interest. Don't leave the city without seeing this neighborhood
Great walk, wonderful place to get lost.. Great neighborhood with wonderful architecture along the canals. Mostly residential, peaceful, quiet, great small eating establishments.
Great market. We had a wander around this area and went to the Monday morning market. It was great fun and full of characters. Lots of quirky shops around
Love. I'll just say this, leave room in your suitcase and be ready to fall in love. The Jordaan made me want to move there! Amazing people in the Jordaan!

Lovely shops and atmosphere. We so enjoyed meandering the streets, soaking up the atmosphere and meeting the people. We also went to the textile market, a must, but make sure you have loads of room in your suitcase!

The place. Forget the touristy Red Light, this is the real Amsterdam and although expensive in places is where lovers fall in love and painters paint. Bars, restaurants, sites, museums, nightlife, shops, canals, stunning houses.

Delightful Neighbourhood in the heart of the City. I wandered for hours along the canal and side streets in this wonderful neighbourhood. Beautiful architecture, unique shops, coffee and pastry places and restaurants.

Pleasant. There are many wonderful walks along the canals in Amsterdam. Jordaan is one option, although we preferred Herengracht and Kaisersgracht, where you can also visit a canal house with stables and restored rooms.
Old Neighbourhod. I walked through the neighborhood and I did not noticed anything special about it except housing with nice flowers surrounded.
Nothing special. . We didnt find anything special about this area. Walked all that way to see it, and the view was the same as anywherw else in the city. Disapointing.
Real old Amsterdam. Here is where you will find great shops and the most realistic Amterdammers. There is nothing to dislike about the Jordaan
Charming neighbor. Rent bikes and cycle through this charming neighborhood. Historical sites and small museums as well as residential side streets, flea markets and farmer's markets.

Love the neighborhood. This is a wonderful walking exploring neighborhood. There is always something/someplace that needs to be explored in the neighborhood. Markets, historic sights, interesting homes, museums the list goes on.
Great place to stroll and shop. The Jordaan has some excellent vintage shopping. Lots of good restaurants to check out and it is a lovely area to stroll through beautiful houses, shops and canals.

Viewed by water. An area well worth exploring on foot, I did it by canal, hiring a low boat which went places other canal boats could not reach. Jordan is full of little canals, streets, shops and interesting things t see.

It was ok.... Was planning on walking the whole thing but it was just stalls after stalls of the same thing on the flea market so we stopped after a couple of streets. It was ok but I would pass in the future when I go back.

Great District. Jordaan District is a lovely neighborhood and a wonderful place to stay when visiting Amsterdam. There is a beautiful architecture and great shops, and restaurants. We stayed at Van Onna hotel on Bloemgracht which is a short distance to walk almost anywhere.
Pleasent stroll. Stayed in this area and had a nice leisurely stroll around the streets around here,A Lovely part of Amsterdam.
A Dutch walkabout!. Pleasant, mellow and engaging.A lovely traditional setting to enjoy at your leisure.The Nooder market is worth visiting on a Saturday

Get lost in the streets of this Neighborhood!!. The streets are magical and full of surprises, get to mingle with the locals have a beer or grab some coffee in one of the local shops and just watch people walk by. Its awesome to see all the bicycles and how people live in Amsterdam. This place made us fall in love with Amsterdam and walking through these streets was one of the best highlights of our trip.

Lindengracht market, Bratworst, apple pie and oysters. Every Saturday My Thai girl friend and I do the following. Think you will enjoy it as well.Every Saturday on the Lindengracht is a street market. Beside the usual inexpensive items you don't need (and some you do) are some things that are just delicious.First we go to a place where you can get a freshly cooked Bratwurst (sausage) in a roll with sauerkraut. or a Freshly cooked ham sandwich. In the winter they also have a Dutch pea soup and in summer fresh Salmon. just great food and you are delightfully filled for 3.50 Euros.From there we go to the first corner (prinsengracht) after loading up on veggies, nuts, and many other goodies and go to the brown cafe on the corner with the best apple pie in Amsterdam. It is nicer in the summer because everyone is outside but in the winter you get to meet the locals who crowd the place all day.Don't believe me Bill Clinton has been there too. and from there. you walk to the other market whose name escapes me but it is less then 100 feet from the apple pie. This market is different because everything has to be natural no additives no preservatives just fresh food.Here we each have 3 fresh and wonderful oysters and load up on the most wonderful mushrooms and fresh goat cheese along with many other delicacies you can only find.On Saturday mornings we don't have breakfast because of the feasts we are about to have at the market. Truly a highlight of our weekends in Amsterdam. And if you don't like any of the things I mentioned am sure you will find others you will.Join the rest of Amsterdam in this wonderful treat. Below it asks when we went but it is such a regular happening for us we go every weekend we are in Amsterdam. It also asks what kind of visit this was. This is for everyone kids old people by yourself or in a group but not a big group.

Best place to stay when visiting Amsterdam. This lovely neighborhood is a wonderful place to stay when visiting Amsterdam. It is close to major attractions such as the Anne Frank House, the Saturday market at the Noorderkerk, the theatre where the improv troupe Boom Chicago has its shows, as well as great shops and restaurants. It is a wonderful place to wander around, with small winding streets and beautiful houses. You can hear the pretty chimes of the Westerkerk many times a day as you walk around.

Stay here if you can. We stayed in the Jordaan District and wouldn't stay anywhere else. It's a really nice place to wander and take in the sights and sounds. The architecture is beautiful and the dining options are great.
Great walkable neighborhood. This was a fantastic day of wandering -- so many wonderful bars, cafes and shops in this neighborhood!
lovely and picturesque. For me the most beautiful quarter of amsterdam... The flea market is very nice, the vintage shops...

Canals on Foot. We visit Amsterdam for a long weekend break, three nights and four wonderful days, despite two days of rain and wind. On the rain free days we spent hours walking around Amsterdam and its canals. On one of our dry days we meandered round the canals and side streets of Jordaan finding markets, pubs and little cafes. Fantastic and how quick the time went.
Quaint. Lovely area, we cycled around here and drank tea in various coffee shops, absolutely lovely, quaint and friendly.

Great base to see Amsterdam from. We stayed on the edge of The Jordaan. This put us within walking distance of quite of few of the main attractions in Amsterdam. Staying in this beautiful residential neighborhood gave us a unique view of Amsterdam.

The Jordaan is a dream a come true... I lived in the Jordaan for several months and it is definitely one of the most beautiful neighborhoods in Amsterdam. The canals are and the houses here are relatively smaller to the big canals of Amsterdam (Keizer, Prinsen & Heren) but they provide for a scenic route and they give you lovely warm feelings inside. The Jordaan is scattered with boutique restaurants & shops and the bars are packed with vibrant young Amsterdammers at night. Some restaurants are quite intimate for couples in love and the funky stores are nice to browse through. My favorite clothing stores are the second hand store on Eerste Bloemdwaarstraat: Goshka's Goodies & the 50s clothing specialist store on Eerste Leliedwarsstraat No. 6: Cherry Sue. The markets during the weekend are also wonderful to visit for light & easy bites. They have the organic food market near the church. If you can only do one thing in Amsterdam however please visit Winkel 43 - they have the best apple pie in Amsterdam! Enjoy the Jordaan, it is most definitely a dream come true for me - the place is magical!
Good for walking and taking pictures.. Spend 2-3 hours on 2 occassions. Good for walking. Best scenes for photography. Better quality shops, ans restaurants. Recommended for couples + families.
typical area in amsterdam. if you are visiting amsterdam and have a few hours to spare then this is a nice walk.The area is safe, it has lots of cafes,restaurants and a few markets to visit.

Quiet beautiful neighborhood. This neighborhood was very quiet and family friendly with small cafes, the Anne Frank museum and lots of bicycles! I highly recommend staying in this part of Amsterdam - it seems that it is less busy than the other neighborhoods
Cute shops. Cute little shops to get stuff for yourself or the family. Literally located across the canal from the anne frank house.

You have to know people here.. This is another area of the city to explore but it's not as striking as some of the more central areas. Perhaps the locals like it because it's quieter. I got the feeling one could enjoy this area with some local friends and gradually learn where the cool places were. But, if you seen everything else already and you feel like a stroll, why not?
relaxing and calm.... Really enjoyed walking around the Jourdan.Small café's,good restaurants and quaint shops.All set in a lovely district.
We'll be back!. Mum, dad & older children - loved the relaxed atmosphere of this area; close to transport links for getting in & out for airport, etc.
Upscale district. This is the place to eat: many good restaurants, it is also good for people watching, but otherwise is a little bit boring... Unless you know location of couple art galleries

The Real Amsterdam. Walking through the alleys of the Jordaan is a mystical experience in itself, home to the working/ middle income community in the past it is now The Heart of Amsterdam...With canals on one side and the monumental Dutch architecture on the other, a walk through The Jordaan provides numerous photo opps and the many cafe's in the vicinity provide you with just the kind of refreshment you'd need on your walks...
The area is packed with small galerries and designer places!. Even if you don't feel like buying anything it's a good place to walk, meet unusual and creative people and get inspiration
Lovely cafe's a nice area. Lovely cafe's & bars around here that are 'normal' as well as various museums i.e. Anne Frank, The Cheese & The Tulip Museum.

Afternoon stroll. My friend and I spent our last day in town wandering around Jordaan. We just took in the sites and sounds and enjoyed shopping at the Tulip Museum and the Cheese Museum. Tons of other places as well. Plus cute coffee shops and wine bars. I'm sure they have lovely spots for dinner as well but we had to catch a train so headed over to Central Station.

Beautiful area with an abundance of quaint cafes and shops. We are just back from our second trip to this lovely city in 3 years. This City has something to offer everyone from the Touristy Dam Square area to this tranquil haven of The Jordaan area. This is our favourite part of the city where you are spoilt for choices to have lunch or a drink in many of the lovely establishments in this upmarket neighbourhood. We enjoyed tasting many nice beers during our visit but I also enjoyed my fresh Mint Tea in the Cafe De Prins,. While you are in this area and you like good quality Vintage Clothes a visit to "I love Vintage" on Prinsengracht 201 is a must, their range of clothing is superb and the clothes are all new. While we were in the area we stumbled upon The Amsterdam Tulip Museum on Prinsengracht 116. We bought some lovely black Tulips and we look forward to seeing them bloom next Spring.Enjoy your visit to this wonderful area, grab a bench and let the world sail by, we did !

Nice Neighborhood. We walked around on a hot day (one of the rare heat waves) and sat down at an outdoor cafe. Wish I could remember the name of the cute place we ate, on a small square. Dining is expensive in Amsterdam, and we got great value there. They are famous for their apple cake!

Lovely stroll. I spent a few hours wandering around and shopping in this attractive neighborhood. Highlights for me included nice photo ops, finding some Korean style nori, my conversation with the lady at the little Asian goods store where I bought the nori, and the excellent, cheap haircut and lively conversation I had at the barbershop recommended by the lady at the store mentioned above.
Great area to stay!. It was a great area to stay while in Amsterdam! Convenient, quite, breathtakingly beautiful, and elegant!

Great Neighborhood. The Jordaan is a great, quiet neighborhood with lots of small restaurants and bars, most of which are quite good. This is my favorite area just off the center of Amsterdam. It's narrow streets and tranquility can't be beat.
Beautiful area to stroll in. The Jordaan is the nicest area in Amsterdam. Take time to stroll the streets, admire the beautiful homes and smaller canals.
very pretty. very pretty, quiet area ideal place to stay, good pubs friendly feel. Like all the city - mind the bikes.
Very nice walkaround. Nice place to walkaround, and maybe stop in some cafe or shop. Calm and relaxing. Good to take pictures of Amsterdam without so many people around!

Excellent neighborhood for lodging, eating, walking. This is a dream of a neighborhood, lots of boutique hotels, excellent restaurants and very romantic to walk about. The cobblestone streets, the canals, the old townhouses, the little shops and restaurants, you would never want to leave or for sure want to return. It is at odds with the other side of Amsterdam, the most touristy side. You should not miss a visit to this neighborhood when in Amsterdam!

The best place to stay in Amsterdam. The Jordaan is mostly residential. It's quieter than the centrum and it's cleaner. Beware of the bicyclists. They are deadly and will ride on the sidewalk if the street is blocked. It doesn't seem that the pedestrians have the right of way in Amsterdam! You can sit out on a patio on the canal and have a glass of wine on a nice day.

Jordan a great area to explore. This quarter of Amsterdam features canals, quiet back-streets, cafés, and shops. We just wandered all over, taking in the sights and dodging bikes. Sitting at a cafe, preferably outside, is a great way to people-watch (people in Amsterdam are very attractive) while enjoying a coffee or beer.
Jordaan. A delightful area, full of small cafes and restaurants, small shops and boutiques; Jordaan is a joy to wander around, stop for coffee or lunch and return to for dinner
Great neighborhood!. Walk and eat in this beautiful neighborhood! You will feel like a local. Lindengracht street has some fabulous restaurants. You can't go wrong!

Trendy Jordaan. Yes! A great area to walk...enjoy the Dutch architecture, narrow pretty streets where people prefer not to shut themselves behind curtains, enjoy the eclectic mix of restaurants, dress shops,homemade pasta, sit on the sidewalk sip good espresso or enjoy ice cream. BUT BE SURE TO GO TO THE WINKEL ON NOORDE MARKT FOR THE VERY BEST, HOT FROM THE OVEN APPLE TART AND CREAM!
Great shops. Try and get away from the main streets to visit the little shops on the side streets in Jordaan, bring plenty of cash.
Love the area.. Really great area within walking distance of central Amsterdam. Really great to just stroll around the streets stopping for drinks at almost every cafe we found. Not to be missed!
Just go there, amazing!. Happiness abounds. Comfortable ongoings. Artsy, great organic food, international scene, open minded folks.
A MUST. Take your time to walk all those lovely streets and visit the small shops. Enjoy the atmosphere and discover your favourite gracht.
Hip and happening. Great place to people watch. Interesting shops and buildings to explore. All within easy walking distance from Dam Square.
Very nice. Joordan is a fantastic and charateristic area of amsterdam full of pubs,restaurants,cafe. Nightlife is very intence and funny.

Decent Neighborhood. The Jordan is a very nice place to stay if you want to be away from the city center.Although it is not very far from Dam Square it is a bit far if you would like to walk there.With a bike it gets easier.it is a very quiet area with many small restaurants, cafes, supermarkets and coffe shops.
Residential Canals. Beautiful residential canal area, great old buildings. Only drawback -dogs are not curbed-lots of sidewalk surprises

Rozengracht and Gilderstern. If the weather if fine and you have completed you visit to the Anne Frank house then you are videally placed to wander the Rozengracht area of the city which is full of quality housing with courtyards and as the(french) name implies little gardens Even the streets are named after trees and flowers,.It is an area of quaint shops,wonderful restaurants alll resonating to the sound of verbeck organs.Trippers of an independent mind can wonder blisfully where their feet takes them.
a pleasant area. A great area for restaurants and shopping. A very relaxing afternoon can be spent in this area. You can sit and watch the word go by.

Fun area. Great area to explore and walk around. Less coffeeshops but ,any quirky stores and restaurants! I loved that it was slightly quieter than the central canal area. Some fabulous restaurants that are less expensive.

Quaint but still touristy.. What once was a refreshing get-away from the tourist crowds of Amsterdam, has now become little more than a place for tourists to spread out so that it feels less crowded than some place like Dam Square. The shops are a little more interesting especially the delightful pastry/coffee shops. There is less traffic, and the tourists are spread out over a wider area, but they are tourists nonetheless. So many guides and desk clerks tout this area a being the "real" Amsterdam that it has become just another attraction with little to offer except a bit of quaintness.
Beautiful!. You need time - so much to see, do and marvel at! And so much to buy as well! While you're at it, try some Dutch food as well, like stomppot.

The most wonderful spot in Amsterdam. Just a 5 minutes walk from the busy centre, you'll find this tranquil neighbourhood with beautiful houses and canals. There are also some hofs (inner gardens) that can be visited, provided you're alone or in a small group.
I dare you to spend a few hours in this place and not want to move to Amsterdam.
Lovely Area. Great area just to stroll, stop for a drink or a bite to eat away from the hustle and bustle of the City Centre

Walk round Jordaan. Check out the courtyards they open between 9am - 5pm. There are street markets too durng weekends. It's a lovely area very chilled out, lots of cafes, quirky shops, very photogenic area for holiday snaps.
Very nice area for a relaxing walk / sightseing.. I loved my visit to Jordaan. The area is a delight for those interested in architecture and Dutch way of life.
Fascinating and beautiful neighborhood. We followed the Frommer's self guided tour and loved learning about the history in this neighborhood as well as taking in the beauty.

Home away from home. We rented an apartment here (short and suite no 304). Perfect location! Easy walking distance to Centraal Station and tour offices as well as quaint cafes and pubs. Very little traffic noise since everyone's on foot or on bicycle. Safe.

Best Neighborhood in Amsterdam. Interesting Saturday market, with great food and discount clothes. The Jordaan is a real neighborhood with small shops and good restaurants, a far cry from the honkytonk atmosphere of Dam Square.

From workingclass to Yuppieville. The Jordaan is still a lovely neighborhood with lots of little shops and cafés. There is an open street market on the Lindengracht and a Farmers Market on the Noordermarkt on Saturday.
The Palmgracht has a lovely playground. De Ooievaar (Stork) is a working still in the Driehoekstraat.

Easy walking tour. Follow Rick Steve's audioguide when taking this tour, which is excellent. The direction is easy to follow. Good narration on this quiet and beautiful neighborhood. You can enjoy people watching, explore the typical lifestyle and housing pattern of Amsterdam, besides passing multiple pretty canals good for photo shooting.

lovely area. as with much of AMSTERDAM, this area is great to view while walking. Really lovely homes. Be sure and walk slowly, as one should in most area, so one can savor the atmosphere. WATCH OUT FOR BICYCLES.

Pleasant tourist shopping area.. After failing to cope with the queues to the Anne Frank House, we calmed down by wandering through the narrow, mazey streets of the Jordaan. Lots of small shops and cafes, but not really much of interest for an old man like me.

A lovely neighborhood outside of the center. While in Amsterdam for 3 days we stayed in the lovely Jordaan area. It is just outside of the city's core tourist spots, but walk-able and tram-able to everything. The area is old and gives that traditional Amsterdam feel with fewer crowds as there aren't many particularly intense attractions in the area.

Great place to stay. We rented a canal boat instead of getting a hotel room. The boat was in the Jordaan neighborhood. It is a great place to stay. The neighborhood is quiet and safe with lots of shops, restaurants and cafés nearby. Also convenient to tram stops. Ten to 15 minute walk from central station
nice neighborhood. Nice neighborhood to go shooping and eating... very good looking, cleaner than RLD but can still be crowded. A must visit attraction in Amsterdam.
Cozy, local neighbourhood. Cozy neighbourhood with plenty of nice restaurants, shops and more. Go there before it gets invaded by tourists!

The place to stay in Amsterdam. The Jordaan is a mixed residential and retail district, perhaps the most scenic and upscale part of central Amsterdam. There are only a few hotels, but you can't find a better location in Amsterdam. It's near to the major sights, yet quiet and beautiful. Even if you can't stay, it's a wonderful place to walk and shop.
Nice area to walk and visit shops. This was a nice are to visit the shops and stroll along the canals. The 9 Streets area seems to be the biggest shopping area. Safe and eclectic

My favorite 'hood. famous for antique market (it closes at midday I think, so check times before going there) and having the oldest cafe in the city (whose name I forgot). Amsterdam just looks different viewed from here, it's not leidseplatz
Great!. What a lovely area! Great shops and coffee houses. Picturesque and quiet. Makes for a great cycle ride too!
A wonderful area to explore. A wonderful eclectic area of Amsterdam to explore. Great farmers markets on Saturday and flea markets on Monday, great to find a treasure from Amsterdam.
Lovely area. This is a quiet area not to be missed, found a really good French restaurant and the walk around this area is relaxing.

The charming jordaan. I was lucky enough o visit Amsterdam again since my visit on the 20th of may till 9th of July and visit again on 16th of august till 6th of October 3 weeks this time with my family all the decent hotel were fully booked we were lucky to find a lovely spacious and luxury 2 floor apartment in the jordaan area i visit Amsterdam every year but that was my first time staying in the jordaan so i was a bit worried specially that this time my family was with me, but when we arrived all what i worried about disappear the area was really nice and safe many small street with small restaurant and vintage shops my family were really happy with the area they felt really safe the neighbor was really charming with many canals and flowers we could walk every where the dam square was 15 mint walk and there was a tram just 3 mint walking which goes to central station in less than 10 mint any way we didn't use any of them and we walk as the streets was nice to wonder around we will gladly stay in the jordaan again i highly recommend to visit the area we cant wait till we be back to this lovely city.

Nice Neighborhood. I stayed in Jordan area and it was nice to stay here since it is close to Central and also walking distant to Central Station. Price of the apartment that we stayed in also reasonable for the high season. definitely will be going back to this place when i go back there
Jordaan. It was relaxing to walk around, browse the shops and so on. On Sunday nights everything closes down! Take note of any restaurants that are open.
Best place to walk around and stay. We didn't stay in the Jordan but if we go back we will look for a B&B in this area. Lovely canals, shops and coffee & pastry shops.

Pleasant section of Amsterdam. The Jordaan is a very nice section of the city of Amsterdam. Very typical collection of canals, buildings, cafes, plazas, etc. It is an excellent place to begin a visit to the city.

Charming Neighborhood. We spent a lot of time just walking around this neighborhood. It has many small restaurants and cafes in which you can sit and enjoy a drink and watch the world walk or float by.

Wonderful neighborhood. We wandered the streets of the Jordaan, enjoying the sights, houses, a quick bite, near-collisions of bikes, and shopping along the Nine Little Streets. A quiet but fun adventure.

great neighborhood. we could live in this neighborhood! very quiet at night, but lots of locals going about their daily routine during the day. Beautiful homes, great restaurants, grocery markets and wine stores all around!
Beautiful neighbourhood. We strolled around the Jordaan over the course of a couple of days, stumbling across bars, coffee shops and cool boutiques. A beautiful area and well worth exploring.

Pretty Place to Stay. The Jordaan is a quiet, pretty part of the city to stay in. I stayed at the Shelter Jordan hostel, a friendly and clean hostel that is relatively quiet for Amsterdam standards. There are pretty canals nearby (although they don't run throughout the neighborhood) and a couple good shopping and restaurant streets here if you need to grab a bite to eat.

Let yourself get lost.. My favourite place in Amsterdam.Bring your wallet aswell becausethere are a lot of quirky, specialist shops around here. And if you Come across a typically Dutch bakery, try a " gevulde koek"!Make sure you have a camera with you. We just wandered for hours, going in and out of side streets. When the canals stop, just turn back, that way you won't be far from the centre. Everybodyspeaks English so,you can always ask the way.

Excellent area - Great restaurants and shops. We went over to the Jordaan area several times over the course of our visit to Amsterdam.The Saturday market was a cool experience. Lots of fresh and excellent food, eclectic fashion and antiques.We wandered around Jordaan and ate at a couple restaurants there as well that were nice. It's a bit less busy and more authentic feeling here versus within the main center (e.g. less trashy tourist shops/ cafes with big english signs plastered all over the place) so was a nice change of pace.
nice place. interesting place to visit street named after many different flowers. easy to find worth a visit.lots of side steets to meander down

Beautifully Relaxed. I was shocked when I got off the train in Amsterdam. There were tourists, people, BIKES, cars, trams, motorcycles (every mode of transportation) everywhere. I thought I was going to have an anxiety attack or get run over! It was not how I imagined Amsterdam. Then, we went away from the city center into The Jordaan. I could breathe. I finally felt I was in Amsterdam with beautiful buildings, flowers, and canals. We were where the locals lived and everything was more laid back. No tourist shops. It was something you see in a postcard. It was our favorite part of our trip.

Great neighborhood. Me and my wife took a Tram to the west and north corner of the neighborhood and walk all the way back to the west Church, it was a great sunny day to take a walk, the architecture is great and we actually saw how their life look like away from city center.

A beautiful place filled with flowers. We have stayed in Amsterdam before but never in the Jordaan. It is charming - beautiful atmospheric streets with flowers planted in every available nook and cranny. There are many bars and restaurants where the beer is good and the food even better. It just couldn't have been any nicer.
Beautiful architecture. If I moved to Amsterdam, this is where I would like to live. Everything looks like it came off of a postcard.
excellent. It is very nice place to walk and do shopping.And you will feel closer to see how people live there.

very nice. we just walked through the streets, ate breakfast at a nice coffee shop (a real one).
not much to do there, no shopping, just travel around

EXCELLENT AREA FOR WALKING LEISURELY IN QUAINT SURROUNDINGS. This is the place to enjoy an overview of Amsterdam. You can stroll along the canals, walk to the Anne Frank House, and enjoy the nicest part of Amsterdam. We spent 3-4 hours doing this.

Funky neighborhood away from the tourist crowds. This is a real funky neighborhood, where the folks in Amsterdam actually live, a neighborhood of old streets, alleyways and a few beautiful gardens in front, where we saw people sitting and enjoying a glass of wine on a warm summer day. Do not have a walking plan for the neighborhood, just plan on getting lost and sometime later look at your map to get you to your next destination

Less hustle and bustle that cetral Amsterdam. I did not like the crowds and hustling in the centre of the city but this area is more relaxed and feels like Amsterdam should feel, old and historical. You can find some good back streets here and markets.

Nice to walk and poke into the shops!. It was ok to walk around and check out the shops but it is the same as anywhere else in the area. We looked a lot to find the place. It is not well marked as you have to ask someone to tell you where it starts.. There are no street names that guide books can say it starts from this street and ends at that! I had the Amst guide from Trip adviser on my tablet and the directions were not very clear.

Beautiful Area for a stroll. Lovely area for a nice sunny day to have a stroll, there are lots of resturants away from the hussle and bussle of Dam square and I would say at a lot better price and quality!! I would recommend for a light lunch sitting on a moored boat with a sandwich and beer e.g. Cafe P 96- but please note due to 'healht and safety' (silly!) they can not bring food out side so you have to grab it!

A middle class neighborhood with history and charm. It is just a trendy neighborhood now, but as with most parts of Amsterdam, the architecture and the care that most people show for their homes make it a very pleasant stroll. Make sure you visit the Church near the canal.
a nice afternoon in an authentic setting. went around the narrow streets with a bicycle, had a coffee in a nice café. visite various markets (bio market, bird market)

Jordaan is the beauty of Amsterdam. This neighborhood have the most beautiful streets and houses in Amsterdam. This is a must in my opinion if you get there. A little stroll on the streets of Jordaan make you forget about everything and makes you think you are in neverland.

Taste of living in Amsterdam. A charming and picturesque are of central Amsterdam that has a vibrant community that doesn't just exist for tourists. Cafes and restaurants and shops and boutiques abound! Leave yourself plenty of time to explore and sit and watch the world pass by!

Lovely area!. We looked after a house for 6 weeks, just off Westerstraat in the Jordaan area. It was lively, bubbling with restaurants and bars and had a wonderful food market on Saturdays! Definitely worth a day visit or a stay!

an afternoon in Jordaan. Spent yesterday afternoon strolling in the Jordaan.
Thank you Trip Advisor for the suggested walking tour. We followed it and found hidden treasures that we surely would have missed. Relaxing way to spend the afternoon.

Great walking neighborhood.... Great walking neighborhood with many cool shops and cafes... I've been both in summer and winter, and of course it's much more enjoyable in the summer. In winter months some of the stores closed early or weren't open at all.
Lively nice neighbourhood where locals hang out. Lively nice neighbourhood where many locals hang out, full of restaurants, cafes and galleries yet away from the confusion of the main tourist areas.

We loved it here. Stayed in an apartment that turned out to be a complete 4 storey house. Great location for cafes and places to eat and drink. Laid back and cool! Interesting and quirky! Hidden delights of old curios and groovy design! Loved all the pot plants - a million hollyhocks! Definitely best place to stay.
City break in Jordaan. We have spent four days in Amsterdam, in a B&B located in Jordaan. A very special district, cosmopolitan and full of life!

Away from the stress of the City. This is the place you have to stay for a while, you'll fell in love to this place, great for walking, a lot of restaurants around the area and a good neighborhood. It's worth a visit.

Beautiful old Part of the city. No trip to Amsterdam is complete without a visit to the Jordaan.So many little boutiques and restaurants and wonderful old buildings here keep your camera at the ready. A great place to sit and have a drink at one of the many bars in this area and watch people go by.Being a tourist magnet some of the prices can be a little bit higher than in other parts of the city so it is worth shopping around as that unusual curio can often be found elsewhere at a cheaper price

The best neighborhood in Amsterdam. Jrodaan is the neighborhood that made me fall in love with Amsterdam. It's a very different city than the one can imagine when you compare it to the traditional Red Light's area. Full of art in all of it's expressions! Great for a walk or grabbing something to eat.
GREAT neighborhood!. Worth a stroll and a visit... spend some time here, you will not be disappointed-- lots to see of Amsterdam life and little quaint shops etc.

Delightful area for dining, walking or cycling.. We found some great restaurants, Indian , Thai, Italian plus tapas bars and brown cafes.
A gorgeous part of Amsterdam, not much visited by tourists and all the better for it!

lovely and quaint. It was very pleasant strolling around the Jordaan area. A lot of boutique shops and cafes. However, be warned as some things in the shops can also be bought at Albert cuypt market for 2/3 of the price..
nothing to see. not enough restaurants. very expensive. highly overrated. Only if you have visited ALL the other attractions and have time to spare.
Nice area. Really nice for a gentle wander, but the food is pretty pricy, and where I went, in minute proportions. But still very pleasant.

Great markets. Go on Saturday when it's market day.
The markets have a mixture of food, clothing, brick-a-brack.
I think you'll be unlikely to find any bargains though!
Half a day is more than enough in the market/s, but it's a nice area to mooch around in too.
Cool Neighborhood. This area of the city definitely reminded me of Greenwich Village NYC. It was neat to pop in the various shops and to explore the cute alleyways.

Nice walk if you are not tired to walk a bit. The neighbourhood was quite good to look around but nothing out of the blue as it was quite similar to other sights we could see in amsterdam. In fact since we had a car it was much more interesting to see the outskirts of amsterdam where we could find some awesome towns with amazing views.
quaint. nice area small shops and boutiques good for a nice walk and browse the canals. also plenty good eating places

Enjoyable Neighborhood To Walk Around. I recommend following a simple self-walking tour around this pretty neighborhood...quite nice. Interesting homes - old and new, houseboats, narrow streets, reminds me of "The Village" (Greenwich Village in New York City).

Charmingly Peaceful. Away from most crowds and museums. It's off the beaten track and well worth the little effort to get out here. Great for strolling and seeing some locals in their natural environment! Good selection of restaurants, shops and tremendous views and photo ops. Free!

A lovely area to just take in the atmosphere. This area was recommended by a local guide who took us there. It's basically just another area in the city and easily just a short walk from the main tourist area.

Piece of paradise. Awesome neighbourhood in Amsterdam. It holds all of the city's secrets. Simply beautiful houses, very clean and peaceful, great scenery, good people. You can see here the most beautiful bridges and canals, the most beautiful old and new houses and house-boats. Not very many people give this place a chance, maybe they think it's just a neighbourhood, but it's so much more. Great bars and restaurants await you there after your long walk in Amsterdam's paradise :). Positive energy all over and if you arrive there before 6 in the evening, many of the stores there are opened.

The Gardens Are All On Street.... Lovely backwater, my wife found here when she went to look for an ice cream. Such a peaceful canal off the main PrinsenGracht, ideal spot to gently stroll and just absorb the tranquility.Jordaan is apparently Dutch for Garden, hence all the flowers in tubs, and displays along the streets.A few bars and some beautiful aromas coming from an Afghan Restaurant nearly made us stay longer......Just walk down the road alongside the Wester Cafe opposite Anne Frank House.
One of Amsterdam's little secrets.. A few narrow streets, some picture postcard canals and some of the best local restaurants and bars. Don't visit Amsterdam without visiting the Jordaan.
charming and picturesque. This is the heart of scenic Amsterdam. Shops and restaurants are everywhere. People are friendly. In summer flower boxes are overflowing with beautiful flowers.
A walker's paradise.. What a great neighborhood. There is everything and anything an urban walking addict needs or wants in the Jordaan section of town.

Charming neighborhood and where you would want to live here.. Charming small street, quaint cafes, small shops, flowers, much less touristy than one might think. A relatively small area near the Anne Frank house. Definitely worth visiting and spending some time exploring.
A nice typical Amsterdam atmosphere. It is worthwhile to visit and walk in this area of Amsterdam A lot of typical local bars.A nice atmosphere
Great place to stay. Location, cleanliness, helpful staff, wonderful breakfast. But, primarily location, location, location.

The best bit!. Without doubt the best bit of Amsterdam, together with the nine streets. We really didn't like the same 'ol' same busy shopping streets and avoided at all costs whereas this area was as imagined. Great for mooching, coffee stops and little shops. Highly recommend :)
Take a Break from the Crowds. Jordaan is a real neighbourhood, not touristy and a nice break from the crowds as you wander the picturesque small streets and small side canals.

Worth a visit. Superb neighborhood, although the roads that make Amsterdam are a maze, they all looks like one each other.
However, it was nice to walk through The Jordaan, beautiful homes, very clean and well cared area.

Nice part of Amsterdam!. My hotel was in this district, so I had an opportunity to stroll there - very nice district with different shops, restaurants and so on that You can find in other districts, but the special thing here - number of quiet places where You can walk or rest!

Great location for your stay. By far the best value for staying any length of time in Amsterdam is to rent an apartment. Onte of the best locations is Jordaan. Close to Central Station and the 9 Streets (shopping girls!) with a Saturday market. Jordaan has some of the best restaurants in the city. Very trendy!

Interesting but not inspiring. There are many shops and boutiques that are interesting, but nothing that cannot be seen in other countries with similar boutique districts.
Definitely worth a visit on the way to or coming from other sites.
Great place to wander and get lost. Just get out and walk around! Great restaurants and bars abound everywhere in the area. The Pancake House is the BEST!!

Not sure what the hype is all about. We stayed on the edge of the Jordaan area and over several days walked most of it. It is a dormitory area for Amsterdam and it indeed has many specialist stores but they are small and not so obvious ( you have to look for them) and there are some nice eating places and little courtyards that are pretty and of course the Johnny Jordan memorial at Elandsgracht From a photography point of view its OK but the other areas around the Dam are much more lively and offer equally good photos. The Jordaan is good for architectural photos as there are not so many people running around.Some folks go out of their way to stay in the Jordaan and rarely move from there. I just don't get it there are many amazing places in Amsterdam, such as the Jewish Quarter, Chinese Quarter the Vondelpark just to name a few.If you want to stay in the Jordaan make sure you are on the Dam side around Westermarket rather than the other side as it gives you walking access to the other areas of Amsterdam.
Pleasant and lovely area to saunter. Lovely to walk around, lots of little roads, bars, and shops to just enjoy and soak up the atmosphere of Amsterdam.

Full of places to eat and drink.. Loved this area! It has lots of places to eat and drink yet not noisy or too busy. Although I would recommend booking somewhere at night as places don't have lots of tables. The area is near lots of attractions and has trams that get you to almost everywhere you need to go. Such a laid back feeling to the whole area.
The most beautiful part of Amsterdam. I love walking around in Jordaan. The shops, cafées, restaurants and the scenary. Hop on a canal boat and just sweep through this historic part of town.

The nicest part of Amsterdam. We lived in Joordan and we dont want to stay anywhere else! It is a beautiful district with many flowers, nice people, wonderful shops and the most beautiful places of amsterdams cityscape.
the Jordaan. What an excellent area. Many little shops to explore and lovely eating places. A must see when in Amsterdam
Not sure what all the fuss is about. Apart from pic nix it was a non event. Go to pic mic for the best ever lunch! It's just rows of houses with canals. Pretty much like all of Amsterdam.

4 wanderers or backpacker elite. this is where the locals live and the Expats too. Things are day-to-day here, a little ways from the tourist areas off the beaten track or canals. Start at the Johnny Jordan and work your way away from Central Station.

The best place to stay in Amsterdam. Lovely charming neighbourhood with lots of bars and restaurants. We have been to Amsterdam many times but always stay in the Jordaan now. THis time we hardly ventured outwith the Jordaan because there is just no need.

slightly disappointing. We found this area slightly disappointing. Several of the canals have been filled in and replaced with parking spaces. This made the locality rather ordinary. There are still some lovely bits, especially the hofies (little courtyards).
Nice neighborhood but .... Pretty nice neighbohood but I don't see why all the hypes and raves. It 's nice to visit but not a must for Amsterdam visitors.

Jordaan. spent an afternoon strolling through Jordaan and nine streets. it was lovely - nice bars restaurants and shops - but not entertaining enough for two teenage boys. coming back to amsterdam I think this is where I would look for a hotel

Cool Amsterdam. Nice neighborhood to take a walk in, lots of little stores and places to eat. Its also known for its art galleries, speciality shops and boutique restaurants. Among the Dutch, the Jordaan is known for its folk singers.
Gorgeous. I've wandered through by day and by night. Lovely strolls, available and dangerously tempting shops. I had a delicious pizza at La Perla and great chocolates at Jordino!
wow!. After an exciting and wonderful gay pride on the Prinsengracht, we walked around in the jordaan area. It's a nice, cute and non-touristic area! We enjoyed it a lot!
FABULOUS NEIGHBORHOOD. full of wonderful boutiques, high-end hand made fashion, no mass produced big brand names ... all very special items in the shops of the Jordaan.

Great Area to walk in. this is the nicer area of Amsterdam. The other side of the city is the red light district and you wont miss that but you dot nee d a hotel right there. We stayed close to this area and had some great walks through the streets and enjoyed some of the outside cafe's
Love Jordaan. Love this nice area of Amsterdam, beautiful canals, nice little shops, cafes and restaurants. I always stay in Jordaan when in Amsterdam.

Lovely. I think walking around this section of Amsterdam is very beautiful. It gave me a good insight into the architecture of Amsterdam and I don't remember seeing any tourists there. There are some nice cafés to stop at on the way. I recommend.
Go for a stroll. Great places to eat, shop and for strolling by the canals. Turned out to be one of my favorite places in Amsterdam.

Really worth a wander!. This charming neighbourhood feels like a window into gentile Amsterdam life. Great food and shopping if you tire of the beautiful street scapes and canal views. For a heavenly shopping experience, Sukha at Harrlemmerstraat 110 is one of the most beautiful shops I've ever seen . . .
www.sukha-amsterdam.nl . . . you won't regret a visit!
Rooie Nelis. It's always a pleasure to visit the Jordaan and beiing in Amsterdam. Nice to watch all the different people.

Beautiful quarter. Really nice surprise to offset all usual city centre noise. Yes - it is also in the centre, but it's quite different to what people usually imagine as "Amsterdam". Here you'll avoid (well you'll see much less) the usual visitors of Amsterdam and find lots pretty, little pubs, bistros and see typical architecture of the city. Jordaan is nice - that's all! Ah - and it's got Vesper cocktail bar!
Great shopping - unique shops and galleries. Looking for something a little different - visit this region. Lovely cafes, bars and relaxed strolling. The up market experience!

Keep exploring.... This is a part of the city that explorers don't always get to, and it's rewarding to make it this far. It feels similar to the North Laine of Brighton, England; there are many little artsy & craftsy shops and galleries, together with a selection of bars, cafés, and restaurants. It's also en route to the city centre's main swimming pool!

Quaint little piece of Amsterdan. Definitely worth a stroll/ cycle through this lovely neighborhood. It tucked away from the hustle and bustle of the centre and is a nice way to take in the city's beautiful architecture and deco. Very peaceful with lots of narrow picturesque streets and lovely, small restaurants and cafes.

Great Neighborhood. Just wander the canals and side streets for a few hours. Plenty of shops and places to stop in for food or drink. Don't worry about getting lost. Easy to consult a map, GPS, or ask someone to point you back to the center.

Away from the main tourist trail. De Jordaan is a lovely district a short walk from the main hustle and bustle of the city centre. Lots of great bars and restaurants. If you go on a Saturday there is a big market selling everything from vintage ornaments to fish - and plenty of lovely cafes to stop and rest your feet in between the shopping. De Jordaan is a must if you visit Amsterdam. Very relaxed and chilled out.

Wonderful neighbourhood with a lot of charm. We were in Amsterdam for only a day and change and the 1st thing we did was to walk to Jordaan. The neighbourhood has a lot of charm with small coffee shops along Prinsengracht which marks one boundary of the area. We also stopped along a superb Saturday market which was selling freshly baked goods, cheeses, meats et al. Next we came to a flea market from where I managed to pick up old currency notes of pre-Euro era. Anne Frank's House too is situated here, be prepared for long queues in case you haven't booked ahead (we skipped after seeing a serpentine).This is a great neighbourhood to see vintage Amsterdam with its forward slanting houses and boat-houses try to get there on a Saturday to enjoy the markets.

Great Shopping. The Jordaan area has many boutiques, local designers and welcoming bistros and cafes. If you're looking for fashion that is more unique than mainstream, this is the area for you. You can spend a few hours meandering the narrow streets taking pictures of life along the way. Very nice area of Amsterdam.
Good place to walk and see. The famous photograph of this neighborhood is a street with snow, but at the summer it´s a good place to walk, see architecture buildings and get a beer anywhere.
Nice place to visit. We were advised to visit the Jordaan district and did so one evening. We found a very nice restaurant for a meal and enjoyed wandering around the quaint narrow streets.

Chilled. Best part of Amsterdam for quiet walks, cool cafès and nice little restaurants. The volume just seems turned down in this area and you feel like you could melt into the background and stay forever. Wonderful!

Overrated. Too crowded, too much traffic on foot, by bike. Shops are meh and too small. Rather go sit in a cafe but even those seem very crowded. Super busy on Queens day so ok for a short time but I'm not a crowd person so avoid if you are claustrophobic.
maybe or maybe not. kind of a cool area, but need to have an experience to support this. This seems to be an area for 'hanging out', which is ok. However, if you miss it, you don't miss much
I could live here. SO chilled out here and full of little restaurants, coffeeshops, Brown Cafe's. A really pretty neighbourhood, definitely worth a visit.

Some 'Old Amsterdam'. If you want to see what it was like in early Amsterdam, this area shows one what it used to be. Now inhabited by single people and small families, formerly there would have been many more than three per Apartment. Large families, not a great or no income and living conditions without sanitation and often good drinking water. But the outside is well maintained and kept for us to see.

quaint, enjoyable. the jordaan is a lovely part of Amsterdam--a great place to stroll, shop and enjoy cafes. Don't be in a hurry. Take in the local color, poke around the candy shop and resale shops. Enjoy the lovely neighborhoods
Authentic amsterdam. Great part of amsterdam. Still quite authentic, great architecture, nice bars and cafes, little shops. Stroll around the small streets, have a coffee and a beer and enjoy it
original neighbourhood. this is an orinal neighboorhood of Amsterdam, really near the city centre, nice shops, nice restaurants, and nice people how live there, certainly not very commercial!

A stroll along the bars. This central city district is very old and cosy and their are a lot of bars and small shops. The small houses en narrow streets are examples of how people lived in this city more than hundred years ago. The district has a very special and charming atmosphere.
Nice but market poor and lost it's character. It has lots of small court yards and nice houses but the market is very poor with it being more boot sale than traditional Dutch.

Cozy area. Nice cozy area , which originally was a working-class neighbourhood. There are several art galleries, shops and restaurants. Its a must to stroll througt thees streets when in Amsterdam. I personally prefer the 9 streets to Jordaan, but they ar in the vicinity of each other so visit both.

Everything about Van Gogh. If you are a art lover, especially a Van Gogh art lover, then this is the place for you. From his upbringing to his apprenticeship and how he mastered colours was very fascinating. You can take photos (*which was surprising) but I bought the book (40 euros), it was worth it. The Rijkmusuem is right behind the museum.
Average. We followed a recommended walk. Did not find it outstanding, my wife was bored. I would recommend the canal trips

Nice for walking and chilling. This is a lovely part of town away from the hustle and bustle of the traditional tourist attractions. there are some beautiful restaurants and top-quality bars where it is very easy to sit and watch the world go by

Too beautiful!. Lovely place to just walk around and see the old buildings and the way in which people go about their lives. Loved the cobble streets and unique buildings. reminded me of Old Town Edinburgh.
THE neighborhood of AMSTERDAM!. Fantastic to see the Jordaan as an old neighborhood with quaint little streets, still bearing the old fashioned character of the city.

What a lovely neighborhood!. Great shops, beautiful streets, nice cafes and nice people. The architecture fascinated me. The weather was beautiful and we were very lucky to be there at this time of year.
The most engaging part of Amsterdam. Beautiful houses, excellent restaurants, and cozy cafes... it's a wonderful place to go with your significant other. What more could one wish for?

Stroll Through When You Visit Amsterdam. This is a lovely neighborhood, easy walking distance from the Dam Square area, that gives you a real taste of life in Amsterdam. The homes are fascinating, and the views will stick in your mind.
Walking in the Sunshine. Brilliant vibrant part of Amsterdam with lovely canals and lots of busy bars and restaurants. A must especially in the sunshine. Quite near to Ann Frankhuis
biking through a nice quarter. we found a very nice and familiar athmosphere with so many different views on houses, people and shops, It was "gemütlich".

Lovely Jordaan Neighborhood. We stayed at the Hotel van Onna in the Jordaan neighborhood. We enjoyed the quaint, quiet Jordaan which is close to many sites including the Westermarkt Church, Anne Frank House, Houseboat Museum, Tulip Museum and a quick walk to the city center at Dam Square. We listened to Rick Steves' FREE audio tour of the Jordaan neighborhood which started in Dam Square. Our hotel also offered a Jordaan neighborhood tour with a local for 6 euros, but since we already did our own audio tour so didn't. I recommend any tourist to stay in the Jordaan neighborhood.

City walk. Used Rick Steve's guide book for a pleasant walk through this area. Canals and cafes abound along with hundreds of bicycles! An excellent place to stroll and experience some of Amsterdam's beautiful architecture, charming streets, and interesting inhabitants!

A relaxing afternoon. One afternoon I enjoyed a nice lunch at a local restaurant and observed my surroundings in the Jordaan. Although this area is relatively close to the busier Amsterdam central,it seemed to have more of a local ambiance. Many people seemed to know each other which gave the impression of a close-knit community. Before heading back to my hotel, I stopped by a local ice cream parlor which was filled with friendly faces and great desserts. This is worthwhile stop for any travelers to Amsterdam/

Great walk, lovely photos. Don't miss the Jordaan in your visit to Amsterdam. It is a beautiful area - flower boxes on the canals, beautifully kept buildings. There are some shops and cafes, but not too many. It's not as crowded as most of Amsterdam is. Definitely visit to take in the atmosphere and take some nice photos.

Beautiful and relaxed. This was my favourite area of Amsterdam and it was great just to walk around and enjoy the beautiful canals. There wasn't many tourists about and the atmosphere was really relaxing - must see.

Amazing neighbourhood!. This neighbourhood is absolutely amazing! Super chilled atmosphere, loads of small streets where no car circulate (only bicycles and pedestrians) - Plenty of small cafes and restaurants to nibble some great Dutch food samples, the buildings are beautiful and genuinely typical! Very few tourists, and more locals hang around Jordaan. Not to be missed!
really cool. this place is really cool, with cool cafes and not so full of tourists. great to just wonder around .
Nice and quiet neighborhood.... ...to walk around, enjoy the canals and the characteristic dutch architecture. There are some shops, restaurants and cafés.

Well worth a visit. Came to Amsterdam in August and discovered the jordaan. Much quieter than the main part of Amsterdam. Nice canal side bars and coffee shops. Fabulous had ice cream bar too. It's well worth taking the time to explore the little streets.
It where you wanna stay. It was summer and it was So nice to walk around, stopping here and there for some beers or shopping. I cant immagine how col it is on winter months....

Great for an afternoon strool. A nice place for an afternoon visit away from the bustle of thecity centre. The area has plenty ofcafes for food and drink and in good weather you can sit outside and watch the world go by on foot and boat. Dont miss the market
Nice walk after visiting the Anne Frank Museum!. Enjoy a stroll in this lovely neighborhood at least once your stay in Amsterdam. It worth to loose the time notion while walking the cute streets.
Another nice walk in Amsterdam. We were staying at the Hotel Pulitzer and walked this neighborhood more than once. The views are great, the area is quiet and feels quite safe.

Nice stroll along the channels. Amsterdam isn't really the best place to watch period buildings and channels (try Bruges in Belgium, or the islands of Stockholm), but you should visit this neighborhood if you're in town.

Hidden Gems of Europe/Amsterdam/the Joordaan. Discovered the Jordaan in the late 1970's and keep going back. I lived there for a year.Amsterdam is so civilized. History and architecture are dazzling. The Dutch are also incredibly smart practical and make getting around so easy. Especially on bikes or trams. Everyone finds something spectacular in Amsterdam. For me it was a ceramics studio and a great living space. I miss the people, the bread and cheese, the great transportation system, the elegant architecture and style. I always fly into Schiphol Airport when traveling to Europe. The train system makes it smooth getting into downtown Amsterdam. Efficient, clean and friendly. I used to fly Northwest, now it is Delta, or Continental, or Priceline whomever. Pass through en route to Spain or Italy, and make it a three day stop. Go to a park or coffee shop or a museum. Do some shopping on the street. Many great markets for clothes, jewelry, antiques, Take home cheese and tulip bulbs with customs pre-clearance.

Nice neighbourhood for wandering!. This is a lovely neighbourhood located a stone's throw from Prinsegracht in the western and central canal ring. As typical, Dutch architecture houses line fairly small canals and there are enough restaurants, bars and cafes to sit, relax and people watch. Chanced upon a house with a big window where you can see a couple of "naked cats" sleeping (the owners had kindly posted information about these interesting cats too). The streets are quiet but not dead, and as expected much of the bustle was near food establishments. There are not many attractions here as Jordaan seems primarily a residential area, but in Johnny Jordaanplein, which is a small square along Elandsgracht, there are busts/statues of Johnny Jordaan and other popular musicians from this neighbourhood. These were visible while I was walking along Prinsegracht which was also how I stumbled upon Jordaan. Jordaan is an easy detour while exploring the Grachtengordel and while not a critical inclusion to a traveler's must-see list for Amsterdam, it is a pleasant way to spend a couple of hours (including a cafe stop). Personally, I also preferred the cafes here which felt less touristy, probably because this place sees few tourists. So it's a nice place to stroll and take a break from the busy-ness of the Amsterdam.

nice restaurants, but weed smell. Like the restaurantes, but not to smell the weed every time you pass by a cofee shop. If this is what we will expect for California and Colorado, it is not good. The people attending the coffee shops are not the best in town, and the smell is not gratiousl

Nice place to walk. Here you can find nice old-fashioned boutique type of shops and plenty of (non-chain) restaurants. Many are very full in the evenings so I think you need a reservation if you have something special in mind. Worth of visiting and just to scroll around. Also a very good ice cream bar is in Jordaan but sorry can't remember the street's name....
a great neighborhood. lovely canals, lots of interesting little places to have a drink, good food, little markets, good shopping etc etc
Looking to Shop?. Some great shopping, lots of vintage stores and second-hand boutiques. Make sure to duck into the several independent shoe stores.

Tanquil Area In a Busy City. An oasis of peace and quiet after the hurly burly of Amsterdam. Don't expect lots to do; this is an area to wander and enjoy the gracious architecture, quiet side streets, quaint cafes and canals. It's a tonic after a hectic day.

A great neighborhood. The Jordaan is a charming neighborhood with 17th Century houses, lots of cafes and shops. It's a great place to just wander. Don't just stay on the main streets - check out the narrow streets as well. Find a cafe and just sit and enjoy a refreshment - it's quieter than the rest of the city and so pleasant.
Nice area to walk about. Lots of nice streets with unique stores and sights; recommend getting Jordaan self-guided walking tour from a tourist store.

A lovely neighbourhood. The Jordaan is a nice neighbourhood not too far from the city centre. It is different from other parts of Amsterdam and away from the hustle and bustle of the city centre. We had a nice evening strolling along the lovely canals, lined with many nice cafes and art galleries in this area. It was a relaxing evening spent here. Definitely a recommended place to visit when you are in Amsterdam.

Explore on bike. I rented a bike to explore this unique neighborhood! It is very charming indeed. I especially Iiked the local feel of this area, the cafes and buildings. I even explored the residential part, which gave me a glimpse of local life.
Neat Shopping Area. It was a beautiful warm sunny afternoon to stroll down the streets of the Jordaan area. They had cute 2nd hand shops and gelato cafes. It was a nice area to peruse.

Most charming area in Amsterdam. This area on the western side of Amsterdam is a must see! There aren't a lot of "attractions" aside from the Anne Frank House, but the main attraction is just walking through the lovely canals, with many restaurants and shops.
Quaint neighbourhood. A very nice, quiet and quaint neighbourhood away from the hustle and bustle of central Amsterdam. Just taking a stroll along the area and the shops was a relaxing thing to do.

Very nice district. We stayed in an apartment in the hip Jordaan district. Once a poor immigrants enclave, it is now popular with DINKs, artists and the like. It is a beautiful place with canals, houseboats, nice buildings (many done up beautifully as residences), shops and restaurants. If you are observant enough, you will notice a large hook hanging from the roof of some of the buildings with huge panel windows. Ages ago, these were factories or warehouses and the hooks were used to hoist goods upstairs through the open panel windows. The famous Anne Frank House is one of them.
Nothing special!. Coming from dubai with all the known shopping this was nothing special for us. Just a bunch of stores on a long street.

You've got the at least take a walk through this little "village" in the centre. It's a nice area, lots of nice shops with several crafts, lots of cafe's, restaurants, hang outs, markets you name it they got it. The famous nine little streets (de 9 straatjes) are cool. Lots of nice scenery for photographs. It's a must to at least take a walk through this little " village" in the centre. Ofcourse the walk is free, but spending some money there feels good :)

One of my favorite places to get lost. This jumble of narrow canals and narrower streets has been thoroughly gentrified since we first walked around there over 40 years ago. It's still fun to walk there and look at the architecture.
Style. Just one of the nicest parts of any city to visit. Great place to wander and watch people. Great bars and shops

Our favorite neighborhood. Canals, quiet walks, fabulous architecture, fun Saturday market and great restaurants (especially the Pancake Bakery) make experiencing the Jordaan neighborhood a must do when in Amsterdam.
Great area for the offbeat!. If you like the offbeat - Cool restaurants, artisans, unique shopping! Great for wandering and walkabouts!

home for a bit. We made Jordaan our home for just 5 days during our trip to Amsterdam, and it was such an adorable little section of the city. Our b&b was located right off one of the canals so we became quite familiar with this area. During the day we would venture out all over the city, then return to Jordaan in the late afternoon. There are so many cafes and places to eat or to just grab a beer, and the streets are quite lively. On Saturday, there was an open market where you could pick up fresh fruit, meats, cheeses, pastries....we ate these delicious sandwiches. Then we saw that there was a line going in to a corner cafe called "Winkel", so my teenage daughter went to investigate. When she stepped out of the cute, cozy Winkel, she had a huge piece of dutch apple pie (and some cold beer for her parents). Let me say, the pie was crazy good. And the Amstel beer was oh so yummy. We felt comfortable and right at home here, and felt completely safe strolling around until late in to the evening.
Great area for a stroll. The Jordaan is a lovely area to stroll around to get a great feel of the Amsterdam the locals love.Lots of lovely houses and gardens.Enjoy

Vivid area with wonderufl old houses and lots of shops. During our walk through Amsterdam we came across the Jordaan, a very popular area with wonderful old houses and lots of shops, like our goal the second hand record shop Velvet. We also went to the Wester Church and the homo monument and enjoyed the pleasant atmosphere.
Just Walk. The Jordaan is a wonderful place to spend a little bit of time just wandering the canals. Picturesque canals and houses make spending a few hours in the Jordaan a delight.

Great walking neighborhood. This area of Amsterdam is kind of "trendy". I took a walk there on a sunny Saturday afternoon and came across an outdoor market. There were lots of people out on the streets. It's an area overlooked by a lot of tourists, but it shouldn't be. It's a great break from the crowds of Dam Square.
Walk. Followed a walk recommended in our guide book - lovely area with lots of Dutch houses to look at and flowers all around the canals and streets

Busy little area. Plenty of shops, eateries and places of interest including museums and churches. Also a local 'tours and trip' shop to book your excursions around Amsterdam and surrounding Dutch countryside.

Great place to stay. Excellent area with lots of places to eat, drink and shop. We walked through the are at all hours of the day and felt very comfortable. It's a very vibrant area with beautiful canals and very friendly people to help you figure out your way around.

Kiss the prettiest girl at the party.. Maybe we just didn't dig the vibe in this area or perhaps we're a little old for the energy here? Anyway, if you want specialty shops and an artsy feel this will thrill you. I'm not downing this, I'm just saying this is a 7 in a city of 10's. For our time, it was Prinsengracht and Herengracht, but The Jordaan was still cool.

Great local neighborhood!. By walking through it pleasant genuine streets and close by canals you get a much more authentic feeling of Amsterdam than in the old center. Definitely the place to stay, eat and hang out!
Great Place for a Walk. Nice little Dutch neighborhood with beautiful houses and flowers everywhere. Great for a peaceful evening stroll!

Great area. This is in my view the best area in Amsterdam. Nice eateries, great little bars frequented by locals and visitors but without the hustle and bustle, and unsavoury characters of other neighbourhoods in Amsterdam. Will definitely return.
The best area to stay in. Quiet,charming and not too far to walk to any/all attractions.We rented an apartment overlooking a small canal with a bar downstairs (our local) which was not noisy at all.
Nice neighbourhood. Walked down Jordaan on my last day of my visit to Amsterdam. Nice, quiet neighbourhood amongst canals and has some places to eat and drink. A short from walk from Dam.

I love this unique place. If you are going to come and stay in Amsterdam , the Jordaan is the place to stay. It is typical postcard Amsterdam, with the little roads, canals and boats and bicycles everywhere. it is quiet and safe, full of kids going to school and very nice restaurants and bars. I rented an old but charming apartment with my two teenage daughters in front of one of the canals, in Passerdegracht, two blocks from a great supermarket and Leidseplein. We love this place!
nice nighborhood. green and quiet neighborhood, with lots of nice cafe's and shops.me and my friend enjoyed to just walk the little streets on a sunny day.

Upscale Neighborhood with a lot of Charm. I understand why this is the most desired neighborhood to live in Amsterdam. It is absolutely delightful! We ate at some of the best cafes during our whole stay in Amsterdam in this area. Must see!

Fabulous. We were lucky enough to stay in The Jordaan, at the wonderful Eelhouse bed and breakfast. It is a delight. Perfect for wandering, lovely individual, quirky shops, great quality restaurants and charming brown cafes. I found a completely different side to Amsterdam in the Jordaan, far from the stag tourist crowds, and the intensity that creates. A great place to stay if you like peace and calm, or a great place to visit for a little respite from the more vivid side of Amsterdam.

A special Amsterdam neighborhood. Jordaan neighborhood is special. A bit bohemian, vibrant, full of shops, restaurants, and locals going about their daily lives. Walk the narrow streets and soak up the sights, sounds, and smells of a unique Amsterdam neighborhood (and be on guard for bicyclists who have the right-of-way).

So beautiful. It a really nice residential neighborhood. In June you can see looks of flowers in the windows and kids on the streets. The bridges look so cute. I believe it's a must. You can see how Amsterdammers live.
Area for all and everything!. Good Market and and too manty things to see!I suggest walk all around this area you will love there this place and you can have options.I prefer more night out..

Authentic Amsterdam. The Jordaan is an old district in Amsterdam that is worth a visit. There are many nice cafes to have lunch or a coffee. It is just typically 'cosy', although you have to watch the pickpockets at the Albert Cuyp Market!!

Nothing interesting about it . Nothing to do , nothing to see There are very few shops !! And very expensive ! Boring and far from the rest of the city Will not be back , and dont advise you to visit unless you have seen everything else and you have nothing else to do, or you're just too old for the rest of the vibrant city !

A very Nice place in Amsterdam. This is one of the best places in Amsterdam. Is a bohemian district very beautiful and you can find unique corners in the city,a better food than in other districts and more surprises

Nice neighborhood. There are so many beautiful neighborhood in Amsterdam. It's also amazing to see the huge number of young people everywhere, especially when a little sun is coming out of the clouds. Just walking the streets, stopping for lunch, or for coffee is a nice way to experience this part of Amsterdam

calm area of residents. few tourists in this area so close to the center, stayed in a private home and loved it, wlaking distance to train and bus station and the canal was on our view, the water reflextion, always felt safe and confortable,squares, coffee shops, and other shops walking distance and great restaurants too
Fun walk. We went on a self guided walking tour (I believe it was out of the Rick Steeves travel book). Beautiful courtyards, very cute neighborhood stores (meats, cheeses, etc.).

Fantastic walkabouts. This neighbourhood in Amsterdam is definitely worth a visit. It lies to the west of the centre and features many pretty houses, narrow streets, small shops and hidden but beautiful gardens. A walk though these streets is recommended.
Lovely old part of town. Nice shopping area , independant retailers and small coffee shops , bars , nice market too well worth an afternoons potter

Nice district to walk into. If the weather allows for it, it is really great to wander around in those streets, looking up to the typical houses, getting into the small boutiques or galleries, stopping for a mint tea in any coffee shop. Here you are not surrounded by sex or drugs gear, and that is quite enjoyable.
Nice to stroll through. Even in the rain, this neighbor is a very nice place to visit and enjoy it's shops and cafe's. The area also offers some interesting Amsterdam architecture.

Lovely stroll. Don't miss the 9 little streets.. We enjoyed a lovely stroll and a great lunch in the Jordaan. There are many lovely shops and quaint buildings in this area.Rembrandt spent the last years of his life in the Jordaan, on the Rozengracht canal. He was buried in the Westerkerk church.The Jordaan was originally a working-class neighbourhood but has become one of the most upscale areas in the Netherlands.You will find a bevy of art galleries (particularly modern art), restaurants, and shops. Don't miss the 9 little streets!
Lovely part of Amsterdam. Great neighbourhood to walk around. Lovely shops, houses to see and canal properties. A quieter part of Amsterdam. Must see!

great neighbourhood. allow a few hours to wander through this interesting part of Amsterdam. Expect to find interesting and individual clothing boutiques, furniture shops, design stores with great household products, recycled industrial products, florists and a great range of little bars and restaurants to stop for refreshments.
A great neighborhood to walk through. Very quaint neighborhood with lots of shops, restaurants, and people watching. We just ambled about and had a great time several evenings during our stay.
Lovely walk. Great to stroll about in the sun, both of historic interest with gorgeous streets and canals and still lived in with some nice but cheap bars and cafes. A rarity in central Amsterdam!

nice part of the city. This was great to be out if the the main tourist parts without having to walk to far. I also stayed in an apartment here which is definitely recommended as no restrictions and we had a private roof garden!
See the real Amsterdam. Wonderful area with local shops and restaurants and not over run with tourists. Got the feeling that this is where the residents of Amsterdam hang out.

Stroll and enjoy. Great shopping and restaurants and cafes. All quality so take plenty of money. Most vendors speak English and are extremely helpful. Watch out for the cyclists, they are every where.

Don't miss the cute, little streets of the Jordaan. Take the tram to the Nieuwezijds Kolk, near the central station. Cross the Singel, Herengracht, till you get to the Prinsengracht. Pass the Noordermarkt. Just stroll down the streets, have a drink in one of the many typical " bruine Kroegen", the so called " brown bars". Many small shops to visit, coffee shops too and restaurants to have a bite.

Laid back with lovely cafe culture. Really great area, my favourite in Amsterdam. Definately worth a visit to walk along the popular but quiet streets and sit outside in one of the many great eateries.
Beautiful. A million miles away from the hustle of the centre. Lovely area to wander around with some nice bars and restaurants

beautiful. we got to see it in the snow, and although i've to Amsterdam in the summer as well it looked gorgeous with a white blanket! I love the cafes, the shops, the canals and the bicycles! always a lovely atmosphere.

Beautiful area of the city. A lovely area to walk in and enjoy a nice lunch near the canals. They have some streets with no cars which is wonderful. There are many old lovely buildings in this area. Looks like many cute shops to check out also.
