Charming. Had a small walk to the restaurant Moeders. This area is quiet, not many people. Really advise to visit if you have time.

Wonderful place to stroll the streets and view the beautiful architecture of Amsterdam.. Loved the scenic streets and canals. There is lots to do in this area and it is well located to all the attractions of the city of Amsterdam.

Escape the madness!. The Jordaan is an absolutely beautiful area of Amsterdam complete with superb canals, boutique shops, good quality brown bars and civilized coffee shops but lacking the lunacy of the red light district or the tourist tat of the main drag up Damrak. Try it... Go for a wander, have a beer, relax!

Such a nice area to live in. My husband and I were staying in a nice B&B in the Jordaan. After 3 days staying, we simply fell in love with this area. The surrounding is so peaceful but still very alive. There is a play yard just downstairs of our B&B. All ages children were playing soccer after school. Sometimes my husband was doing nothing but enjoy watching them playing. Very good memory in Amsterdam. You can find everything in The Jordaan. Neighborhood coffee house, high quaility restaurant, market to get extremely fresh grapes and veges, and etc......In a word, if we go back Amsterdam someday, we will stay in The Jordaan again for sure.
Pretty neighborhood to stroll through. Fairly quiet neighborhood that offers many small cafes, bars, restaurants, shops and nice places to sit along smaller canals.
Beautiful. Liked the houses, they are neatly kept, decorated. Canals and tree lined .... People are friendly and speak many languages.. Not afraid to switch from Dutch to another.

Wonderful place for a wander. We visited the Jordaan due a Trip Advisor recommendation. Wonderful little place for a stroll, lovely small cafe's & bars, great little quirky shops and generally a lovely atmosphere.
Cute, cute, cute!!. Loved this area! It's full of cute shops and restaurants. I could wander here for days and not get bored! Definitely worth spending some time exploring this area!
Jordaan. Residential are mainly, small canals, found little of interest walking through area. Busier streets surrounding the neighborhood have more to offer.
Quaint streets. A great area to visit with its quaint streets and canals walked around the area and found the arcithecture interesting. Loved it.

Most famous neighbourhood in Amsterdam. We passed this area by when we were on a cruise and then paid a short visit, designers shops, historical buildings, canals and beautiful reflections! It has slightly different atmosphere from the central part of the city.

Lovely, trendy neighborhood away from the tourists. The Jordaan neigborhood has the look and feel of comparable upscale neighborhoods in London, NYC, Boston and Chicago where the young locals live and hang out. There are many nice restaurants and fun bars. At night, there are not a lot of tourists around as the Jordaan regains its Dutch character. Best of all, even without the mass of tourists, it still has all the beautiful old buildings and lights reflecting off the canals in the quiet evening.

Saturate yourselves in the historic Jordaan district experience!!!. There is plenty of history here and a dizzying array of things to see & do for all interests and ages. (In the link, you can scroll down to the 'streets and canals' section - yellow sublinks) to get a virtual feel for the area! You'll see that The Jordaan is nestled ammongst the Brouwersgracht (N)/ Leidsegracht (S)/ Lijnbaansgracht (W) Prinsengracht (E) canals. Consider yourself lucky if you have unlimmited timme to explore! There are great little discoveries at every turn - charming little shops and galleries; cafes/restaurants; markets:Lindengracht Market, Westerstraat Market, Noordermarket; beautiful canal scenes plus the mmost interesting street & building facades. The Westerkerk and Anne Frank statue; the mmany distinct shuttered windows on buildings lining the Brouwersgracht; the Brandweer(fire station) are just a few of the landmarks that are easy to identify that you are in the Jordaan. Going east (away from the Westerkerk) along Prinsengracht will take you to Johnny Jordaanplein and it's popular historic Amsterdamer musicians personality statues (pic unavailable). In mmy encounters, mmy immpression of the Jordaan residents is that they are quite friendly! I've lived in Amsterdam NL for just over three years, walk the Jordaan frequently and I find I never ever tire of the area!!!

The place to be on King's Day next year. Bands on every other corner, people dancing in the street, vendors and food booths, the boat parade. I didn't even know what Queens Day was when I booked our trip last fall, but if there is anyplace more fun than the Jordaan on Queens Day, I'd like to know about it.
Styles shopping and eats. Nice slow fun boutique shopping,chilling food and treats.A must for a slow day and recover. Upmarket area and food to delight
Great for a wander in the afternoon and evening. Great place to loose yourself for a few hours wandering about and seeing the sights around the back streets and canals

Beautiful area. We took a tour that was provided by our river cruise to this lovely area and enjoyed walking the streets and learning about the architecture, seeing courtyards that are hidden away, and having coffee/apple cake as we took a break. I am sure there are many companies offering walking tours if you are interested in learning more about this lovely neighborhood.
Favourite place in Amsetrdam!. Really loved Jordaan! So many great shops and cafes (for coffee!), the canals are so pretty there, a lot less tourists than the center. A must see in Am'dam!
Best restaurants.. We was told that in the De Pijp area are the best restaurants but we think that the Jordaan is better.

Real Amsterdam. Did the self guided tripadvisor walk on Wednesday.Fascnating to see the hidden courtyards.Much quieter than other parts of the city that I visited.Beautiful in parts. Well worth a wander.
Perfect for an afternoon stroll. Easy access and great coffeeshops around. Make sure to sit at a cafe close to the canal. Perfect for an afternoon stroll!

Great experience. Scenic, atmospheric and free! You walk by some gorgoeus canals and see small courtyards dating back to the 17th century and there are small cafes along the way to stop for coffee and cake. It gets you away from the crowds and noise of the city and yet is only a stones throw away. There are also great one-off shops to look around.
Nice neighborhood.. Walk the side streets to view real life in the city. Some high end homes and interesting shops and very nice cafes. You can find a restroom in the church
Beautiful Place. Sat on the floating cafes and bars drinking nice beer and wine. Visited Cheese factory and ate lots of it. Don't pay the 2 euros to go downstairs. 1 room with pictures.
Lovely area. Wonderful area, full of nice cafes, bars, little shops. I could have stayed all day lazing away the lovely sidewalks beside the canals.

Oh My.... We walked through this neighbourhood our first day - what a shock compared to what we are used to. I couldn't stop taking photos as i couldn't believe how open the sexual products and Pot was. I am not sure I would take children down there - nor would I take them to the Red Light District. The canals between the streets were amazing, as were the buildings. Overall it was interesting and fun to explore.

Jordaan. The whole area was packed with rubbsih, maybe as it was right after the abdication of Queen Bea, but still. There are certainly other canal areas more beautiful than Jordaan, but one has to find then off the beaten path.

Queens Day. We visited the area during Queens day.The area was dotted with live street theater at every turn. Next year Queens day becomes Kings day and may be on the Kings Birthday 27th April.The Dutch sure know how to party! There are lots of places to take a drink or eat, and we saw a number of "coffee shops"
the real city. This is the nice part of the city, wonderful to stroll over teh markets, see the shops and have a coffee, beer or lunch. Great athmosfere
Beautiful Neighborhood. Enjoyed wandering through to see the wonderful canal views. Very peaceful with nice restaurants and cafes. My favorite part of Amsterdam!

Great neighborhood to visit. Lots of fantastic restaurants and neat shops to choose from in this diverse neighborhood. There are many sights to take in and a variety of cafes to sit and people watch or just view the boats cruising the canals.

Dont go on Sunday, everything is closed.. Really nice area, boutique shops, nice restaurants and bars, well worth a walk out from the center. As in the title most things are closed on a Sunday so worth avoiding.
Best neighborhood in Amsterdam. Vibrant, fun, eclectic, beaming with energy. We spent the majority of Queen's Day here and savored every second. Love Jordaan!
Upmarket Canal Area. The whole Jordaan Areas is upmarket and different . Here you experience the more authentic Amsterdam - no tourist shops but rather delightful small restaurants and unique shops.
Did we miss something?. We walked the Jordaan streets there one day. It was okay but we didn't find it that different from other parts of the old city. It was a Sunday and some shops were closed.

Lovely, artistic, trendy. Just a short walking distance from Amsterdam’s Centrum, Jordaan is an old neighbourhood that has now got transformed into a hip, fashionable area. While the style of houses is fairly similar to those in the centre, the Jordaan, just to the west of Centrum and across the canal, is a shade more esidential. Though it is home to more the creative community, with lots of boutiques, galleries, stores. If you are there for longer, explore the inner lanes and the hidden yards.

Gorgeous Area. We decided to stay on the blue house boat located in this district. We are so glad we did. This area is simply breathtaking and was even quite at night when we were sleeping. Sit out at a sidewalk restaurant and have a beer or coffee and just take in the area. So lovely!!!
Trendy Private neighborhood atmosphere. Many shops of individual designers, delicious café, all the people smiling .... Just wander the streets and enjoy.
One of the most beautiful areas in the city. Great neighbourhood with well conserved houses and streets, very quiet and great to bike along the canals, day and night.

Excellent shopping & move theatre. There's not only a bunch of cute shops all along here, there's also a great movie theater. At the end of the street there's often an open-air market. Oh and that view down the street is the trash-to-energy incinerator (it's prettier than it sounds)

A great part of the city. Make sure you walk around this area as its all the best of Amsterdam - canals, architecture, bars, shops and generally what makes the city great. Good idea to walk on and under the railway ..

Nice area in Amsterdam. Took a guided walking tour through the area on a Sunday afternoon. While some things were closed, it was still a nice tour as it was little quieter than the rest of the city. Would recommend visiting this area as it completes the sites to see in Amsterdam.

Did not meet expectation. No criticism of the area, except that I found similar quaint streets in other areas of Amsterdam as well. Consequently it did not come off as being particularly special in my view.
Quiet away from the tacky side. We did a walk from Sunflower books "Walk & Eat Amsterdam" through the Jordaan area it was lovely. Where the real Amsterdamers live.

Blending the old and the new and the old again.. The Jordaan is a diverse and thriving area of Amsterdam. Old Canal houses can be found alongside newer student housing, and the place is always alive with people in bars and cafes or just walking around and admiring the little streets and alleys that make up the neighbourhood. The area has a very cosmopolitan feel and there is a diverse range of people living in the Jordaan, and it has also become home to a regrowing of old trades. Traditional bakeries, artists and craftsman can be found, and it adds to the beauty and feel of the area.
Where on earth are the '9 streets'. Don't ask anyone local they haven't a clue! The website is very promising but there are no directions so you don't know if you are there or not!
Lovely place. This area was my favourite place in Amsterdam. There were some lovely unusual shops here. The atmosphere was great and everyone seemed to be very friendly.

Jordaan neighborhood, Amsterdam. Wonderful, vibrant area with a mix of folks who live and work there, folks visiting there, shops, churches, businesses, charities, markets, canals, bikes, boats, cars, restaurants, and all the history and patina from all the years passed. We stayed in this area for the weekend and could walk easily around old town Amsterdam. Felt safe walking through the streets at all hours. Anne Frank House is in this neighborhood. But so did Rembrandt live and die in these streets. Easy access from Central Station (walking).

Rick Steve's Jordaan walking tour. We used the walking tour from Rick Steve's guidebook. It led us through the lovely Jordaan neighborhood and even through what appeared a normal house door into a "Beginhof." The canals, bridges, and old buildings give the Jordaan the true feeling of being in old Europe.

Backstreets Amsterdam. Whilst on a Photo Tour with Amsterdam Photo Safari (check out my other review) we cycled through the Jordaan. We spent about 20 mins here but i liked it so much that I choose to come back to shoot some more. Great chilled out bars and cafes. But what i liked the most about the area was that its a bit of a getaway from the normal tourist traps. If u like to kix more with the locals then this is worth a visit for 2 hours.

Very cool, but know WHEN to visit. Classic Amsterdam - what you see in all the pictures. Definitely worth wandering around for as long as you like - cafes are terrific places to sit, enjoy nice weather, and people-watch. But, we initially visited on a Saturday morning - bad idea - NOTHING started around the neighborhood until about 11:30, and we had plans for the afternoon. We rearranged the back end of our trip to revisit this neighborhood on a Monday evening - much better - lots of people around, things were open, lots of activity, atmosphere and fun.

Find the local food places in this area. We walked the area and felt like we were in a typical neighborhood for the locals, very nice area and by the history of the place it has changed a lot and you can find fine places to dine and entertain, we loved Luna Restaurant at Lindengracht.

Worth walking. We spent much of the day walking this lovely neighborhood. We skipped visiting the Anne Frank House, however, both having visited it years ago and daunted by the long lines. We attended a concert at the Westerkirk but could not locate the famous grave in the floor. The organ is extremely large and beautiful but was out of tune today so the smaller organ was played. The church is lovely, large and light. The canals and houses are classical for Amsterdam. The views are lovely. There are many quiet streets that are relaxing to walk. Recommend it to get a better feel for the less touristy side of this famous city.
great neighbourhood. lots of great restaurants, quiet area and close to everything. Very clean part of Amsterdam, not as crowded as other districts
Fun neighborhood. This is a fun neighborhood with great restaurants, cafes, and shops. Take time to explore and enjoy.
Escape the tourist places.... Nice walk which allows you to escape all the tacky touristy options. Good walks with nice cafes and reataurants.

Bijoux bistrots. Loads of of tiny streets and quiet canals host an area of tiny cafes and bars with various individual shops, specialist collectors, fascinating shop windows showing unbelievably bizarre wares for sale, from wigs to water! Worth a wander!

Great area to stroll. Our hotel is blocks away from this neighborhood. There are many nice restaurants, bars, cafes and shops and it is always lively. It's a safe area because there are always so many people "out and about."

Saturday morning stroll between the stalls. The neighborhood is pleasant, clean and quiet and we found the market easily. Lots of good local food to taste as we walked among the stalls selling inexpensive clothing. Got some good bargains as gifts.

Nice neighborhood. We visited on the beginning of April and most shops were closed. The neighborhood itself is quiet and peaceful, and there isn't much to do but stroll around. It has a nice feel of old Amsterdam, so you can include a visit there as soon as you are done with De Negen Straatjes ("The 9 Streets") that are adjacent to it.
Our favorite 'hood. The Jordaan is a wonderful area to explore. Great shops, restaurants, bars etc. We seemed to venture here nightly for dinner.

Charmimg-Stayed here 8 days. We (2 couples) rented a charming canal house for 8 days in the Jordaan neighborhood. We absolutely loved it - the Saturday market, the various ethinic restaurants, Winkel's apple pie, within walking distance of churches and museums. We definitely experience a more realistic Amsterdam than if we stayed at a hotel.

nice stroll. It is worth walking around and if you are lucky, peep into some of the private Hofjes, they are peaceful. You might sit for a while and relax in the rush of your day or just find a café and enjoy the sun and life

Felt like true Amsterdam. We explored many neighborhoods of Amsterdam (primarily on bikes - far and away the best way to get around town) and the Jordaan felt the most like true Amsterdam. By this I mean for folks that call that town their home, the way of life in the Jordaan felt the most real, lacking the trappings of tourism and hypercommercialism that saturate areas like Centrum.There is no one thing to see in the Jordaan as there is no central hub therein. It's simply a sprawling network of quiet streets and canals lined with hole-in-the-wall shops, boutiques, bars, and restaurants. One of the most serene moments of our exploration came when we happened upon a gorgeous quiet courtyard with a massive old elm towering overhead. Sitting on a bench to watch the world go by we saw folks just going about their days. It was quite peaceful.The shops and restaurants are endless but none are overt or ostentatious. Just charming and tucked away waiting for you to wander by. Everyone was friendly and everyone spoke English quite well. There was a healthy mix of more expensive fare as well as affordable places to grab a bite or find something cute to buy.The Jordaan was best seen from atop a bicycle. Bike rentals are inexpensive and practical throughout Amsterdam (Bike City on Bloemgracht was where we rented from and would rent again). The riding is easy and relaxing and allows for covering a lot of ground.Finally, on Saturday mornings Noordmarkt at the north end of the Jordaan explodes with a sprawling open-air market filled with delicious foods and all kinds of clothing and items to buy. This is definitely worth exploring.
Peaceful and Relaxing - The Real Amsterdam. Really enjoyed walking around this area, some lovely views and much more peaceful than the rest of the city.

Nice walking area. Enjoyed walking in the evening. A lot of options for dining. It's a a nice residential area, close to the canals. We started hitting a great cheese place and a superb chocolate shop then heading to the central side for a meal.

Beautiful. Without a doubt one of the more beautiful areas of Amsterdam. We visited towards the end of winter when it was cool and crisp. However, it was still a lovely area. The amazing architecture, canals and bridges can't be beaten. there are also a number of lovely coffee shops and pitstops along this area.

Jordaan. A pleasant quieter area not as many tourists about, seemed to be more locals, a nice ambiance about it. Some nice shops and the clothing ones were more local names. Plenty of cafes and restaurants.

brilliant area to stay in or just have a stroll through. beautiful area to spend time in with a less touristy and more local feel about it. i stayed in jordaan in october 2012 and it was a nice area with local shops and eateries, old local pubs and coffeeshops. when i visit amsterdam in june i will be staying in this area again.its not too far from dam sq (5-10 mins walk).

Small streets with big secrets. The Jordaan is one of my favorite places to shop and to eat.The shops are diverse and different.The restaurants are similar and definitely off the tourist routes, so the service is 200% better.A visit compared to the standard shopping places is really recommended.

Lovely area....cute shops!!. It's a lovely area, we were there on a Monday morning and enjoyed the flea market very much. There are many cafes and esturants you could enjoy and the walk itself is very pleasant.

A magical place to wander. I rented a flat on Keizensgracht near Jordaan, and found it a wonderful area for wandering - there are a few smaller canals in Jordaan, as well as great little hidden streets ( and terrific coffee shops and cafes!). Just what the wandering tourist wants - I will return! Thank you Jordaan

If you want to experience Amsterdam..... ....you must walk and experience the Jordaan. It is a fantastic authentic neighborhood, with at its center the Jordaanplein, rich of history due to the numerous amount of popular singer that lived or worked or singed there. It is probably the best place to experience Amsterdam, meet the people of Amsterdam and get impregnated of the local culture. If you have the opportunity, i recommend that you go when it is the Jordaan festival around September. It is fantastic.
Nice area of Amsterdam. Great part of the city to walk around in - lovely canals, nice shops, good restaurants. Less touristy than the Dam and near the station.

Mainly visited the Saturday market this time. The attractive Jordaan district we visited last time. Now our destinationg was the partly organic food market only held on Saturdays and which is great for foodies! Some really excellent quality stalls - mushrooms, a bakers (the muffins!) and cheese in particular.Went into a small gallery with superb photos from India printed on/behind glass, though the road was up for roadworks and only passable for pedestrians over Easter. (The road down the w. side of the Prinsengracht canal.)

A village within Amsterdam with everything on the doorstep. Brilliant area to stay, no big hotels just B&Bs, but a fabulous local friendly feel to the area. Loads of small interesting shops, good bars, and excellent restaurants and you are only a short walk right to the heart of Amsterdam, I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else.
so many shops. so many quirky quaint shops, bars, restaurants, not as loud and brash as other areas...felt safer. lots of canal views for photo graphs
stroling round in the sunshine. reflection of the trees in the canals, tiny second hand and antique shops, brown cafe's & trendy small scale dining. a village in a town.

Another great area in Amsterdam !. We actually cross almost every part of the center of Amsterdam, passing tens of nice bridges and walking along several nice canals. The Jordaan was the area we choose to stay a few days (we finally went to the excellent Hilton Double Tree because of wrong choice of apartment) but we love the area. In fact, it's difficult to say if Jordaan is nicer than other area or not.. we actually felt in love with the whole city !:-)

Lovely house. If you like photography this is the area for you. This is where you will find the houses and canals you find in guide books and on postcards. I found the area nice and quite and some lovely bakery's that weren't the stupid prices found only 3 streets over towards the seedy side of Amsterdam.
A lovely area to get lost in. A gorgeous area full of canals and beautiful 17th century buildings. Nearly every angle is postcard material. A "must" when you're in Amsterdam.
Artisan in 1913, Arty in 2013!. Great area to stroll around, grab a coffee, explore the canals and enjoy a slice of Amsterdam not obviously touristic.
Relaxing Easter Monday Stroll. Classy, quiet and put me in mind of Venice with narrow canals and streets, a residential area where tourists and residents mix. Wonderful area for exploring.
Wonderful to walk through this neighorhood. Every neighborhood is delightful to walk through in this special town. Make sure you do not miss this one.

Quiet and quaint. Nice to look at, some very nice spots - was extremely quiet when we walked around and only found a few bars and shops so if your wandering around and not wanting to be in the hustle and bustle of Dam square then this will suit you fine

Wonderful!. We stayed here instead of staying right downtown. The neighborhood felt safe with our two daughters ages 10 and 8. There are unique shops, great restaurants, and very friendly people! We stayed in August the weather was perfect. It was a short and enjoyable tram ride to the city center. We will return here!!

Beautiful, Gorgeous, Spectacular. This district is perfect if you are looking for a day to walk around and just see where your feet take you. It is full of shopping, small cafes, and beautiful architecture. It is far enough away from downtown to not be crowded yet close enough to get to by foot. Just a tip if you end up going here, bring your camera. You won't be disappointed.

A more quiet neighborhood to investigate. This neighborhood in Amsterdam features more unique shops and restaurants and is fun to explore. It is a bit off the beaten tourist path so it is a nice to roam around.
A really nice area. This is well worth a visit. During my visit the weather was cold but in warm weather it would be really pleasant to stroll.

Very beautiful and pleasant place!. Very beautiful and peaceful place, walking there or just sitting and eating or drinking is highly recommended. Amsterdam is worth of visiting, and Jordaan is one of the part of the city you have to see
Something for everyone. Wonderful part of Amsterdam, great food,lots of street entertainment, one of the nicest places to visit on a visit to Amsterdam
Awesome!. Nice shops and places to eat, with nice bridges and amazing architecture. A lot to offer, whether you have half an hour or a day.

A more, uh, mature Amsterdam. Just four canals and maybe a KM over from Dam Square, the crowds dissipated, the stoned morons shoving each other in front of oncoming cyclists disappeared, the beers dropped in price, the food dropped in price and improved in quality... still have the beautiful houses, bars, coffee shops, etc, but seemed much less "amateurdam". We did most of our dining, drinking, and wandering here, quite happily.
It is a beautiful area. it is beautiful to go past this area on the canal. The people are just so peaceful on their bikes or walking by the canal.
Quirky. This is how & where the locals live. A nice stroll through less busy streets plenty of stopping of to eat or drink points.

pleasant walk of canals. splendid area, just west of the main walkways, over a few bridges to the left of anne frank house, quiet and peacefull canals, along with antique shops and very pleasant cafes and small but friendly restaurants, well worth a couple of hours.
Beautiful neighborhood. This area is not to be missed, away from the bustle of dam square, great shops and restaurants in a wonderful residental area, great for a stroll

Nice and Quite!. This area of Amsterdam is a great place to get away from the craziness of the main sites and just get lost in the streets. I can never get enough of Dutch Architecture and this is an amazing place to just take that in.
Lovely area. Very quaint and great for strolling around, lots of variety. Look out for bikes coming from all directions!

interesting for a stroll. for a different view of amsterdam away from rembrantsplein,this area was,in my aging opinion,'trendy'.lots of bars ,cafes restos and designer shops.worth a stroll around or through.seemed very quiet at night.

Nice walk to admire architecture. This is just a beautiful neighborhood. You can walk for hours just admiring the architecture and sink in all the buildings history. This is also Anne Frank's House neighborhood. Very scenic area!

Lovely, peaceful district with quirky shops, bars and restaurants. We spent our first afternoon in Amsterdam wandering around this district and thoroughly enjoyed it. We didn't have any set plans, we just meandered around the little streets, often stopping to look in the quirky shops and cafes. Very much recommended.

Just a caution. Do not try and go to this area on a Sunday in March, every shop is closed and shuttered, most people are down in the middle of Amsterdam where all the crummy shops are. Also all the shops and museums are closed on Monday. Must be because it is March and not tourist season yet. Also a tip, if you are driving to Amsterdam park at the Olympic Station Park and Ride, it is 8€ a day with a tram card for 2 hrs included. Great deal.

One of the best parts of Amsterdam. I think this used to be the working area of Amsterdam or working class area, I could be wrong. It's lush and very atmospheric with lots of quirky little boutiques, cafes etc in the area. Not so much the bustle of the city centre or the buzz of Singel, so very relaxing and interesting. Chill out along this road and take your camera.
Cool District of Amsterdam. The area reminded me of the old East village in N.Y.C. back around 1972.Great area and the residents were very cool and very scenic as well.

Wandering through the streets of the Jordaan,nostalgic. You never know what type of shop,cafe,bar,restaurant,clothes shop you will find in this area,take time out to wander through the streets,you will not be disappointed .We did it for first time in ten years and it has not lost its charm...meander through and then head over to the north kirk and eventually stroll down the Harlemmerstraat to the top of the walking street that eventually will bring you down into Dam square,allow 3-4 hours more if you bar/cafe hop....enjoy

De Jordaan, not all tourists who wander there are lost. To me it felt like I was in the most authentic part of Amsterdam. I like this neighborhood with it's nice café's, little shops, art galleries. Definitely worth a stroll when in Amsterdam.

A gem in Amsterdam.. One of the best open secret of Amsterdam. This area is full of little nice of everything. From nice small shops to nice small restaurants to nice small galleries. Everything seems to be nice and small BUT as whole, is a GREAT BIG area to discover and enjoy when visiting Amazing Amsterdam.

Go on Saturday when organic market is there. It is recommended to Saturday morning and enjoy organic market.The neighborhood is very well maintained and advanced. Many pedestrians and cyclists traveling in the area.Antique shops in every corner and great cafes.
Yep!. Just the best district of Amsterdam. Small canals, nice bars and cafes, small art galleries, street markets at the weekend. Get an apartment here and stay a while. Definitely recommended!
Lovely walking around. Like th previous reveiwer it is hard to imagine how all these shops keep going but thankfully they do. We spent ages just ambling and looking at everything. Beautiful area.
Great for walking around. There are just so many lovely streets and specialist shops, not really sure how they manage to keep going it's well worth a visit for ambling and enjoying the atmosphere.

Very Holland. This neighborhood is not touristical at all, and yet, is very beautiful and you can sense the real atmosphere of the city! There are not fancy stores and restaurants, but it's very cosy and nice to walk.
Quaint & Lovely Neighborhood, Good for a Stroll.. These streets are easily devoid of tourists and rife in sweet little cafés and canals! Nice to take a walkabout.

you must visit it...trust me.... i was speechless, when i visited it.excellent!!!!!!!!!!
you must visit it and you MUST have a camera with you to record it...

The only place to be in Amsterdam. We are bias but we love this area and it is just the experience that you want when visiting Amsterdam. You stay and hang out in the Jordaan area when you've grown up and have left the days of "coffee shops" and giggling at "red" shop windows behind. If you know Brighton, the Jordaan area is like a big version of the North Lanes with funky bars, great restaurants and little vintage shops and foodie places.

One of the best neighbourhood in Amsterdam. Pretty, quaint, but edgy at the same time.This is arguably one of the best neighbourhood in Amsterdam, with its canals and small outdoor cafes providing good food.Stroll around here and enjoy the view.
Great walking area. This seems to be where the locals prefer to spend their time. Lots of nice cafes and restaurants that don't seem like tourist traps.

Nice cafes. The Jordaan is a nice area with some good cafes - however, the four days that we were in Amsterdam were some of the coldest of the winter and it was not a pleasant experience to be wandering around the streets for hours on end. I think it would be very nice to visit this area in warm weather and spend time strolling around the pretty little cobbled streets beside the canals.

The Jordaan is a very nice walk - great places. We went to the Jordaan every day we were in Amsterdam. We were staying at the hotel Pulitzer which is 2 blocks away and there are just so many nice places to visit. Bars, restaurants, galleries etc. I am glad we were so close and would make a point to stay close to here again. Highly recommended.

Nice quiet neighborhood with interesting restoration.. The neighborhood is quiet and a great place to wander. There are lots of good restaurants (displaying the Tripadvisor logo). Some of the buildings have undergone interesting restoration.

Must see. take a stroll through the Jordaan. A real Dutch folk neighbourhood with intimate streets and nice markets during the week. Visit the Noordermarkt on saturday or monday. A combintion of flee market meets fresh produce on a saturday. Monday the accent is more on the flee market part.
Beautiful Area. Beautiful area to walk around in. Markets and vintage shops close by as well as lovely restaurants and small cafes.
lovely canals. Wow, what a quaint hip area....great places to eat, shop and people watch. We strolled the streets even late at night and enjoyed the lights and the atmosphere
Wonderful area. If I was going to live anywhere in Amsterdam it would be here, wonderful, quiet, pretty part of the city, beautiful to wander around day or especially at night.

Off the beaten track, quiet and beautiful. See the real Amsterdam, wander through the streets where people live, enjoy the cafes, the little shops, the beautiful canals. Great but very busy flea market on a Monday, crowded does not describe it. Go another day for the piece and quiet and take your camera

Must see if you visit Amsterdam. As an inhabitant of Amsterdam, I recommend every tourist to visit the Jordaan. It is a great place to wander around, enjoy the canals, visit some stores, encounter amazing places, and feel the charm that Amsterdam has to offer.
I personally think that the Jordaan is one of the most authentic neighborhoods in Amsterdam. .

Nice lively place for a stroll. The Jordaan is a nice area in Amsterdam just like the area around Leidsplein, for a stroll on a weekend or even on a summer evening after work. There a large number of cafes and restaurants and also other shops, teeming with life till late in the evening which makes it even more enjoyable. One of our favourite evening haunts.
Joordan passion. I was actually staying here, in a wonderful apartment in Brouwersgracht 131. The area is characterized by canals ans little markets, coffee shops and cool pubs.
Nice for a walk. Really nice to walk through the little streets, sadly the weather was a bit rough, but then simply head for one of the small cafes and enjoy the flair

My favorite area of Amsterdam. I loved this area as it seemed very residential with many interesting small shops and cafes. Many of the side canal houses aren't so grand as on the major rings, but they are quite charming.

Enjoyable Neighbourhood. Last time we were in Amsterdam a couple of years ago, we wandered around this neighbourhood one day, and stumbled upon an outdoor market. So on our second trip to Amsterdam, we decided to stay in this area, and found a small apartment in a guesthouse that suited our needs. All the amenities we needed were nearby - grocery stores, cafés, pubs - and the area is close to the usual tourist attractions. We again enjoyed the market. We would stay in this neighbourhood again.
Old Amsterdam - like it used to be centuries ago.. A fine area where the old Amsterdam mentality / people and atmosphere dominate. Nice classic Dutch cafes interspersed with hip places.

Not as good as expected. We planned to spend a morning wandering in this area but found it a bit of a disappointment. We struggled to find a cafe where we could stop for a snack and it certainly couldn't have occupied us all morning. It was pleasant enough but perhaps our expectations were too high or perhaps we didn't really find the right little streets. We much preferred other areas of Amsterdam which we felt had more to see and do.
Nice quiet area but a good walk. Loved this area, a bit bohemian and chic. Some nice bars and restaurants. The old part of Amsterdam and ayou can spend a nice afternoon walking round here.
Great Area. I spent 7 weeks in Amsterdam this fall, 2 weeks of those was in The Jordan. I loved it, I was a very residential area & felt I got a good idea of life in Amsterdam.
A nice, buzzing area of Amsterdam.. Great for young professionals after a busy day at meetings. Kick back with a nice Dutch beer and enjoy food of different ethnic cultures.

Awesome. The Jordaan neighbourhood is quaint filled with beautiful little stores with authentic Dutch goods. Really enjoyed walking through - and of course buying my ornaments at prices far less than the commercial areas, and far more original!
gorgeous area. i loved walking the streets of jordaan. so beautiful and the architecture is awesome. would love to live there
Nothing to see. worst place in Amsterdam. Nothing interesting to see and very dirty streets. The only worth-going place there is the Pancake Bakery (amazing food by the way!)

Jordaan,. My fiancée and I stayed in Jordaan for 3 nights and it is an amazing neighbourhood. It seems up and coming, a perfect location to get anywhere in Amsterdam with great coffee Bars, shops, galleries, canal views everything. A picturesque place to stay and easy access to the centre. Very, very great stay. Adamthetraveller x
Not to be missed. Very relaxed neighbourhood. Lots of shops and restaurants. Try to visit the market on Saturdays or Mondays. Just walk around and enjoy!

Cool area of Amsterdam. Many good pubs and hip-styled houses. The canal nearby got a lovely decoration at night. Besides this area is much calmer and more local even though it's not very far from central.
The coolest neighborhood!. This neighborhood is fun gem to visit: many galleries, bars and cute little shops. We enjoyed spending several hours in the afternoon and early evening.

quirky shops and intersting cafes. Loved this area especially the most amazing cheese shop we chanced upon. Take a whole day to explore this area as you need to wind your way up and down streets to find un expected little shops. The cafes are quirky and different too.
Lovely part of the city. Pretty canals, good restaurants, some nice bars and cafes. The Jordaan seems to have a more relaxed vibe than other districts. Worth spending a fews hours exploring

A quarter not to be missed. This is the most characterful and, to the visitor, the most characteristic district of Amsterdam. Long neglected, it is now being regenerated without suffering the mauling at the hands of developers which other canal sides of the Old Town have experienced. Don't miss the Westerkerk!

Great Market. Head over here on a Saturday Morning ,where you can buy anything from a canary to apair of second hand Levi's. A quieter side of Amsterdam, fabulous cake shops wit hgreat coffee,(great for the morning after the night before)

Loved it so much. This was probably the best part of Amsterdam for me, I simply loved it and spent the majority of two days there. It is utterly delightful and just full of quirky independent shops, gorgeous architecture, small friendly bars and cafes and so many photo opportunities, with the canals houseboats being the quintessential, picture postcard Amsterdam. This is old school cobbled roads with horse drawn carriages every now and then, houses that are literally leaning on eachother, many locals of all ages and the more appreciative tourist.If you like to absorb some culture, have fun and do a bit of shopping and break up the day with some delicious fresh mint tea, apple cake, beer or coffee and people watching then this is a must see.
Fun, funky and perfect!. Great cute stores, great cafes, wonderful place to stroll. Wonderful place to spend a day or more just exploring.
Worth the walk. This is a pleasant area to walk and even do some shopping. As with most parts of Amsterdam, there are good and bad things to see and do.

Lovely area to wonder around. We really loved this area, it felt so quaint and charming, even though it was right in the centre of Amsterdam! It's close to the Anne Frank museum and a perfect place to wonder around before or after. We loved the narrow streets, the unique and quirky houses and the little restaurants. What made it even better was that it is tucked away and not many tourists seem to find it. I wouldn't highlight any particular streets to visit. Just walk and turn down whatever street takes your fancy !
Very busy on New Year's Eve!. I preferred Barney's Coffeeshop before its refurbishment... I didn't visit Uptown and only briefly visited Barney's Farm.

Wonderful area to stay & shop!. We were lucky to stay in the neighborhood and so walking through here everyday was great. The 'nine streets' for clothing and other items, the Anne Frank house nearby & lots of lovely places to eat made it the perfect area for our family to stay. There wasn't even enough time for us to get everywhere we wanted in this charming part of Amsterdam! It was easy for us to walk to the main centre of Amsterdam also. There are a couple of markets on Saturdays that we visited, one near the church (Noordermarkt is the name I think) and then there is another one a little further north also (it's a lons market all the way down one street and it's undercover too!) Both are great and around that area is the cafe famous for its apple pie! If you can manage to stay in the Jordaan I highly recommend!!

Lovely area to wander around. Really liked the laid backness of Jordaan and think we'd like to stay here on our next visit. Our favourite spot was the Mooi showroom!! (Westerstraat 187). Well worth a visit on a city break.
Great neighborhood. Great neighborhood, with nice canals, very good to walk around, located next to Anne Frank's house. Quiet area, not so full of tourists.
A day's walk about. Very quiet, loads of back street cafe's and old houses, we spent most of one day checking it out.More of the 'real' old AmsterdamHot Choc and cream at about one every hour!!

A must-include in all fashion lover's itinerary. Don't miss the small alleys of Jordan with the fashion galleries, small cafe's and unique "soho" feeling. Even after 10 years of this hype - it still works! Pay a visit to the weekly flee and food market during Sat-Sun around the local church in the south side of the district.
Shopping, Drinking and Fun. Check out the 9 Streets with all of its shops. Won't disappoint. Grab a bite to eat at Lust...Fantastic.
The best applepie. Saterday market near the church and near by in the corner you'll find a coffee house with the best hot apple pie
Lovely area. Well worth a visit, we walked around after seeing Anne Frank's house. Interesting houses and of course the lovely canals.
Great walking area. If you like to walk and look around, this is a nice, quiet area to roam around! Go eat at the Pancake Bakery at 191 Prinsengracht. Very unique food!
trendy area. a nice area to walk around with many small cafe type restaurants and boutiques. very photogenic with cute canals and lovely old houses
great place to wander. lots of lovely places to visit in a warren of streets. A great place to spend a few hours with plenty bars, cafes, restaurants and shops to tempt you.

wandering in the Jordaan. I like this area of Amsterdam a lot, its a little more quirky with more artisan shops and of course Barney's for breakfast. its away from the main tourist drag and a much better area to have a meander away from those awful argentian steak houses in the Liedersplein.
nice place to visit. a little hard to find if you are not used to the canal system. great shopping and landmarks. not many restaurants in this area though.
Fun area to explore. This is a charming, easily accessible neighborhood with lots of interesting little restaurants. Definitely worth a visit.

Just A Great Place To Explore. Narrow streets that contain so much. Almost a warren of discovery. Around almost every corner you will find a snug little Brown Cafe or a unpretentious restaurant. There are shops of, how can I put this, a more original nature than the norm (check out some of the more unusual window displays to see what I mean) and small art galleries. There is always something going on, but it is never too loud. If you are lucky enough to be there on Market day then you must visit. You can buy everything from a zip to some retro clothing or an apple. The Pea and Ham Soup stall is a must and try the Apple Tart and cream.

blessed peace!. We spent a week in April on a houseboat in the Keisergraacht, on the edge of the Jordaan. 4 blocks from the noise & bustle of the Damrak, & I woke every morning to the burbble of the Dutch ducks nibbling on the seaweed on the hull. The first few mornings I woke up thinking I was in my family's cottage in Vermont. The neighborhood was upscale in a very understated way, quiet, residential, well kept. Literally 4-5 blocks walk brings one to the Damrak, the spine of A'dam, the Centraal 3 blocks to the left & Dam Sq. 10 or so to the right. (with all the noise & crowds that such an axis portends.
Authentic Amsterdam in every corner. Great neighbourhood to see the typical sights of Amsterdam: the canals, narrow houses, cafes, coffee shops, cyclists, independent shops and historical buildings.

Lovely area. We visited this area on a cold but sunny Saturday morning. The market sellling bric a brac, different breads, fish etc was interesting. We also saw a larger market nearby selling vegetables etc. Stopped for a coffee in one of the local pubs which was full of locals. In some areas there is a 'village' feel with many interesting shops.

The garden of Amsterdam. Once known as the Jardin, Jordaan is one of the most romantic sposts in town for taking a walk or a canal ride in the city. Don't miss the Saturday and Monday markets at Noordenkerk!

Beautiful. I stayed here with my family in July it was nice and peaceful. The streets are nice to just walk along even if you aren't going anywhere. Everything you need is in close distance, transport, cafes/shopping centres, pubs, clothing stores.
walkthrough you won´t forgett. The most picturesque part of A´dam, very quite and romantic I guess this is the place most Amsterdam postcard pictures are from ;)
Nice neighbourhood. Started my walk around the Jordaan with raw herring. Very pleasant walk. Nice neighbourhood with quaint shops. Nice change from the madness of the rest of Amsterdam.
lovely old area of amsterdam. This a lovely part of amsterdam so give yourself a day to explore. we biked and walked around the area and found great cafes to enjoy wonderful dutch coffee

Charming neighbourhood, with great bruin cafes. I really liked the Jordaan, it's definitely one of my favourite areas of Amsterdam. It is home to many charming bruin cafes (brown cafes, which are kinda like pubs but nicer).
very nice street. its near dam square you can walk there nice view and some canals ,also a famous church ,there were two Iranian supermarket there

wonderful walking tour. my 11 year old daughter and i spent a delightful morning walking around the jordaan with the trip advisor walking tour. it was fun to discover the secret courtyards....our stop for apple pie was perfect and it gave us a look into the residential side of life in amsterdam.
Look for more. Find some of the hidden gardens. Get a local guide if you can to help find and explain these local gems.

Excellent. Best area in Amsterdam....Base yourself in this area and you cant go wrong. Peaceful safe streets with some beautiful houses cafes bars....not all the riff raff that you get in the red light district.
A thousand small boutiques in historic setting.. My hotel in Amsterdam was not close to this site, and maybe next year I'll choose to stay here. All very historic and loads of fun little stores!
Worth walking through - good restaurants. Loved this area, a great way to take in the architecture and sights of amsterdam and several great restaurants. We loved La Perla.
Captivating. Don't bother with the main Amsterdam shopping area, cross over to the Jordaan and the 9 streets and enjoy the real dutch atmosphere and saturday market

Walkabout. Enjoy the essence of Amsterdam: great style, attitude and young, confident people. The Jordaan is "sort of" like the Village, Chelsea, Soho... but less commercialized and crowded. Just go, you'll love it.

My favorite area of Amsterdam. More intimate than other parts of Amsterdam, some of my favorite restaurants are in Jordaan. Rick Steves does an excellent walking tour of Jordaan in his guidebook- takes about an hour.

Amsterdam 2012. great fond. read reviews through this site. definitely the Greenwhich Village of Amsterdam. plenty of shops and restaurants to choose from. rode bikes here at night and had great dinner. highly recommended area.

A little off of the tourist area so very quiet.. We both walked and rode in a car in this area and found it quite charming and lovely. Many typical Dutch style townhouses and several good restaurants.

Superb architecture and quiet streets. The area around the Jordaan is beautiful with tree lined canals and gorgeous architecture on canal houses. Boats are constantly moving on the canals with tours around the canal rings quite popular
Great neighborhood!. The Jordaan is a beautiful neighborhood to get lost and wonder around in. Nice canal lined streets and very good place to take some great pictures.

Just walk around and also look up!. Theis is a really nice neighbourhood in Amsterdam. There are many great cafes and little shops. Have a stroll around and sit down for "Koffie verkeerd and Appeltaart met slagroom" at either Winkel or "de blaffende vis"
Lovely walk. If you are looking for smething different to do in Amsterdam, take a walk trough this area. The restored houses and the gardens are lovely.
Quirky living. The mixture of small, independent restaurants, shops, Moooi, dry cleaners, small supermarkets, deli's, wide street, and the ease of cycling

Amsterdam at its best. Extraordinary, picturesque zone of Amsterdam, full of authentic houses, shops and bars, not as packed of tourists as the medieval city. Fantastic place where to walk and get lost in.

very nice neighborhood. This neighborhood has a nice atmosphere, lots of old houses and friendly people. There are some attractions to see, including some of the 100's of coffee shops. You should visit at least one to see the specifics of this kind of places

Wonderful neighborhood. We got a vacation rental in this neighborhood and it was perfect for us! It's a quiet area with lots of little cafes and restaurants. If you just wander you will see some amazing houses, pop into a cafe for a beer, wander by some art galleries, get a snack at one of the restaurants and wander some more. Locals have dinner with their windows and doors opened so you can hear and smell everything. It was such a welcoming neighborhood and after a couple of days here I really felt like I understood Amsterdam, and I was sad to leave!

Go to Cafe Chris!. Look out for Cafe Chris down one of the lanes, it's a traditional Dutch bar which you can smoke cigarette and cigars in and dog friendly too. An asthmatics hell but nicotine addict paradise! Lovely decor and hospitable barman.

Lovely area, great cafes and little shops. A quiet and great neighborhood/area for walking and getting away from the hustle/bustle of Dam Square, Leidseplein and more busy areas. It's a great place for soaking in the atmosphere, discovering little shops and galleries, sitting in a cafe for a coffee or, if the weather is good, out on a terrace and just watch the world go by. It's picturesque, great architecture - definitely make sure you have your camera or smart phone.

great to walk along.. we loved walking along the canals. you could do that all day and not think of being anywhere else! keep a day for this. add the museums of the neighborhood in your itinerary (Ann Frank is the best know one) and it will be a day well spent!
pretty neighborhood. very scenic and some interesting homes -- also some cute cafes. nice walks around neighborhood and seeing the canals.

Cool neighborhood. We rented a condo on a canal in this neighborhood for our vacation in Amsterdam. The neighborhood has so many great restaurants, we ate there almost every evening. Very cool place to stay, I highly recommend.
Where Amsterdamers live. We loved the tiny streets with hidden gems - secret courtyards, little shops, cafes, and amazing architecture. Great fun to amble about.
Just walk!. ...and walk a bit more, and come back to where you started and go around again finding another new place or pretty canal. I could live here!

Old world charm with small shop amenities. The Jordaan district is perfect for those who don't mind walking or biking for an afternoon or respite from the usual tourist destinations in Amsterdam. It is a tourist destination unto itself, but the rows of 'dancing houses' (houses leaning in all directions-- don't worry, they won't topple onto you!) canals, cafes and beautiful dutch people make the Jordaan a lovely mix of old and new. Do not look for major retailers here, you won't find them. You will find shops catering to all manner of needs-- from fine clothiers to cheeses, from small art galleries to candy shops, and the many pubs, coffee houses and restaurants. The Canals are often lined with houseboats, the roads with bicycles, and the sidewalks with people at all times of the year, though the warmer seasons are nicest. One word of warning: Bicycles have the right of way almost everywhere, which can be unusual for may pedestrians. Do NOT walk on the bicycle paths. It is akin to walking in the middle of a busy street of cars.

Take a canal boat trip. A great way to see this is on one of the many canal boat trips offered. A peaceful way to see the older side of the city, get a boat with an audio feed. A hop on hop off boat is another option
Beautiful neighborhood. This neighborhood is amazingly beautiful and peaceful, very trendy but still quiet, would definately recommend for couples who want a romantic amsterdam experience.

Just walk. There is absolutely no need to get public transport in Amsterdam. Just walk. The small roads and alleys around the Jordan are perfect for simply ambling along. You will find all sorts of shops and cafes. It is simply wonderful and you will be rewarded by not being rushed. Just stroll, look and enjoy.

Lovely area!. Lovely area to walk around. It feels like being in a small town while you're just in the centre of Amsterdam. Nice little shops and restaurants. Definitely an area to visit when you're in Amsterdam.
Nice area. Very worthwhile for a visit. 9 streets area was interesting - if you are a shopper you would love it. canals in this area are very pretty.

Nice Area. The Jordaan is a great area to visit. Its a bit more cultured and upmarket without being too pretentious. All the restaurants we saw looked classy and its just nice and more peaceful if you want a walk around.

Lovely area!. I was lucky enough to have an apartment in this area. It's walking distance to the main Dam square so worth going over to in order to see some non commercialised Amsterdam.It's got an array of 'different' shops - no 'highstreet' chains here, except the Albert Heijn supermarket... so worth a look to see something different.The canals are lovely. There's also a market on Saturday and Monday, both of which were bustling with locals - not tourists - so food, etc, was reasonable priced.

Beautiful area, full of character. Liked: Unique shops, calm atmosphere and beautiful tree lined canals. The Anne Frank House is also in this area and we bought some fantastic presents from here.Disliked: Nothing

You simply can't resist the charm. I've spent less than an hour in this neighborhood and at one moment I remember I simply couldn't hear the vehicles or the noise anymore. My wife bought a lovely purse from an elegant small store and the clerk was the most relaxed ever. We had a cup of coffee and none of the customers were in a hurry but were there to enjoy every sip. Some believe it is overrated but it surely has a relaxed feeling and an elegant charm that you can't find anywhere else in a city full of noise, red lights district action and coffeeshops.HINT: If you are uninterested or out of time, simply invest an extra half-an-hour after you finish visiting the Anne Frank House. Simply cross the canal westbound and walk though the streets.
don't expect too much. We had a walk in the streets of the Jordaan district. Nice area to have a walk but shouldn't be expected more than this. No interesting shops or coffees

Good for a wander. Get hold of a walking tour published on a web site and wander the streets, visiting almshouses, smaller canals, markets and cafes. We spent a pleasant hour or two just strolling. It is quieter than other parts of central Amsterdam, and all the better for it.
Chic and sophisticated. A lovely neighbourhood to wander around. Great bars and restaurants. The market on Saturday well worth a visit,
Lovely neighbourhood. This is a great area to wander round. The shops, restaurants and bars are lovely. The market on Saturday is well worth a visit.
Fun to walk in the bobo land. great shopping for some Dutch sweets, and cheese, and other funny objects, some shops do NO take cash, environment friendly

nice area with shops and restaurants. We were surprised that many shops were closed early...sightseeing all day, we ate dinner and then stopped by and found most everything other than a few restaurants and bar types open

lovely!. Just walking around this neighborhood is amazing; the small cafes and restaurants, the galleries, the shops, the inside of the apartments (woops!)! wear comfortable shoes, and walk, eat, drink, see, shop all day long!

Nice atmosphere, safe to walk even at night. Even the smallest house has flower pots in the windows, walking there was very pleasing and didn't feel unsafe at all. Loads of things to see, nice cafes, nice restaurants.

A cool place, but not much different than everywhere else. Was not sure why this area seems so different than the rest of Amsterdam. When you're walking around, the whole place sort of blends/bleeds together, and I found other than the more residential quality of this area, it was just like the rest of Amsterdam. Beautiful, amazing architecture, but ultimately, identical to lots of other areas. Easy to get lost, and not really any more or less wonderful than everywhere else, I thought. Flowers Coffeeshop was a nice hang. Tell the female counter person Charlie I said aloha. Nice people there, in the heart of the Jordaan.

Lovely area, don't miss it when you're in Amsterdam. This is a great area to wander around through the small streets with little shops and restaurants. The area doesn't feel like being in the middle of Amsterdam. One of my favorite areas in Amsterdam and an area I always show to foreign friends. Don't miss it when you're in Amsterdam.
Great place to walk. Lovely neighborhood for shopping, eating, wandering around the canals and getting a feel for living in the area. Good place to get away from "the big city feel."
Lovely area with interesting history. We followed Tripadvisor's self directed tour in their Amsterdam smartphoen app. Was very informative and took us to place we would not have visited otherwise.
Perfect. This area has it all the quaint shops, bars, cafes, horse and carts, riverhouse's, canal boats, bikes but no trams its laid back crowd free, perfect if you want away from the hub.
Beautiful Neighborhood with Nice Restaurants. Great area to explore little shops, eat and even stay. We ate at La Perla and enjoyed the food, the people and the place.

Peaceful place. Loved the Jordaan District, a little more upmarket than some places with beautiful houses and nice shops even though they were a little on the expensive side they were worth nipping in for a look. Very quiet, peaceful area and walking along the canals was a treat, as always though you have to have eyes in the back of your head for cyclists!
Pretty Area with a great market. We found this area by chance and really loved the atmosphere. A great organic market, antique shops and pretty cafes! Brilliant!

Post card Pretty.. Tree lined streets, canals and houses in various states of stability and almost picture perfect. The gables were a sight to behold and between us we made up some new definitions of gable types.
Market. Spent time wandering the market. Nothing fantastic but was glad I went. Went to the Anne Frank house too. Was worth the wait in line.

I would live there!. It is just like the perfect place to live. Really close to the centre, quiet, with small quite narrow streets, with lots of cute restaurants with terrace and small shops. Perfect place to walk around and get lost. Also good to visit with kids. Lovely ambience.

From poverty to high end. Year ago, this was a poverty stricken neighborhood that has now evolved into a high end district. It contains a lot of high end shops, restaurants and stores in addition to the numerous housing buildings. There a lot of revered history connected to this area and Asterdamers relish it.

Love this neighborhood!. We could walk in the Jordaan for hours. Loved the energy of the cafes. We found there were so many great options for places to eat on our first night, we couldn't decide. But then we saw Olivia's and decided to try it out the next night. We hope it is as enchanting as it looks. Can't wait to try the pintxos!
Bustling and interesting older part of Amsterdam. Small cafes and coffee shops to stop at .. The buildings are so interesting and the flea market atmospheric. Always something interesting to see.
Lovely area. We loved the area! We enjoyed browsing the quaint shops along the way. We couldn't stop taking pictures! What a beautiful place!

strool thru beautiful neighborhood. the jordaan is very pretty, much nicer then the rest of the city, which unfortunately is sort of dirty just walk up and down all the streets to see art galaries, little shops most everyon is friendly
Nice area to spend time. Quiet, lovely and full of small bars, coffees and tradicional shops its the perfect block to spend a day a bit away from the tourist ways

Lovely place for a wander. A beautiful part of Amsterdam with lots of small individual shops to browse in and some nice canal side cafe's. Coffee and apple cake - not to be missed. Remember and take your camera as there are lots of photo opportunities. Remember also to keep off the cycle ways..!!!
delightful.. we rented an apartment in the area. wonderful place to stroll, soak up, stop for coffee and wine. safe, attractive, interesting, clean. many families and play areas.

We stay here!. This area of Amsterdam is charming and fun to walk around. It's got beautifully restored and maintained canal houses, many boutique shops and restaurants and you can almost imagine what it might have been like a couple of hundred years ago. It's very close to the Anne Frank house on smaller canals that give a quieter atmosphere. There is an excellent Saturday market.
Gorgeous Walk. Get out of the hussle and bussle of the main city with only a 10 minute walk from the centre....beautiful with fantastic Cafe Bars and beautiful scenery!!!

Lose Yourself in Jordan. Put your map in your pocket and allow yourself to lose amongst the labyrinth of canals, churches, small lanes to fully explore and enjoy Jordan. The moment you feel tired, hop over to one of the numerous cafes lining the streets. Its really a pleasure to see this rich neighbourhood.

A delight for the senses. THis is a great part of Amsterdam to just wander . The size of the streets and the many shops make this a "human" sized area to play in and investigate. Our suggestion is to make sure you wander around just before sunset becasue then all the store lights come on, and makes the place look even more magical.In many ways this reminds me of Wandering around Venice --canals on one side --- twisty little streets on the other , going who knows where, but all of it interesting.

The place to be!. It is a cosy, artsy and family friendly area in Amsterdam.Great weekly markets,many cozy restaurants and caffees to visit.You`ll find antique shops of old records, comics,clothes and furnitures.
Wandering about.... Love this area for a wander about...VERY beautiful architecture, found myself taking pics of random buildings ALL OVER the place!! :)

Wander around, lose yourself!. The Jordan is to the west of Centraal, wedged between Lijnbaansgracht and Prinsengracht. The Anne Frank House is along the east border of Jordaan.As mentioned by others, this is a wonderful place to walk about and enjoy the neighbourhood. This used to be a working-class area, but now it has become one of the most expensive locations in the Netherlands. It is tranquil and peaceful, quite a posh looking area and yet rather quiet. Enjoy the scenic neighbourhood, and have a meal at the restaurants around.

amazingly beautiful area. very typical old amsterdam neighboorhood..definately need to visit it!If you walk around you will find lots of bars and cafes...it s really nice to enjoy your coffee or your beer to one of those places
Nice for a walk. Quite a nice district with lovely canals. Check out the vintage market at Noordermarkt every Monday.
walking activity. To visit the Jordaan, you just need to walk around the small street, and loose yourself, just following the next nice shop or cafe'. Enjoy the time there!
Best area!. My favorite part of Amsterdam for sure. The best place to go for shopping. Great fashion stores, but unfortunately above my budget at this time :( Lovely cafes as well.
Good for cafes. To be honest - its great for food and drink but you'd never buy anything from the shops in my opinion - a lot of it is a bit "hmm"
Lovely part of Amsterdam. We spent a lovely Sunday wandering around this lovely area with its charming streets, beautiful canals, and interesting historic houses. Not to be missed!

Great are for a trouble free wander. We didn't follwo the advised walking route we just killed a couple of hours whilst waiting for our time at the Anne Fank House. It's delightful and pretty and interesting and it has plenty of quiet reefer free bars where you innocentlt sit and have a coffee and apple cake
Beautifull area. It's a beautifull area to walk around with nice little shops and kafes. Very special atmosphere, very romantic.

The Great Jordaan. By Far my most favourite part of the city. Explore the Boutiques, stop off at a charming brown cafe/bar. Walk some more sit by Prinsengracht watch the boats and people watch. Check out the architecture. In the evening walk down the Tuinstraat enjoy a dutch or belgian beer and then grab a pizza from La Perla. Then watch the sun set against the Westerkerk. Perfect.
Great to wander around. Cool area with little alleyways filled with Spanish and Italian restaurants, bars and cafés. Nice to wander around, especially in the evening.
Great Walking!. This is a great area to walk around. Filled with very interesting boutiques and small restaurants. A lot of shops say"no cash" and will take only debit or credit.

Great place to stay. We stayed in the Jordaan and I wouldn't have wanted to be anywhere else. It's a lovely, quiet and cute area with many neighborhood bars, cafes and restaurants. While in the Jordaan you get more of a feel for how people really live in Amsterdam. I highly recommend not only visiting, but staying in the Jordaan.
Lovely neighborhood. We stayed in this area and I can't recommend it enough. The public transportation is fabulous and you can also walk to many restaurant and the Anne Frank House.
Beautiful!. After you visit the Anne Frank House, take some time to walk through The Jordaan. This is a beautiful part of the city and is a great place to have a meal outside by one of the canals.

Charming quarter. Gives a great idea of the architecture of the city & life in the canal city. Charming areas to walk and very pittoresque! Bring your camera and walk the canals while browsing the shops or having a coffee.

We Loved It. The Jordaan was our favourite area to wander around. Great cafes and restaurants, fewer tourists, beautiful canals, great antique and vintage shops (when they are open) and an eclectic range of other small shops and boutiques. Beautiful.

A Great Area. We spent hours walking around this wonderful neighbourhood.
Great little shops, coffee houses and delicious restaurants. This was our favourite neighbourhood. Do NOT miss.
Nice & Quiet. Some of thee best reataurants located in this area. And you will not be run over by bicycles...great shops here as well...
V nice area of Amsterdam. all of us loved walking around, many places to eat, nice shops and small galleries! better on foot, then on a bycicle

Worth an early evening stroll. relaxed hour long walk from South to North along the main streets to find the shops and bars. very relaxed and uncrowded with very friendly locals. Get a map to make sure you follow the best streets.

Great walk-about area........ Great walk-about area AM or PM, nice cafe's, canal views etc...turning every corner provides another different surprise....make sure you bring your camera... a must visit area............

The Best Area of Amsterdam. If you want to see locals, see great bars, restaurants, lovely canals, amazing shops - get away from all the tourists - this is the place. Its wonderful to wander about, chill out and just enjoy Amsterdam at its best.
Nice. Very relaxing neighborhood for a stroll or a bike ride. Beautiful streets and buildings and I stumbled upon a nice morning flee market with fresh bread, cheese, and fruit.
Nicest part of Amsterdam we saw. Classic Amsterdam, cracking cafes and views with the canals and architecture as the backdrop, unlike the main shopping streets its very clean and tidy.

Peaceful after the bustle of the Red Light and Dam Square. The Jordaan is very close to the centre of Amsterdam but a world away! It is a lovely area for strolling and having a quiet coffee. It was very hot when we were in Amsterdam and the Jordaan offered lots of shady walks along beautiful canals. Come here to see amazing canal boat homes and floral displays.
Quiet neighbourhood. Quiet neighbourhood so close to the bustle of city cente.. We went for a stroll after our morning breakfast and it was simply charming and ever so relaxing.

The Center of it All!. The Jordaan neighborhood is home to everything you want to see in Amsterdam: Red Light District, Coffee Shops, Historical sites, Art, beautiful architecture, food, drink, and shows. You can fill day after day here and never get bored!
nice market and pubs. if you like to wander and have a beer, it's a good start. very relaxed, with a bit of the 1960's vibe still around.
Family friendly. We took the Hop on Hop Off bus to the Joordan and walked to the Nine Streets area with cute boutiques and restaurants. Very nice and calming.
Charming. A lovely, less commercial/touristy area. Felt like we were experiencing more of residents' normal lives, Visited a trash and treasure market and saw more residents than tourists.
See the Saturday Market. We strolled around the area on Saturday morning when it was market time. Lots of local produce and breads; music, organic products.

You can't come to Amsterdam without wandering around the Jordaan. This area of town has gorgeous narrow streets, some closed off to cars. The bikes are everywhere of course, this is Amsterdam after all. There are little cafes everywhere, and they spread out onto the footpaths in the evenings. The little canals are beautiful, the old buildings very picturesque. Well worth wandering through the area.
beautiful area of Amsterdam. This a beautiful area of Amsterdam near Central station.Jordaan area is tranquil and peaceful.Beautiful houses/shops/squares

A little of peace in a frenetic town. After the masses around central Amsterdam and the Red Light District this on the west is a refreshing and quiet area.
Little shops, cafes, restaurants, open street market on Saturday.
Take you time and enjoy.
Beautiful area. Beautiful, peaceful area filled with tiny cafe's, cheese shops and lovely canal views. You can easily lose yourself for a day strolling around and stopping off for wine.

Wonderful window gazing. Beautiful shops, lovely antiques, tasty food, cute hotels, a wonderful place for an afternoon. We bought soup and ate it along the canal, then did some window-shopping. Lovely!
Lovely Area. Just loved it in this area. Quirky shops that didn't mind you just browsing and some fantastic art galleries ti view. Mind the bikes...but that applies wherever you are in the city !!

Beautiful!. Walking through this gorgeous neighborhood was one of the highlights of the trip to Amsterdam for both my travel companion and myself. While the rest of Amsterdam is bustling with action and tourists everywhere, this area was surprisingly serene and quiet.People don't seem to shut their shades in Amsterdam so in the the early evening we could see right into many of the beautiful decorated homes, which was amazing.

Nice and quiet. The Jordaan area is to the west of the centre but it feels like a world away because its so much quieter than Dam Square, Prinsengracht et al. There are lots of small cafes and boutique shops which are worth a look around to find a nice lunch or some quirky souvenirs. You can end up turning down a street where there are only apartments and no shops but you're never far away from a more populated street, best to stroll around on a nice dry day and see what you find! If you're visiting Anne Frank House its just across the canal outside there.
Expensive. I think I proffered to walk around the city shops, much better buying, but jordaan was beautiful. In fact the whole city was beautiful...gorgeous people with such tolerance

Charming and close to almost everything. We stayed in an apartment in The Jordaan that we found online. It was quiet and fit our family of 5 well and provided us a base to explore the city. The Jordaan is very charming, with cafes, Delft stores, canals, and easy access to most of the major attractions in Amsterdam. We literally walked the City every day that we were there.

Don't know. I ran in this quarter really curious after reading lonely planet review, I thought there were a lot of vintage and cheap shops but I really don't know why this area is famous. There were few shops and really expensive but not concentrated, far each other.

Peace can be found in Old Amsterdam. After the manic masses round Dam Square take the tram (lijn 13) to the Westerkerk and stroll around the Jordaan. Quirky little shops, cafes, restaurants are all welcoming and the residents in the are reflect the real Amsterdam rather than the tourist areas. Little hump backed bridges covered in bicycles and flower troughs lead you through enchanted Amsterdam, coffee and a sit down are never far away for tired feet. Lovely lovely place to walk and you can get back to the busy bits of Amsterdam in minutes any time you choose.
Quiet neighborhood. Nice place to walk around by the canals, to see the beatiful architecture of the houses, to have lunch or dinner. It's a quiet and peaceful neighborhood.
Stroll and experience the atmosphere. Just a great place to stroll around and soak up the atmosphere and stop and get a beer. Good place to eat as well

If you would like a more quiet area to take a stroll in, that's the place to go .... Jordaan is an Amsterdam quarter that is a bit more off the main roads of the city and that will give you insights into smaller places, with a good general "feel" of this quarter that houses artists and has many unique places to find. Always enjoyable when we return there ...
Best district of Amsterdam. To get The true Amsterdam feeling, GO there. Old buildings, city centre, great people, restaurants, bars, clubs

Nice shops!. Loads of shops and restaurants! We were there in occasion of a classic music festival in August and there were many concerts located around so we enjoyed it! Pay attention to the hotel you choose...our had a good price but it was a bad one!
Picturesque. The canals are superb. I had never seen so many bikes before, nor the amount of house boats. The floating flower markt was a delight as well.
Nice neighbourhood. Me myself I grew up with Dutch television and a part of Dutch culture, so I was glad to see this popular neighbourhood with my own eyes.

One of the nicer canals... This was one of my favorite canals to venture around as it was conveniently located within walking distance (like most things) and had a neat air around it. Great for picture taking.
Very pastoral streets. Great for an afternoon walk, lots of small buildings with flowers and little canals. Close to Anne Frank's house you'll find lots of small cafes.

Nicer side of town. Lovely cafes,shops and energetic vibe. Classier part of the city, especially after visiting the red light district. Enjoyed the quieter side streets alongside the hustle and bustle.

Beautiful Neighborhood. We loved staying in this area. There was so much to see and do and it had a really nice feeling to it. Great places to eat and fun shopping. The market on Monday morning was great fun!

A beautiful (quiet) walk. With a tourist guide in hand we set off through the Jordaan for a 2/3 hour leisurely walk. In contrast to other touristy parts of Amsterdam there was hardly any other people doing the tourist bit thru this delightful area. The guide came in very handy as we explored this beautifully restored area. Plenty of real coffee shops on the way and lots of cute little narrow streets and plenty of picturesque canals.

old neighbourhood of Amsterdam. Just a few steps from the Central trainstation you'll find a very nice neighbourhood called "De Jordaan" with lots of restorated old houses and a lot of very nice shops in the "negen straatjes" area or in the Haarlemmerstraat. You also find here a lot of good restaurants and cafe's for a good meal and a pleasant short stay. You can find here the most famous Anne Frank House.
