Beautiful. Pretty houses and canals. Locals and tourists. Nice places to sit and watch the world go by. Nice to watch daily Amsterdam life with most on bikes or boats.

eclectic and fun. ok, did you ever expect to see people shopping for swim ware next to a tent where a very large man is trying on a vintage / worn fur coat plus tophat. there are also a number of cool boutiques and coffee shops around (both kinds).jordaan has a large variety of both merchandise and people watching, and is an interesting way to spend half a day.
a contrast. We only discovered this area on our last day. It was a complete contrast to Dam Sq area, quiet and peaceful. There was also lots of nice places to eat.

Best of the Inner Canal Areas. Definitely the best of inner canal areas. A mix of tourists and locals. Easy to navigate, with good restaurants AND definitely not as crazy as the eastern portion of the inner ring.

Not bad. As you might already know, The Jordaan is a bit different from the central part of Amsterdam. Indeed it's nice and quiet and you should visit it if you are staying anywhere near it. Don't know if it would be worth to visit if you are not so close to it. But if you hate crowds and you are in Amsterdam, that's your place.

Quaint, quiet. Good for person with autism.. I took a chance by taking my 14 year old son who has autism to Amsterdam. He gets uncomfortable in crowds and loud sounds, but I try to get him out in the world anyway. Repeated exposure helps him learn to cope with that discomfort. With his limitations in mind, I chose the Jordaan area to stay. I'm glad I did. Although there are still crowds here and there, it gave us a real taste of Amsterdam without too much over stimulation. When he needed a break, we could find a quiet street cafe to sit and calm down. We stayed at a B&B here too.
A Peaceful find. and a great place to chill out, walk and eat. It was great to have fewer people around and out of the bustle of the more touristy areas.

Tranquil neighborhood for a nice walk.... I totally agree with the other posts..this is a GREAT neighborhood to stroll through that is peaceful compared to the more crowded touristy areas.Beautiful houses and really great atmosphere. Definitely it's great to walk around in and explore.
NIce Area To Visit. Quieter than the city centre/red light district and a nice area with lovely houses etc.Local markets available most days

Amazing and beautiful place.. Very good place to walk through and also make a channel tour in a romantic boat. We visit Amsterdam in March and the weather was amazing sunny and it helped our stay and tours through the channels and streets.

beautiful. Beautiful area to take a strool through the streets. The houses are beautiful and the streets are not crowded with tourists. The shops in this area are very quaint and more on the eclectic side. Not your typical tourist shops.
A break from 'hip" Amsterdam. Best CD store - The velvet. The Jordaan was a pleasant atmosphere from the "hip" Amsterdam scene. Shops and restaurants were reasonably priced and inviting
Cool area. Nice walking area of Amsterdam. Quiet with some good shops and restaurants. Architecture is one of the things Ilike and this area had some nice residential type buildings.

Charming area. The Jordaan is my favorite area with the small and large canals. There are wonderful market days by the North church. Wonderful streets for strolling and nice, reasonable places to eat or have a drink.
Amazing Area. This is a great area to cycle around, visit the restaurants, and stroll through the canals. Very nice shops and authentic Amsterdam.
Wonderful art. This is the fine art neighborhood with lots of galleries and restaurants. If you enjoy looking at contemporary art, this is the place in Amsterdam.
Not much to see. Not many good shops, but it's a relaxing walk. You may spend an hour or two if you have the time, but if you have a tight schedule then probably fon't bother.

Loved my walk through the Jordaan. Spring time in the Jordaan is a great time to explore. We stopped in a few local pubs for a "biertje". Everyone was friendly and willing to chat about the local history.
I think a must see while in Amsterdam!
A very nice neighbourhood. A neighbourhood with beatiful houses, clean streets and a wonderful restaurant we found by accident. Daalder - we recommedn it.

Canals and Old Buildings. Walk around; explore, spend some time to enjoy the area. Watch out for the bicycles, they take the right away. Interesting design of the buildings and interesting watch them hoist furniture up to the third and fourth floors. Look at the house boats on the canals where people live.

Nothing special. I went there during the day and I found this area very boring and surely nothing special. Maybe during the night it's better but if you have little time to spend in Amsterdam don't bother going there.

leafy canals. nice area of Amsterdam with leafy tree lined canals.
Worth a walk around if you have an hour or so free
Lovely and peaceful. Lovely area and peaceful. Stunning and great restaurants.
One of the nicest areas in town. A lot of small canals and alleyways. A student/bohemian atmosphere with small shops and restaurants.
An area to discover by foot. Much like a lot of city of Amsterdam, the Jordaan is a really area to see first by boat, and then to walk around and discover all its curiosities
Good restaurants. It is a beautiful neighbourhood especially at night. It is rather expensive but definitely worth visiting some of the best restaurants you can find in Amsterdam.
nice place to stroll. beautiful place to walk around and have meals; however, the restaurants are a little pricy
A must. Nice place to stroll around in Amsterdam. Many things to see .. shops and cafes around.
just fun to look around. If you've never been to Amsterdam, you will like just looking around
Very charming area. The area is very charming, tons of nice cafes and restaurants and shops, great area to just strolling around in for a few hours.

Great galleries and shops but bring a guidebook. All the gallery spaces were fantastic and there were some really good shops but make sure you have a good map/guidebook so you can spot the galleries - some are very small but easy to miss! A really great area to spend the day in if you love art. Go to NiMk before it closes - it's fantastic!

Crowded and rude. We find the people in the Jordaan area quite rude and unfriendly. There are some nice fashion shops and deli's.
Try and pop over to the Pijp area, it has a great vibe.
joordan area. loved staying there loved the cafes and shopping and easy accesability to everything/ would definately go back there.
amazing. good local to walk,many restaurants beautiful houses,good market on saturday

A pleasant walk. A pleasant walk with lots of small bars and a local nick back market which we visited one May weekend. Anne Franks House is now like large theme park. We didn't visit as a mark of respect.
Great Area. Lots to see and do in this area. Lots of interestings shops, cafes etc, all within easy walking distance, just watch out for all the bikes!

The best. This is by far the best area of Amsterdam! Nice little shops, lots of nice restaurants and small bars. A great mix of tourists and locals just the best place to walk/bike around! my favourite de Tweede Egelantier Dwarsstraat on a summer evening.
Cool neighbourhood. Just strall around the streets and feel some of the charm of the town. Nice and quiet with some cool restaurants and bars.

Cozy, understated and posh at the same time. This neighborhood is home to some of the city's best restaurants, shops and pubs. Places can be very basic and traditional to very posh and trendy. Take your time walking through some of the pedestrian streets here and see if you can find some of the city's best places.
Lovely. This neighborhood was my favorite part of our Amsterdam trip. Lovely cafes, flowers, architecture. Take a walking tour around the canals and enjoy the views.
Great place to be. Loose yourself among all the canals and its cafes... rent a bike and be happy!
Not really that spectacular.. I went to this area of Amsterdam expecting a neat neighborhood with shopping options and found very little. The neighborhood was very picturesque, but not much more.

This is what I imagined Amsterdam to be like. When I saw the busy and dirty streets of Amsterdam I was a bit disappointed, but when we entered the Jordaan area where we stayed I found the Amsterdam I envisioned. Calm streets, beautiful canals, lovely brick houses. Lots of good restaurants and little shops.
great neighborhood. we stayed here and walked everywhere. great cafes, restaurants, views.

a little SOHO in Amsterdam. Do not miss this quaint area of Amsterdam brimming with charm and hip stores. There are a lot of little restaurants, if you get tired of the usual food around town. I revisited this area several times, as each time I stumbled across another amazing side street.
Great walking. Beautiful neighborhood for a stroll and a beer. Some good restaurants and nice cafes.
Great atmosphere. Love the Jordaan, just to even walk around and soak up the atmosphere. Can get very busy.
Beautiful!. We loved to walk in this beautiful area. Enjoyed most of our meals there, and just love the old pubs with character!
Favorite neighborhood in Amsterdam!. Get away from the touristy areas and take a stroll around the Jordaan! It is a beautiful neighborhood and you'll get some great pictures!
a most charming area. many small streets, canals, bridges, cafes. We took a boat for two hours floating on the various canals.

One of the top neighbourhoods to visit in Amsterdam. You simply must visit The Jordaan if you want to discover the authentic city center. Beautiful buildings lean gently towards tiny streets leading to some of the quirkier and more interesting shops that Amsterdam has to offer. Why do the same old high-street shopping? Visit The Jordaan and The Nine Streets!

Lovely area to walk around. The lovely little, character filled streets are great for walking around and there a lots quirky shops and restaurants. You could spend days enjoying the area but if pressed for time you could still get a feel for the area in just a couple of hours.
Beautiful narrow streets alongside picturesque canals. Able to wander for hours but never far from good restaurants and bars.
Village atmosphere. A real village feel within a large city. Just wander around the lovely tree lined streets and admire the buildings. Not full or tourists so quiet and peaceful.

I would move here tomorrow. I would live here if it were feasible in my life right now. I wouldn't live anywhere in Amsterdam; just in the Jordaan. Just walk, walk, walk, and walk more. It's a surprisingly beautiful place, full of charm and character that I can't get enough of!

Walk, walk and walk a little more.. Every time I end up in Amsterdam I find myself walking and walking. The Jordaan is one of my favourite areas because it is so damned pretty, relatively quiet and the perfect antedote to the squalor of the Damrak. Best time to wonder is dusk. Best fun is catching a sneaky glance into the houses and seeing dinners laid and people watching tv. Imagine living there.
Must see area of Amsterdam. Out of the hustle and bustle of touristy Central Amsterdam, the Jordaan is a haven of sophistication and tranquility.

A great place to stroll. Window shop and see the small delis and restaurants. Remember that in Amsterdam there is a difference between a coffee "shop" and a coffee "cafe". Watch out for bicycles at all times and remember cars come first; bikes come second; and, pedestrians come last in the travelling hierarchy of the wonderful city of Amdsterdam.

The Jordaan, what's in a name. The Jordaan is a district of the city of Amsterdam.The most common theory on the origin of the name is as a derivation of the French word jardin, meaning garden: most streets and canals in the Jordaan are named after trees and flowers. Another theory is that the Prinsengracht canal was once nicknamed Jordaan (the Dutch name for the river Jordan), and that the neighbourhood beyond the canal came to be called this as well.Amazing to see are the hofjes (inner courtyards). Many houses in the Jordaan have a stone tablet on their facade, a stone sign displaying the profession or family sign of the inhabitants.

Away from the tourist trap of downtown. A lovely neighborhood that provides a genuine Dutch experiance. The area is neat, clean, safe and easily navigated. It's obvious this is first and foremost a residential area with a few streets of shops and lot of great restaurants. Food is remarkably better than that served in the central restaurants that cater to the occasional tourist in Amsterdam who come to enjoy the nightlife.
Don't miss this!!!. Really cool shops and friendly people.We went to Paris as well on this trip and prefer Amsterdam Jordann.
good bike riding in the Jordaan. I really enjoyed riding a bike through the Jordaan a number of times just watching people and visiting the outdoor markets.
nice quartier. good for a walk around the city... one of the most famous places in the city... restaurants, bars, shops and more
Oasis in the heart of Amsterdam. Its quiet and quaint district of Amsterdam full of great little bars and restaurants offering food and drinks at better prices than the most touristy places.

Pretty, very cool and great food & shopping. For us, this is the best area of Amsterdam to stay in. It's close to everything you might want to see and do throughout the city, but it's also a fantastic area to be in if you don't feel like wandering far from home. There are excellent cafes and restaurants everywhere, and wonderful one-off and artisan shops to discover. I can't imagine ever tiring of this part of Amsterdam.
The Real Amsterdam. Visit the Jordaan to experience the real Amsterdam, and not the tourist trap of Centraal Amsterdam.
Must visit neighborhood. Fascinating neighborhood, great architecture, restaurants and shopping.
Cool area to explore.. We wandered around the Jordaan and found it to be a cool and quiet place to explore.
relaxed bohemian feel. enjoyed wandering around the streets ,lots of boutiques and small bistro like cafes-enjoyed lunch there

Individual, fun, full of flowers. Great music, jazz and accordian.
Full of flowers
Superb saturday organic market
Great coffee and apple cake
great neighborhood. Tons of character, restaurants, unique shops, and charming architecture.

The Jordaan needs to be explored. This district has neat nooks and crannies, starting at the Singel Canal and reaching over to the Prinsengracht, and towards town from the Leidsegracht. Bicycles, mothers, fathers, kids, motorcycles, ebb and flow, usually in a rush. Small restaurants, bars, shops, galleries, boutiques, offices, and more all here, in a village style. Bought some awesome Dutch cheese at a "cheese only" shop, a baguette and wine next door. There is a touch of Haight-Ashbury in the air - love it.
Jordaan Ditrict. Lovely area to walk in. Get a guide sheet and see oroignal historic house and architecture - and an antique ice cream shop!!

Beautiful Old Amsterdam, Perfect for a Peaceful Cycle Trip or Some Boutique Shopping. If you want to experience the 'old Amsterdam' this is the place to be. The streets are lined with houses beneath which little shops and restaurants are housed, these old buildings are constructed in the style of architecture Amsterdam is famous for along with the cute little bridges that cross the canal. The canals themselves are lined with houseboats illustrating another more modern but still typically dutch way of living.The 'Negen Straatjes' in this area are filled with boutique shops, that although may not always be kind on the purse are fantastic for window shopping. If you fancy something different and would like to make your own jewellery pop into Beadies:http://www.beadies.nl/

Residential vs commercial. We moved out from Rokin to spend 2 nights in a house boat at Marnixkade in Jordaan. The stay in the house boat was made wonderful when we watched a family of ducks swim up and down the canal. A very different sight, very quiet but the Dutch hospitality can still be felt. We got lost walking in the neighborhood, walked down narrow lanes and saw quaint shops, not touristy at all. It would be good to experience this neighborhood for those who wants time away from the very commercial & touristy Damrak. We were also glad as the neighborhood brought us nearer to the museums. We walked along the beautiful Prinsengracht and met many friendly and helpful locals. Loved the experience very much.

Great neighbourhood. Take a stroll through the Jordaan, visit some of the 'hofjes; which are hidden behinf walls and large doors, have apple pie at Winkel on the Noordermarkt on Saturday morning and get yourself some beautiful cheeses from the biological market as well. All the small streets are lined with nice houses, boutiwues and great cafes and restaurants.

Bazzar. Visit the market in Jordon & then go for an excellent meal at Bazzar. Bazzar is an Egyptian resturant serving great authentic food in a really buzzing atmosphere at reasonable prices. Menus are in English so no problems there!
Beautiful artistic area. Take your time, wander through this beautiful part of Amsterdam, enjoying all the artisic little shops etc.
Go where the locals are!. Loved this little area....nice little shops and restaurants. If you want to get away from all the tourist...take a walk through this area.

Visit the Jordaan at Queensday. On april 30th we visit Queensday (this was former Queens Juliana's birthday, the past mother of our Queen Beatrix) in the Neatherlands. A must visit during this day, I like the atmosphere this day.
But for sure you can visit the Jordaan through the whole year.
Not touristy.. The old working class area. Lots of traditional pubs and small shops.

Fasntastic to meander on a nice day. There is a great local market in Jordaan, great restaurants and funky cafes. The streets are lined with colourful flowers in the spring. Caneasily spend a half day exploring up and down the streets, with extended coffee stops along the way
cosy quaint area. atmospheric and tradtional canal areas with true Amsterdam style architecture fro the past
Nice and fashion neighborhood. Nice walking with fashion stores and cool bars and restaurants. If you rent a bike, don´t use there. There is lot of people and narrow streets.

Clean , Green and Pretty. The narrow streets and tree-lined canals of the Jordaan are a must in Amsterdam. It was unseasonably cold when we went so we nipped into shops and welcoming cafes quite frequently as we wandered round this gorgeous area.
One of the jewels of Amsterdam. Quiet peaceful streets with quaint houses - also many restaurants away from the main tourist area.
Awesome spot. Very interesting and amusing. It worths the visit. A must do.

Nice little houses and shops.... We had a stroll in the Jordaan while visiting Amsterdam upon the recommendation of our hosts. Great place to visit. We especially love the cute little houses, shops and cafes around.

Favorite Amsterdam Neighborhood. In a city of several charming neighborhoods, this was the best. Go on a market day -- the market was so charming, with all of the food stalls, the many delicious bakeries (one of the best brownies I've ever had was purchased in the market), and all of the plants. But go on any day -- charming streets, both busy ones and quiet ones, some cute little shops, and tons of cafes. We had so much fun just biking around this neighborhood, parking our bikes frequently to explore a shop or enjoy a cafe.
There is no more beautiful place in Amsterdam. So quaint, so unspoiled. This area is the jewel in Amsterdam's crown. For a nice night out, to a great day of shopping - this area has it all.

Open Artist Studios. We had the rare treat of being able to visit the artist's studios in the Jordaan during an open studio weekend. There were about 60 open studios in the neighborhood and it was great fun to climb the crazy stairs, and see firsthand where people work and the amazing work and workspaces in Amsterdam.

Charming. The Jordaan is the most charming district, with more upscale houses that are cared for and have flowers under the windows. This is a good place to wander around. It is the area around the Westerkerk, with its very high bell tower.
Jordaan walk. Stroll along the canals, especially away from the congestion around the Anne Frank House, and soak in the beautiful old homes and ambience.

We enjoyed staying in this section of Amsterdam. Even though this area has a number of shops and pubs, there are a number of residential side streets which are quiet and charming.It is a short walk to the train station and not a long walk to the very active center of the city.The canals are lovely to stroll around and have a number of anchored quirky houseboats which are personalized with decorations.

The Nine Streets (negen straatjes) are the real Amsterdam. Get away from the usual tourist traps and visit the Jordaan and the Negen Straatjes to see the real Amsterdam. Lots of old buildings and little shops offer something new for visitors
Jordaan cosy and lovely canals. Jordaan cosy and lovely canals, nice cafes.Just a good place to stroll around and have a coffee or a beer.
Lovely atmosphere. A very relaxed part of Amsterdam. Some lovely cafes and restaurants.
Nice district. quiet place to visit the real amsterdam without high tourists

A must visit. I loved the very dutch atmosphere of the neighborhood. Unlike Dam street, you don't see many tourists (like myself:) Went to the market on Saturday, a real treat and a gala for shoppers. Clothes, antiques, food, name it.... While walking make sure you have a close look on the buildings as they are truly amazing.

Quirky and Full of Character. Loved the area. Really interesting shops for all sorts of things - food, clothing, homewares etc etc. Also the occasional cafe where one can go to really 'chill out' on the local weed!

Nice to people watch. Because of its reviews I decided to walk over from the train station. It was nice getting lost around the neighborhood, many nice style houses, bikes, quaint resteraunts and canals to take pictures of. Nice to people watch when you are an outsider. Prepare for the cold and rain, I hear its always raining and its chilly most of the year.
nice for walking. nice family atmosphere. many nice cafes. very safe and clean.
Great museum. Lots to look at here, I enjoyed it a lot. The only thing was that at the time I visited it was being renovated and so we didn't get to see all of the displays.
Quirky. Lovely area to take a stroll and look at all the quirky shops and some great little cafes.
Favorite section of the city. It is so peaceful and quiet. The canals are beautiful. It makes for a great place to stroll.
Lovely neighborhood. Great place to just meander around, stpo and have coffee.
romantic , quiet. It was beautiful walk , very romantic in the evenings and quiet.
Interesting area and great shops. Loved the little lanes, houses, shops and Amsterdam's oldest bar

Pretty area with markets, boutiques and lovely cafes. Walked around the Jordaan area on Sat 19th May 2012. The large market was on, which whilst vast, was a real mix of interesting and tat, but worth a look.As you move towards through the main shopping areas, you come across cafes, boutiques and some wonderfully pretty tree lined canals.Make sure you stop off Pompadour for some cake and a drink.
cool neighborhood. it has an art district and a great little market lining the major street
Friendly and fun.. Busy and active area. Lots of little shops and the Tulip Museum.

Great quiet apartment. This is the place to stay in Amsterdam if you are a little older and want to sleep well at night and be surrounded by lovely shops and restaurants. We had a little coffee shop around the corner and multiple restaurants within a couple blocks. A nice place to come home to after a hectic day in Amsterdam.

Beautiful area of Amsterdam!. We enjoyed walking through the Jordaan area for several hours. There is lots of history in the canal houses, and beautiful canal views. Peaceful and quiet, not overly crowded.
Lovely for a walk. The Jordaan is a lovely area to walk around, with lots of little shops and cafes- really nice neighbourhood- really laid back with a mix of residential streets and markets.
Great area, characteristic feel. We strolled around for hours, just getting the feel, great restaurants and cafés, lovely little terraces everywhere
A quieter side to Amsterdam. Worth a trip for the quieter side to Amsterdam, peaceful canals, flea markets and great Apple Pie!!
Don't Miss. A beautiful part of this elegant and civilized city. A great part of the city to see on a rented bike.
A+. One of my favorite places in Amsterdam. Quiet streets, great pubs with excellent beers. Good food too.
Beautiful Area. Well worth the walk after your visit to Anne Frank House. Nice architecture, shops and food options.
Picturesque. Loved Jordaan area with nice cafes and shops along the canals.

so charming. If you get tired of overcrowded city center take a walk through this part of the city. We were there at the evening and it was so quiet and peaceful. Lovely to stroll around canals and admire typical houses. Had a dinner there in nice restaurant called La Oliva.
Nice area to explore. We really enjoyed walking around the Jordaan. Nice and peaceful away from the crowds. Recommended

quaint jordaan. the prettiest part of amsterdam - beautiful tree lined canals - filled with interesting house boats - restaurants spilling out into the streets - fabulous little boutiques for shopping - just love it

Boho chic - canalside. This quieter district to the West of the busy centre is a great antidote to the hustle and bustle. There are some great places to eat and drink and lots of interesting little shops to potter about in.It takes a little while to get your bearings, but if you want to chill out a bit whilst in Amsterdam - this is the place to go.

Nice area.... The Dutch couldn't pronounce the French version so they just called it the Jordaan. It's a nice enough area but nothing special. It has a diverse range of restaurants and caters to different tastes. You can see people walking their very cute puppies around this area!
Hidden Jem!. Good walking around and many of souvenir stalls to shop nice house located in small street.

Charming, walkable neighborhood. We spend several very pleasant hours wandering the Jordaan neighborhood. This is a residential area featuring small shops, cafes and galleries and a nice change of pace from the busy, crowded area around Dam square. It's a good opportunity to see a vibrant neighborhood and get off the beaten path.
Lovely to walk around. Lovely place to walk around with lovely little couple streets.

The most interesting part of Amsterdam. This is a great place to wind down and relax. A lot of good restaurants and small shops. The atmosphere is relaxing and a lot less stressful than the typical tourist areas of Amsterdam. If your trying to find that special pair of shoes or the perfect vintage tshirt, this is the place for you - but be prepared to pay for it!

difficult to find. The Jordaan was pretty difficult to find; even with a map. There wasnt actually that many shops there either. I would definately stick to the in the centre of amsterdam! its not like there isnt enough
OLD EUROPEAN ELEGANCE. Beautiful upscale area to stroll , shop & dine. Loaded with charm. Very romantic.

Have a walk in the Jordaan!. I live in Amsterdam and always enjoy going for a walk, or a beer/cappucino in the Jordaan. It has a nice local scene, while offering diverse restaurants, shops and cafe's. Gezellig !
Perfect area. After traversing all of Amsterdam, we found ourselves trying to spend more time in this neighborhood. Our dream would be to house-hunt internationally here. Can't wait to go back!

Nicest neighbourhood in Amsterdam - don't miss it. We spent several hours wandering along the different canals, looking at the nice houses, shops and birds. It's a very pleasant work among the several canals, don't miss it. It is well deserving the Unesco classification.
Old part of the city, near the Dylan. Lots of little boutique shops and bars, either walk or take a bike, definitely no room for cars

Nice area for a stroll. What a great neighborhood! We felt perfectly safe here, and spent hours wandering about, looking at homes, canals, tiny dooryard gardens, etc. The wealth of restaurants was staggering; I wanted to eat at so many places that it was difficult to pick one. The diversity was truly amazing. On the edge of this area, we found thrift shops that were open on Sundays. That was great because we needed to buy warm scarves to keep out the chill and to look a little less like American tourists!

Beautiful. Being here during the Queen's BIrthday celebration makes it very different from normal days. This area was fantastic in its celebrations. This area had a slightly older crowd, (30's+) the music was geared to this crowd. The entire city was music stages and parties. This area was beautiful and wonderful concerts. I don't know what it would be like under normal conditions.
Take a stroll - it's a great experience.. Love to walk around the Jordaan. Interesting shops.
Wonderful Buildings. Buildings are amazing and the "Nine streets" with all the little independant shops are well worth a visit.
Beautiful area. great canal views, fun to just stroll around and look at the shops.
A nice place to visit. Colourful and intense, this is a neiborghood that you won´t want to miss.

Great area for walking around. Grit your teeth and buy one of the over-priced walking tours from the Amsterdam Tourist Information Office -- and then enjoy the route and the info it provides. You're bound to enjoy a walk through the Jordaan.

Typical district from Amsterdam, a must see. This district is very pretty and very typical of Amsterdam. Best is going during the Saturday at market time. There are plenty of terrass to have lunch. It is just nice to walk around or bike. It is also a fancy area. Everybody is looking for an apartment there!
Shop til you Drop. This is small shop heaven...I really like going in all the different stores. The drawback is the relatively early closing time.
Food. Great little food outlets - highly recommend as a friendly neighbourhood with many small cafe's restaurants etc at a reasonable price
Amazing!. Pretty nice district! It's quiet, beautiful and really cozy!
Amazing. Simply beautiful part of the world......I love its European-ness! I could walk around loking at buildings all day!

Nice neighbourhood!. Stayed in Jordaan for a week, and we loved it. The area is central but still much more peaceful than down town. There's a lot of restaurants, cafes etc. and it's also a great area for shopping. Would definetly stay in this part of Amsterdam again.

Walk and Enjoy. We'd heard/read that Amsterdam is best seen on foot and we found walking around the Jordaan bears out the truth of this adage. Excellent cafes and some quirky shops set in an intriguing meant that this area was one of our favourites.
Nice, walkable neighborhood. Has plenty of shops, cafes, bars and restaurants tucked in the various sidestreets.

rainy Jordaan. we enjoyed strolling around the streets.
The atmosphere was great and the buildings were interesting.
Jordaan. Lots of lovely shops, cafes and really pretty to wander around
pretty tourist trap. this area is hyped in all the guide books, especially the nine streets. It was very pretty, but a but of a tourist trap. Ohter parts of the city are just as pretty
A nice place to wander.... Beautiful area that one can easily lose their thoughts in.

Stay here.. The Jordaan wasn't as magnificent as I imagined (but I have a good imagination!) but it is well worth a wander around. What I really recommend is staying in the area. It is so quiet and safe and its lovely to pop into a local bakery etc for a quick snack. Really makes your experience of Amsterdam special. (The Eelhouse B&B is highly recommended!)
Very nice neighbourhood. nice neightbourhood to walk by but only if you have extra time. :)

Quietest and nicest Amsterdam neighborhood!. Amsterdam is a city full of tourists all year round. If you want to find a quiter and more peacefull part of this city ,Jordaan is the place for you. Walking around the nice canals and small streets or visiting the good small restaurants and pubs will give you some peace of mind and tranquility.
Amsterdams green district. Quieter and more sedate than the frantic traffic and noise of the Damrak. A lovely place to escape and catch your breath.

Hidden Treasure. These small streets are well worth the effort. You will be rewarded by taking the time to get lost in the small side streets where you gain a real picture of how the locals live and the great eateries along the way.

Nice area for a stroll. Full of interesting houses. A good area to take a slow and relaxing walk. Jordaan area is directly over the river (due west) from Ann Frank House. We found it a convenient place to walk after visiting the House. Visit the Winkel Cafe on the walk for great apple pie. If it is sunny Winkel has plenty of space to eat outside.
A Lovely Area. An up and coming area of the western canal system with delightful streets, shops, cafes. Go to the Cafe Winkel for Apple cake and slagroom (=cream).
Cool neighbourhood. Really liked the feel of the place.; just wished we had more time to spend there and sit in one of the nice cafes
Shipping. 9 streets. Visit for unique gifts and qualitybproducts
stay here. Sleepy little neighborhood with shops and restaurants and a few weekend markets. Much more enjoyable section of Amsterdam than the crowded, dirty tourist part near Dam Square.

Dirty streets, but you have to walk them!. We were a bit surprised with amount of garbage and dirt on the streets, maybe it was just days before they do some big street cleaning... Anyway, we walked these streets few times, number of places to sit, drink and eat.
not quite as expected. quite deserted - not the buzz expected to find but a good spot to sit, eat drink and take stock onto next stop
Very nice walk. Good place for souvenirs and the canals. Strongly recommend the pancake restaurant.

Loved it during the day. This is a lovely area to walk around, stop in pastry and coffee shops and take in the sights. But when we went there at night, we had a heck of a time to find any of the restaurants that Trip Advisor readers had recommended. We actually found very few restaurants open at night. And those that were open were very over-priced. We turned around and went to another area looking for dinner.
walked around here a lot getting lost. very pleasant with interesting shops and houses.worth spending a couple of hours getting lost here. feels like you're in the 17th century.

Nice Area for a Sunny Day. Just wait for a sunny day and go for few hours walk in the streets of this area. Relax in the coffee places (with real coffee) and enjoy pastries while shopping. Definitely recommended!

The best. The Jordaan is the best area in Amsterdam. Many little shops, bars and restaurants. It is touristy, but not to touristy. People are friendly and there is also the farmers market on Saturday and the Flea market on Monday's.

lunch canalside. Can't remember the name, unfortunately, but the tables were right beside the canal (I could have fallen in). Had a beer and a croque madame. Enjoyed the sun, sketching the bridge, people and canal watching.

Close enough to the centre yet far enough to be seperate. This is our favourite area of Amsterdam - finding its self close to the centre but far enough away to feel loke a seperate part of the City. There is lots to to including the must see Noord Market and plethora of peaceful canal side coffee shops and restuarants. Dont miss visiting this area.
So cool.....so relaxed. The chilled atmosphere and the vast range of quirky shops made for a relaxing few hours strolling.
Nice Place!. Simply the best for shopping, relaxing and walking across nice area fully of stores to shop, cafes and taking boat around.

Quaint. A pretty area of town with some good restaurants and bars and some unusual shops. This area is less crowded than the old town and not seedy, so feels much safer at night. A great area to wander around.
A must see quarteer. Very nice and quiet area of Amsterdam. I recommend you de Noordmarket

Walk every bit of this area. shhhhh..the locals won't like it if you find out about this fabulous area of Amsterday. It is chock full of great cafes, restaurants, shops, etc. and is extremely walkable.
Great Area. Very nice area for a walk, a drink or some serious shopping
Van Gogh museum. The extensive exhibit is amazing. The flow of the rooms worked well and the live music on Friday evenings was a great addition.

Best done through the canal tours!. Reading about this before traveling to Amsterdam, I was expecting much more ....but while this place does have a history and is good to see, its best done while on one of the canal tours in the day! Walking around this area can be boring after a point...however, the old buildings with their unique style can well be seen during the boat trips and the guides usually explain things and point out stuff you'd miss if you simply walked around.

A lovely neighborhood. It was nice to stay a bit off the tourist area. We enjoyed the neighborhood feel and walking through its picturesque canals. We used airbnb (.com) to book a lovely apartment. We recommend eating at Balthazar's kitchen

Excellent area for browsing and staying. Wonderful array of small shops to browse and after plenty cafes to sit and watch the world go by or have a meal at some of the many wonderful restaurants, they are not as pricey as some reviews I read before going.We were doubly lucky that we found a wonderful place to stay in the Jordaan area, so peaceful and quiet, yet a short walk to the Dam Square, ideal, can't wait to go back, once the city centre upheaval is over.

Old Amsterdam. Typical Amsterdam neighborhood - some streets have lots of shops and restaurants and others are bare. Can seem lonely and deserted on dark, cold winter evenings, but very lovely to wander around on a sunny day!
Doors. loved the doors the homes have and resturants and stores nearby

take a walk on the canals. small streets, a lot of canals and place where you can stop for a coffee or a beer. i enjoyed my walks in this part on amsterdam, where you can also discover the monday morning flea market (Noordermarkt)
Great place to stay. So nice to come back to this neighborhood after a hectic day in Amsterdam.
get a guide!. The Jordaan is a fairly size able neighborhood steeped in history. I went through here as part of a BestDam segway tour, and then wandered around by foot.

A charming neighbourhood. No Amsterdam visitor should miss a walk across this charming neighbourhood. Very pituresque Grachten and houses, little streets, shops, cafes, pubs. A friendly and laid back atmosphere, at least at noon. Many people, mostly locals, were sitting in the sun in front of cafes or restaurants, enjoying lunch, a beer or just a cafe. A very nice spot is the Egelantiersgracht.

Great Neighbourhood. By far, one of the best neighbourhoods in Amsterdam. It has charm during the day and cool laid back cafés, restaurants and bars in the evening.
When you want to go somewhere for grown ups, go to the Jordaan neighbourhood.
Old Area. Old town centre, cute shops, but a bit pricy & touristic. Picturesqe.
Wonderful Area of Amsterdam!!!!. Cute Shops! Cute cafes! What more do you need?! This was my favorite part of Amsterdam.

Go to the open market on Saturday morning!. Cheese, clothes, bread, vegetables, pastries and collectibles. Though the tram gets you close, you will be walking to get to the open market. The Jordaan is a slower pace than the top attractions. We enjoyed our visit.
A gorgeous area. We strolled through the Jordaan district on our last evening in Amsterdam and were taken aback at the unusual beauty of the homes and surroundings.
Great for window shopping. Don't go before noon as not much open. Still lots to look at and a nice place to just wonder around. very chilled atmosphere.
Nice neighborhood. We had our best meal at a restaurant in this neighborhood. I would read up on this area ahead of time and would spend more time visiting some of the shops and cafes.

charming, but know when to go. The shops and restaurants in this area seem to be closed a lot. Maybe it's more happening during the evening hours when people are home from work or maybe it's busier during the summer. Still was very nice.
Nice stroll.. Good area for a walk. There was a nice flea market with lots of people and interesting things for sale. Close to Ann Frank House.
Walking in the Jordaan. A really nice looking area with lots of independent shops, cafes & bars all on or off the canals. Looks really nice when it snows.

quite little canal area. We sat here eating out picnic next to the canal. We had a couple of pre-rolled smokes with us as well. We sat in the sun eating our lunch and smoked a couple of joints. We kept them out of sight of any kids or oaps. Be respectful and the police will leave you alone.
Picturesque. Some of the best shopping in Amsterdam can be done here (apart from PC Hoofdstraat).
Beautiful area of town. This is one of those quiet areas for when you want to relax. Almost the whole area just looks like a postcard of what you visualize Amsterdam to look like.
Pleasant area. The area around the Brouwersgracht at the top of the Jordaan is particularly attractive, with few tourists.
Fascinating. Fascinating little streets with unique shops and window fronts. Plenty of little bars / coffee houses to stop and watch the world go by. Make some time for this section of Amsterdam.
Meh..... Heard this was supposed to a pretty and clean part of the city, it isnt.
a beautiful part of Amstersam. Simply beautiful - good shopping at the top end, a great walking experience, not to mention seeing it by boat, which is an absolute must.
Our tour guide was a little naff (in comparison to the other European tours we experienced). Some nice shops and a decently relaxed area with Anne Franks museum near by.
Interesting area with quaint shops. Lovely area. I stayed in an apartment there in 2008. There was lots of nice little shops, cafes and restaurants. Also walking distance to Dam Square.

Nice area with a lot of little shops.... My wife and i are not very keen on the big shopping street, they are crowded and have all the main stores that you can fin anywhere in the Netherlands, it is much nicer to go to places like the Jordaan where you still have a variety of little shops... My wife decided to go to a store where they sell all kinds of Asian and African stuff, amongst others jewelry... we spend more than an hour in this store, my wife came out with 5 complete sets are very reasonable prices!... My wife worked in Nepal for more than a year and likes that kinds of jewelry, the prices in this shop were not much more than what my wife paid in Nepal only the quality was better.... anyway they have lot's of these kinds of stores, check it out!.

Saturday Must. Go to visit the Noordermarket on Saturdays and stroll the canals around this area.\Visit also the Haarlemmerstraat 5 minutes from the N. market.
Saturday antique market with musicians and the famous Apple Cake at the corner make this area worth visiting.
Great chic neighbor !. This place is great to enjoy with friends and lovers.But may be not a great place for singles....
Nice neighbourhood with good bars!. Nice area, has good bars, cafes & shops. Spent half the time there

Beautiful place.. This is a very beautiful part of Amsterdam and I was happy to be staying there rather than somewhere else in the city. There are lots of cafes around and places to eat.You should try renting a bike and cycling around the area, it's too pretty to miss and probably one of the safest places to cycle in the city. There are great shops around and the canals are lovely.When I visited the canals were frozen over so we had the unique experience of being able to skate on the ice and get a hot dog on it too heat us up in the very cold weather.It seems like the hub of the city.
Quirky. An amazingly quirky area of Amsterdam with lots of boutique style shops. Well worth a visit.

Stroll-drink-stroll-shop-drink-stroll-eat. De Jordaan is filled with small shops, little streets, typical Dutch cafe's (Bruine kroeg), hipsters, restaurants and all the other stuff that makes life worthwhile. It;s like New York SoHo/Meatpacking goes Dutch.
Nice area with several little shops. We walked around, looked in some of the shops, liked this more than the busy shopping streets as here they had more special shops.

Great neighbourhood.. We stayed in the neighbourhood whilst on a short trip to Amsterdam. The area is very nice and has a very safe feel to it at night. There are many shops and bars open at different times of the day so you are never searching for things to do. The one thing that struck me was that the area was VERY well kept and in excellent condition. It was not very often that you saw any litter, graffiti or houses in disrepair.I would definitely recommend a walk around however watch out for the bikes!
hours and hours. Just walk around and feel amsterdam. The small shops, cafés, picturesque streets...wonderful!
Sensible shoes only please................. what to say?, what to see? just wander. There's nowhere else like Amsterdam, there's nowhere else like the Jordaan.
Nice quiet area. If your into nice quiet scenic photography this is the areas for you lovely tree lined canals and buildings
Great walk!. Easy pretty walk in the midst of bustling Amsterdam. Less crowded, great small shops and a wide variety of eateries. So glad we chose to stay in this area.
Lovely neighborhood. A great place to walk and cafe visit when you need a break from museums.

Okay?. This place certainly gets a lot of hype in the tourist books, but we didn't really get it? Just seemed to be another nice neighborhood in Amsterdam, but I wouldn't go out of your way to see this.
One of lifes great treasures!. The Jordaan is my favourite place to just walk and relax in Amsterdam. Since moving here almost 2 years ago it is a place that I never get bored of.

Call me biased, but its beautiful!. I have lived in the Jordaan for a year, so I may be biased - but having declared that point, I must say that the area is beautiful. Its close to the centre, so easy to get to, lovely narrow streets, with traditional old Dutch houses (tall, skinny and slightly wonky!), nice little shopping streets with individual boutique-y stores, and lots of nice cafes to stop and have coffee in and watch the world go by. Very photogenic, and a lovely calm area for you to to just generally potter around in.
Excellent location. Brilliant bars and restaurants. Very peaceful quiet area.

A walk around a residential area. A pity their was no main feature to serve as the purpose for meandering around here. Would be nice to see information somewhere about the history of trades carried out in the roads we were in, eg ropemaking, tanning. Only bother if you've done everything else!
Quick walk. Just a quick walk around but some nice shops to gaze into.

chilled and fun. taking the tram from Centraal you'll need to walk a bit to find the main bars/restaurants/boutiques, sort of left/right/left/right/left/right and you'll come to it. The walk there is really sweet, very residential and just gorgeous. Once you reach the shops it's so chilled out, lots of locals and generally a great vibe.
Great. It is a charming neighbourhood that is worth your visit. Probably one of the most beautiful parts of Amsterdam. On the bankside of the canal, an abundance of places to eat or enjoy a coffee.
Utopic Amsterdam, scenic and charming. This is a very picturesque , clean and nice part of Amsterdam. Many artists are there, several art exhibitions etc. Do pass by there for a walk.

The place to stay. We love this area if you are over 40 and enjoy the good things in life. Good people in the brown bars, good shoping and also a surprise in a new restaurant popping up everytime we visti

the most beautiful district of amsterdam. The central position of the district allows to reach the main places of tourist interest...the district is residential, full of channels that when freeze you fill up with people ice-skating on the frozen river between boat houses...very fine structures of the houses overlooking the canals...take a walk around Jordaan!!!
Heel hollands, typcial dutch. This is how Holland used to be in the old dayd, naroow streets small houses and shops. Altough it is very tourtistic you still can see, smell and feel the old ambience.

Favorite Neighborhood. I am an American that has lived in numerous neighborhoods in Amsterdam. This is definitely one to see if you want to see more of the old school side of Amsterdam. It is more for wandering through, relaxing and enjoying the beauty of this very cute city. The houses are tiny and the streets are narrow, making it picturesque. The shops, pubs and restaurants are very nice. You should expect more your small local shop owner than a chain experience. There is a street market on Saturday where you can wander through and enjoy (food, clothing, flowers, etc.). The best apple pie spot in Amsterdam is right there. You can sit on a terrace along one of several canals and enjoy a snapshot of Amsterdam life. What is not to love?
cute area great for photography and some shopping. Found a fabulous music store hidden amongst the canals, it is a great area and virtually empty of tourists, wonderful photo ops.

Nice old part of Amsterdam. I like the nice little streets, the beautiful canals but unfortunately the nine streets are now crowded in weekends and they lose their original shops by coming of the big brands like COS, Bjorn Borg, Lee, etc. It has lost his atmosphere

Quirky Neighbourhood. Just go see this eclectic delight! Great arty, crafty shops, staffed by friendly knowledgeable staff. Fabulous bars and restaurants, mostly patronised by locals. Super to stroll through.

So nice, so romantic. It is a very nice quarter.I loved the old hospice now became a residential quarter, and it is full of sprained houses (I can send pictures if you wanna see).I suggest to read a guide, that can help to follow the best walk. Mine started from the bottom (in front of the high canal) and continued above the Nortgheklerk.During the walk it's better to try the old cafè (like the Bruin) where you can taste some dutch cookies.
Better than the red light district!. Interesting shops and bars and the secret that is the Cat Boat.
Nice. Beautiful neighbourhood near the Anne Frank house - quiet and picturesque with some cute cafe's and unique shops.

Little bit of Boho. Fab area, gerat markets, fab pancake house and alternative shops. Found a really great cafe selling very inexpensive luches, pumpkin soup to die for...Great for Veggies, just on the corner of market.....
The real Amsterdam. With its small streets and many restaurants, you will egt the feeling of real Amsterdam atmosphere here. Not to be missed!
Great Neighborhood, Pleasant Walks!. Shopping at the Nine Streets, coffee at Cafe de Prins or Cafe 't Smalle, bread, cheese and salami from Kasskamer. Lovely!
charming. nice, quiet neighbourhood with small shops, boutiques and restaurants. Clean, safe and quiet.

THE neighborhood of Amsterdam. Stil quit genuin. Beautifully restored. Visit the old cafe's. This is really 'Amsterdam".It's a village community in the center of town with their own famous humor. A lot of famous Dutch singers grew up here.
Good to walk around. This is a very beautiful, up-scale part of town. The main draw is to just walk around and look at the beautiful canal homes.
Walking the streets of Jordaan. Becareful of strangers that come and beg which marred the walk slightly otherwise a nice stroll through what seems like a residential street
Fun, eclectic mix of shops & restaurants.. Good fun to check out with the great mix of fun places to eat and shop in.
So refined.. My favourite place in Amsterdam you can just walk for hours in the stillness and admire the beauty.

Jordan is beautiful. I totally loved this area. Quiet, but full of life! Packed with small shops and lovely surprises... We bumped into the saturday vintage market, and it was totally awesome! Full of nice things to buy, and yumm, a lot of cheese around. Many little restaurants with caracter, not pricey at all, and certainly not touristic at all. We tried the "Restaurant De Eettuin" (close to the Ann Frank house) with some typical dutch food. It was no less then awesome! Delightful! Here is the address: Tweere Tuindwarsstraat 10A, www.eettuin.nl. Totally recommended!Many students and artists live here. Easily my favorite spot in Amsterdam. Don't miss the 9 roads: shopping paradise!

Cool neighborhood. Walked around the neighborhood with my wife when we went to go to the Anne Franke house but did not feel like waiting in an hours long line.Very quaint homes, lots of flowers, nice people. Probably the nicest area of Amsterdam to live in. Lots of character but not seedy at all.

Historical place. The Jordaan is one of the attractive historical places in Amsterdam to go. Many old buildings to see and the typical atmosphere and the Amsterdam humor you will find here. Visit also Ouwe Nol a nice bar in the middle of the Jordaan.
Place to be. With the old houses, with the nice little streets and the canals.
If you want to know Amsterdam, feel Amsterdam and live Amsterdam then the Joordaan is the palce to be!!. It is all in the title of my review, the Jordaan is what make Amsterdam -Amsterdam
Great area. Great area for cafes, restaurants and boutiques. Beautiful part of Amsterdam

Hang out and feel the atmosphere. Lovely area in a corner of Amsterdam. Relaxed people - both visitors and locals. Full of nice, cosy restaurants and bars. Hang out at Thijssen, and "brown cafe" - but don't expect service. Get your drinks at the bar, that is much faster

Real Amsterdam. I'm born and raised in Amsterdam and whenever I've been abroad for an extended period of time, I just love to come up and walk alongside the canals. This is what Amsterdam is about, from the grandeur of the canal houses, to the small blue collar workers' houses in the side streets. It has many charming corners, nooks, and new surprises everywhere with plaques and small memorial plates. It is best when walking around (wear your sneakers or walking shoes! Cobble stones everywhere + long walks possible because of the bridges), looking up, a bit of sunshine (lots of people out on boats as soon as it might be a sunny day), a bite and a drink along the way and a mix of quaint and hip flagship stores. The 9 streets (in fact 3 streets, but they switch name after each bridge across a canal) just behind the Royal Palace (Hartenstraat) are known for cool stores and restaurants. Just look around, this is the heart of Amsterdam.
Worth a stroll through. Chilled, fashionable and an easy route to everywhere else you want to go.
One the best areas in Amsterdam. One of the nicest areas of Amsterdam, far nicer than the sleezy red light district. It has kooky shops, loads of character and great bars and restaurants.

Lovely Area. The Jordaan is one of those typically old Amsterdam neighbourhoods that just needs to be experienced. It is very nice to just walk around. Plenty of shops, plenty of restaurants and bars. One of the boundaries is the Prinsengracht, thus easy to combine with a visit to Anne Frank House
Very cool.. Very cool. Put aside a whole afternoon to explore the shops.

Walk around and enjoy the surroundings. It's a really lovely neighborhood to walk around and enjoy a non touristy area of Amsterdam.
It may remind you of the Village if you 've been in NY.

The best place to go out in the evening and shop during the day. Some great cafe/bars/restaurants and lots of boutique shops during the day. Probably the best part of Amsterdam with the characteristic buildings.

Charming old quarter of Amsterdam. Start at the Westerkerk and stroll along the flower-decked canals. You will find the real old quarter of Amsterdam here, where students and artists live. The canal houses are charming and humpbacked bridges span the canals. Magic. Stop for coffee at canalside "Cafe 't Smalle" -cute and picturesque.
The Jordaan. Great restaurants .This is Must in Amsterdam.There are typical cafes and restaurants in Amsterdam.

Get a walking guide guide from the tourist information (VVV). If you want to experience The Jordaan to its fullest, purchase a walking guide from the tourist information (in April 2011 the price was 3 euros) and just start to walk. The guide is great in giving you both the directions for finding the "gems" as well as gives you the background and history of the places. The Jordaan is full of little cafes where one can sit inside to drink a cup of hot chocolate when it is raining outside or enjoy a glass of rose outside in the sun. It used to be a district for working class but is now the most expensive district in Amsterdam (if not the whole country). While there, don't forget to visit the Noordermarkt (on Westerstraat) in the weekends for the whole buzz, and the textile market (on Lindengracht) on Monday.
Love the area. quirky and interesting. Easier to explore on a bicycle.

venice of amsterdam. Water streams, little bridges, beautiful old houses...it looks as if you are in Venice. It is the most beautiful part of Amsterdam. Just take a walk of the area anytime during the day and admire the beauty that surrounds this part of Amsterdam. It is so poetic, so romantic that you will definitely fall in love with this place. Anne Franc's house is also in the same vicinity. Do not miss this place if you visit Amsterdam.
Nice area - not that exciting though. It was interesting to walk around this area, although I wouldn't say it was much more interesting than walking around any other areas of Amsterdam
The best place to stay. Nice shops, nice restaurants and cafes, near the station: a must!
The Jordaan. Great places to be lost and just wandering around...

A wonderful world of its own in the middle of Amsterdam. When you do have the time, get a guide that will tell you the history of the most beautiful houses and little hidden yards in the Jordaan. A neighbourhood that used to house 3 times as many people than currently while back then there was no fresh water system.
Beautiful neighbourhood. Great place to wonder around and get lost in the small streets for an afternoon.
The best Amsterdam neighborhood. I wouldn't stay anywhere else. The loveliest canals and best hotels. I could live here!
Jordaan. Great area. Lots of adorable shops/boutiques and restaurants/cafes.
A great place to slowly stroll around. This is a nice area to stroll aorund enjoying the architecture and the shops with plenty to see and to take pictures of.
Lovely stolling neighborhood.. Take an afternoon and stroll around this neighborhood. Visit the "9 little streets" for shopping. So quaint and cute. Typical Amsterdam experience.
Quaint area. We loved walking around this quaint section of Amsterdam
Fabulous Neightborhood. make sure to explore this neighborhood, it will make you want to move to Amsterdam.
Favourite part of Amsterdam!. This neighbourhood was a very charming and wonderful place to have a stroll and visit the best coffee shops in Amsterdam.

Lovely and typical part of Amsterdam.. Our hotel was situated in this part of Amsterdam and its great to walk out into this area and walk back in the evening. Full of little side streets with interesting independent shops it's a must. Very typical Amsterdam.

A unique athmosphere. If you want to go to trendy restaurants, nice vintage and curious shops, see the beautiful canals and houses and have a nice beer / coffee then the Jordaan is THE place to go. I love it. Sometimes it is a bit overcrowded with tourists riding bikes (BE CAREFUL). You should definitely go!
Little restaurants everywhere!. Nice to visit for a cafe/restaurant. To walk around
Take time to walk around here. It's a million miles from Dam Square and the Red Lights. A lovely part of the city.
very noisy. nothing special, many cheap cafes and restaurants ,not the places i'm enjoying during my trips

my favorite part of Amsterdam. breaths the free spirit of Amsterdam, small authentic houses with original people living there. you will notice seeing to many old women that still behave and dress like they are 25, never grow up here!!
must see. typical amsterdam. a must see for all tourists. wonderful, little fairytale streets full of bikers. have a coffee in one of the many little cafeterias.

Quiet and charming. This area is for the tourist who is above college age and not on a stag weekend. The little streets and canals are more picturesque and quaint, the shops are posh, the coffeeshops play 80's hits... It's lovely.

Charming neighbourhood. The Jordaan is a lovely neighbourhood to explore. Just follow your nose and you will see charming buildings and canals. Check out the smaller canals. If you need a book (and who doesn't?), check out the English Bookshop.
Great area of the city!. This is the best area in my opinion, very authentic with great restaurants, shops and coffee shops, definately worth a visit!

Frommers walking tour was perfect. I downloaded a free self-guided walking tour from the Frommers website and it was a great way to walk the Jordaan. Simply beautiful architecture and the guide directed us to hidden gardens that we wouldn't have otherwise seen.

Nicest place of Amsterdam. Jordaan has an unique atmosphere, it's nice to walk around the streets, many things to see and if you get tired just sit on some bar and relax. Jordaan is the finest of AMS!
Lots to do and see. We stayed in this neighborhood and we were very happy with it. There was so much to see and do here and we felt safe.
Lovely for a wander. Very pretty area. Quiet at night particularly towards the north of the area

The best. If we lived in Amsterdam- we'd hope to live in the Jordaan. It's low key, classy, and clean. Great restaurants and small shops attract a few tourists but strong local flavor and feel. Love it.
Worth a look...... ....if you are in the area. We had a wander about before going to the Anne Frank house. There are some lovely little shops and bars/coffee houses, but these are all quite busy.
Noordermarkt. The farmers market on Saturdays is a good recommendation!
Very nice walk. Beautiful buildings, lovely canals, tiny bridges, peaceful. Great small pubs. With the Christmas lights it is a great place for a romantic walk.
worth a walk through this area. the houses in the Jordaaan provide a back drop to how the dutch lived since the 1800s. Well maintained hoses in original style although graffitti spoils some of it.
Attractive walking area. picturesque buildings, easy & safe to walk around, cafes & sights.
get lost for an afternoon here. you can get lost for hours walking in the picturesque streets
Jordaan - great area. Great area with vintage shops, nice cafés and good athmosphere.

Perfect neighborhood to stay and explore. Walk everywhere to shop , eat and explore
Good people watching

Cute and homely. We had lunch in this cute area of the city, and it is completely different from some other areas of the city. It is almost like a small town in itself with rows of smal boutique stores and cafes it was quite a lovely place to take a walk around.

This area is for the romantics at night. Take a stroll in the evening when the sun goes down and the street lamps come on in this area. The orange from the street lights, reflecting on the canals, and the warm glowing windowns of the cosy dutch bars and restaurants are a delight to see. Take your camera as this will be an area to remember.We didn't really experience the shopping side of this area, but had a few drinks in the bars and ate at Vlamings Brasserie on Prinzengracht. Well worth a visit for a romantic meal.This area is alot quieter, although from the centre you will need to walk past a number of coffeeshops. Don't be put off by these, as the street gets quieter, and then changes completely as you walk further from Central station.Very safe, very romatic and a must when with someone special.
A beautiful part of old Amsterdam. It is a wonderful part of the city. I recommend to visit Jorddaan by foot and enjoy in these old streets and buldings.
Quaint, pretty and lots of places to explore!. A lovely part of Amsterdam with many beautiful canals, buildings, shops and attractions to explore - we spent a large amount of time in this area!
Good eats.... Food, food, food...and a beautiful neighborhood too. Great market on Saturday morning at the Noorderkerk.

Love this area. Upscale, hip - very cool area. Go there and spend the day on the "9 streets" for upscale boutique shopping and lots of great little lunch places... Rookies is a great coffeeshop (awesome music), best street waffles on the square here :-)
great fun. shops atmosphere interesting people and a sense of fun not always found in some areas, for good reason sometimes
beautiful strolling area. Peaceful with beautiful architecture and a few nice restaurants and shops tucked away.
Jordaan. We expected more of a neighborhood feel and experienced less than that, more like the other neighborhoods.

Perfect for walking and taking in the ambience. Spent most of the holiday walking around Jordaan. Loved the atmosphere and enjoyed hunting for "hofjes" as described by out guide book. Found two good restaurants as well.
Great area. This is a great area to go out for dinner or drinks. It has a very friendly and relaxing, yet hip atmosphere!

Perfect neighborhood for a stroll, day or night. The Jordaan is full of wonderful clothing boutiques, cafes, restaurants and bars. Yet, for a neighborhood so full of attractions, it is surprisingly quiet and peaceful. It's a very different scene than the bustle of touristy Leidseplein and commercial Kalverstraat.

Oft overlooked but worthwhile destination. I love to explore the REAL living city when I travel. The Jordaan is a wonderful, quiet excursion where you can stroll canals, explore local galleries and see life from the view of a local. There are some lovely cafes and bistros. Easy walk from Westerkerk and Anne Frank house. Go, explore and become a local.
Quiet area to amble through.. Lovely atmosphere, architecture and fun to watch life going past!
Beautiful. Beautiful quiet neighborhood with lots of hidden shops and restaurants

lovely neighborhood for shopping and dining. Lots of restaurants to chose from, lots of cute and interesting shops. Just walking around was fun, with all the interesting architecture to see. Seems like a fantastic place to live!
Lovely. a absolutely lovely part of town, for a meal, a stroll, a bike ride..
Upcoming area. Lovely area to stroll round - former artisans' houses, now the most sought-after residential area. Shops and cafes all over.
A beautiful area of Amsterdam. If you like walking this is a very worthwhile area of Amsterdam to "hoof it".
Interesting stroll. Great place for a relaxing walk, plenty of things to keep your brain engaged.
Didn't really care for. Too quiet and not much going on. We walked, biked, or candled all of Amsterdam, so we didn't want to leave this out.
Apple Pie. We had the best apple pie in Amsterdam here. The area is delightful.There are lots of great bars and coffee shops to indulge in here

The real Amsterdam :). I'm a repeat traveler in Amsterdam and whenever is a sunny day, which is not often in Amsterdam, I love to stroll on the little streets of this neighborhood. It really is the real Amsterdam!
Cosy and busy atmosphere!. It's a very nice neighbourhood, cosy and busy at the same time. The houses are very typical for Amsterdam, but in the end they are all the same.
Nice neighborhood.. Great place to have breakfast in a small pub or cafe.

A great part of town.. I always dedicate a whole day to exploring, photography, shopping and eating in this area. It feels the most gezelig to me. The Pijp is right up there but Jordan is right next to the center and very nice.

My favorite section of the city. I like to sleep and eat in the Jordaan, and I could spend many days walking through this area before becoming bored. Try using the Blue Guide to the Netherlands (okay, it's very old) for descriptions of the buildings you pass.
Nothing to see. There is nothing to see. No flowered houses no green pieces on sight
i want to live here!. Full of locals, all friendly, gorgeous bars and shops, antique shops and little treasure troves....utterly gorgeous!

Just stroll in any weather. Take your camera, there's no place like it. Watch for herons, sitting on cars, whatever. Plenty of places for a koffie (Amsterdam koffie beats every place except Italy for me) or a bierje (beer). The houses, the bridges, the bikes, the boats, all lovely.
Way cheaper. Neighborhood that has stayed more authentic (lots of small businesses), a GOOD deal cheaper for a meal than the other parts.

Beautiful neighborhood of charming streets full of unique little shops. Great place to find a restaurant or souvenirs.. This is a great place to get away from the crowds of the main walking streets of Amsterdam. There is not a chain store in sight. As you stroll the 9 little streets (straatjes) you will discover a myriad of charming views of the various canals running through the Jordaan.
Like going back in time. It's quaint, lovely little shops to explore along with little coffee/bar places to relax in.

Cool part of Amsterdam. We were on a romantic short break, and decided on the last morning to wander around the Jordaan. It was very different from the rest of Amsterdam, with lots of greenery, nice cafés, and a lovely, relaxed feeling. It used to be the old working class quarter, but feels very bohemian and lived in.
What a great area to walk around.. We loved the the surrounding areas, the canals, this place must to wonderful in the spring and summer. Great reason to return.
The best place in the city. A lot of good restaurants, shops and last tourists than red light, or leidseplein square.

A beautiful place for couples. One of the most beautiful and serene places you will end up visiting as a couple. Must visit recommendation for all who enjoy nature and want to spend some quite time with your loved ones. Walk around the canals in a no pollution, traffic environment is very refreshing.
so little time. did not get to spend much time here but what I saw was very pretty.
Expensive popular but cosy neighbourhood.. A part of town where I'd like to live (if I had the money)...
A walkable, fascinating neighborhood. The Jordaan, just west of the main canal belt, is a quieter and fascinating old neighborhood with great little shops, restaurants and coffeehouses.

Great place to walk around. Nice area to have a walk around in. Many places to have a coffee or something to eat.
We ate lunch in a cafe at the corner of Herenstraat and Herengracht. Some nice seating upstairs with lovely views of the canal.
Real Amsterdam. When you're in Amsterdam stroll around the Jordaan and visit a nice Brown café. You're sure to have a good time.

Great neighborhood. Wish we would've spent more time here.. We chose to stay in the 'Oud Zuid'/ old south area of Amsterdam and after visiting the Jordaan realized we made a mistake. Jordaan was active but laid back, family oriented with plenty of nice shops and restaurants. It just seems cleaner, safer and slower than the rest of the city, a great little neighborhood.

Heard it was Beautiful, Really Disappointed. Researched this place on trip advisor. It is a HUGE area. I walked quite a bit of it, but was disappointed, because what I found instead of beautiful canals and architecture was a very ordinary neighbourhood where the Dutch live their regular lives. So, unless you are interested in doing research about that, I would leave this out of your itinerary on foot. The only time I would ever go back to the real Jordaan area is to go to one of the markets (the Alburt Cuyp and Waterlooplein markets are the best though not in the Jordaan so I probably still wouldn't go back). Definitely take a canal boat in the canals, though, and they will take you around the famous part of the Jordaan which basically consists of Prisengracht. One single canal/street that contains some pubs and maybe a couple shops and the Anne Frank Huis.
Nice to walk round. Quirky shops. Very nice but loads of walking. very expensive like everywhere in Amsterdam
So cute!. I sat in a café for a few hours just writing in my journal and doing my postcards.

Saturday market. On the Westerstraat on Saturday experience the real Amsterdam. You name it; it's there. Try "poffertjes" or a "stroopwafel" made fresh in front of you. Stop at a local bar; people will talk to you and be interested.

Very nice area to walk around without destiny. I have been to Jordaan on a Saturday (24Sep) after what I read in TripAdvisor and it is really very nice, with its street markets (to which I will write another post to add the photos), nice and calm areas to walk around and with its many caffes and canals. I really recommend everyone to go there taking time to explore its many streets.
Spend Most of your time in the Jordaan. Don't waste your time in the Dam Square area - the Jordaan has beautiful boutiques, restaurants, bars, general store and near museums, etc.

Embodies Amsterdam. A walk through this neighborhood is what Amsterdam is all about. It includes wonderful shops, restaurants and residences. Exploration of neighborhoods like the Jordaan makes a trip to Amsterdam worth while when you also add specific museams and such.

Beautiful & Artsy with great galleries & cafes. We actually got lost here trying to find our way back to our hotel and I fell in love with this area! The houses are beautiful and the cafes looked really good. Definitely recommend to take a stroll through this lovely part of town.

Very pleasant and peaceful part of Amsterdam. If you have worn yourself out, visiting all the sights and attractions Amsterdam has to offer then you might like to de-stress with a stroll round this beautiful area, just west of the city centre. The tree-lined canals, flanked by the tall houses are a real contract to the hustle and bustle of the city centre and you can sit in one of the elegant cafes, watching the world go by, or just walk and take in the beauty and tranquility of this oasis of calm.This was my first time in Amsterdam and I really like the place but Jordaan is something a little more special and, if you have the time, a couple of hours here is time well spent.

Pleasant Area To Have A Relaxing Stroll. The Jordaan is an area just to the west of Prinsengracht and the central canal area of Amsterdam. It is also a quieter area and has a more relaxed feel to it, and is a wonderful area to spend a couple of hours having a peaceful stroll around during an afternoon. Some of the canals in this area are much more picturesque too such as the Egelantiersgracht.We found that allowing a couple of hours gives you enough time to cover pretty much quite an extensive area of The Jordaan. Once you are all walked out, there are plenty of quaint cafe bars to enjoy a drink or two and have a quick bite to eat whilst watching the world go by too. We stopped off at the Cafe 't Smalle which is on the corner of the Egelantiersgracht and Prinsengracht. There is a very nice terraced area to sit outside too when the weather is nice. There is a good selection of snacks and sandwiches on their menu to choose from. It was in here that I sampled an Old Jenever for the first time too – anyone who hasn’t tried one I would certainly recommend it!All in all, The Jordaan makes a pleasant contrast to the busier feel that the streets in the Red Light District offers and any visitor to Amsterdam should make the time to explore this area.

The Jordaan has it all!. A delightful part of Amsterdam which deserves a closer look! It can be found near the Anne Frank House but on the opposite side of the canal. Take a map as there are many small streets. Lovely, little shops, cafes, restaurants and hidden courtyards to discover. Allow plenty of time although it is very atmospheric at night too.
Great Neighborhood. Loved walking around this wonderful neighborhood. Restaurants and Ann Frank House made it complete.

An interesting stroll. Having visited Amsterdam many times, this was the first time I had strolled round Jordaan. We followed a guide book walking tour and I think that's the best way to do it, for it's the detail of individual buildings, streets and canals that is most interesting. It sometimes means you need to double back on yourself a bit, but well worth it. Apart from bumping into the occasional walking group tour, it was very calm and peaceful other than where you cross two major artery streets. Set aside a couple of hours which will allow for a coffee and cake stop too!

The most picturesque area of amsterdam. Jordaan area is the prettiest part of Amsterdam. It was such a pleasure strolling the streets and enjoying the beautiful architecture, the picturesque canals, the gorgeous designer shops, small art galleries, quaint cafes and restaurants. It has a quieter feel to it than the rest of amsterdam but you still need to be careful of all the bicycle riders who are ruthless to touristy strollers! Definately worth a visit!
Very nice area. It is worth seeing the area. Lots of good restaurants and beautiful homes along the canals.

Lovely little place, off the tourist track, lovely cafes that serve nice food and wine. Visit here to get away from the hustle and bustle of main Amsterdam. We chilled out in the lovely cafes here. Place where mainly the locals visit. Would definately go back here.
Great walking tour. We enjoy walking and the Jordaan is a perfect place to walk. Full of café's and great views of the canals.

Quiet area, nice to explore. The feeling I got was mostly of a quiet residential area, but it's nice to walk around and the Sound Garden coffee shop is a real gem, with a great outside seating area next to a canal. Not much to do here in the evening, there is a blues bar but no music the night we were there, but worth a wander through.

Jordaan is a cool oasis in a bustling capital city. My wife and I wandered around Jordaan on 2 evenings, soaking up the atmosphere and admiring the canals, the houseboats, the magnificent merchant houses lining each criss-crossing canal and the generally calm atmosphere that pervades the whole of the Jordaan area in Amsterdam. We found plenty going on though, the steets alive with a low-level buzz, people walking arm-in-arm or students having fun near the canals, or just walking their dogs and we spent both evenings eating at excellent restaurants by the canals. The people were friendly (although watch out for the frantic cyclists who ring their bell and expect you to jump out of their way immediately!) and we decided we would love to have a house or flat in Jordaan, which quickly became our favourite part of Amsterdam.
Nice area, get away from the tourist hordes. Lovely area, worth exploring and easy to get to. Some nice cafes and bars and generally a relaxed feel to this area.
