A special neighborhood in Amsterdam. A visit to the city is incomplete w/o coming to the Jordaan. The area is filled with cafe's, bars, and small shops and galleries. It typifies the local experience with a nice Saturday market (organic near the Noorderkerk and traditional on the Lindengracht). Small Hofjes dot the neighborhood and the history of the Jordaan is remarkable. Stroll the neighborhood and catch your breath before heading back to the tourist zones.

Real Amsterdam. Head west from dam square along radhu istratt,past westerkerk to your right, and you will find yourself on rozengracht the beating heart of the jordaan.in this part of town you won't find stores selling weed tee shirts or clog slippers.what you will find is everyday Hollanders going about there daily business,nothing pretentious here.this is reflected in prices of drinks food etc stop at moeders for some dutch cuisine.then pop across the street to flower power for a joint if that's your thing. Head south a couple of blocks from here(its on a corner)and you will find yourself at sarrein.this is a lesbian bar but during daytime everybody is welcome.free pool table downstairs smoke friendly and cool snacks think hard boiled eggs and chilli nuts

Calm area. The jordaan is a city on his own. It's a calm area in busy Amsterdam. It's worth to visit it, and watch the old houses. The most of the streets were named to a flower.
The streets are small, and the footpath too, so watch out for bikers.
There are some gardens and nice cafes.

very nice area. Jordaan in Amsetrdam is a really nice area.
It is vibrant but still qiuet.
There are a lot of nice cafees and resatuants and nice small shops.
I just love this area

Favorite neighborhood in Amsterdam. The Jordaan lives up to the hype. My partner and I spent hours wandering around the canal houses, shops and cafes of this district. Having been there in mid-May it truely was the "garden district" as almost every house had a rose or gardenia bush blooming. There were several quirky shops we stopped in as well as visiting the Anne Frank House, Westerkerk and other sights. Away from those sights the neighborhood is not crowded and you get a feel of what it is like to live in Amsterdam.

Great area.... Lovely area of Amsterdam and if you want to get away from usual attractions don't miss it. Lovely bars and restaurants and little shops if you like that sort of thing. Just have a beer by a peaceful canal.....

So worth to take the time and see...... We loved to just walk around and explore this area. It is so cute and a photographer's paradise. Even our kids (age 8 and 10) loved it. It is not nearly as busy as some other areas in Amsterdam and you can even find a bench by one of the canals and just sit and relax and observe the happenings around you. Many little shops are seemingly still family owned and just fun to look at.

Peaceful village in Amsterdam. I spend some time walking the area. It was like being in a small village. There were local stores. The pace of life seemed to be slower. There was some amazing buildings.

a special neighbourhood. That Amsterdam has unforgettable views and amazing places...we all know...but only when you enter this special neighbourhood - with its calm and its surroundings - you can enjoy trully all its beauty and take part in the everyday life of the city...an advise: take your time and get lost!

One of the prettiest neighborhoods in town. A stroll through Jordaan and you will forget all that's wrong with the city. Peaceful, quiet and serene neighborhood is even more of a delight when viewed on a canal boat. I loved how nearly every house had lush rose bushes outside of every color. Not much in terms of night life, but ideal for an afternoon or evening stroll or bike ride. Even better, it's not touristy at all.
Great!. Great neighborhood! My hotel was there and it's a beautiful place to walk through and spend some time!

Just discovered it!. Typical lad, been to the dam lots if times never made it out of east of dam square. Just in the middle of a week renting a house in Jordaan with the family and this neighborhood is the biz. It is so chilled and the bars and restaurants and canals and churches and sights and walks and........are the business

Fav part of Amsterdam. This is my favourite part of Amsterdam - relaxed and some lovely spots for lunch - look out for a pizzeria with its own stone oven and also check out the bars in the area. A world away from the tackiness of Dam Square and worth a look.

This is where couples and travelers stay!. Great place for real travelers to stay. Perfectly preserved old world Europe mixed with urban cool and foodie restaurants. The mellow coffeeshops with locals and not Texas frat boys are here.We rented an apartment here on the Kaisergracht and it was spectacular. Those two weeks living in Amsterdam are some of the best times my wife and I have had as a couple.
Absolutely beautiful. Gorgeous part of the city, well worth getting lost in, lots of fantastic places to eat and drink with lots and lots of character.

My favourite part of the City..... I have visited Amsterdam before but never had the time to wander around this neighborhood. I was amazed what I had been missing ! The atmospheric network of streets and smaller canals offered a far more charismatic experience. The small cafes and shops were friendly and plentifull. Next time I visit intend to stay in this part of town. Thoroughly reccomend it for just roaming around browsing and relaxing.

For all my afternoon needs. Shops, restaurants, coffee, clothing, bars...the works. The Jordaan was the best place for an afternoon stroll. I spend a lot of time out here before my nights of going out and partying. One of the many places I would visit was the Singel 404 for a great hangover reducing open face sandwich. Then I worked my way through the beautiful 9 streets, shopping for presents, clothing, and when i got tired, I found some of the best pancakes and coffee a man could ever dream for in the middle of the day.The Jordaan is an island of tranquility in the midst of Amsterdams bizarre center. Check it out for yourself...

Beautiful little area. You will love walking around this area. There is so much to see. Bring your camera. Look up at the buildings. Some of them are hundreds of years old, tilting forward till you are sure they are going to fall. Make sure you stop in one of the famous "brown cafes", called such because the walls and ceilings have turned brown from years and years of patrons smoking in them. Charming houses on lovely canals, the kind of place you would want to live in had you the money to do so. The stores that are in this area are one of a kind, you will pay for that privilege, but this is a lovely afternoon walk. Enjoy it.

Perfectly beautiful Amersterdam neighbourhood. We stayed in the Jordaan Hostel when we visited in November. The neighbourhood was beautiful, safe, clean and within walking distance to the main attractions and neighbourhoods in Amsterdam, though comfortably far from the Red Light Districts. During the day explore the back streets, boutiques and cafes, and wander comfortably along the canals at night.

Charming. We found the neighbourhood of Jordaan really charming. We went there on a Sunday hence many shops were closed.We were walking quite a lot and once had to take a break on a bench outside one of the houses for some snacks. Shortly after the house owner came back and was friendly towards us (strangers sitting on his bench). Very nice people in Amsterdam.

Pretty little neighbourhood. The nicest place in Amsterdam. Cozy, charming, relaxed, picturesque, sympathetic, and safe (not many agresive bikers there), great little cafés and quality restaurants. Summerlife on the street with neighbours. Lovely!I suspect life there is as regular as in the rest of the Netherlands, but here it's still got character.

Jordaan is fantastic. We recently visited Amsterdam and had a wonderful time. We stayed with City Mundo in an apartment in the Jordaan distrct, which was very pretty and highly recommended for those who prefer a quieter place to sleep within easy reach of all the city sites. Being a vegetarian, there were plently of choices (check out 'happy cow' online) but our favourite was Green Planet and Bohead (spelling?!). The van Gogh Museum was amazing but would recommend being very careful about pre-booking your tickets online as the door staff refused to acknowledge ours and we spent longer trying to sort it out than we would have in the queue! The Dutch people are very friendly and really made our trip. Have fun!
